transcription.title: Science has drugged participants in this game with intranasal oxytocin, which increases generous offers by 80% relative to a placebo! thanks, intranasal oxytocin! i hear you're also useful in childbirth

panel.line: The ultimatum game is an economics game thing! Two anonymous strangers have to decide how to divide a sum of money between themselves.
Player One proposes a non-zero split, and Player Two can either accept or reject it!
If Two accepts, they both take their money and go their separate ways. But if Two rejects, NOBODY gets any money. And the game is played only once, so there's no worry about reprisals.
So what's the problem? Player Two should accept all the time - some money is better than none, right?
That's what's so interesting! When there's really unfair offers (90/10, 99/1), some players reject them anyway.
Maybe they'd rather have their pride than a few dollars!
Exactly!
I suppose it shows that people aren't motivated ENTIRELY by greed, even in situations involving money and a stranger you'll never see again.
Exactly, and that's something! We're not ALL motivated by greed. Some of us are ALSO motivated by pride.
"VICTORIES WHERE WE CAN TAKE THEM"

I know! !

panel.line: Today is the day I find I'm no longer immersed in popular culture. I used to be SUBMERGED in it, but now I'm not even in the lake! I'm on the shore, dripping wet, furrowing my brow and pointing at the lake in confusion.
Today is the day I realize that saying something "rocks" is actually really weird!

It's like a switch went off in my head. This radio station was all bragging on itself, saying "Kewl 105: WE ROCK!" and my first thought was "Like a moored boat? Is it cool now to sway back and forth, like a boat tied to a dock by a length of rope?"
You're taking it literally?
That's the thing! My FIRST INSTINCT was to take it literally. I had to remind myself what they really meant.
Then I thought of "rock concerts" and it seemed silly! But "punk rock" seemed ADORABLE.
You just need to ROCK MORE!
I know you're trying Utahraptor, but it sounds to me like you're saying I should pitch dangerously to one side a little more often. It's too late for me. Tell them my story.
Goodbye T-Rex. We had a good run, didn't we?
We did. By God, we did.
Hey, when I decide that "cool" can only mean something chilly, you'll still shoot me with the kryptonite bullet, right?
No worries!
Awesome!
Awesome.

Yes! Because if he dies, then the money that shows up will make us say, "Perfect! This is exactly as much as I valued that guy!"
AND HE'S NAMED T-REX AS HIS SOLE BENEFICIARY!
WHAT?!
Oh God, I'm DEFINITELY going to jail, and it's all Utahraptor's fault! It's his revenge for all those arguments he los!
How is naming you as beneficiary revenge?

Because when he dies, the police are going to ask "Who stands to gain?" and now there's a giant MILLION-DOLLAR ARROW pointing right to me, signed and notarized! Insurance policies are instant motive! JUST ADD DEATH!
Well, what if I die of old age?
Still no good, my friend!

Your insurance company still saves a MILLION DOLLARS if they can somehow make it look like I murdered you. They'll be there, hands cupped around the policeman's ear, whispering "Listen I am almost certain this green dude killed him and made it look like old age"
I - okay?
Utahraptor [[from outside the panel]]: It's just I got the policy free through work, and I named you as a nice gesture? It doesn't even pay a million dollars. I'm pretty sure it's capped at $200,000.
Utahraptor!
My fears have been reduced by precisely 80%!

transcription.title: alright, i was talking about my virginity

panel.line: I fear that I've lost something... something important!
Something I'll never get back again!
Something that was very special! Something that I guess part of me thought I'd always have with me! Something that I'd tried to hold on to, but lost nonetheless!
Something-
Knock it off! It's obvious to everyone you're talking about you VIRGINITY.
What? I was talking about a baby tooth.
Alright, I was talking about my virginity!

transcription.title: t-rex, we're involved in a high-stakes game of 'chicken'

panel.line: "EUPHEMISMS" FOR DATING
Yes! Maybe sometimes you don't want to throw the fact that you've found happiness in the arms of another in my face? Maybe you need some "euphemisms".
For example!

Instead of saying "Sally and I are now dating exclusively" you can say "Sally and I are now seeing other people ONLY WITH REGRET." On second thought, maybe you should keep the "Sally and I are now dating exclusively" because if I don't want to acknowledge your commitment, I can play dumb and say, "Sally and you are now dating exclusively... axe murderers? Mad scientists? Um, DOGS?"
So, hey, your euphemisms are pretty weak so far!
Yes. Allow me to correct that!

Instead of "T-Rex, we're dating": "T-Rex, we're eating an awful lot of picnics on Sundays", "T-Rex, we're hanging out more than can be politely explained away", "T-Rex, we're playing Mega Man in two-player mode".
Mega Man doesn't have a two-player mode.
Not for us, Utahraptor! Not for us.
*sigh*

transcription.title: i found a terrible website, left undisturbed for years, yet the last update promised more new content soon. it seemed as if the author was spirited away mid-keypress. as i investigated, i was startled to discover the server was STILL WARM TO THE TOUCH

panel.line: You know what's freaky? Ghost ships! Ships sent sailing and found drifting weeks or months or years later, and EVERYBODY'S GONE.
Totally spooky, dudes!

I think what I love best about them is their aloneness: how everyone aboard was basically removing themselves from larger society, expecting to be reintegrated when they arrived "#8212; and then something went catastrophically wrong! All we can do is piece things together. Botched mutiny? Rogue wave? Everyone accidentally turning invisible AND mute AND ALSO incorporeal? If you are overly credulous then it is impossible to say for sure!!
They do have a certain romance to them that modern technology lacks, eh?
It's the sea!
A boat can float along for years without crew or sails or a working engine. But if everyone disappears on an airplane it's not like we'll find it still flying around years later!
Imagine if we did, though?
FINE
[[In T-Rex's imagination]]

Imaginary Reporter: Reports indicate the "ghost plane" drifted for years over Europe before being found. The plane was undamaged, but in-flight meals were only partially eaten, as if abandoned in haste.
Um, even in the heady realm of fantasy I don't see how this could happen!!

Health and wellness?
Forget that noise. I'm going to eat something way bigger and show that stupid tractor guy how it's done. What's something bigger than a tractor? The box the tractor comes in?

transcription.title: in translating shakespeare's lady macbeth sleepwalking scene into modern cadence, i added an extra exclamation mark. read into that what you will!!

panel.line: Deus Ex Machina is the most excellent of all literary techniques because it's the only one where God shows up and says "Hey fellas, what the heck's going on?" and then solves all the problems.
LITERARY TECHNIQUE COMICS today's technique: DEUS EX MACHINA

And it doesn't even have to be God! ANYTHING that comes out of nowhere and solves all the problems counts! An early example is in Macbeth, where Lady Macbeth is TOTALLY GUILTY over the murder she masterminded, but then she remembers her time machine!
What?
Act V, Scene I? Lady Macbeth is all, "Out, damned spot!! Out, I say! Oh wait, here's my time machine!"
I'd like to know where you buy your plays.
I'd like to know where you buy yours!
EVERYONE knows that Macbeth ends with Lady Macbeth going back in time and stopping the murder, and then she and Macbeth go to the future, which is the 1800s, which is actually the past now.
Then what happens?
Shakespeare spends pages wildly inaccurately describing life in the 1800s?
MEANWHILE, IN TUDOR ENGLAND!
I'm glad you decided to add time machines to your plays, Shakespeare!
Francis Bacon: i'm not shakespeare, i'm francis bacon!
christopher marlowe: and I'M christopher marlowe!
SURE YOU ARE

transcription.title: i am thinking of writing a comic about the Midas Flesh, can you tell

panel.line: THE MYTH OF KING MIDAS
Midas was a king who was nice to a friend of the God of Wine, and so he gets a wish from the God of Wine! NICE! And so Midas wishes that everything he touched would turn to gold.
Instantly the ground he's standing on transforms into gold!

The gold change races across the planet's surface and down into the mantle like a shockwave, transmuting it instantly. In seconds, the Earth's iron-nickel core becomes pure non-ferrous gold, and the planet's magnetic field is lost. Unshielded from solar wind, every living creature begins to absorb desperately fatal levels of radiation. The soft gold of the planetary crust is unable to sustain the weight placed upon it, and begins to buckle and distort.
Midas watches in horror as his planet dies a golden death!
But not for long!

He's soon overcome by the terrible sensation of drowning on dry land: any air that touches his lungs is being transmuted on contact into tiny flecks of gold. He suffocates and dies as his lungs fill with the formerly precious metal.
Air that touches his cooling body continues to transmute, and he's soon covered in a fine golden layer of ash.
The moral is not to make wishes like that, King Midas!!

transcription.title: i'm sassy AND classy

panel.line: Attention, people who are breaking up with someone! Don't say "it just wasn't meant to be", okay?
You are greatly complicating your breakup!

Because now instead of simply saying "hey listen for my tastes you are WAY too sassy" you are saying "hey listen okay there's this all-powerful invisible being who controls EVERYONE'S FATE and he's or she or it or they (it's hard to say and nobody really agrees) has got plans and intentions and a particular interest in us NOT being together."
Occam's razor, people! OCCAM'S RAZOR.
You're saying that in a breakup, entities should not be multiplied without necessity?
I AM.

Besides, honesty can help the dumped person improve. They can say "maybe my sassiness IS at all-time highs!!" instead of saying "GEEZ I wish whoever controlled our fates would stop being such a DICK", saying "DICK" really loudly so the fate controlling entity is sure to hear.
"You don't need God to dump someone"?
You don't need God to dump someone!! Oh my God, Utahraptor. Yes!
T-REX
I AM HAPPY TO HELP THOUGH

transcription.title: gravity is a property of matter. bill! bill! bill! bill bill bill bill nye, the science guy.

panel.line: So gravity happens because matter bends spacetime and blah blah blah. But dudes, I had a crazy idea! What if instead of gravity being a property of matter, it was a property of the ENTIRE FRIGGIN' UNIVERSE?
Have all minds within the sound of my voice been COMPLETELY AND IRREVOCABLY BLOWN??

So check it: the universe is suffused with tiny invisible particles that travel in equal intensity from all directions. So if you were alone in the universe, you'd be hit equally from all directions and nothing would happen. But if there's a planet in front of you, then any particles coming from its direction are going to hit it instead and not you! So you're no longer in balance, and particles coming from BEHIND you will push you towards the planet.
And YOU'RE blocking a much smaller number of particles from hitting the planet, so it'll move a little towards you!
Yes!
It's a fun theory, but if you're absorbing particles all the time, shouldn't you be gaining mass?
No, because they're "#8212; massless?
Ah, so you'd be absorbing energy then.
They're "#8212; energyless as well?
SOON, T-REX FINDS OUT THAT HIS GRAVITATIONAL THEORY HAS ALREADY BEEN PROPOSED BACK IN THE YEAR 1690!
Everyone in the past needs to stop preemptively plagiarizing my ideas!
I keep saying that but it keeps happening! It's total crap!!

transcription.title: ATTENTION LINGUISTS! i do wince every time I use words derived from "anthropology" in my comic, but i don't really have another word to reach to :(

panel.line: Oh my goodness I just figured out what I was meant to do with my life. I have discovered my CALLING.
Body farm owner!!

Forensic anthropologists want to study how bodies decompose in different circumstances! And so they go to their neighborhood BODY FARM, which is basically just a few acres of land surrounded by a fence and filled with DEAD AND DECOMPOSING BODIES. Some are out in the open, others are underwater or entombed or whatever! And scientists come and science up the joint, and I'LL be the guy who holds a torch under his face and says "Welcome to my farm of death and decay."
I'd only say that sometimes, Utahraptor.
You'd only say it never!
There are tons of legal, ethical, and security issues you're not even considering!
"Security issues"! What's better security than living in a house surrounded by CORPSES? "Oh hey, let's go steal the TV from the corpse house"? NOBODY HAS EVER SAID THAT, UTAHRAPTOR!!
Honestly, Utahraptor. If you keep being so down on my body farm idea, when you die I might not let you decay out in the open on my front lawn!
T-Rex, what I am about to say, I say with all honesty.
In my heart of hearts, I truly thought we already had such an accord

panel.line: What is the point of going to sleep? I'm just going to wake up again!

With my nights freed up from the chore of sleep, I will become unstoppable! I'll have an extra eight hours to plan and scheme!
I will stop sleeping right away! Tonight!
Who knows what the future holds for me?
TWENTY YEARS LATER...
Want to come over for a slumber party?
Oh, sorry, I forgot how you never sleep.
What the hell, man?
It's been like twenty years!

panel.line: Okay so this game is called "Guess Two Thirds of the Average"! We all pick a number between 0 and 100 and guess what 2/3rds of the average of everyone else's guesses will be!
The winner is the person who guesses the closest number!
So let's say everyone else chose 100 - you'd want to choose 66.67, because that's 2/3rds of 100. But the catch is you all choose your numbers at the same time and don't tell the other players.
So, 66.67 is really the ceiling - any number larger than that can't possibly win!
Exactly!
But I can assume all the other players know this too, and won't guess higher than 66.67.
Yep!
So in that case I should choose 2/3rds of THAT, which is - 44.44?
But assuming the other players know that too...
...then I keep taking 2/3rds off that number until I end up at 0.
Woo
LATER:
From off-screen: Who here can name a game that sounds like it's way more fun than it actually is?
GUESS TWO THIRDS OF THE AVERAGE GUESS TWO THIRDS OF THE AVERAGE!!
PICK ME!
GUESS TWO THIRDS OF THE AVERAGE

transcription.title: i'm not putting another god before you! i'm putting you and all other gods in a line, EQUALLY.

panel.line: Dudes!
There are a lot of friggin' religions!

And let's say you're a lady or fellow who thinks "Man, heaven sounds like okay times! I've GOT to get in on that action." But you're stymied, because which religion should you choose? There's like a billion different ones, and if you bet on the wrong horse then no heaven for you, chumpy!
My friends, I have the solution: The T-Rex system!
Okay, I'll bite: what's the T-Rex system?
You overlap each and every religion in a Venn diagram!

THEN, you just look for the place of maximum overlap and follow the precepts there! Say you discover most religions say something like "Give to the poor": you know that by doing this, you're maximizing your Heaven Potential"#8482; for HUNDREDS of religions at once! Plus, you're not wasting time on CRAZY and UNPOPULAR precepts.
Utahraptor [offscreen]: Um, what if the Judeo-Christian God exists and wants you to believe in no-one else but him?
Um, here's another hypothetical for you, Utahraptor: WHAT IF ALL GODS EXIST AND WHEN YOU DIE YOU COULD SPEND YOUR TIME IN LIKE 80 BILLION HEAVENS AT ONCE??

transcription.title: that fruit stand / car chase thing is pretty awesome. you'd be forgiven for thinking that it was all downhill from here after doing that.

panel.line: I have kissed a lady. I have seen PLENTY of beautiful sunsets. I've even driven a car through a fruit stand during a car chase!
...What's left?

This, my friends, is the malaise of the glutton at life's buffet, The Man Who Achieved Too Much Too Soon. He looks ahead, his life not half over, and sees no more frontiers to conquer, no more challenges, no more surprises! All that remains is a slow slide into compromise and old age, the long December spent waiting for the day his mind and body finally fail.
Then: death!
Hah! We're seriously talking about you here?

Hey, here's some things you've never done! you've never tried fugu, punched out a ghost, gotten married, eaten your way out of a whale, gone heli-skiing, or been shot at by a criminal, but then ran around the bullets at super speed, grabbed the criminal, and then ran back at super speed so that he could be shot by his own bullets.
MEANWHILE, IN THE UNIVERSE WHERE T-REX HAS DONE THESE THINGS:
Well!
I guess I could do them in ORDER...

transcription.title: i realized after writing it that you can read this comic as being prejudiced against disability, seniors, alcoholics, insomniacs, arthritics, people with skin cancer, the suicidal, the diseased and the dead. so um, please don't do that?

panel.line: WHAT ARE ONE IN SEVEN CANADIANS UP TO?
One in seven Canadians is living with a disability!
But one in seven Canadians is ALSO productively employed in the agri-food industry!
So they're not allowing a disability to affect their job performance! Nice.
It's especially impressive after I tell you that one in seven Canadians is... A SENIOR CITIZEN!!
Wow, they're doing a lot for their age!
But it's not all sunshine and roses, Utah-raptor.
One in seven Canadians also has alcohol-related problems, suffers from insomnia, arthritis, skin cancer, AND has seriously considered suicide.
Yikes.
Don't worry! One in seven Canadians will die of an infectious disease before they can suicide! PLUS they'll leave money to charity!
THIS COMIC IS DEDICATED TO ONE IN SEVEN CANADIANS
THANKS FOR TAKING IT FOR THE TEAM?

transcription.title: because in wars if you fight for too long then you become your enemy, remember

panel.line: Zombies versus vampires! They're the new pirates versus ninjas verses ants that combined themselves together to form the shape of a giant ant!
And the question is: who would win in a fight?

Unfortunately the question is ridiculous because zombies and vampires have no reason to be fighting. vampires drink blood and zombie blood is all decayed and pooling in their feet. They wouldn't be interested! Correspondingly, zombies eat brains and vampires -
- okay maybe they would fight sometimes.
And zombies would win, obviously!
Obviously!!
If you're bitten by a zombie then you become a zombie, so all the vampires would eventually be vampire zombies!
Except if you're bitten by a vampire you become a vampire, so all the zombies would eventually become vampires.
Utahraptor!
T-Rex!
T-Rex and Utahraptor: This is the poignant example of the futility of war that we've ever seen!!

transcription.title: can you believe i wrote this whole comic before i thought of the phrase "holy ghost"? i can. I JUST LIVED IT!!

panel.line: I wonder what it's like being a ghost. Immortality coupled with incorporeality seems like a potent combination! Is it TRULY 24/7 party times?
There's one way to find out!
"A TALK WITH GOD"
Excuse me, God! What's being a ghost like?
WHAT I AM NOT A GHOST T-REX
Okay but what's the difference between you and a ghost then?
THE DIFFERENCE IS THAT WHEN I SAY "BOO" PEOPLE GET TOTALLY SPOOKED
LISTEN
THAT WAS A BAD EXAMPLE
LISTEN ANOTHER DIFFERENCE IS THAT I CAN CREATE UNIVERSES
I've no evidence that ghosts can't do that!
Huh?

I was saying, I don't have any evidence that ghosts can't create universes. Maybe they just CHOOSE not to, you know? Maybe they've got enough hassles without adding a whole new UNIVERSE on top of them.
Huh?
Nevermind!
God, it would be more convenient for me if other people could hear you.
T-REX IT WOULD BE MORE CONVENIENT FOR ME IF YOU WEREN'T SO SASSY
God! We will DEFINITELY have to agree to differ on that one!!

transcription.title: LATER: T-REX'S HOUSE IS NEVER DISCOVERED AND ALL THAT HE ACCOMPLISHED TURNED TO DUST :o :o :o

panel.line: Cave painting: check. Renaissance-era painting: check. Astrolabe from the Age of Discovery stuffed inside my computer: check!
It appears I have finished decorating my house!
That's a pretty eclectic set of decorations!

It is! But here's my angle: let's say there's a catastrophe and everyone dies. When Future Folks dig up my house, I will throw their historical understanding into chaos! They will say "HOW COULD A CAVE MAN OWN A RENAISSANCE-ERA PAINTING AND A COMPUTER WITH AN ASTROLABE STUFFED IN IT?! FRIG. HISTORY IS RUINED, YOU GUYS."
Or they could simply deduce that someone collected these things from the past!
They might!
But THEN worst case they'll think, "Wait, nevermind: THIS dude just had supremely excellent taste!!"
So either you want to destroy a future generation's idea of history, or be remembered for your skills at interior decoration.
Yeah, either way I win!
EPILOGUE: YEARS LATER, T-REX IS MOSTLY REMEMBERED FOR THE ONE TIME HE SAID "WHICH ONE OF YOU JERKS POURED A COFFEE IN MY HAT?"
Attention, future generations!
I'm still calling that a win!

transcription.title: revenge by carnivorism

panel.line: The best way to revenge yourself on an animal is to eat it.
Everyone knows it but they leave it to ME to say it out loud!

And this is the problem with vegetarians!! If a cow sasses me, I can say "Oh yeah? Well guess what, wise guy?! I will use your flesh for digestive energy." But vegetarians just take it! And then cows have no idea who they can get away with sassing, and let's face it they're not the smartest pickles in the fountain, so they sass EVERYONE and then I end up eating a lot of beef.
It's not that big a problem.
I find it doubtful that you've ever revenged yourself on animals in such a way!
You haven't?
Utahraptor, it's so SATISFYING. You're like "My feelings are hurt, but soon I'll be full of meat. Wow, I feel better already!!"
What, you hang around farms and wait for some imagined insult?
Okay, you're coming with me and we're going to sneak onto a farm.
45 MINUTES LATER
HOLY CRAP SHEEP HAVE RECTANGULAR PUPILS!!
WHAT THE HELL WHAT THE HELL
AHHHHH

transcription.title: sometimes people ask me "what is dinosaur comics about?" and sometimes all i can say is "about six panels, i'd say"

panel.line: "T-Rex," she said "I'm in love with you." She gazed into his eyes, smiling. "I thought differently about it, and it's DEFINITELY because you're so handsome and intelligent."
T-Rex laughed!

"Baby," he replied, "it's also because I am sexy and loveable and smart and manly and sexy." She was nodding. He paused, looked around, and then whispered, "I put 'sexy' in twice because I'm - " " -twice as sexy" she whispered back, the two of them whispering it together. She knew that he was twice as sexy as a regular sexy man. That was probably a good thing for their relationship, he decided. Better that she know now, than be suprised down the road!
Suddenly she threw up on T-Rex, over and over until he was drenched in digestive fluid!
No! That's not what happened!
Um - "That's not what happened," she said, wiping her mouth. T-Rex realized it wasn't vomit, it was -
- ultravomit, a new form of vomit that was digesting him alive! As his skin began to dissolve, T-Rex's face melted, slid down the side of his neck, and plopped onto the ground.
FOR SOME REASON T-REX AND UTAHRAPTOR PUBLISH THEIR COLLABORATIVE STORY! IT GOES STRAIGHT TO NUMBER 1
Woo!
WHEN SORTED BY REVERSE POPULARITY
awww daaaang

transcription.title: remote-controlled cars: just as awesome as world peace? you all nodded in agreement when you read that, don't even lie

panel.line: People say to me, "T-Rex, what do you want for Christmas?" This year I have the perfect gift idea!
Peace on Earth!

I'm serious! People SAY this a lot, but they're always adding a "oh hey if that doesn't work out remote controlled cars are just as awesome", which, WHILE TRUE, also supplies an out! By only asking for peace, I'm forcing my entire network of friends to try to get it for me! It turns negative consumerism into Positive World Change, PLUS, if anyone pulls it off I get to raise my hand in the new utopia and say "Awesome! This was my idea."
So you want world peace with none of the work and all of the credit!
Yes please!
Utahraptor, it's CHRISTMAS. If you told me what you wanted I would get it for you, no questions asked! And I'm telling you I want world peace.
So listen, I might just get you a towel.
Peace please!!
T-Rex, it's December 18th! Even if I knew how, that's not much time to convince the entire planet to hug.
Utahraptor
It's CHRISTMAS

I do!
Are you sure? It's pretty...biological.

SHORTLY...

panel.line: WIKIPEDIA HAS BECOME A REAL PERSON!
Yes, I don't know how it happened but it's true! Wikipedia is a woman now.

You ask her about frogs, and bam! She knows ALL ABOUT THEM. And then you ask her about trains, and she's all, "Did you mean the band? The album? THE BAVARIAN VILLAGE??"and I'm like, "All of them, I guess!" It's great. It's kind like dating God!

transcription.title: Daffy Duck the daffy duck

panel.line: Today is the day I bring back the word "daffy"!
LIKE THE DUCK
NO NOT LIKE THE DUCK
It means "crazy"!
And it USED to be a good adjective, until Daffy Duck showed up and stole it and now when I say "daffy" everyone thinks "duck"! He only wants the adjective for himself! He got GREEDY.
But Daffy's his name! Shouldn't we think of him when we hear it?
There's plenty of guys named "Bob", but I can still float in a volume of water without everyone suddenly reminiscencing about those dudes!
So, if I can summarize: you're mad at a fictional character.
Yes! No.

Look, I just want to be able to use "daffy" again. I want to say, "What a daffy car that is!" and have nobody get that far-off "Huh, I wonder if they're still putting Daffy Duck on mugs" look in their eyes.
I-
YES THEY ARE STILL PUTTING DAFFY DUCK ON MUGS

I AM MAKING MY OWN DAFFY DUCK MUGS WHERE WHEN YOU PUT HOT LIQUID IN IT IT SAYS "DAFFY IS ALSO AN ADJECTIVE AND NOT JUST A DUCK"

transcription.title: if i eat the flesh of my enemies, can i turn them into my brains, and thus have their OWN BODY think my thoughts, and those thoughts will be "ha ha ha AWESOME"?

panel.line: Heading: ASK PROFESSOR SCIENCE
Our letter to Professor Science comes from me! I write:
"Dear Professor: How do I know which food that I ate got turned into my eyes?"
I really thought I wrote that one better. Wow.

Anyway, what I meant was this: how do we know what food we ate contributed to which parts of our bodies? Put simply, Professor, last week I ate a salami sandwich. I have but one simple question: IS THAT SALAMI NOW MY BRAIN??
Well, I imagine proteins are digested and used in different ways!
Unsatisfactory!!

I want to know precisely where my meals will end up before I eat them! You know what my dream is? My dream is to pick out a lobster in a tank and say "Oh, I'll have that one, the one on the right. Yes. Have him boiled; I will consume his flesh. I will turn him into eyeballs."
Huh.
LATER:
I have a new science question, Professor!!
Is it wrong to want things that are terrible?

transcription.title: finite space in my brain

panel.line: I was thinking about my grade-school days last night, and I realized I couldn't remember most of the people who were in my classes!
I've forgotten pretty much everyone who didn't go on to the same school as I did!
This has raised some pretty profound questions for me. First off, it seems evident that I have finite space in my brain, and things are getting erased.
The problem is, I don't have any control - conscious at least - over what gets deleted and what stays.
And you're concerned because you don't know who you are if you can't even trust your memories, right?
Right. I'd say a good part of who a person is comes from their experiences - but if they are forgotten, where does that leave the person?
I suppose this comes down to whether or not you believe there is some essential part of you, something more than the sum of your experiences.
There's only one way to find out! It seems that, once again, I will have to contract...
AMNESIA!
TO BE CONTINUED...

transcription.title: t-rex's "screw those guys, man" phrase discriminates against women twice in one sentence! what's the deal, t-dogg?

panel.line: I found out about the best word yesterday: "frigorific"! It means "cold". With this word I can now finally say the sentence, "DAAAAMN, girlfriend, that was totally frigorific!"
I HAVE ALWAYS WANTED TO SAY THAT SENTENCE.
"Frigorific" is actually old news, T-Rex! It was Merriam-Webster's Word of the Day last - Thursday, I think?
You know what? Screw those guys, man! I don't even care if it WAS their Word of the Day last week. It's my Word of the Day TODAY.
Anyway, who trusts a Word of the Day chosen by the publisher of a DICTIONARY?
Basically everyone?
It's ridiculous! It's like asking Kellogg's what their Cereal of the Day is. Hey, here's a hint! I BET IT'LL BE A CEREAL MANUFACTURED BY KELLOGG'S!
But M-W will obviously choose words in the dictionary!
THEIR dictionary, not THE dictionary! There's like 80 billion words they've never heard about.
SOON:
See? I couldn't find "sexplosive", "mathemagician", "backne" OR "ambisextrous"!
I'm pretty sure my life is better without those words.
Utahraptor! No one has ever said that about "ambisextrous".

transcription.title: let's get off the reproduction treadmill. also, let's go get some whoppers with cheese. maybe we can do both, is my thinking

panel.line: Okay so we've all evolved from lesser beings and in order to continue the species, we have a genetic imperative to reproduce!
And this is PROBABLY why sexin' is fun times!

And I'm told that when you hold your newborn child in your arms for the first time, this is a transcendental and joyous life-changing event. Sure, fine! I TOTALLY BELIEVE YOU. But why are these pleasures just related to reproduction? Why can't I have the joy of having a child without actually HAVING to have the child?
It's my understanding that children are really expensive, you guys!!
I don't see what kind of shortcut, you're going for here!
Genetic Engineering! It's SO EASY.

let's just replace the biological imperative to reproduce! Let's give ourselves the same joy and wonder from an egg sammich as we get from first holding our child in our arms! Let's make gum as deeply fulfilling as watching your child graduate top of the class, Dean's list, summa cum laude. Bubblegum flavour.
So your ideal future is one where everyone's weeping over their Whoppers with Cheese, and nobody's having sex?
Who said anything about not having sex? The whole point is you can do both at the same time!
"Boo hoo this is tasty boo hoo I'm also enjoying this sex as well"?

transcription.title: when i'm an old man and my license is about to expire, the last time i go driving i'm going to be SO DANG INCONSIDERATE

panel.line: I am a generous guy! If someone wants to go in front of me in traffic, I slow down and let them in.
But it's all an act!

I let someone cut in front of me for two reasons: because I figure this way it's more likely they'll do the same for me in the future, and because I recognize that it helps the traffic system as a whole. But this isn't generosity, it's greed! It's well-presented greed. It's me selfishly wanting to get around quickly so BADLY that I'll sacrifice the short term for the long term.
So you think you're not actually a good person!
I'm not!

I'll ask if you want the last piece of pie before I take it, but again: that's just me selfishly wanting friends and knowing that actually showing my greediness impedes that. Otherwise I'd be gobbling it like crazy!
Well, even if it's an act, at least you're pretending! Tons of folks won't even do that.
That's true! And... and that means as long as they're still around, then I'm NOT the worst person ever! Oh my God, now I have a perfectly selfish reason to be thankful for all the jerks!
You're SUCH a good friend, Utahraptor!

transcription.title: t-rex has become a counselship relationer.

panel.line: T-REX HAS BECOME A RELATIONSHIP COUNSELLOR.
Yep!
It's not that hard, you guys!

Someone comes in and says "Boo hoo I have trouble with one or more of my RELATIONSHIPS", and what do I say? I say "How does that make you feel?" and they say "Sad" and I say "But talking about it makes you feel better, right?" and they say "A little, I guess" and I say "Excellent! CASE CLOSED."
When I say "Case closed" I make eye contact, take off my glasses, and dramatically slam closed the book I'm holding.
You don't wear glasses!
I wear them when I'm a relationship counsellor, silly!
This whole thing is so implausible! How did you suddenly become a counsellor? Where do your customers come from?
From bad relationships, obviously!
HOW DO THEY HEAR ABOUT YOUR SERVICES?
VIA THEIR EARS, I WOULD IMAGINE??

transcription.title: this is all i have to say about oil, except for that you shouldn't drink it, because i saw a james bond movie where a guy did that and he died!!

panel.line: Everyone, there's no need for all this fussin' and a-feudin'!
Oil is totally a renewable resource!

We just have to give it time, okay? We'll all go and do something else for a while, when we come back there'll be oil EVERYWHERE. The place will be rotten with it, and then we can stuff that into our cars, okay?
Is this "I am techically accurate but not practical" day?
Of course not!
Today is "What would things be like if we had lifespans of millions of years? Guys, let's pretend" day.
Ah. So we're still burning through oil much faster than it's being formed.
Only if you're not participating in today's theme!!

Hey, since we live for millions of years, let's go make some staggeringly beautiful art that can only be created by synthesizing thousands of years of experience, hopes, fears, triumphs and failures into one transcendental expression of life!
I need to be home by 7

transcription.title: statistically it's likely that someone reading this comic was playing chess with someone and they had a heart attack and died. I HOPE YOU ARE ABLE TO LAUGH AT THESE CIRCUMSTANCES NOW; OTHERWISE I WILL FEEL LIKE QUITE THE HEEL

panel.line: Let's say you're playing chess with someone, and suddenly they have a fatal heart attack. This is the best possible way to win, you guys!
You have kicked their ass at chess so HARD that they DIED.

It doesn't matter if you were losing when they kicked the bucket: you've still won with the best finishing move possible! And what's more, your victory is SO AWESOME that it completely overshadows everything your opponent ever accomplished during his life! People will say, "Sure, that guy may have CURED CANCER, but he lost so badly at chess that he died." EVERY VERSION OF HIS OBITUARY WILL END WITH "CHECKMATE."
Every time we play chess, you're hoping that I die!!
I'm not!
Okay, I am. But it's a small hope!
Yeah, a small hope I'll be dead and gone and remembered as "The Guy Who Was So Upset When He Lost His Queen That His Heart Stopped Beating"!
Yes! Exactly!
I'm not a terrible person, Utahraptor! If you died playing chess I'd be sad, obviously! But also happy, because I KICKED YOUR ASS STRAIGHT TO THE GRAVE.
...Let us pause here and remember how truth and honesty are the foundation of any social relationship?

transcription.title: don't tell anyone else though, okay?

panel.line: What is love? Love is "a strong positive emotion of regard and affection". It was a silly question to ask because the answer is right there in the dictionary!
But that's too easy. We have to complicate up that business!

Maybe we'll insist that love can't be defined, that it's beyond the reach of rational thought, that we fall in and out of love in a way that is completely beyond our control. All we can do is hope for the best and hold on for the ride, because it's Cupid's arrow straight through the heart, striking anywhere at any time! It's a lot like an axe murderer, or a brain aneurysm. Or a stroke. Or dementia.
Love is just a feeling! A CHEMICAL STATE. We don't need to deify it!
So romantic!

I've got nothing against romance! You can still be romantic while maintaining that love is an understandable emotion. Just be rational! And don't do tons of stupid stuff and use "I was in love!" as the justification. That's not love: that's responsibility deflection.

A voice outside the picture: So you're completely rational about love? You keep any non-sciency feelings out of it, walking around town saying "this person is acceptable; I will proceed to love them. Love begins in 3, 2, 1, - now."
Excuse me!
I just THINK that

transcription.title: it's like turtles with mutagen. it happens in seconds!!

panel.line: So it turns out that there's different kinds of love.
I know! Who knew?

There's ROMANTIC LOVE, but there's also the love you feel for a family member, an activity, religious love, a sandwich, and so on. And we call all these "love", which maybe is why people are so confused about it! What we need are DIFFERENT words for each of these feelings.
Like other languages!
Aw man! Other languages already stole my idea?

Long ago, actually! Ancient Greek had words for passionate love (eros), dispassionate love (philia), the love of family (storge), general affection (agape), and so on. Versions of these survive in modern Greek as well!
Aha, but still no sandwich love!
EVERY DAY EACH OF US SAYS THE DUMBEST THING WE ARE GOING TO SAY THAT DAY.
Hey, maybe the ancient Greeks all died out and evolved into current Greeks PRECISELY BECAUSE they didn't have a word for "sandwich love"??
T-REX IS GETTING HIS OUT OF THE WAY EARLY.

transcription.title: what you need to imagine here is an english lit prof in tweed with a case of the righteous punches

panel.line: I am a fan of knowing things! Generally, the more things you know, the better prepared you are for someone asking "Hey, do you know all about 18th century literature?"
Because then if you know about 18th century literature you can punch them aside and say "OBVIOUSLY!"

But it occurs to me there are situations where ignorance is bliss! For example, imagine if you knew all about how the worst moment of your life would go down. You'd spend a bunch of your time saying "Aw dang, that's STILL going to suck!"
Or maybe you'd say "I'm glad my current circumstances aren't as bad as THAT!" or "Now that THAT'S over, things have nowhere to go but up!"
True. Okay, but say you knew the BEST moment of your life!
Something to look forward to!
Okay, but say it's passed, so it's all downhill from here on out.
Still, maybe you've got a bunch of tied-for-second moments, and I bet all those combined are better than one single best moment!
FINE.
T-REX KNOWING EVERYTHING IS NOT ACTUALLY THAT GREAT
I knew it!! Why?
WELL I KNOW EXACTLY 217 PEOPLE ARE CURRENTLY PLANNING TO SNIFF THEIR OWN POO AND CLAIM IT WAS AN "ACCIDENT"

transcription.title: red! red!! WIIIIIIIIIIIIIINE

panel.line: You know who hasn't written a screenplpay for a while?
MOST PEOPLE
But especially me!!

Okay, so the scene opens in a spaceship and it's the future! The ship is this huge mechanical leviathan, all pipes and metal catwalks, unfriendly, imposing. And it's drifting in deep space! The engines have overloaded and blown up. This is all explained in the opening musical montage, set to "Louie Louie"!
It's comedy?
Um, no! It's science fiction DRAMA. "Louie Louie" is just a really good song.

What's his story?
Well, he's a gruff man, but he knows his spaceships. His name? Captain Flannigan O'Spaceships.
Captain O'Spaceships.
Yes. He's yelling "Status!" and there's a dramatic strings version of "Red Red Wine" playing. It's a very tense scene!

Running up behind you like that?

Slogan on the front! And maybe on the back sometimes!
Forget that, man! Let's kick it up a notch or two! Let's break free of our self-imposed t-shirt boundaries.
How? Funny sweaters? Funny evening gowns? Funny HOSIERY?
Layers, Dromiceiomimus! SEQUENCES.
Beneath an "I'M WITH STUPID" shirt, wear another one that says "NO, NOT REALLY".

transcription.title: the sequel is "The Pedestrian Who Was Dropping His Pants While Also Dropping A Barf"

panel.line: Most of Shakespeare's life is a mystery! People spend their time reading his plays and saying "Man, this guy has dudes sailing from cities that are days away from large bodies of water."
"He must not have known geography that well!"
"Therefore... he must not have travelled that much! I HAVE UNCOVERED A FACT ABOUT SHAKESPEARE'S LIFE!" and then they're happy.
But that's because there's not much we actually know about Shakespeare's life.
That's exactly my point! We're RECONSTRUCTING it from hints, subtext, deduction and innuendo from his works. I CAN USE THIS.
How?
In my own life!

I'll write plays that HINT at how great I am, how smart and sexy and awesome everyone finds me. Then I just excise every other mention of myself from history, and the plays are the only source left! They're the only way to learn about the towering mind behind them, this Adonis of authors, this... T-Rex.
But what if your play sucks and nobody wants to know ANYTHING about its author?
Please. My first play is called "The Motorist Who Spewed Racial Epithets While Also Spewing Vomit"!
(It was inspired by an actual motorist I felt terrible about AND for!)

transcription.title: WHAT'S THE DEAL WITH THE AFTERLIFE, AMIRITE? SOMEBODY SHOULD GET ON THIS

panel.line: So, God!
HEY WHAT'S UP
I was wondering, what happens when you die?
UM
PRETTY SURE I GET TO LIVE FOREVER
No no, I mean, what happens when the RHETORICAL "you" dies?
WE ALL START SPEAKING MORE PRECISELY
What happens to ME when I die? Me. Myself!
I DO BELIEVE YOU GET BRAINED BY A TEAP CUP
Argh! Never try to have a theological discussion with God!
I never do!
In fact, I don't try to have theological discussions, period! Debating something that boils down to "I believe this despite an absence of proof" is not my idea of fun times.
ALL I WANT TO KNOW IS WHAT HAPPENS WHEN I DIE
...Don't you get brained by a teacup?
Alright, that's it. Attention, everyone! I have an announcement to make! I don't know when people started using "brain" as a verb, but i find I am forced to give it my full endorsement!!

transcription.title: it's only plagiarism if you write "plagiarism: the final frontier" and then you have a li'l footnote saying "i totally wrote every word of that, SCREW GENE RODDENBERRY"

panel.line: I think it would be a great idea to write a really convincing essay praising plagiarism, and have significant parts of it plagiarized. Hilarious!
Looks like this Thursday morning just got filled up!!
Ahem. Plagiarizing is the act of plagiarizing; taking someone's words or ideas as if they were your own! That's from the dictionary, Dromiceiomimus. I plagiarized it!

At what point does plagiarism begin, though? When defining a word, especially in brief, it's possible you'd hit on the exact same word structure as someone else. That's not plagiarism, that's just "#8211;independent invention!
Yeah, and if you say "I'm hungry", you're not plagiarizing everyone who's said it before!
FINE.
"How do I love plagiarism? Let me count the ways."
Well, there you're using a poem so famous I'd argue it doesn't need citation. It's a reference! People will get it.
Ah! You mean like "Plagiarism: the final frontier"?
"But, soft! what light through yonder window breaks? It is the east, and Plagiarism is the sun"?
"Deep into that darkness peering, long I stood there, plagiarizing, fearing"?
I feel like maybe you're not sure what plagiarism is

transcription.title: astute readers will notice that t-rex has travelled through time on many occasions. just sayin'!

panel.line: Any machine that travels through time has to be a machine that travels through space as well! I've been saying this for years.
Because dudes, the Earth is spinning on its axis!

And it's whipping around the sun, and the sun is rotating in the arm of a galaxy that's also whipping around the Universe. You go back in time without travelling through space, you're likely to find yourself alone in the vacuum, millions of kilometers behind the Earth you left a (relative) instant ago!
Perhaps! But this problem only comes up if you're not the centre of the Universe.
Huh?

If you're not the centre of the Universe, then you're perched on an Earth that's whipping through space, and sure, there's problems from that. But if you ARE the centre of the Universe, then everything's revolving around you! You can go through time without worry, because you'll always arrive right where you started.
Oh, wow! This means that if we can travel through time, then we can also SCIENTIFICALLY PROVE whether of not someone is actually the centre of the Universe.
Science keeps surprising me in surprising new ways!

transcription.title: if this were the last dinosaur comic ever, it would be exactly the same, except the last panel would be replaced with t-rex's painting

panel.line: So let's say I'm a painter, and I've studied really hard and I've worked really hard and I've become one of the best painters in the world. Hooray! Except there's one problem:
There's nowhere to go but down!

I've got no new frontiers to challenge! Do I quit while I'm ahead? That seems like a waste of all effort. or do I power throgh and continue painting as my body begins to fail, trying to recall my earlier successes as my work inevitably declines, sliding towards self-parody?
I think that's egotistical and false dichotomy!
Explain!

Just because you've conquered everything about painting TODAY doesn't mean you've also conquered everything about painting in the future. You're in privileged position of a master painter: from that high vantage point, maybe you can see where the medium can go next!
I have a confession, Utahraptor!
I was 10 the last I painted! And it was muscley dog doing the splits. And I'm sure Leonardo could have painted it better. And I'm pretty sure I'm talking about the Ninja Turtle there.
Aaaaand now I'm certain of it. I am speaking of the ninja teen.

transcription.title: hey everyone, remember xtreegold? man i have been on, like, a 24-hour xtgold nostalgia bender

Wooooo

I'm not sure I'd want to be with someone who describes their own body as "surprising".

You really think your body is perfect, don't you?
Honestly, I don't see any flaws!

Really? Because if you had wings on your back, that would look incredible in this amazing death metal sort of way, and they might even give you limited flight abilities. I'd say that's MORE perfect! I'd say it's so much more perfect, in fact, that their absence becomes an almost palpable flaw.

transcription.title: AND BY "RELIGION" I MEAN "CHRISTIANITY"

panel.line: If I had lived in the past I'd have different beliefs, because I'd have nobody modern around me to teach me anything else!
FACT.

And I find it really unlikely that I would come up with all our modern good stuff on my own, running around saying "YOU GUYS! DEMOCRACY IS PRETTY OKAY. ALSO, WOMEN ARE EQUAL TO MEN, AND RACISM? KIND OF A DICK MOVE!". If I was raised by racist and sexist parents in the middle of a racist and sexist society, I'm pretty certain I'd be racist and sexist! I'm only as enlightened as I am today because I've stood on the shoulders of giants.
I'm pretty certain that you're right!
Okay, good!
But that doesn't make me a terrible person, right? We're judging the past by the standard of the present.
Right.

T-REX LISTEN THIS IS WHY I DON'T THINK ABOUT RELIGION THAT HARD

MAN

transcription.title: i've eaten so many friggin' animals!! i've eaten ALL the friggin' animals.

panel.line: I have been assuming that our development as a people is linear, moving generally from less to more permissive. It occurs to me:
Maybe that isn't always the case!
Maybe 100 years from now people will look back on us and say "MAN I can't believe they permitted lifestyles different than my own, current lifestyle. Sheesh!"
Or maybe they'll look back and be aghast at all the animals we kill and eat for food?
Aw man, do you really think so? Frig, I'd be TOTALY POOCHED. I've eaten so many friggin' animals!
Most of us have though!
Yeah, but I'm totally the worst.

Future folks can munch on a carrot, look back on us and say "They were wrong to eat so many tasty animals." FINE. But then when they see the caliber, frequency and verve of MY animal consumption, they'll spit out their carrots in surprise! And teh carrot chunks are 99% guaranteed to spell out the words "HISTORY'S GREATEST VILLAIN"!
Come on! Our culture COULD end up swinging towards rampant fleshotarianism instead.
That's true. Man!
The future having different opinions than the present is making it REALLY HARD for me to be popular across all possible timelines.

transcription.title: 10,000-pound gorillas!!

panel.line: ADVENTURES IN METAPHORS!
Hey everyone, let's kick up our metaphors a notch, okay? It's time for 800-pound gorillas to become 1000-pound gorillas!
10,000-pound gorillas!!
It's time for us to do things three-quarters assed. Or deci-assed. If we're doing something femto-assed then why are we even doing it at all?
Domiceiomimus: It's time for us to not just break the ice, but smash it?
We can do whatever we want, Dromiceiomimus! We can gently tap on the ice. We can rub our cheeks on the ice. WE CAN SMASH THROUGH THE ICE WITH A SUPERHEATED NUCLEAR BOMB!!
I don't see how this engenders effective communication.
And I don't see how that's possible!

We will not be "rolling in dough", Utahraptor. We will be SNOWBOARDING down MOUNTAINS of dough. Dough will splash up and get in our eyes. We will have to go to the doctor, and we will say, "You can keep what you pull out of my eyes, Doc. These days I'm snowboarding down mountains of the stuff."

Why didn't he compliment my metaphor

transcription.title: destruction is the natural response

panel.line: Forget it! All these personal revelations have left me baffled, disoriented. Values are baseless and nothing can be known or communicated!
I believe this is called "nihilism".
When we abandon illusions, life is revealed as nothing! It is nothing short of absurd!
There is no objective order to the world: all values are baseless and reasoning is impotent!
Destruction is the natural response to such a metaphysical collapse!
GoodBYE, house!
It is futile to do one's best in an absurd world!
Wait!
IS it not true that a "cheerful nihilism" can carry the day, distinguished by an easy-going acceptance of meaninglessness? There is no need for such physical and psychological destruction.
Consider that!
If we accept that all perspectives are equally non-binding, then intellectual or moral arrogance will determine which perspective has precedence!
MY APOCALYPTIC TENOR HAS NOT BEEN DISPELLED!

I can't remember a thing about myself!
Therefore, I will use deduction to determine my role and place in society.
Judging by this well-conditioned body - including thighs - and coupled with what I feel intuitively to be an impressive intellect, I can be one thing and one thing alone!
An astronaut.
You're not an astronaut.
I'm not?
No!
You are a Tyrannosaurus Rex.
Seriously?
Yep.
Seriously.
Kick ass!

transcription.title: to my knowledge there are no helicopter pilots who have married poorly who read my comic. if you are one, then hopefully by "married poorly" you just mean "the wedding itself was ridiculous, strictly amateur hour"

panel.line: What's so great about being an adult?
Let's consider!
Adults can eat whatever foods they want, but also have to pay income taxes and manage personal finances, which is Boring and Stupid!
Adults can buy their own clothes, but also have to reconcile themselves to the fact that sooner or later, their best years will be behind them!
Adults can own grocery stores, but also have to face the long slow of their body, mind and self!
Adults can see R-rated movies, but also have responsibility for their own well-being!
Yes!
Adults can pilot helicopters, but also can marry poorly!
Adults can sex each other up, but also can put so much meaning and pour so much hope into a single dream that, when this dream is finally achieved, it can never possibly live up to its expectations!
Utahraptor?
Utahraprot: Yes?
...That one made me sad.

transcription.title: the gift-givers were like, "SERIOUSLY?? ALL YOU HAVE ARE NASEEM BALLOONS? FRIG. I'LL TAKE *ONE*"

panel.line: Here are some things that are sad!
Abandoned puppies, and little birds with a wing in a cast. Aww!

And then you throw in an orphan with a crutch! And a little girl holding the limp string and rubbery plastic remains of her only birthday gift this year, a balloon with the words "Happy Birthday Naseem!" printed on it. The girl's name is Jenn.
And the balloon wasn't filled with helium! It was filled with water.
Brackish, swampy water! And it was tossed to her without warning and now she's drenched.
And the water also drenched the orphan and puppies and birds!
Yes!

They're all drenched, lost in sorrow - a new kind of sorrow, a grief, a sadness so intense it could smother them. Dripping wet, staring at the ground, they weep. Eventually Jenn looks up and smiles as best she can, bravely, but it's so small, so fragile. She turns and walks away, her broken balloon dragging behind her.

A scientist runs up, explaining that dogs and birds can't cry! But, as she examines the animals she discovers that in addition to tear ducts, they have ALSO evolved the ability to experience sadness with an intensity previously unknown on the planet. THE END.

panel.line: SECRETS.
Do we keep them in order to keep relationships running smoothly?

Do we share them to cement friendships? Treasure them because we value knowledge, and if the knowledge is privileged then it's even MORE valuable? Create them because we are all hopelessly duplicitous and our public faces and private personas can never be reconciled?
Perhaps we create them out of shame?
Yes!
Those who keep their failings secret appear more perfect, and so we too keep our shames private, in order to bring ourselves up to this impossible standard!
And when failings are revealed, we react with judgement, fearing any sympathy might arouse interest in our own secrets!

panel.line: LITERARY TECHNIQUE COMICS today's technique: FLASH FORWARD
Flash forwards are a useful storytelling technique! They happen when you-
Frig, we're all dead!!
Get the hell out of here, Dromiceiomimus! The Contamination is right behind me!
You let it loose?!
I didn't let is loose - it let itself loose! It's self-aware, I'm sure of it, but all it seems to be aware of...

panel.line: LITERARY TECHNIQUE COMICS today's literary technique: PLOT TWISTS
Plot twists are when you think the murderer was the cape guy, but then it turns out....
...the murderer was actually this other cape guy!!
They also happen when a plant is revealed to ACTUALLY be a ghost plant. Or when Oedipus realizes he's in Oedipus Rex and then stabs out his eyes!
He actually stabs out his eyes becuase he realizes he's murdered his father and married his mother.
*gasp*
Twists upon twists!!
Plot twists don't always happen at the end, though!
It's true!

Sometimes they happen in the middle. Like in romantic comedies when the female lead says "You know what I'M just not that into? NOT BEING INMY GIANT ROBOT SUIT!" and then she walks around in her giant robot suit.
...What?
And then Mr. Darcy shows up in HIS robot suit, and he holds up a sign that says, "Forsooth, I had forgotten I ownned this robot Suitte"?
Holy crap, Utahraptor! Would it be a plot twist IN MY OWN LIFE to spend all my time rewriting out-of-copyright books??

panel.line: Okay, so let's assume you know the position of every air molecule in the room.
Things are going pretty well for you, my friend!

Someone in the room says something to another person, and then they both leave. Assuming you know exactly how they moved when they left (and therefore how they displaced the air!) then any remaining displacement is due to sound waves. By looking at the location of the air molecules in the empty room, you can reconstruct what was said in the past! Dudes! It's a perfect, UNDETECTABLE listening device!
But how much particle displacement happens at conversational levels?
LOTS, probably!

I dunno, Sound's a wave that travels THROUGH the medium it's in, right, so I'd imagine that's mostly oscillation, not displacement. If you talk to me from across the room, I'm not being splattered with air from inside your lungs.

panel.line: My new book is called "BILLY THE TEEN! BILLY WAS THE TEEN... WHO LOVED BEING A TEEN!"
(It's aimed towards teens!)

So, after clearly being established as a teen, Billy goes off and meets some other teens! They become friends and they hang around outside fast-food restaurants, and sometimes, they go in and get some fast food FROM the restaurant. Later, Billy announces that he just plain loves being a teen! All his friends nod their heads in ready agreement.
And then what happens?
A few pages in, Billy realizes his 20th birthday is coming up!
He'll no longer be a teen. It's a disaster! He's TERRIFIED. He's waking up in cold sweats. Billy's certain that when he becomes 20 he'll lose something vital of himself.
And then?
And then... he dies of a heart attack!

But like, 50 years later, you know? Long after he's come to terms with everything. The vast bulk of the book details Billy's entire adult life, and the last page says "The actual title this book is 'Mr. Bill Peterson, Who Came To Terms with His Life Over 60 Years'".

transcription.title: CORPORATE verbing weirds language

panel.line: I am generally a pretty easy-going guy! But guys, there's this one thing really boils my potatoes!
TWEETING.

Okay, I get that you're using Twitter! SUPER. But I really don't get why we need a new verb for that.. All "tweeting" means is "posting to Twitter": it's got the same meaning as "post", except THIS verb can only be used in relation to a single corporate website. That's insane! Corporations invent nouns all the time, and I can accept that, but verbs? Really? Is updating Twitter SO DIFFERENT than updating any other website that we need a whole new word for it?
Man this is old news, Professor Curmudgeonly! You ever seen something escalate?
Sure have!

OH DAMN "ESCALATE" IS A VERB MADE UP FROM "ESCALATOR", WHICH WAS ITSELF A TRADEMARK! So now you can't escalate. And you also can't zip up your pants. Or go trampolining, roller-blading, or jetskiing. Or tase your enemies.
Man! Friggin' English friggin' lets me down friggin' again!!
Also!
...I do believe that last sentence let me down as well
Somebody please write a really popular song about me, okay?
And make it really catchy, okay?
And make sure all the lyrics are really positive, stuff like "Oh T-Rex you're so fine / you're so fine you blow my mind / Oh T-Rex / you are assuredly the best is what I'm communicating here", okay?
Why?
A #1 song all about how great I am -- It's the best PR imaginable! Folks'll meet me and say, "YOU'RE T-Rex?! Suddenly, arousal washes over me as unstoppably as the ocean tide."
You meet some eloquent people!
Once this song is written I will, anyway!
But have you considered that no song stays popular forever? There's bound to be a backlash, and the faster a song becomes popular, the greater the backlash to it once it begins to fall from favour!
Impossible! I'm certain that THIS song will be so good that, for the rest of time, folks will forever say,
Off-Panel speaker: Dear God, this song is like a polka equivalent of Vanilla Ice covering "Achy Breaky Heart" in a quarter-time falsetto.
Hey! Hey you, across the street!
Daaaaang.

panel.line: Dudes!
Why are there not cyborgs yet?

Every day we're closer to the future, and YET, every day I have to watch movies to see a cyborg rebelling against purely organic life, instead of just looking out my dang window! panel.line: Cell phones built into your friggin' hands!
IT'S THE FUTURE!

You'll think, "Hey, I wanna call Ricky!" and then, digits will glow on your palm. you punch them in and then make your hand into a phone shape! Talk into your pinkie while listening on your thumb, and when you're done, you just mime hanging up! That's the future, my friends. Cell phones built into our friggin' hands!

I'm afraid you're making the #1 mistake in predicting the future, T-Rex!
What's that?

Only extending existing technology forward. Why are we till shackled to the cell phone interface? It's a thought-activated process, so why do we have to dial? transcription.title: now you never have to admit that you've never committed any poems to memory! YOU JUST DID

panel.line: Okay, so I've been down on poems in the past. I MAY have been heard to remark "Guys, poetry bloetries." But I've just discovered:
Poems likely predate the written word!

It makes sense when you think about it. Before writing, the only way to keep track of something is to memorize it! And if you're memorizing something in POEM form, then you can automatically incorporate structure to the language: say, rhyming couplets. And that structure gives you something to jog your memory if you forget! The result is that structured narrative poetry can be much easier to remember than just free verse.
So poems could be among the earliest, most practical forms of communication!
Yes!
And this is why I feel bad! I didn't know that I was making fun of one of the Elder Gods of language! I thought I was making fun of "The smelly dog who pooed / Has spied me in the nude".
So now more respect for poetry?
I promise it!!
THE END
BONUS PANEL: THE COMPLETE TEXT OF "THE SMELLY DOG WHO POOED"!
The smelly dog who pooed / Has spied me in the nude / I say to him "Hark! Who goes?"
I think the smell comes out his nose

transcription.title: "i've saved $3.55 in my life. $3.55 in 80 years. :0"

panel.line: Conceptual metaphors are those that allow us to understand one idea in terms of another! They inform the language we use when talking about all sorts of concepts, and are almost subconscious.
For example: "LIFE IS A JOURNEY"!

People use this metaphor all the time, all talkin' about "going places in life," "getting a head start in life," "being at a crossroads," and so on. It's so entrenched that to talk about life using another metaphor seems odd! For example, saying "I've saved $3.55 in life" sounds weird, but only because I'm using the much less popular "LIFE IS A DISCOUNT STORE WITH SALES THAT CAN OCCASIONALLY BE TAKEN ADVANTAGE OF" metaphor.
Are there other metaphors like this?
Oh, tons!

"Burning with desire and "warming up to someone"? That's "AFFECTION IS HEAT." "Falling behind" at work before "catching up"? "SCHEDULES ARE MOVING OBJECTS." "You're in my way," "Get out of my way," and, ARGUABLY, "I've lost my way"? That's the classic "DIRECTION IS A BUCKET THAT PEOPLE KEEP SNEAKING INTO."
In conclusion, cognitive linguists love conceptual metaphors because they allow us to describe direction as an intensely desirable giant bucket.
The end!

transcription.title: He has "hung a lampshade" on it, if you will, allowing us all to move on. Good job, Shakespeare! Once again you have saved the play

panel.line: Lampshade hanging is when you've got something hella dumb in your story, but then Shakespeare shows up and says "Forsooth, guys, that's dumb" and then the audience accepts it!
BECAUSE WHO WOULD ARGUE WITH FRIGGIN' SHAKESPEARE??
LITERARY TECHNIQUE COMICS today's technique: LAMPSHADE HANGING
Shakespeare has drawn attention to the hella dumb, and in doing so, addresses and placates audience concern!
Sure!
But any character can pull that off. It doesn't have to be Shakespeare.

It doesn't hurt! If a random character says "that's dumb", I'll listen. But if SHAKESPEARE says it, I'm spitting out my drink and saying "Wow, Shakespeare!! I'd better listen to THIS line of dialogue right away!"
MEANWHILE, IN TUDOR ENGLAND:
Shakespeare, you should have a line that says "Forsooth, if this were in a play, I'd want my tuppence back!"
Shakespeare: t-rex
Shakespeare: who told you all we tudor england people say is "forsooth"
Shakespeare: because that is RACIST

transcription.title: my father wanted a comic about this for his birthday. HAPPY BIRTHDAY DAD.

panel.line: Ssh! Come closer!
I know yet more secrets!
Yet more SECRETS of the MEDICAL PROFESSION!

Okay, so let's say you're a dude or lady who often is called upon to perform CPR on someone in cardiac arrest. Nice. YOU'RE A HANDY PERSON TO HAVE AROUND. When performing CPR, you're aiming for 100 chest compressions per minute, but this is an awkward rate to hit. HOWEVER, if you hum Queen's "Another One Bites The Dust", you'll be fine! The song is simple, catchy, memorable, AND has a steady beat that runs, as it turns out, at exactly 100 beats a minute.
So the professional performing CPR on me is thinking "Bum bum bum / Another one bits the dust"?
Quite possibly!
And if I ever need to perform CPR on you, you can bet I'LL be belting it out at the top of my lungs.
T-Thanks?
No worries, man! I've got your back. Listen. It'll be a great show.
Although, I MIGHT change the lyrics to "Hey there guys / You know what would be great? / If this guy / would cardiopulmonarily resuscitate"
We share the laughter AND the tears, Utahraptor.

transcription.title: TWO WAYS TO MAKE NEW FRIENDS. just two.

panel.line: Guys, there are basically a billion different ways to make new friends!
TWO WAYS TO MAKE NEW FRIENDS

Okay there are at least two ways to make new friends. One way is to look at the friends your existing friends already have, and then pick out/up the most awesome ones from those! This algorithm allows you to grow your network of friends in much the same way that ANY NUMBER of deadly diseases reproduce!
You need a seed friend, though!
True!
And that brings us to method one: online dating!
But that results in spouses, not buddies!
Not NECESSARILY: Look up profiles, find someone interesting and date 'em, and then say that you "just want to be friends"! Kapow: INSTANT FRIENDSHIP THAT'LL LAST A LIFETIME.
Friendship, founded on deceit and romantic frustration.
No deceit with me, baby! I use the lines sincerely!

If I just want to be friends, I just want to be friends! And if I'm saying "It's not you, it's me", then I'm also saying. "Frig, man, I've got to go pull myself together! I'm dropping the ball here, and it's REALLY not fair to you."
"P.S. Let's make out."

transcription.title: If anything, we can say that lasting peace is rare. But over and over throughout history, just when it appears to be within reach, we seem to collectively shrug our shoulders and say, "Naw, forget it."

panel.line: There are tons of phrases in the English language that I can never use because they've already been claimed by someone else!
What the heck English?

If I want to give a very serious and momentous speech about the history of war, I can! But if I also want it to begin with "Now this is a story all about how some lives got flipped, turned upside down"? I CAN'T. It is a perfectly awesome introductory phrase that is forbidden to me - unless I'm cool with my audience and being distracted by thoughts of young Willard Smith! Fresh Prince used scorched earth tactics when withdrawing from the phrase.
Why don't you just ignore all that and use it anyway?
It doesn't work!

Even if I'M ignoring it, my audience won't know to! I'll be explaining the origins of conflict as hard as I friggin' can, but they'll all be hopelessly distracted by thoughts of chillin' out, maxin' out, relaxin' all cool and all shooting some b-ball outside of the school!
Well then - phrase it differently!
SPEECH DAY
The history of war is a journey. A narrative. A story that, at its core, is all about how some lives become turned upside-down by conflict: "flipped" if you will.
FRIG IT'S STILL A REFERENCE.

transcription.title: if i get audited in the future i'm blaming this comic SO HARD

panel.line: Alright everyone!
Let's do our friggin' TAXES!
Woooo
LATER:
So um it appears taxes are not as fun as I expected.
How fun did you expect them to be?
Dromiceiomimus, I expected nothing less than the fun of a job well done!
And...?
Did you do them well?
Man, who can say?
There's no feedback at the end: no "B+ try harder next time", no "PURR-FECT WORK" sticker and then there's a picture of a cat!

There's just the knowledge that audits can happen for any reason, AND the knowledge that there's no statute of limitations for tax fraud, even accidental, and that the only other crime with such status is MURDER.
Woooo

transcription.title: several advantages to amnesia

transcription.title: i wrote this whole comic before actually thinking to check that st. patrick lived before the 1200s. turns out he lived from around 387 AD to 461 AD! thanks, st. patrick! YOU SAVED ME FROM HAVING TO SCRAP A COMEDIC PREMISE

panel.line: IT'S ST. PATRICK'S DAY!
HERE ARE SOME FACTS ABOUT ST. PATRICK'S DAY!
Did you know that St. Patrick used to be associated with the color BLUE?

It's true! You travel back in time to the 1200s and you say "What color goes with St. Patrick?" and they'll answer "blue"! Eventually. First you'll need to figure out how to communicate with the people there: their vowels will sound all crazy to your ears. Plus, assuming you're in an English speaking part of the world- and there were a lot fewer of them then- the language was way more Germanic than what you're used to.
You're right in the middle of Middle English, my friend!
And it was really fragmented back then!
The British will end up creating a Standard English just to ensure that government communication can be READ outside of London.
But not until the 1400s, so if you're in the 1200s and nobody understands you, you could always wander around, find another dialect group, and try again!
Anyway yeah now St. Patrick's color is green

transcription.title: i call this comic, "the one i wrote wednesday morning, shortly after chartering a helicopter ride for two"

panel.line: I have no plans for tonight. Will this TRULY be another night of staying in, solitude, and quiet contemplation of my life thus far?
Forget that!!
Dromiceiomimus, let's do something tonight! Something awesome!
What did you have in mind?

Something! ANYTHING. We're awesome AND we have disposable income - why do we have dull evenings? Why aren't we taking helicopter rides to the grocery store? Why aren't we WHITE WATER RAFTING into our friggin' jobs?

daaaaaamn

transcription.title: for those not keeping track of t-rex's nicknames for his fists, they run as follows: knuckles and chuckles; rocco and choco: the twins! who! punch!; the chinese buffet; geraldine and geraldina; and now, plans b through c.

panel.line: Man, I'm not old! I do tons of stuff that's not old people stuff! Do old people knock back extremely sour gumballs like they were regular gumballs?
If they do, they're not doing it around me!

Do old people stomp on things in their way instead of walking slowly around them? Do old people solve their problems with their fists? I have never seen an elderly gentleman solve problems with his fists!
I've never seen you solve problems with your fists either, actuall!
Then you must not've been looking, Dromiceiomimus! My left fist is called "Plan B" because it solves so many problems!
And what's your right fist called?
"Plan C!"
It's put into action in the event that Plan B fails. ONLY IT'S NEVER BEEN USED BECAUSE PLAN B NEVER FAILS!!
And this makes you not old.
Yep! I'm young because MY body parts still have nicknames.

transcription.title: puppyocracies OH MY GOODNESS WHO HAS THE BALANCE OF POWER AND SUCH A CUTE LITTLE NOSE

panel.line: If someone were to ask me what my favourite suffix is, I would answer them without hesitation: "-cracy"!
IT TURNS ANYTHING INTO A GOVERNMENT.

If you really like sandwiches, all you have to do is think "sandwichocracy", and hey presto, your ideal system of government is right there! If you love yourself, an autocracy is what's perfect for you, mister! And et's say you love action figures.
"Actionfigureocracy"?
WHY THE HECK NOT??
You'd really choose "-cracy" over "-tastic"?
Any day, my friend!

You could say, "Hey, imagine something awesometastic" and I can say, "Wait, imagine an awesomeocracy instead!" and then everyone will imagine my thing instead because it's better. Plus, "-cracy" INCLUDES "-tastic". All sandwichocracies are sandwichtastic, but not all things sandwichtastic are a sandwichocracy!
T-REX WHAT IF I TOLD YOU THE UNIVERSE WAS JUST A TEST TO SEE IF "SANDWICHOCRACY" AND "SANDWICHTASTIC" WOULD EVER BE USED IN A SENTENCE

YOU WOULDN'T THINK IT WAS A BIT OF A LET DOWN AT THE END THEN HUH

transcription.title: i was going to tell you the hapax legomenon i found in dinosaur comics so far, but if i did so it would no longer be the case. it would become a self-unfulfilling prophecy!

panel.line: Let's say I decide to say a word only once in my ENTIRE life. That's a hapax legomenon!
HAPAX LEGOMENON
"just as cool as it sounds"

Hapax legomenons are words that are only said once by someone! They're also words that only appear once a book, or even once in the ENTIRE RECORDS OF A LANGUAGE. Like "gopherwood"! It only shows up ONCE in both the Bible AND in the entire writtern record of Classical Hebrew. That's one heck of a hapax!
What does it mean?
Nobody knows! It's a kind of wood? Probably?

It's there because God's all "NOAH BUILD AN ARK OUT OF GOPHERWOOD OKAY" but now we're all, "what? Um, maybe he meant cypress wood? Did somebody transcribe this friggin' poorly?" It's cool how unlikely we are to ever discover anything new about a hapax!
Its precise meaning will forever remain a mystery!
T-REX GOPHERWOOD IS JUST WOOD THAT WAS PEED ON BY A GOPHER
I CONFESS I FIND THE SCENT
INTOXICATING
YES ITS PRECISE MEANING WILL FOREVER REMAIN A MYSTERY

transcription.title: anyway. turns out that t-rex is ACTUALLY mad at a wide cross-section of history

panel.line: It's not that hard to be creative! But sometimes when I come up with a joke, I find out it's already been invented in the past, and it's always by the same dead guy! I now have a beef with this dead person. You'd best watch out...
...OSCAR WILDE!

Man, Oscar! Here's a guy who's been taking the credit for TONS of great jokes that I would have come up with if he hadn't done so first. Telling a border guard "I have nothing to declare except my genius"? I TOTALLY WOULD'VE COME UP WITH THAT IF IT HAD NOT ALREADY BEEN COME UP WITH. "I'm not young enough to know everything"? THAT PROBABLY WOULD'VE BEEN MY BON MOT. Wilde's the most egregious preemptive plagiarizer of my funny jokes ever!
You're not mad at Oscar Wilde, T-Rex!
Pretty sure I am, Utahraptor!
No, you're mad at J. M. "Peter Pan" Barrie for the young one, and at some anonymous wag for the genius one - nobody's found a reliable link to Oscar for it. He just gets the credit!
Huh. Okay, I'LL be the guy who's mad at all the UNWARRANTED credit Wilde gets, then.
"If with the literate I am/ Impelled to try an epigram,/ I never seek to take the credit; / We all assume that Oscar said it." - Dorothy Parker.
FRIG.
...I'm going home to never do anything original again, okay?

panel.line: What doesn't kill you only makes you stronger!
Is that... medicine?

I know it doesn't work in all cases, or maybe even MOST cases, but it works with vaccination, right? A weaker version of the disease teaches your body to fight the real deal. I'm intrigued because the same thing also happened to me this morning!
MAN THAT'S CRAZY THE SAME THING HAPPENED TO ME TODAY TOO

transcription.title: am i to understand the operating room also has something dangerous that can be laughed at AND a business card printing machine? because if so that is an operation room that is very convenient in some very unexpected ways

panel.line: Attention, please, everyone! I've done some reading about the brain and I discovered there's a part of it called the "amygdala"!
And the amygdala is responsible for FEAR RESPONSE!

This is amazing! I had NO IDEA fear was localized to a single location. This opens up whole new avenues in the field of toughening up the very scareable: just open up their brain and remove their amygdala, and it's an instant fearectomy! They'll wake up from surgery, shake your hand, laugh in the face of danger, and then get business cards that say "PHYSICALLY UNABLE TO EXPERIENCE FEAR".
That's like solving a problem of high blood pressure by removing the heart, T-Rex!
Only analogously!

The amygdala doesn't just do fear, anyway: it's also responsible for long-term memory rentention! The more emotional the memory, the better it's stored. If you lose it you also lose the ability to learn from feelings!
Hah! NOT A PROBLEM. You know all I've ever learnt from feelings?
ALL T-REX HAS EVER LEARNT FROM FEELINGS:
"Being sad sucks"

transcription.title: the first draft of this comic had the wrong "who's" in it. I KNOW.

panel.line: I know that getting a transplant is serious business, and that it can be a traumatic event.
But it's also kind of awesome!

If you've got a transplant, it's like you've leveled up! AS A PERSON. The rest of us are stuck with the genes we were born with, but you've got SELECTION. You're made out of the best parts of other people!
It's one way of looking at it!
It's the BEST way of looking at it! Plus, anyone who's had a limb or organ transplant is way more mysterious.
How do you figure?
Listen. I can tell you what my left hand has been up to for most of my life.
But if I had a transplant, I'd have no idea. There'd be a part of my body with a WHOLE DIFFERENT HISTORY than the rest of me: how is that not awesome?
I imagine it'd raise some issues of identity and self...
I imagine it'd raise some issues of WHAT AWESOME THINGS MY HAND HAS BEEN UP TO!
Oh man!! Imagine if my LIVER came from an axe murderer? MINE WOULD BE THE LIVER THAT'S DANGEROUS TO KNOW, and my philosophy would be "If you're not interesting, at least have parts of you that are!"
...Hey, do you want to swap feet sometime?

transcription.title: jokes explained

panel.line: A MAN WALKS INTO A BAR explained
many jokes begin with this line. It is called the "set-up", and is analogous to establishing-shots in films or first paragraphs in essays.
It alerts the audience that what follows is likely to be a short story with a humorous climax!
What is the attraction to this structure of humor? Why are there so many jokes about men walking into bars?
Part of the attraction to this structure may be its possibilities: most anything can happen in a bar, especially if this bar is contained within the wild and wooly world of the verbal jest.
What about the joke, "A man walks into a bar...ouch!"?
Good question!
The joke assumes some sophistication on the part of the audience, an expectation gleamed from previous jokes that the bar is a drinking establishment.
Go on!
The "ouch" is startling. How could entering a bar hurt? It forces us to now re-evaluate our most basic assumptions.
We must ask ourselves, "What if the bar were a bar proper, and by walking into it the man actually, physically walked into it?"
It is this confusion on the part of the listener that is responsible for the humor!
