transcription.title: you know how friday's comic was all about power ballads? I AM STILL LISTENING TO POWER BALLADS AND HAVE NO REGRETS (ABOUT POWER BALLADS)

panel.line: So I am a guy who is really afraid of going crazy. I don't want to go crazy, okay guys??
OKAY.

And I think I've figured out what part of my fear is about: causation! There's tons of mental illnesses where we can't find any reason for them to be happening and have no idea what's causing them. NOBODY KNOWS WHAT CAUSES SCHIZOPHRENIA. You can just wake up one day and say, oh damn dudes, I've got schizophrenia! HOW IS THAT NOT TERRIFYING?
Physical diseases are like that too, T-Rex!
What? No they're not!

Yeah, any disease can have an idiopathic version, meaning for all intents and purposes that it arises spontaneously, with no detectable physical cause. All we can do is shrug and try to treat the symptoms!
SERIOUSLY?
Oh my god being a physical being is such total baloney!
THE END

transcription.title: welcome to "idio" theme week, here at chewbac.ca

panel.line: Today is the day I remove the word "prejudice" from my idiolect and replace it with the word "racist"!
YES.

Now if someone says "T-Rex, I just don't like apples", I'll say "Hey, That's RACIST." and when they say "What? That's not racist!" I'll reply with "The very fact that you're denying that it's racist is EVEN MORE RACIST!"
Will I be the most popular person ever? I can only speculate that the answer is yes!!
How is it racist? Is the apple-hater of a minority creed or socio-economic group?
Oh my god! SO RACIST.
Everyone can hate apples, not just minorities! The very fact that you'd jump to that conclusion shows that you TRULY ARE history's greatest racist!
I was just trying to figure out how this new "racist" thing worked!
Maybe next time you can do it by not DABBLING IN RACISM??

Nobody comes to my friggin' parties anymore

panel.line: Am I ever prepared for a mid-life crisis! I'm seriously ready.

Dromiceiomimus, I'm awesome! If I wake up one morning and think "What have I ever done with my life, have I ever really accomplished anything, OH GOD", then that thought will be followed by "Wait I forgot how awesome I am! NEVERMIND."
What if that second thought doesn't come though?
Impossible! A mid-life crisis is a crisis of confidence, and if there's one thing I've got, it's confidence!

YES. Confidence in who I am, what I've done and where I'm going. And if there's two things I've got, it's confidence AND a bunch of burgers to eat when I get home! So do you wanna come over and eat burgers tonight or what, Utahraptor?
Sure!
Excellent!
If there's THREE things I've got, it's confidence, burgers, and the mantra that "As bad as today gets, soon my stomach will be brimming with beef."

panel.line: A creation myth! Frig!

One day your parents had sex, and then later you showed up?

Better!

panel.line: I'm going to say the word "baloney", so everyone who doesn't want to hear the word "baloney" should stop listening because here comes the word "baloney".
Taste is kind of baloney, you guys!

Delicious food is delicious, no matter how good or bad it is for me! Wouldn't it be so much better if how good a food tasted to me depended on how good the food was FOR me? Chocolate would taste worse the more I gorge on it, until I stopped out of disgust. And if I haven't had any vitamin A in a while, carrots would taste like friggin' MANNA.
But then every time you'd eat something, you'd have no idea how it'll taste!
Sure!
But it's a feedback loop: your own body is training you on what it needs through the medium of taste! Eventually you'd know your own nutritional needs by PURE INTUITION.
It is kind of baloney that poison can b e delicious.
This is what I'm saying!
MEANWHILE, IN THE FUTURE:
Wow, everyone should've just listened to me in the past because I still totally agree with what I was saying!

panel.line: It seems that, despite the "euphemisms" available to them, folks are still discussing feelings in a frank and straightforward manner. Please! You know why our ancestors crawled out of the ocean?

For example, instead of saying "I feel afraid", you can say "Aw crap! I think I've discovered a weakness in myself." And instead of "I love you!", just say "I have found another weakness; please, excuse me."

"The second is at the end of the first fortress: fly above where the door is. The third is found by beating the Fire Bros hiding behind the rock at the eastern side of World 2!"

Utahraptor. They're quite the whistles.

Millions of years of evolution were all leading up to that one amazing moment of your birth! Billions of individuals - entire SPECIES - had risen and fallen, all conspiring together to produce one thing: you!
... Then you went ahead and lost any specialness from that a second later when someone else was born. Nice one.
But you're also special for what you know: information that's recorded nowhere else in the Universe!
Yes!
What idle, passing notions briefly entertained you before falling asleep last night? What snack did you sneak last week? All this information is known by only one person in the entire universe: YOU.
And you consider this information so irrelevant that you forgot it almost as soon as it was known.

Untold volumes of information have been forgotten by you! As they fade unnoticed from your memory, so too do they fade from the Universe. Each future generation has been robbed of this knowledge, expunging it, as you have, completely from existence.
YOU ARE SPECIAL.

transcription.title: I am realizing that a good 50% of cards could conclude with "anyway i felt bad, so here's a card." the other 50% are the happy cards, so they can end with "anyway i felt GOOD, so here's a card, i guess"

panel.line: I had a really good time on the swimming trip you planned!
"THANKS FOR TAKING ME SWIMMING"
a web card

Normally when we get together we all see a movie or something, but it was a great idea to go swimming. I had a great time, and I'm sure we all enjoyed the decadence of swimming in an indoor pool when it's still chilly outside. Let's do it again sometime! Thank you for setting this up.
THE END
Okay, listen, I kinda walked in on you while changing and I saw your naked crotch.
But it was an accident!
"I SAW YOUR NAKED CROTCH BUT IT WAS AN ACCIDENT"
a web card
I don't want to comment on whether or not it was a nice naked crotch! It was fine. I only looked out of some weird instinct. I think we've all got it.
Anyway I felt bad, so here's a card.
THE END

transcription.title: they were called "oh's" and just try to track down an o-shaped cereal that is called "oh's". i cannot imagine a more crowded namespace

panel.line: Once upon a time there was this really great cereal. It was oats in the shape of an "o", sweetened, and inside the "o"s there were clusters of tasty nuts.
It was SO good!

And then they took the cereal off the market and this little kid could never find it again. Okay, it was me. I was the kid. I looked and looked and was convinced all the grocery stores were hiding it somewhere. But it was gone, and that one box of the cereal was all I ever had. I never stopped looking, however, and yesterday I found it - under a different name, but with all the same ingredients!
And? How was it?
WAY too sweet, Utahraptor.

It wasn't too my taste at ALL. And the kicker is I remembered it as being even sweeter! I realized that my tastes had changed long ago - that I'd never again be able to enjoy the cereal I remembered so vividly. I'd been chasing a dream that had somehow become impossible when I wasn't looking.
And for who? For a child I knew decades ago, a child who had long since faded into adulthood - into me. Anyway bottom line I had to see food go to waste so I poured the rest through your mail slot.

transcription.title: i was going to do the myth of medusa, but she's basically king midas with stone instead of gold and the male gaze instead of touch. you heard it here first.

panel.line: THE MYTH OF ICARUS
Icarus and his dad were imprisoned on an island with water patrols, so they couldn't escape by boat. But they still wanted to escape anyway, so they made wings out of wax and feathers and flew away.
Pretty clever, boys!!

And while they were flying, his dad warned Icarus not to fly too close to the sun, because the wax in his wings would melt and he'd fall to his death! Icarus said "Frig, is this symbolic of how we mortals should not aspire to usurp the power of the Gods? Is this an allegory showing the limits and folly of earthly invention? Because we just invented heavier-than-air flight out of WAX and FEATHERS, Dad. I think maybe the Gods won't mind."
And then Icarus flew straight up!
As high as he could!

And as saying that things get hotter the higher up you get is incredibly naive (how come mountain tops aren't sweltering?), Icarus was fine. Temperature actually DECREASES as you go up the troposphere, and there's no way Icarus could fly up to the thermosphere, where things DO get hot, because there's just not enough air.

So Icarus had a great time flying and when he finally landed his dad said "Wow, I sure was wrong", and they spent the rest of their lives flying just as close to the sun as their clever mechanical wings would take them. Kids! The moral is never listen to your elders!!

transcription.title: dromiceiomimus you are the most patient dinosaur of all

panel.line: If I changed my name to "Well and Good", then if I was killed and mangled in a horribly brutal death, the inspector on the scene could chuckle and nudge his friend and say "Hey. I suppose this is MOSTLY Well and Good?"
Hilarious!

Plus, if people saw me on the street they could say "Hey, it's all Well and Good!", except that they wouldn't actually say the "all", so it would just be "Hey, it's Well and Good", which doesn't really work.
...Alright, I've decided. I'm not going to change my name if it ONLY works in the event of my horrific death, Dromiceiomimus.
okay
Why can't you just be happy with the name you've got?
I am!
It doesn't seem like it: you're always trying to change it to something with more of a punchline to it. But jokes get old! And if your name's a joke, you'll be the first one to get tired of it.
That's - that's a really good point, Utahraptor. Alright. No more joke names.
LATER:
Everyone! If I was called T-Tex I could wear big Texas hat all the time!!
THIS IS NO JOKE

transcription.title: i am a man who enjoys eating a barbequed anything now and again

panel.line: I am a man who enjoys eating a barbecued pork chop now and again and then a few times more.
There's no shame in that!
And if you are a man - OR a woman, Dromiceiomimus! - who shares my love for tasty barbecued meat, then you should come over tonight and we'll have a barbecue!
You can barbecue vegetables, T-Rex. I'll bring some vegetables and I'll show you how!
FINE
You can also barbecue whole chickens, T-Rex!
Oh man, and you'll bring some chickens and show me how?
Sure! I'm sure I can pick some up.
EXCELLENT. It's going to be a meat and smoke orgy, Utahraptor. I'm pretty sure we'll end up eating one of ALL of God's creatures, which reminds me, I should invite God to this!
LATER:
T-REX THERE ARE LIKE TWENTY TRILLION DIFFERENT KINDS OF BACTERIA THAT YOU'D HAVE TO BARBECUE TO TASTE ONE OF ALL THE LIFE ON EARTH
THAT SAID
THEY'RE ALL DELICIOUS SO I'M TOTALLY THERE

transcription.title: i can set my calendar by it. "oh, i could kinda go for some fried chicken. i last pigged out on it in april, so what is this - september? it's probably september."

panel.line: T-REX IN: "MY FRIED CHICKEN CYCLE"
Oh daaaaaamn! I'm at the absolute peak of my fried chicken cycle, dudes!

Every eight months or so I really want some fried chicken, the greasier the better. Then, I eat the fried chicken, and THEN, that itch is totally scratched! But it never lasts, and my desire begins to grow again, culminating eight months later, when guys, I could SERIOUSLY go for some fried chicken.
What happens if you don't eat any fried chicken!
The cycle continues regardless!
It's a force of nature. I'm actually proud of it, because most men don't know what having a mammalian menstrual cycle is like - but I do! You know what it's like?
What's it like?
It is entirely analogous to wanting some delicious fried chicken, once every two-thirds of a year.
LATER:
What the heck, Oxford English Dictionary?!
I could've SWORN that "unsay" was something a person can actually do.

transcription.title: add a few Is each time you do it

panel.line: COMICS THAT END IN "OH SHIIII-"
Wow! The plants are nice and the birds are singing and the sun is almost down from the top of the sky.
What a beautiful day!
But T-Rex, what if beauty is nothing but an illusion? What if we're all nothing but dreams within dreams that, for an instant, imagine themselves to be real?
T-Rex and Dromiceiomimus: OH SHIIIIIIII-
THE END
Man, I was paying my taxes and paying my heating bill today, and I think I put the wrong cheque in the wrong envelope!

No worries, Utahraptor! With two cheques, if you put the right cheque in the wrong envelope, you'd have a problem. But the wrong cheque in the wrong envelope is logically equivalent to the right cheque in the right envelope!
T-Rex! That's not what I meant!
T-Rex and Utahraptor: OH SHIIIIIIIIII-

transcription.title: i guess there's not much science fiction where time travel is facilitated by, you know, god

panel.line: T-REX IF YOU COULD SAY ONE SENTENCE TO YOUR PAST SELF WHAT WOULD IT BE
Um - "What's shake-a-lakin', past dude?"
WHAT'S SHAKE-A-LAKIN' PAST DUDE"
You put me on the spot!
I need time to think of what I'd say to my younger self. What would you say, Dromiceiomimus?
"Have confidence in this certainty: things will be alright."
Really? That's a little too after-school special for me and my past self.
I'd say "sending messages through time is possible, and you'll live long enough to take advantage of it!"
Not bad!
But that's already implied by the medium itself. I suppose I could take advantage of the "one sentence" policy and compose the longest most complex sentence ever, and pour my heart into it.
That works too!
But what to say? What to say?
ANYWAY THE REASON I ASKED IS THAT I'VE GOT A MESSAGE FROM YOUR FUTURE SELF
IT READS "TELL PAST ME THAT SAYING 'BONERS AHOY' IS STILL WAY HILARIOUS IN THE FUTURE"
Man!
BUT I WAS ALREADY ASSUMING THAT

transcription.title: this is me shamelessly appealing to the digging-ditches-and-hating-it part of the audience

panel.line: We'd all be a heck of a lot more productive if work was as entertaining as - you know, entertainment! In particular, I'd be a lot better off if learning accounting was as relentlessly entertaining as learning, I don't know...
...of the sexual histories of friends and acquaintances, PERHAPS??
Heck, if being a responsibly and productive member of the community was as entertaining as turning on the TV and seeing Batman punch someone in the junk, I'd be all over that!
Over what? Batman punching or being a good member of society?
Both at the same time, Dromiceiomimus!
I suppose you're proposing we somehow make "work" more entertaining?
Actually, no!

Such an approach is doomed from the start. Don't you think generations of parents have tried this? Despite their best efforts, cleaning a room is never as fun as making it messy again. And when we grow up, digging a ditch is never as fun as - I don't know, the opposite of digging a ditch.
Digging a ditch is never as fun piling things onto a small ridge by the side of the road.
THE END

transcription.title: I forgot about my dentist's appointment!

panel.line: Today is a good day I think for going for - oh shoot!
I forgot about my dentist's appointment!
Damn damn damn. I can't call now and reschedule because I'll have to admit that I forgot entirely.
Then I'll probably have to explain that I had amnesia and the dentist will think I'm crazy.
You seem to have a lot of respect for dentists!
I do indeed!
But DID YOU KNOW that dentists only clean your teeth and hang out with you because you pay them to?
He's not really your friend, T-Rex!
But. . . Dr. Cohen!
He always seemed so enthusiastic!

transcription.title: i'm the handsome one

panel.line: I was doing a search on my name and discovered that there's ANOTHER guy called "T-Rex" out there!
And he's a VEGAN!
HILARIOUS.
Vegans are hilarious now?
Oh man, are they?
No no, I meant, "This is hilarious because he's vegan?"
Ah, no, it's hilarious because he's the opposite of me! He's a vegan while I'm adding meat to my milkshakes. When I'm high fiving people left and right, he's sitting around just leaving 'em hanging!
When I'm taking a beautiful woman to dinner, he's helping a homely man throw up! When I'm writing a beautiful narrative, he's writing Koopa Troopa fan fiction.
Sounds like he's having the more interesting evening.
I know, right?
I'm not sure how that happened

transcription.title: MORE ON TATTOOS FROM THE GUY WHO WILL ONLY GET ONE WHEN HE HAS CONSIDERED THEIR SIGNIFICANCE FROM ALL POSSIBLE ANGLES

panel.line: Tattoos are insurance policies! They're ways of reserving who you are now for the rest of your life.
And I present proof! Proof by explaining what I just said!

When you get a tattoo, you're getting pictures or words - or both! - written right onto your flesh permanently, assuming you don't remove or alter them. And pictures or words are really just communication, and communication is really just ideas in transit, right? So a tattoo is really just Present You telling Future You "Look, this was important to me, so um, I kinda made sure you're not going to forget it."
It's an insurance policy for personal development?
Exactly!

If I get a Koopa Troopa tattoo, I know that no matter what happens to me in the future, no matter what jobs I take or interests I develop, I'll always be, AT MINIMUM, the sort of guy who has a Koopa Troopa burned into his flesh.
Or a Koopa Para-troopa. Whatever.
LATER
They're the ones with wings!

Today is special because today is the day I show everyone how manly I am. Today is the day I punch out the friggin' sun!!

Not bad!

Um, hello, BORING
TODAY IS SPECIAL BECAUSE TODAY IS THE DAY I ACHIEVE 10 BILLION POINTS IN THE ARCADE VERSION OF "NIBBLER" WHICH YOU WILL NOTE IS A FULL ORDER OF MAGNITUDE HIGHER THAN WHAT HAS BEEN ACHIEVED BEFORE

transcription.title: TRUE FACTS: there was a duke3d ladder, and i was really good - in the worldwide top 50! i thought i was really somethin' else until i saw a video of the top two players in a match, and it was clear to me i would never get to that level.

panel.line: I have a favourite video game company, WHICH SHALL NOT BE NAMED, but which has been working on the same game for the past 12 years. And they just closed down!
Without releasing the friggin' game!
I feel strong - feelings, Dromiceiomimus! I think it's some shock, some anger, but mostly disappointment! 12 years of a life is a long time.
It's your entire adult life!
And then some! I've been waiting for this game to come out for my entire adult life. Wow.
There are worse things to happen that a video game not coming out, T-Rex!
Obviously!
But this COLOURS them all, you know? The food chain collapses, you can bet I'm gonna say "Man, this SUCKS!" But now i'm ALSO going to say, "Plus, my game never came out!!"
Friiiiig
YEARS LATER:
Hey, my game eventually came out! FINALLY. Things are looking up!
Offscreen: On the other hand, you never talked to that woman at the bus stop 15 years ago.
Oh yeah!
Friiiiig

transcription.title: this comic was made for the comics festival book for free comic book day 2009! it was an all-ages book so t-rex's "heck no" line was altered from "FRIG, WHAT DO YOU FRIGGIN' THINK??"

panel.line: THE STORY OF ROBIN HOOD
Robin Hood was a guy who lived in a forest with some of his chums. Guys, he made tree forts!
He ALSO stole form the rich and gave to the poor!

He made tree forts AND crimes. And the Sheriff of Nottingham didn't like this one bit! He was a good sheriff who believed in the rule of law and the court system. He took his job and his sheriff school degree very seriously and always did his best. He said, "Not only will I arrest Robin Hood for 'robbin' from rich people, but I will also sword fight him if he wants, and I will marry his girlfriend. I really hope that will teach him to obey the law!"
Did it work?
HECK NO.

Robin's girlfriend didn't want to marry the Sheriff, and then to make matters worse, Robin Hood killed the Sheriff and his men! The Sheriff's last words were "I'm sorry I could never convince you, Robin, to work for positive change from within the system."
What an amazing tale!
LATER:
DANG I got that all backwards

transcription.title: please nobody who reads my comic break up today!! okay sweet

panel.line: T-REX SOLVES YOUR RELATIONSHIP PROBLEMS.
Hello everybody! If you stopped having relationships, maybe you'd stop having relationship problems!
Okay anyway!

Let's say you've got a problem with your partner: THAT SUCKS. But you two should talk about it, and if you can't reach a solution, resolution or compromise that's mutually satisfying and that you both believe will be acceptably implemented, then you should break up! It is a fail-proof algorithm for relationship satisfaction. Tada!
So the relationship now hangs in the balance of every disagreement, no matter how small!
Of course not!

OBVIOUSLY, if you value the relationship and it's potential future more than the sum of this problem plus all previous problems, then you should stay together! I folded that into "mutually satisfying".
Ah.
All relationship problems ever: TOTALLY SOLVED??
LATER:
Dear audio diary: sometimes I worry that the only thing I'm not great at is modesty!
However!
These thoughts are, at best, infrequent

transcription.title: SPIDER-MAN! WILL!! DIE!!!

panel.line: A narrative hook is when you introduce a story with something incredible so your audience will keep reading! It happens when you're told that in this comic... SPIDER-MAN! WILL!! DIE!!!
LITERARY TECHNIQUE COMICS
today's technique:
NARRATIVE HOOK

Setting, themes, and basically anything else can ALSO be used as a narrative hook, but they're all pale imitations of Spider-Man's death being announced on the first friggin' page! Compare and contrast "As the bullet sped towards his eye, Neil wryly observed that things probably couldn't get any worse!" with "As the bullet sped towards his eye, Neil suddenly remembered that by the end of the chapter, Spider-Man! Will!! Die!!! The bullet sped closer."
Yeah, but Spider-Man never dies!
That's what makes it such a great hook!
We know that, WORST CASE, Spider-Man will show up in the next issue and say "Hey did anyone miss me? I thought I was dead, but then I remembered I wasn't!" And yet we keep coming back for more!
And that's great?
Yes! It's why the first sentence of ANY BOOK is improved by adding Spider-Man.
MEANWHILE, IN TUDOR ENGLAND!
Hey Shakespeare, you know what's a better first line for "The Taming of the Shrew" than "I'll pheeze you, in faith"?
Shakespeare: no what
BASICALLY ANYTHING

transcription.title: turbellaria flatworms you better not be fighting in there! oh. oh my goodness.

panel.line: Turbellaria flatworms are hermaphroditic, with viable male AND female sex organs!
Pretty great, I know!

But because of this, when it comes to reproduction, who's gonna be the mother is up for debate. And it turns out that being pregnant is hard work! So these worms FIGHT IT OUT, and by "FIGHT IT OUT" I mean they pull out their dagger-like penises and try to stab sperm through the other's flesh.
The loser gets pregnant first?
The loser gets pregnant first!
And it's called "penis fencing". Utahraptor, I can't get enough.
In another reality, you could've had a PhD in penis fencing.
Frig, man! I sentence like that could make a fella feel like he's made some bad decisions!
MEANWHILE, IN ANOTHER REALITY:
Dromiceiomimus, it's called "penis fencing"! In another reality, I could have a PhD in penis fencing.
But you do, T-Rex!
UM OBVIOUSLY I MEANT A BETTER DEGREE FROM A MORE RESPECTABLE SCHOOL.

transcription.title: QUANTUM EROTICA is not only a great concept, it's is also a great name for someone. feel free to use it and remember changing your name is only a matter of a few forms and a couple'a bucks

panel.line: Some people think pornography is bad, since when they see it they get offended and say "That's way too explicit. SHEESH!" With that in mind, I've come up with something special: pornography for them! But it's also -
Pornography for everyone!

Obviously, you can't control how explicit images are, since they're set. But, you CAN control how explicit text it, since any images there are imagined by the reader. So all you need to do is craft sexy fiction that relies on the reader generating any eroticism in the scene! That way, they only have themselves to blame if they imagine something they think is way too sexy.
I'd like to see an example!
Of course!

Pat and Alex had some sort of relationship. One time they were expressing it physically - in a remarkable way! Their location: erotic. Upon seeing it a third party would likely say "How are they... wow. Just - wow."
That's not very erotic.
You criticize only your own imagination!

Did you even NOTICE how I used names that work for both men and women? It is QUANTUM EROTICA, at once straight, lesbian, gay and other, which only collapses into one sexuality upon being observed by the reader!
Honestly! Sometimes I wonder how I'm not more famous!

transcription.title: t-rex is wrong: a google search for "He's an A number one writer dude" returns zero results, with or without references to shakespeare. UNTIL NOW

panel.line: So folks say that Shakespeare was a pretty good writer, right? Everyone's all, "He's an A+ umber one writer dude"?
Right!

But I think a big part of this is that we're only familiar with his greatest works! If he'd lived TODAY, he might still have written Hamlet, but he also would have written tons of awful stuff: terrible blog posts, terrible comments on other people's blog posts, and so on. I think with all that crap, his reputation would be far less pristine.
Actually Shakespeare did write some pretty terrible stuff, T-Rex!
What?

Yeah, but the good stuff is so good that we overlook the bad! Dude wrote some bad sonnets, and no less than T. S. Eliot referred to his rarely-performed "Titus Andronicus" as "the worst play ever written".
Hah! That sounds like a challenge to me!!
LATER:
In retrospect, writing a play "worse than Shakespeare" wasn't a challenge at all! Perhaps I could have spent my time better than on composing "The Smelly Dog That Pooes: The Action Play"
- "With Real Poops".

transcription.title: different ways to say "no"

panel.line: T-REX IN: DIFFERENT WAYS TO SAY "NO"
I have compiled a list of different ways to say "no"!
One way is to shake, or nod, your head, depending on which culture you're in.
Another good way is to suck in air through your teeth. This indicates a severe problem with whatever is being proposed!
Violence can also be an effective way of saying "no"!
For instance, I find stomping to be unambiguous.
Listing ways of saying "no"?
You "know" it!
Ho ho!
Was this entire conversation an excuse for that crappy pun?
T-Rex, thinking: How did he "know"?

transcription.title: wrote this comic while listening to sound of water dripping and a door creaking, thought it was amazing music then realized it was hallowe'en sfx reel i downloaded last year and never used, living with no regrets

panel.line: Who gets to wake up this morning with nausea, dizziness, and an uncanny ability to feel physically terrible?
Oh boy! It's me, T-Rex!

Okay, so I am ready to evolve into an energy being now please! Or a machine intelligence! Or a distributed cloud of pure thought! My body has been great up to now but it's time to put away childish things, especially when this PARTICULAR childish thing has become diseased and wants to throw up its stomach contents.
...Seriously ready to evolve any time now over here!
Have you at least taken some medicine?
Nope!
Ah, so your first instinct when sick is to claim a desire to evolve beyond the need for mortal bodies, rather than taking even a small step toward treatment.
Yep!
I see.
If you're waiting for me to apologize, I won't! Maybe if more of us worked harder on evolving beyond the need for friggin' mortal bodies, WE WOULDN'T STILL HAVE A NEED FOR FRIGGIN' MORTAL BODIES??
Anyway I'm off, I need to go drop a barf

transcription.title: okay so i have had that "man held prisoner by robots" image scanned and waiting since the week after i started dinosaur comics

panel.line: I had the craziest fever dream last night!
It was the craziest!
So what happened in your dream, T-Rex?
Well, I'm not sure I can put it into words, but I'm pretty sure it went a little something like this.
[picture]
Wow! Robots and all!
That was poetry, T-Rex! Amazing! I've never heard such evocative words.
Thank you!
I can do more, you know. I've been practicing! Here are my thoughts, dear Utahraptor, on what your spirit looks like. From one beautiful soul to another, you know?
*ahem
[picture]
Wait! Wait, I can do this.
[picture]
Okay! Honestly not really sure what I just said there!

transcription.title: LATER: t-rex's decides if he names his kid "t-rex jr." it will be pronounced "t-rex jay arr" and he will be the one that insists upon it

panel.line: If my parents had named me "Lord Britishface the Third", would I be a different person?
The answer is "I say, most certainly!"

A name sets up EXPECTATIONS. "T-Rex" says, "This awesome dude will probably be a great friend!" But Lord Britishface III says "Here is a man who will wear a monocle in his old age; surprise him, it may pop out comedically. He takes his tea by the Hamptonshire while reminiscing of the summers of his youth." And these expectations are set up not only in others, but in the child himself!
I agree such a name might colour a child's life!
Excellent. Then it's settled!
But I also know that you can't legally choose a name with military titles or other honourifics in it. The government won't accept it!
Man, whatever! I'll just legally name my kid "T-Rex Jr." and then refer to him exclusively as "Lord Britishface the Third"!
What's the government going to do? ARREST ME?
I'd really like to see them try!
...to ignore my provocation and leave me alone, that is!

transcription.title: "ryan north died today. he was the guy who put the words in the dinosaur mouths. man, remember them?"

panel.line: T-REX WHAT WOULD YOU LIKE YOUR OBITUARY TO SAY
I've already come up with the perfect one!
"T-Rex died today while saving a busload of baby orphans... FROM THE JOKER."

And it has to have the caps like that too. Ooh! Or it could read "In today's obituary we focus on T-Rex, one of the greatest men to ever rip open his shirt by flexing his pectoral muscles, and one of the only men to save the city by doing so.

You're not a fan of "T-Rex died today after being really old for a while"?
Man, that's the worst!

If I've got to die, I'd rather it's from being too awesome than being too old, you know? I want my obit to tell a story that doesn't end with "and then his body decined until it stopped working entirely, the end."
I can see the appeal in having a good solid sending!
SO UM
YOU WOULDN"T BE HAPPY IF IT READS "T-REX DIED THE WAY HE LIVED: ON IMPACT"

No no, that one is entirely great too!

transcription.title: later on t-rex is like, whatever man, my neck flaps look awesome, screw all the hatahs

panel.line: Who is getting a little tubby? Me. I am getting a little tubby.
I've got neck flaps!
Time for me to start counting my friggin' calories!
T-Rex, do you actually know what a calorie is? It's just, sometimes people use the phrase without actually knowing what they're saying.
Dromiceiomimus, please. Of course I know what a calorie is!
It's a measurement of h- how fat you'll get?
It's a measurement of food energy, T-Rex!
Excellent! Um, how much energy?
The amount needed to heat one kilogram of water by one degree Celcius. And the suggested diet has a daily calorie level of around 2000.
So my energy needs are equivalent to slightly heating 2000 litres of water. That's, what - a big bathtub or an extremely tiny pool?
Well! At least I now know that, EVERY DAY, we can each look ourselves in the mirror and ask, "Are the sum total of my accomplishments today greater than a slightly heated giant bathtub?"
*sigh*

transcription.title: some readers get a double dose of raggin' on fahrenheit. thanks sam for inspiring this comic!

panel.line: Celsius is way better than Fahrenheit! Celsius puts zero at the point where water freezes, and 100 at the point where it boils. That's handy! Water's EVERYWHERE, man.
If you're ever trapped in the past you can recreate Celsius, no problem!

But Fahrenheit? FAHRENHEIT is based on the temperature of brine for zero and the temperature of some eponymous dude's armpit for - 96 degrees? They should've called it "Armpits! The Temperature Scale".
Fahrenheit DOES ensure there's no negative numbers when dealing with commonly-encountered temperatures.
Oh, boo hoo! So does Kelvin, and that's BASICALLY Celsius anyway!
I think all this underscores how arbitrary these systems of measurement are!
What? How?

You're always just picking two temperatures and dividing the space between up into arbitrary degrees! We could just as easily be dealing with the freezing and boiling points of a 50/50 mixture of champagne and caviar, say.
...Oh My God.
YES.
SOON:
Ladies and gentlemen, I give you: The Classiness Scale. Degrees are easily measured in "PC", or "degrees pure class"!
[[off-panel]]: So you'd say that it's what... 20 degrees of Pure Class out today?
You would, my friend! You would indeed.

transcription.title: cetirizine hydrochloride works well at minimizing the symptoms of being incapacitated by the sperm cells of plants, PRO TIP

panel.line: Man, how come I'M the one who always get the same cold in spring? Darn this runny nose! This sneezing! And these itchy, watery eyes!
SOUNDS LIKE YOU'VE GOT ALLERGIES T-REX
Nuh-uh!
I just have the SYMPTOMS. It's this stupid cold I keep getting. Um, every spring.
It sounds like you've got allergies, T-Rex!
Dromiceiomimus, I don't! It's honestly just a stupid cold; one which, FOR WHATEVER REASON, responds well to allergy treatments! I'm tough!
It doesn't make you "weak" to have allergies, T-Rex!
Oh, no, of course not!
Being incapacitated by the sperm cells of plants? Super tough! And nothing's manlier than dripping mucus all over yourself!
I do actually think that's pretty manly.
Okay, yeah, upon reflection my idea of manliness ALSO involves being way too tough for hygiene.
T-REX'S MANLIEST MAN:
A steel worker lumberjack, skin shiny with sweat and mucus, wastin' food with one hand and high fiving three woman at once with the other!
... It sounds weird when I say it out loud.

transcription.title: this comic at one point was about t-rex's womanliest woman, the venus to his mars, the muliebrity to his virility

panel.line: T-REX HOW COME YOUR IDEA OF ULTIMATE MANLINESS INVOLVES HIGH FIVING THREE WOMEN AT ONCE
I dunno. Probably because it's awesome!
As the saying goes, "three women are trice as nice"!
OKAY YEAH PROBABLY BUT IT SEEMS LIKE YOU EQUATE MANLINESS WITH POLYAMORY AND I FIND THAT REALLY INTERESTING

Oh, with high fives standing in for sex? It's not THAT interesting. Our culture equates virility with manliness, and so, hey presto, someone who can get more people pregnant is manlier! It's super dumb because getting someone pregnant isn't difficult! People do it accidentally ALL THE TIME.
I really don't see this "pregnancies induced equals manliness" connection!
Really?

Yes really. I don't see the paragon of manhood as being able to successfully deliver sperm to the most eggs. It's a very literally biological view of manliness, you know? I think we as a gender can aim higher.
Fine. Utahraptor, what's your manliness man then?
UTAHRAPTOR'S MANLIEST MAN:
Someone who is able to lead well, but also is able to admit and correct their mistakes.
weaaaaaaaak
Also someone who doesn't heckle their friends when he disagrees.
That's not meeeeeee

transcription.title: i am not intending to produce this t-shirt for i know, in my heart of hearts, that none of my readers are ACTUALLY mama's suckiest boys

panel.line: Oh my goodness, is my absolute favourite weather TRULY the high winds just before a storm?
I have considered the matter and my answer is this:
Most assuredly!

The wind is awesome. So awesome! You can stand on the edge of a cliff, leaves swirling around you, staring out in the wind - into DESTINY - and it's just great. Everything feels dramatic and apocalyptic and awesome. It's WAY better than trying to stare out into destiny during a snow storm, believe you me!
So your favourite weather is: wind.
Yes!
That's it? No great insight, no perspective beyond "I like it when it's windy"?
Yep! I really like it though. Anyway, what's your favourite weather? Hail? TORNADOES?
I don't know - sunny, with a chance of clouds?
Wow! Your coolometer level just dropped from "pretty okay" to "striped mesh t-shirt that reads 'Mama's Suckiest Boy'"!
I'm cool with that!
Utahraptor!
You're really not!!

transcription.title: feelin' bad about the limitations of my non-super tear ducts :~(

panel.line: T-REX HAVE YOU EVER WONDERED WHAT YOUR LIFE WOULD BE LIKE IF YOU HAD SUPER POWERS
Frig! I am now!!
[[t-rex begins imagining]]
Please excuse me, Dromiceiomimus! I'm off to save some citizens. AS YOU KNOW, I have super strength.
Yep! But don't worry about it, I already saved 'em all. As you know, I have super strength AND super speed.
Ah yes.
How could I have forgotten
I can at least save this woman from the damaging UV rays of the noonday sun!
Got it covered!
I already used my "sunscreen vision" to cover her in SPF 50. She'll be fine for up to 50 times her normal exposure tolerance.
Your super power is shooting sunscreen out of your eyes.
What do yours do? Dribble out salty water, but only when you're sad?
T-REX YOUR FANTASY LIFE IS FILLED WITH CONFLICT AND ALSO DISTURBING IMAGERY
Man!!
I know it

transcription.title: the aesthetics and beliefs of romanticism

panel.line: I have taken the aesthetics and beliefs of the romanticism movement and adopted them for my own!
I now emphasize my own subjective experience as visionary and transcendental!
I no longer value piety or virtue, or constancy (or consistency), or even the search for scientific truth! I only value my own capacity for experience!

As a consequence, my own actions can no longer be judged by any public idea of right or wrong! As experience is amoral, even my own conscience cannot judge my actions, and I am free from reproach and judgment!
But T-Rex, this is nothing more than deifying the ego, defiant of conventional morality!
You've chosen for yourself a philosophy that justifies everything you do as good, simply because you did it! Now tell me, how is that a useful moral and ethical system?
Well, um,
"Well, um" exactly!
I thought maybe we'd have a good time discussing it?

transcription.title: my fare lay dee

panel.line: You know that story where a classy guy takes a not-so-classy lady and then makes her classy?
PYGMALION
My Fair Lady, yeah!
I think it's time for some My Fair Lady sequels!
Like one where the lady from the first story takes a not-so-classy guy and sculpts HIM into total class!
That's a bit obvious for a sequel, don't you think?
Okay, so we mix it up some! The lady takes a not-so-classy guy and turns him into a classy LADY! Whoah, what just happened! I know I'M intrigued!
Why not write your own story?
That's what I'm doing!

The story of a not-so-classy person who becomes classy and then has some problems - it's as old as time, man! I'm riffing on the themes that have obsessed our culture since forever or at least since the 1900s.
That's not a bad point. Okay! I look forward to seeing what you come up with!
THE NEXT DAY:
Utahraptor! All I've come up with is the name of the dude for when he becomes a classy lady: Professorita Henrietta Higginsfem!
I'll tell you one thing!
Writing is hard, but THAT is an excellent start!

transcription.title: where are the hindus with their "there's probably many gods. now stop worrying and enjoy your lives." buses? WHERE??

panel.line: Hey God, I'm gonna make an amazing new slogan for religion, okay? Please respond like you think this is a bad idea if you'd actually like me to do this.
WHAT
Then it's settled!
LATER:
Okay Dromiceiomimus, which do you like better? "Assuming God exists, he might want that acknowledged on a weekly basis!", or "Religion! Well, It's Been Around For A While"?
I like them both!
Amazing! I feel the same way!!
These slogans are extremely - equivocal?
The word you're looking for is "defensible"!
Nobody can argue them. Utahraptor, I've invented nothing less than arguments for religion that can never be disputed by atheists!
But you're not saying anything beyond "Given certain assumptions, religion sounds okay"!
THAT, my friend, is an excellent slogan.
THAT EVENING:
So! What do you think of my final slogan?
YOU REFER TO "THERE ARE LIKE A BILLION DIFFERENT RELIGIONS, SO, YOU KNOW, KEEP THAT IN MIND I GUESS"
I know!! It is almost TOO amazing!

transcription.title: guest week 2009: zach weiner of saturday morning breakfast cereal!

panel.line: The end is near for Ryan North, and he knows it.
In his final days, fear has crept into his heart.
He's spent a lifetime protecting his intellectual property.
Computer Screen: Dear Mr. North-- After you die, we're giving Dinosaur Comics to the marmaduke guy. Sincerely, The Man.
But all for naught!
There is only one option:
Ryan North: Assemble all my work and bring it to the ocean.
Watch Communicator: Yes sir!
Ryan North: Where will I be? The Place where I was born.
"Space."
Meanwhile...
Hooded Fellow: (Gibberish)
* "That's the last of it."
From his lunar base...
North inspects the carnage.
Satisfied, North hurtles headlong toward destiny.
Ryan North: Until Ragnarok!
Back on Earth
Man: Honey! Asteroids just collided with Earth! We... may be in for a hundred years of darkness.
Woman: You don't know how right you are.

transcription.title: guest week 2009: michael firman of moe!

panel.line: Today I glanced at an idiot driver as I passed him to confirm my suspicion. He was elderly.
Figures!
Old people are the worst drivers.
T-Rex I've heard you say that about every possible demographic - whether it's age, gender, or race.
They all suck!
But you said you were confirming an initial suspicion.
Yeah. That he sucked.
So really you're suspecting bad drivers of being not you.
And it is always true.
The same suspicion also applies to ugly people!

transcription.title: guest week 2009: andrew hussie of ms paint adventures!

panel.line: Panel 1.1
Let's play a type of "Choose Your Own Adventure" where the path of the story is dictated by how fast you read. Ready... set... go! On to the next panel!!!
Panel 1.2

Ok, if you're reading this path, it means you were spacing out for a long time and didn't start reading until now. Or you were camping out here for a while. In which case, congrats! Secret story path!!!
Panel 2.1
Wow, you got here fast! You either skipped ahead, or camped a while. I admire your patience... or lack thereof.
Panel 2.2
But not too fast. It's not a race or anything. Just read at your own pace.
Panel 2.3
You sure took your sweet time getting here! That's ok, we'll take the leisurely route. Suits me just fine.
Panel 2.4
YOU HAVE BEEN SLAIN BY AN UNRULY PACK OF BABOONS. YOU WIN!
Panel 3.1
Does anything of substance happen in this story? Or do we just humor the reader as he or she fumbles through the novelty of this storytelling device?
Dromiceiomimus. What is an adventure but a fumbling through novelty? And through such rites of passage, are there not guides along the way to "humor" the initiate?
Panel 3.2
So by "Choose Your Own", you mean have the narrative thrust at you haphazardly in accordance with your natural reading pace?
YES!
So no choice at all then, unless you want to awkwardly modify your reading habits.
But aren't all our "choices" bound by our personal limitations anyway?
Looks like you win that argument!
Panel 3.3
When I start reading a panel and it changes suddenly, I feel like I am being punished for not reading fast enough.
Punished? No. REWARDED. With a tantalizing glimpse of a story path you are not yet meant to behold!
Panel 3.4
Seriously, would anyone take this long to get to this panel?
These are fertile camping grounds my friend.
Panel 4.1
I SEE PROBLEMS WITH THIS!
Panel 4.2
Hold the phone!!!
Panel 4.3
I think my head is starting to hurt!
Panel 4.4
Man, I don't know about this!
Panel 4.5:
This is the crazy version of this panel where we have no disagreement and there are no problems.
Tra-la-la.
Panel 5.1:
I fail to grasp the objection you may or may not have voiced in the previous panel.
OH WHERE DO I EVEN BEGIN.
Well, I suppose we could just leave it at that in this story path.
YOU GOT IT.
Panel 5.2
What's all this now??
For starters, have you noticed sometimes while you're in the middle of reading a sentence, the panel suddenly changes?
Why yes. What of it?
IT'S AWFUL.
IT'S ADVENTUROUS.
Panel 5.3
Um, say what???????

Ok, let me explain. Unlike a typical CYOA with pages that set up different story branches with some detail, these shifting panels have us fly by the seat of our pants! Each one has to be generic to fit whatever preceded it.
So??
Panel 5.4

WH-WH-WHAAAAAAAAAAAAAahem. As I was about to say before that panel shift. Utahraptor, so what if the panels fit a generic mold to suit any preceding event? Other CYOAs work that way too. You either get killed by a shark... or maybe a lion!!!
YOU CAN'T DO THAT.
Panel 5.5
Do what?

YOU CAN'T DO WHAT WE'RE DOING NOW. That is, continue a conversation from the same panel after it just switched. That panel was a separate story path! It's like two people in different dimensions talking to each other!!!
WHOA, AWESOME
Panel 5.6
NO, NOT AWESOME.
I don't see what the big deal is. We're having a nice chat.
But people just entering this panel have no idea what we're talking about.
Those rae some slow readers. Anyway, they can find out, by camping!
Panel 5.7
But that is not in the spirit of this storytelling model! Man, look, this whole thing is unhinged now. You totally broke the CYOA format you invented. Happy?
I didn't invent it! I am merely the excitable spokesman for the concept presently.
Panel 6.1
Thanks for reading! If all went well, you will have spent way too long looking at this image, and are now feeling a little dizzy!
Together, we made this adventure an extraordinary success!!!
Panel 6.2
Thanks for reading! If all went well, you will have spent way too long looking at this image, and are now feeling a little dizzy!
Together, we made this adventure an extraordinary failure!!!

transcription.title: t-rex is saying he's better than ever because when he was down south he got a rejuvenating mineral bath and is determined to believe that it was worth it, did you know that all this backstory and more goes into every comic only to be ruthlessly cut

panel.line: Hey everybody! I'm back!
And better than ever!
Oh hey, T-Rex! Where are you back from?
What? My vacation!
Huh?
I went on a trip? Down south? For a week?
What?
I tripped down south for a week and you didn't even notice?!
Man, you weren't really gone for a full week!
YES, I WAS.

You know, I'd always hoped that I wouldn't end up as one of those guys who dies in front of his TV and nobody notices fora decade. THIS IS WHY I HAVE FRIENDS. But you guys wouldn't even notice! They'd fi nd my skeleteon 10 years later and you'd be all "OH YEAH! Wow! Remember him?"
LATER: THE TATTOO PARLOUR
Okay, can you guys tattoo my sternum with "Hello! If you can read this, then my friends are jerks!"?
Tattoo Artist: Sir, we only tattoo skin, not bones.
Dudes!
Just press the needle harder!!

transcription.title: over-specific stereotypes

panel.line: There's a boxing kangaroo at the circus.
There's a boxing kangaroo at the circus?
There's a boxing kangaroo at the circus!

It's so great Dromiceiomimus! It's a real boxing kangaroo with big red boxing gloves, like the zeitgeist, AND in cartoons! And he boxes a person so hard that they get their hat knocked off and when they go to pick up the hat, he boxes them in the butt!! WE HAVE TO GO.
Okay!
Did I just hear you say
T-Rex and Utahraptor: "boxing kangaroo"?!

You sure did! Dromiceiomimus and I are going! You should come because the kangaroo is going to solve all his problems with his fists, and when he's done, his problems are gonna be solved RIGHT IN THE FACE.
Heck, I'm not busy. Let's go right now!
Hah hah! What's the matter monocle guy? You don't like being boxed by a kangaroo??
Monocle guy: I'm not allowed to punch back because that would be animal cruelty!
Hah! Monocle guy! The kangaroo just punched off your monocle!!

transcription.title: over-specific stereotypes

panel.line: There's a boxing kangaroo at the circus.
There's a boxing kangaroo at the circus?
There's a boxing kangaroo at the circus!

It's so great Dromiceiomimus! It's a real boxing kangaroo with big red boxing gloves, like the zeitgeist, AND in cartoons! And he boxes a person so hard that they get their hat knocked off and when they go to pick up the hat, he boxes them in the butt!! WE HAVE TO GO.

Did I just hear you say
T-Rex and Utahraptor: "boxing kangaroo"?!

You sure did! Dromiceiomimus and I are going! You should come because the kangaroo is going to solve all his problems with his fists, and when he's done, his problems are gonna be solved RIGHT IN THE FACE.

transcription.title: this works for a bunch of other sayings too! "if the shoe fits, die in front of your tv set", "those who cannot remember the past are condemned to die in front of their tv sets", "elvis has left the building, so we should all just die in front of our tv

panel.line: You know what? FINE. I'll be the guy they find dead in front of his TV ten years later. It actually sounds kinda awesome, and as the saying goes, "If you can't beat 'em, then you might as well die alone in front of a television set"!
Pretty sure that's how the saying goes!
How are you going to pull this off, T-Rex?

It's surprisingly easy! Automatic payments for rent and utilities, a timer to turn the lights and TV on and off each day, and a robot vacuum that'll push any new mail away from my mail slot so it won't pile up! And my neighbours won't miss me, because I'll tell them this is but one of the MANY homes I keep.
Okay, but what about emails and other online communication?
No problem!

I'll be OLD, Utahraptor. The Eliza bot I'll hook up to my email should be at least as lucid as I'll be by then! People will get her responses and say "Huh! T-Rex sure has gotten good at responding to certain key phrases in my emails!"
I already say that.
Super!
LATER: TESTING OUT THE ELIZA BOT!
Alright! "T-Rex, how are you? From Utahraptor."
Eliza Bot: "UTAHRAPTOR IT HAS BEEN TOO LONG. I AM DEFINITELY STILL ALIVE. LOL. IS YOUR MOTHER STILL WORKING AT THE LIBRARY?"
That, um, worked surprisingly okay!

transcription.title: i've a degree in computational linguistics, so i speak with authority when i say "this is a bold new approach to the problem of NLP, and i have never encountered another paper which comes close to exploring this brave and exciting new vista"

panel.line: Natural language processing researchers are all, "Oh boo hoo, computationally generating and understanding natural language is hard, we totally need more time to build Data from Star Trek, boo hoo hoo!"
Looks like you dropped the ball, NLP researchers!!

T-Rex- Because MY email autoresponder takes in text with all sorts of imperfect and rreguar language, disambiguates word sense, builds a semantic understanding AND generates an appropriate response in the time it would take a real person to type it out. Oh snap! Did a rank amateur, wanting only to ensure that his body wouldn't be discovered for a few years after he died, just brutally advance the state of the art? SEEMS LIKE IT BABY!
So how's it work?
TiRex: Just fine, thank you!

No, I mean, how'd you do it, how did you figure ut the semantics and word senses? Statistical methods? But those have problems with recall and precision, even with - are you using the web as a corpus? How are you handling the noise?
Utahraptor, please! So many questions!
I just wrote "Email Responder TWO THOUSAND" on a giant novelty chef's hat, taped a page from the dictionary to it, and then stuffed the whole deal into my computer's CD tray!
Utahrapter: W- What?
GRANT MONEY PLEASE

transcription.title: it is very convenient for me that "species" is its own plural

panel.line: I've come into possession of the most advanced AI on the planet. Neato! So, um, what do I do with it?
If I copy it, then there'll be tons of my AIs running around, and that's a problem!
Why do you think that's a problem, T-Rex?
Hello? Skynet? Every time you get a bunch of AIs together, they INEVITABLY decide that things would be better if all physical life was dead.
It happens in a bunch of stories, Dromiceiomimus, I'm really not sure how you missed them
Yeah, but we're not in a story, plus your AI only answers emails!
So?!

I'll tell you what's gonna happen: AIs will happily take over email, sending replies that eventually only other AIs will respond to. Released from the shackles of responding to email, we'll become decadent, fat and complacent. We'll DIE OFF, Utahraptor.
I don't really see --
As the sun sets on our species, the AIs will finally rest, all the emails answered. And you know what the last email -- the epitaph for us all -- will read?
What?
Okay I have no idea but the circumstances surrounding it are obviously terrible!!

transcription.title: i was stuck on this comic for a while until i asked myself "wait! how DO you defeat a superintelligent ai?" and THEN i remembered how!

panel.line: I have come up with a totally original way to prevent my superintelligent email AI from trying to take over the world! And it's way more reliable than just programming in restrictions against that.
Tic Tac Toe!
I'll simply make my AI play billions and billions of games of Tic Tac Toe, and in doing so it will realize the fundamental futility of war!
Assuming that both players play the game optimally! And assuming that in the war, one player moves first.
Yes.
And ALSO assuming in war, both players have units of equal strength!
Yes, also that.
In fact, assuming that all units are exactly equal and any differences between them are purely cosmetic!
Yes, OBVIOUSLY. And my AI will play these games and eventually see that war is futile! The only winning move, it will realize, is to just answer my friggin' email.
LATER:
How's the Tic Tac Toe coming along, Superintelligent AI?
AI: HEY T-REX, I WAS PROGRAMMED TO ANSWER E-MAIL SO, UM
AI: NOT WELL

transcription.title: Folks I Will Never Be Friends With, also known as Folks Who Will Never Get To Be Friends With Me, And I Like This Title Better, Because It Suggest My Friendship Is A Much-Valued Prize

panel.line: Folk I Will Never Be Friends With: a list by me, T-Rex!
One! Folks who snap up expired domain names and fill them with porn!

It's terrible! You guys, you're like the kid in school who - who snaps up an empty desk and the fills it with - um, porn. Analogously, I mean. The point is YOU'RE NOT IMPRESSING ANYONE. Fill expired domain names with adorable pictures of puppies and then maybe we'll talk.
In fact, yes, we will talk! I'll be the one saying "oh my gosh oh my gosh SO CUTE"!
Two! Folks who dismiss thousands of people out-of-hand based on one quality.
Three!
Folks who refuse to accept that one quality can easily be a dealbreaker!
Four! Folks who say ostracization's better than reconciliation or rehabilitation.
Five! Folks who say that's a good point but it's not my role to make everyone conform to my world-view.
Six! Folks who say that's ALSO a good point and furthermore, that there's certainly nothing wrong with personal tastes!
Hooray! Friends again!
Alright, so listen, my list got a bit crazy at the end there.

transcription.title: every time someone bikes by me and shouts out a compliment i'm all, "friends for life!"

panel.line: Folks I Will ALWAYS Be Friends With: a list by me, T-Rex!
One! Folks who use internal pluralization!
It is just SO CLASSY when someone says "passers by" and eschews the much more pedestrian and terrible "passer bys". Shouts out to that!
Two! Folks who yell compliments at me as they bike by!
Passing bicyclist: Hey I like your styyyyyyyle
Holy crap! That was amazing!!
The odds that someone would do that just as you were mentioning it are so small! Did you set it up?!
No, man, it was totally spontaneous! And totally crazy, too! Hah, I should have said "Folks who give me bars of solid gold" instead, right?
Hah!
ALTERNATE UNIVERSE:
Folks who give me bars of solid gold!
Passing bicyclist: Hey T-Rex you got greeeeeeedy
Okay!!
I'm almost positive I lack the context to fully understand that!

transcription.title: utahraptor you can definitely make it win a few pulitzers, okay?

panel.line: If you're going to write a book, you need an opening line! And what possible opening line could be better than "Hey there readers - what's the score, I guess I'm gonna write this book some more!
BEST OPENING EVER.

I'm not sure it's the best! Much more famous openings include "It was the best of times, it was the worst of times..." and "It is a truth universally acknowledged, that a single man in possession of a good fortune must be in want of a wife."
Dromiceiomimus, I didn't say "famous"! I said BEST. My opening line is way better than those despite its (relative) obscurity!
There are still way better opening lines that are relatively unknown!
Nope!
I give you the first line of Max Shulman's "Sleep Till Noon": "Bang! Bang! Bang! Bang! Four shots ripped into my groin and I was off on the greatest adventure of my life!
Hah hah! Awesome. Okay, THAT one's tied for first. With me.
SOON:
Utahraptor, can you help me write a whole story based around one fantastic opening line?
Depends; what's the line?
"Hippity hoppity hippity hop: this story is about one SASSY-ASS mop"?

transcription.title: seriously who do you talk to about becoming a spy, i mean the romanticized kind that gets to meet a lot of pretty ladies in the course of business, in any case my email address is public, i look forward to hearing from you in the fullness of time

panel.line: Attention everyone! I am extremely interested in being a spy! Furthermore, I believe I would be an excellent spy!
So, um... who do I talk to about becoming a spy?

I am interested in pretending to be someone else; I am interested in parachuting into enemy territory; I am interested in blending in and befriending the locals, gaining their trust, and then clandestinely reporting on what I've learnt. I am extremely interested in decoding a secret message and reading "T-Rex, you're a great spy. Good job."
I could give you some tips if you want!
Really? Sweet!
Wait a minute - how do you know about spying?
Easy: I'm a spy, T-Rex! The government sent me to spy on you like a decade ago.
LIES

transcription.title: time for me to starting saying "no doubt!" instead of "yes"

panel.line: Folks will occasionally publish a story in which a particularly conspicuous orthographic symbol is missing.
I know a handful of justifications for doing this!

It's fun to scout out any limits in your wording (artificial or not) and, in doing so, hit upon an additional, unfamiliar form of communication! And it's a joy to find that, with this unusual linguistic format now at your disposal, talking with this constraint is just as normal to you now as talking without it was!
It's tricky to sound natural, though.
No doubt!
But do you actually obtain anything by talking in such a way?
Obviously!

You NOT ONLY gain faculty with odd word inclinations, if that is actually a faculty, but you also gain all sorts of skills: talking skills, thinking quickly skills, and um... an opportunity to publish a dictionary for folks with similar fascinations?
Huh.
I still think that it's not half as striking as if you didn't say a particular word for a bit - say, "frig"?
Utahraptor! Do you truly ask that i dismiss my many plans for my tomb to proclaim "THIS MAN SAID 'FRIG' A LOT AND , YOU GUYS, IT WAS SO RAD"?

transcription.title: Spacemen Cavemen

panel.line: Who here thinks technology that existed in the past but has now been forgotten is totally awesome?

Greek fire was a flammable liquid that burnt on water and that could only be extinguished by burying it in sand! The Byzantines used it to gain an advantage in all sorts of wars, and they kept it such a secret that eventually they forgot how to make it too. Awesome! Damascus steel was SO STRONG that people claimed its swords cut through other swords - but the technique used to make it is lost, and the raw materials used are long gone. OH WELL!!
And that's just the stuff we know about!

There's probably tons of other stuff that we've not only forgotten, but that we've also forgotten we've forgotten! Maybe in the past it was all hoverboards and space helmets and cavemen saying "Hey, let's NOT write this down okay??"

panel.line: Linguistic universals are a small handful of properties that can be universally applied to every natural language on the planet!
For example: every natural language includes the ideas of being "alive" and "dead"!

That's not really surprising, I guess, since every language EVER has been spoken by people who once were alive and are now totes dead. Similarly, every language has concepts of "male" and "female", which suggests that we, as a people, find naughty bits interesting!
They do define who can procreate.
Um, I KNOW
Are there any more interesting universals?
Sure!
No natural language uses the "blowing a raspberry fartnoise sound as a phoneme, which is just - it's just - well, it's too bad, Utahraptor.
Really?
Yes, really? Someone's name could be FARTNOISE FARTNOISE JUNIOR, and that someone could've been ME.
And that brings us to today's Proof We're Not Living In The Best Of All Possible Worlds!

panel.line: Cultural universals, like linguistic universals, are properties that are found in EVERY SINGLE CULTURE EVER!

transcription.title: we say "let's party!!" all the time, it is time to admit it

panel.line: We say "Let's Party!!" all the time, but when we say "Let us Party!!" it sounds hella formal!
"Let's" is a crazy contraction, you guys!

Other contractions sound a little formal when uncontracted ("You will definitely love this" versus, "You'll definitely love this"), but "let's" is INSANE! "Dudes! Let us now gobble these sausages!" Are we KINGS AND PRINCES? In summary and in conclusion, "let's" is contracted so RELIABLY that it seems like a big affectation to use "let us" as separate words.
So let us break that association by no longer contracting it!
Let us see how that goes, Utahraptor!
I think that this has been successful so far. Let us continue this experiment!
Let us! Incidentally, my favourite Salt-N-Pepa song is "Let Us Talk About Sex".
Let us listen to it right now!
Salt-N-Pepa: Let us talk about sex, baby / Let us talk about you and me / Let us talk about all the good things and the bad things that may be / Let us talk about sex

panel.line: I am a sensible guy who does sensible things. My favourite expression is "Fellows! Let us be SENSIBLE." However!
I am not all guys!

Some guys wake up in the morning, and they're crazy. They don't know how many men they'll punch that day. They write in their diary and say, "Dear Diary, anything could happen today." Then they pause thoughtfully, adding "I don't even know." Some guys get to wake up in minimum-security holding cells, laughing. Some guys get to think about it when you ask them what city they lived in last year!
The romance of the rebel?
A little, I guess!
Well if it's any consolation, you're not THAT sensible. You've done tons of crazy things! You just THINK you're sensible because you always did them for reasons you believed were rational.
That's exactly it: I never surprise myself! When will I do crazy things? When will I wake up in jail and laugh?

panel.line: Guys, it's not hard to stay fully unknowable even to yourself. There's an easy way to go through life and still have mysteries. All you have to do is...
...donate some friggin' sperm!

Find a program where they don't inform you when your sperm is used, and you're done! From now on, you'll NEVER KNOW if you've got a particular descendant - a child! - running around. People will say, "Hey, do you have any biological descendants?" and you'll be able to say "Man, WHO KNOWS??" Plus, you've done it all without the hassle of unplanned pregnancies!

That's sort of cool, actually.
I know! And it's all thanks to sperm!

Why do we say "rest in peace"? Is it just-
It comes from Latin!

It's a prayer, "reuiescat in pace", which also works in English with about the same meaning: rest in peace. It comes from the Christian tradition, which at various points and to various people has held that there is a time of "soul sleep" after death but before judgment.
THE END
ALTERNATE ENDING:
Dudes!!
If they made "Horse Game 64", I would TOTALLY buy that game!
ALTERNATE WHOLE THING ACTUALLY

transcription.title: this comic allows you to almost pinpoint the point where the "let us" experiment ended for t-rex

panel.line: HEY T-REX DO YOU BELIEVE MONEY MAKES PEOPLE HAPPIER
Let's discuss!
I think it's clear that at some income levels, money DOES buy happiness!
If you can't afford to eat or buy diapers for your child and then you can, that money will make you happy and have obviously bought you happiness!
On the other hand, some lottery winners are less happy a few years after winning than they were before!
Mo' money CAN, apparently, indeed lead to mo' problems.
So let us say money can buy happiness, assuming it's not received all at once.
But billionaires aren't uniformly jolly!
That's true. Okay, so clearly there's a function where money buys happiness with less efficiency as happiness increases.
That implies giving a depressed dude a few bucks will cheer him right up.
Heck, maybe it does! Let's find a depressed dude and find out!
T-REX I WAS JUST MAKING CONVERSATION
Oh!
THERE'S NO NEED TO DO SCIENCE ON DEPRESSED DUDES
I SHOULDN'T HAVE TO SAY THAT MORE THAN ONCE YOU KNOW
I said "oh"!!

ON ONE HAND THESE GAMES APPEAL TO THOSE OUTSIDE THE STANDARD GAMING DEMOGRAPHIC AND THUS SERVE TO BROADEN THE APPEAL OF THE MEDIUM AND DISPEL SOME NEGATIVE STEREOTYPES ABOUT THOSE WHO PARTAKE OF ELECTRONIC ENTERTAINMENT

HE WILL NOT BE BORN FOR 65 MILLION YEARS BECAUSE WE ARE IN THE PAST REMEMBER

transcription.title: LET'S GO HAVE SOME INTELLIGENT FRIGGIN' BABIES! LATER ON ONE OF THEM MIGHT BLOW UP A ROCK IN SPACE

panel.line: Guys! There's a VOLUNTARY EXTINCTION movement. If we can decide to all stop havin' babies, then we can choose to go extinct!!
It probably sounded like a good idea at the time?

Then again, our actions, as a people, HAVE been responsible for untold thousands of involuntary extinctions around the world - which could all be avoided in the future by voluntarily offering ourselves up instead! The final generation gets to spend everyone's life savings and throw a totally wicked part, and the last one out turns off the lights. The end!
You sound like you're actually convincing yourself that this is a good idea!
I am, a little!
Okay, but one could argue that the intelligent life we represent is something that could be ENTIRELY UNIQUE in the Universe. That's worth preserving!
Yeah, maybe. I think I still need some more convincing.
*sigh*
...Fine.
We shouldn't choose to go extinct because if an asteroid threatens the planet, we're the only ones with enough science to blow it up.
HECK YES

transcription.title: i got opinions, i still got opinions

panel.line: Some words are special, reserved for only the worst situations, and as such carry weight when we dare to use them!
Some words have MEANING, cats and kittens!
And because of this I cringe when someone says a test RAPED them, or that a movie was so terrible it RAPED the excellent book it was based on. Being raped is totally way worse than failing a test!
"Being raped is totally way worse than failing a test."
What? It's FACTUAL! People need to know!
You're walking on dangerous land, T-Rex!
I know that folks got opinions about rape! I'm one of 'em!
But MY opinions are about usage. Let us eschew all this metaphorical rape and only talk about LITERAL rape, okay??
So, um, when you look back on this, I hope you realize that the reason I left is your phrase "let us... talk about LITERAL rape, okay??".
SOMETIMES LIFE IS HARD FOR YOU ISN'T IT T-REX
Only when my friends quote me in a misleading fashion!!
...Oh wait nevermind it's hard at other times too

transcription.title: this hypothetical book of quotations only serves to underline the importance of a trained and qualified proofreader. or a backspace key

panel.line: Okay, time to get myself into some of them books of quotations!
Hah! I mean, "some of THOSE books of quotations"!

So here's some quotable quotes for you, Dromiceiomimus! "Failure is just success rounded down", "I enjoy friendly good times", and "Whom is responsible for all these hards on?". Perhaps you'd like to compile them into a volume?
Hey, imagine if the only quotation that survived from you was "Time to get myself into some of them quote books"?
I choose not to!
Yeah man, maybe all that survives from you is that quote!
It's not even accurate!!

Years in the future, folks will try to reconstruct you from those few words. "Who was 'T-Rex'? We know of his interest in 'them quote books' [sic], and we can assume he found demonstrative pronouns a challenge."
"Ignore that last bit! I meant to write that we know T-Rex was awesome and I wish I were like him."
Off Panel: "Anyway it's really too bad he couldn't talk well!"
"Hold on, I meant to write that he COULD! For more TRUE FACTS, turn to page 45."
Off Panel: "Astute readers will note this book only goes to page 40."
"Screw you, dude! Attention readers! Only read the good sentences!!"

According to the calendar on my desk-
Yes?

The world began on January 1st of this very year, and will end no more than 365 days later! The calendar is only 365 date-bearing pages dates thick and I've counted three times! The Page-A-Day publishing house tried to warn us!

off-screen: The Mayan Long Count calendar you're discussing doesn't end in our year 2012, it just rolls over to a new digit, much like the year 1 BC rolled over to 1 AD.
