transcription.title: if you re-read the comic again with "girlfriend" you will see that t-rex has had a great dating history. no regrets!

panel.line: I will, one day, have the best breakfast of my entire life.
It is inarguably so!

Arrange all of my breakfasts from worst to best, and one's going to come out on top. I believe there are easily enough variables involved in breakfast that if you look closely enough, you can break any ties! One breakfast will be best. And what kills me is I'll probably not even notice it!
How do you figure that?
Most breakfast are pretty great! EVEN THE JUST OKAY ONES.

It's unlikely my best breakfast will be so amazingly different enough from a regular breakfast that I'd notice it. That's sad, isn't it? That in a lifetime of breakfasts, the best one should pass unnoticed?
I - I guess?
MEANWHILE, IN THE UNIVERSE WHERE INSTEAD OF SAYING "BREAKFAST", T-REX SAID "GIRLFRIEND":
There are easily enough variables involved in girlfriend!
(Off-screen): Interesting

transcription.title: update bodies set status = 'dead'

panel.line: Well my screenplay for "(A)bort, (R)etry, (M)urder?" didn't work out. Nobody wanted to produce it! So, I have started a new screenplay, based on the structured Query Language for databases!
It's called...
"UPDATE bodies SET status = ' DEAD ' " !
It's about a database administrator for a large company who uncovers a secret database by accident!
A database...of MURDERS!
Your screenplay once again, appeals only to a micro-niche market!
How do you mean?
Well, the only people who will enjoy it are those in the intersection of the set of people who know databases with the set of people who like crappy movies!
Pretty nerdy, my friend!

transcription.title: if by "kinda sucky at the best of times" t-rex means "kinda sensual under very particular, controlled circumstances"

panel.line: Going to the dentist means lying down and baring your teeth and paying a stranger to scrape at them: kinda sucky at the best of times. But then I realized!
Dentists are totally CYBERNETICISTS.

I know, Dromiceiomimus, I was skeptical of myself too! But teeth naturally accumulate plaque and decay. Dentists apply technology to biological life (me!) to upgrade my smile and stop biological decline! Isn't that what cyberneticists do??
Cyberneticists study the structure of regulatory systems.
Honestly I don't know what you feel that brings to the conversation.
Doesn't technology have to be implanted to make you a cyborg?
They implant fillings!
Dentists are cyberneticists that operate with metal scrapers instead of experimental medical contraband, and the result is cleaner teeth instead of glowing red pupils.
I suppose!
I've bribed cyberneticists to ply their trade and enhance my fragile mortal body!!
[[tooth sparkle]]

transcription.title: This theory is called "panspermia"!

panel.line: Certain bacteria may be able to survive a long trip in space, and there's a theory that life on OUR VERY PLANET was seeded by such space-born organic materials.
This theory is called "panspermia"!
HILARIOUS.
Undermining serious work into the origins of life on our planet, I see.
I'm not!
They're undermining it by choosing such hilarious names! You know what it's called if you think the organic life is sent out on purpose by aliens?
No.
DIRECTED PANSPERMIA. That doesn't sound like the origin of life on earth! That sounds like a CRAZY FRIDAY NIGHT.
"A rose by any other name would smell as sweet"!
Nobody's smelling roses called Flower of Sperm Directed Onto Everything Ever"!
...Okay, listen, maybe they'd smell them ONCE.

transcription.title: utahraptor is assuming t-rex may occasionally think of him as "an orange man"; it seems a fair assumption

panel.line: EPISTEMOLOGY COMICS
If I say "Guys, I know I'm rad", what am I saying? What does it actually mean to KNOW something? Philosophers have struggled with this for ages!
Luckily, the answer is super easy and they should have come up with it sooner!

Knowledge of anything, radness included, comes about if three conditions are met: that this thing is true, that I believe it to be true, and that I have a JUSTIFIED cause for this belief! Perhaps my justification of radness is that I've been shot out of a cannon onto a motorbike, which is extremely rad. When these three conditions are met, then I've got what's called a Justified True Belief, and that, my friends, is what knowledge is!
Okay, so we're hanging out, and I say "T-Rex, I'm gonna go nap in your bed."
I say, "Dude, feel free!"

However, once in your room I startle a sleepy murderer, who without alarming you, quietly murders me, stuffs me in the closet, and then goes back to nappy times - in your bed!! A few minutes later you say, "Nice. An orange dude is sleeping in my bed." Clearly, this is justified, and it may even be true.
But only if the murderer was orange! Don't you see? It's sheer luck that this murderer was coloured to make your belief true. Are you really going to call random chance "knowledge"?
Utahraptor!!
Please don't get murdered in my bedroom, Utahraptor

transcription.title: just ran all these queries and am now relieved to be so innocent

panel.line: A person's activity is often used by law enforcement when pursuing a conviction! Facebook posts, Twitter updates and Google searches for "how to murder the sucky neighbour" have all been used as evidence of intentful wrongdoing.
I can totally use this to my advantage!

AS SUCH, I've recently done tons of Google searches for "how to avoid breaking laws", "i love being not guilty", "how to be an EVEN MORE innocent dude", and "how to avoid crime because, not unlike Batman himself, I too hate crime".
There's nothing like a Twitter post that says "Definitely not planniny any crimes ever! #seriouslyyouguys"
Nothing!!
Now if I'm ever accused of wrongdoing, any investigation will reveal these posts and my extreme innocence!
Really?
You're not worried how suspicious it is for someone to be SO CONCERNED with appearing innocent?
Man, there's nothing illegal about being big into innocence! Besides, Utahraptor, I'M not the one who looked up "how to frame T-Rex for future criminal activities??" on my home computer.
...I looked it up on yours.
But friends forever, right?
That's binding, right?

transcription.title: Here Lies T-Rex: He's Dead, But That Doesn't Mean You Should Make Fun Of Him.

panel.line: Time for some more epitaphs, bitches!
I'M NOT BITCHES
Time for some more epitaphs, everyone!!
Here Lies T-Rex: Hey I Bet He's Still Wicked Handsome!
HERE LIES T-REX HE WAS MORTAL SO THEN HE DIED
Depressing!
"Here Lies T-Rex: He Never Stopped Saying "Frig" / Even If He Stopped Saying Other Words".
BAD. ASS.
Here lies T-Rex: He lived his life well / and tried to understand.
Boooring!
Epitaphs need to grab the attention of passers by, Utahraptor - you're competing with EVERYONE ELSE who's ever died!
Here Lies T-Rex: His Heart Was Punched Out Of His Chest By A Robot, But Then Wind Blew His Heart Into The Robot's Face And The Robot Said, "Error, Oh Man, Gross".
Niiiiiice. I also would have accepted "Here Lies T-Rex: He Tried To Eat One Of Every Animal; Hopefully That Counts For Something!"
Because. . . hopefully it does, you know?

transcription.title: if ANY ONE of these predictions fails to come true before the final heat death of the universe, i will PERSONALLY buy each of my readers a doughnut.

panel.line: Guys, it's totally easy to predict the future. Observe: IN THE FUTURE, the general public will be given ample opportunities to purchase the solid gold hits of this, our current decade!
THE FUTURE, YOU GUYS

IN THE FUTURE, portrayals by others of our shared past will infringe upon our memories of it, and people born after our time will only understand it through the shorthand aspects of cultural consensus found in the media.
Just like how everyone in the 20s was a flapper!!
Exactly!
IN THE FUTURE, our actions and beliefs will be evaluated by standards we didn't have!
No doubt!
IN THE FUTURE, we'll solve the old problems but we'll also have new problems.
Also, we'll still have some of the old problems.
The future, ladies and gentlemen!!
LATER:
Maaaan!
I forgot to predict friggin' ROCKET BOOTS

transcription.title: half-way through writing this comic, I realized that if dame judy dench reads my comic then t-rex WOULD, in her head, to her, already sound just like dame judy dench. niiiiiice

panel.line: My life - ALL LIVES, in fact - would be measurably improved if I had a sweet accent! FACT.
And it totally doesn't count to say I already have an accent!

We're being relative here; it has to be different from everyone else around me. Wouldn't it be great if I sounded like Dame Judi Dench, Dromiceiomimus? I mean, a male version? Ooh, or like Cary Grant! I could sound like the platonic form of charming, suave, unreliable and debonair MANHOOD.
Have you tried faking it?
Oh, for sure, but all my accents sound like bad Irish fakes!
It's confusing and disappointing.
So, you want to sound like Cary Grant, eh?
Why not hire voice and accent coaches, like actors do? I don't see why the same "here's how to talk like someone you're not" lessons wouldn't apply just as well to you.
Utahraptor, that's brilliant! Oh my gosh. My lifelong dream can finally now be realized!
A FEW MONTHS LATER:
Why, hello there, Utahraptor! Wouldn't you say I sound like a young Cary Grant?
I would!
Well, sure! It would be harder to hear my accent, however, if our conversation were relayed in a text-based medium.

panel.line: INTERNET ARGUMENT COMICS
NAZI ACCUSATIONS
T-Rex" Can we accept that everyone on the internet is PROBABLY a Nazi, and move on??
YOU'RE BEING PRESCRIPTIVIST ABOUT LANGUAGE AND KEEP TELLING EVERYONE ELSE HOW TO TYPE
Keep up the good work!
NO THE PROBLEM IS THIS IS A JERKY THING TO DO

YOU THINK "FAIL" IS SYNONYMOUS WITH "Q.E.D."

YOU ARE TYPING IN ALL CAPS
I ACTUALLY HAVE NO PROBLEM WITH THAT

transcription.title: i wrote this comic while listening the TWO separate albums called "the ocarina of rhyme". i know mc hawking has "a brief history of rhyme"; apparently i am a big fan of the ol' time/rhyme switcharoo

panel.line: COMPRESSED ORIGIN STORY COMICS
Today's origin story: ALL LIFE (in the Judeo-Christian tradition)
I'm God and I'm going to create life!
INTERESTING

Okay so first off I'm going to invent the week! Monday's for inventing light, Tuesday's for inventing sky, Wednesday's for inventing stars and moons, Thursday's for inventing land and trees, Friday's for inventing sea beasts and birds, and Saturday's for inventing animals and dinosaurs and humans! Sunday's for chillaxin'.
I GOTTA SAY THAT IS A PRETTY GOOD GIST OF WHAT HAPPENED.
And now I'm going to put everyone into a big garden! Nobody eat the fruit of one particular tree, okay?!
Okay!
But I gotta say, there's this one forbidden tree that has this AMAZING fruit and you should definitely eat some right away.
Okay!
AWESOME.
T-REX ADAM AND EVE ARE TE ONES WHO ARE SUPPOSED TO EAT FROM THE TREE OF KNOWLEDGE YOU'RE GOD IN THIS STORY REMEMBER
Oops. Oh well!
IT'S JUST THAT IS SOME HELLA CONFUSING SYMBOLISM

transcription.title: Someone must have gotten it right by now!

panel.line: People are predicting the future all the time. All the time, you guys!
Someone must have gotten it right by now!
So I'm going to go back and read tons of "Life in the World of Tomorrow" articles from centuries past, and find the one dude who was the closest to being accurate.
And then what?
What do you mean, "And then what"? And then I'm going to read a bunch of startlingly accurate predictions about our futuristic society!
It is kind of neat to imagine the one guy who, purely by chance, has the most right predictions.
I know!
I'd love to go back in time and tell him "Hey man - of everyone here, you were the most right." Actually - I think I'd mostly just like to hear that myself.
It would be pretty amazing to go through life knowing that in the future, people not only remember but also APPROVE of you.
THAT EVENING:
Okay, time travellers! This is your LAST CHANCE to tell me I'm the more right guy here. Right now. Now! Nownownow. Now! Nnnnnnow! Now. ...Aw maaaan.

transcription.title: skydiving

panel.line: Excitement Comics
Today is a good day I think to find some excitement!

Hmm...stomping this house is kind of exciting, but it's a more familiar feeling - like getting served a favourite meal. It's good, but I know how it's going to end. I think I can do something more exciting.
Well! Stomping on this woman is exciting but again - too familiar.
What are you doing?
I'm looking for excitement! But so far it's been pretty much a "bust".
Hmm...You could go skydiving!
Yeah man!
And I could land on my enemies houses!
"Surprise!"

transcription.title: the wikipedia page on pedigree collapse writes about "the common historical tendency to marry those within walking distance", which i find to be ENTIRELY CHARMING. you're within walking distance, baby! let's get hitched!

panel.line: Let us assume that everyone alive today has two biological parents, a mother and a father. I will call this the "No Cloned Chicks" hypothesis!
And let us further assume that everyone's parents had a biological mother and father too!

This seems pretty reasonable. But it can't possibly be the case! If you take me, I've got two parents. My parents have two parents themselves, so this means that three generations ago, four people are needed to eventually produce me. Another generation back, we're eight people, and five generations ago gives me sixteen ancestors!
And if you go back 1500 years or so, say, fifty-five generations?
That's exactly the problem!
At fifty-five generations, I've got over TEN QUADRILLION grandparents all running around at the same time! Man! There's NO WAY there was room for that.
Ah, but you're assuming everyone's sexing up a totally genetic stranger. If you sex up a relative, any child produced will have fewer grandparents!
...Huh! So the fact that there weren't ten quadrillion people 1500 years ago SCIENTIFICALLY PROVES that some of my ancestors liked sexing it up with their cousins!!
...Huh.

transcription.title: let's say you have a giant heap of sand.

panel.line: T-REX LET'S SAY YOU HAVE A GIANT HEAP OF SAND AND I REMOVE ONE GRAIN AT A TIME
Ooh, let's!!
CLEARLY WHEN THERE'S ONLY ONE GRAIN OF SAND LEFT IT'S NOT A HEAP ANYMORE
Clearly!
AHA MY FRIEND BUT WHEN PRECISELY DID IT SWITCH FROM HEAP TO NON-HEAP
I dunno! At some fuzzy point if would switch for most observers from "heap" to, say, "small pile", and there we can draw the line. Language isn't that precise.
LISTEN THIS IS A CLASSIC PARADOX THAT EUBULIDES OF MILETUS CAME UP WITH OVER 2000 YEARS AGO
YOU NEED TO HAVE YOUR MIND BLOWN NOW OKAY
Sounds kinda dumb to to me!
What does?

The point at which a shrinking heap of sand becomes a non-heap. Clearly I'm supposed to struggle with an arbitrary threshold, because piles on either side of it look much the same. But it's just language! Look at statistical usage of the word "heap", decide using that average, end of story.

Oh snap, philosophers! Did T-Rex just totally school you with statistically-based descriptivist approach to semantics? IT APPEARS THAT HE TOTALLY DID!! It also appears he's speaking in the third person because he's so impressed with his awesome self!

transcription.title: if you think either t-rex or utahraptor is being unreasonable, just adjust the amount of money owed up or down until you can see their point of view

panel.line: COMICS IN WHICH T-REX OWES UTAHRAPTOR FIFTY BUCKS
Hah hah! Yep!
And I TOTALLY haven't paid it back yet, either!
What? Are you talking about your $50 debt to Utahraptor?
He told you about that?

T-Rex, he told me because he'd lent you the money a long time ago, and he was concerned that asking you for it a third time in as many months was not polite. I told him YOU were the one who was impolite in for putting him in this situation!
Man, now I'M the bad guy for not honoring debts in a timely manner?
My debt?
Utahraptor! Homeslice! Oh, I wasn't talking about you, I was referring to another debt which - um, I also owe?
T-Rex, you only ever call me nicknames when you owe me money.
Aw, that's no true! C'mon, Shortpants!
Oh my God, from now on his name is definitely Shortpants.

transcription.title: we'll always have batman

panel.line: I am a guy who really likes Batman. And it occurs to me: at some point in my life I'm going to be an old man!
I'm going to be an old man who really likes Batman!

It's gonna be so awesome. Am I to imagine that one day I somehow WON'T be interested in figthin' crime, punchin' dudes, and saying things like "I AM THE NIGHT"? Of course not! When I'm old I'll be sitting on a rocking chair next to the other old men, arguing about whether it's Batman or Bruce Wayne that's the real mask. CLEARLY BRUCE IS THE MASK.
It sounds like this comforts you!
Oh, it totally does.

I have NO IDEA where I'll be or what I'll be doing in fifty years but when I picture myself talking about Batman everything falls into place. I'll always have that, you know? No matter what happens, I'll always be able to argue about Batman.
Even if you were paralyzed and couldn't communicate?
Utahraptor, please! For every Batman argument that comes out of my mouth there's like eighty of them that go on in my head.

transcription.title: T-REX YOU HAVE MADE OUT WITH PRETTY MUCH EVERY VISIBLE CHARACTER IN THIS COMIC; YOU'RE LUCKY THERE'S A FOURTH WALL BETWEEN US RIGHT NOW

panel.line: T-REX DID YOU HEAR ARCHIE IS GETTING MARRIED
Perennial teen Archie Andres of Riverdale, USE?! To whom?
VERONICA LODGE
Oh, poor Veronica!
You'd rather she marry - well, who, Jughead?

Man, I'd rather she expand her horizons beyond the ten NON-BACKGROUND characters in Riverdale. Her dating options there are, in their entireity: Archie, Moose, Dilton, Chuck, Reggie, and Jughead. That's it! PROBABLY SHE CAN DO BETTER. Maybe she should chat up Background Teen In Green Shirt once in a while, you know?
That's like complaining when Princess Leia falls for Han Solo!
Yes!
And that is a valid complaint! I hate it when fictional universes are SO CLAUSTROPHOBIC that everyone's hanging out in the same swimming pool.
Huh?
Okay that's a metaphor, but just BARELY. It's basically a literal description of what's going on.
Only so many characters can splash around in a swimming pool at the same time. And they keep bumping into each other!
Man! If there's a better two-sentence summary of BOTH Star Wars and Archie comics, I don't want to hear it!

transcription.title: this comic started with "who will be the first person to be murdered in space? it could still be you!" which i posted to twitter, and then thought, man, someone should write a comic about that

panel.line: You know what hasn't happened in space yet? Friggin' murder! Nobody's been murdered in space yet!
Guys! This means I still have a chance!
You want to be the first murderer in space?

No, man! That's a sucky way to go down in history. But as the first MURDEREE in space, going out as a floating corpse in Zero G: that's something! And it's totally easy. All I need to do is convince some spaceman, when the time comes, to murder me!
Is it murder if you're literally asking for it?
That's for the courts to decide, my friend!
Listen, bottom line: when my time on this planet is just about up, I'm going up into space and you're going to murder me, okay? Surprise me with a knife!
I -
for the sake of history, Utahraptor!!
I can already see the headline: "The First Dude Murdered In Space!"
At the very least, "The First Dude Murdered In Space By His Friend, who Is Now Going To Jail!"
At the very least!!

transcription.title: i once dreamed that i cheated on my girlfriend and woke up feeling AWFUL. it wasn't until i was in the shower that i actually remembered it was all a dream! the sense of relief was palpable; it was so great that i kinda wish i had dreams like this more

panel.line: Last night I dreamt I had been invited to a fancy party, far away, and the host was nice enough to buy me a plane ticket to get there.
Finally, things were looking up for dream T-rex!

This was at noon, dream time, and the plane was to leave at six. I made myself a sandwich, but it must've taken a while, because when I looked at the clock, it was 6:30 already! I'd missed my flight AND party entirely, and my friends all chastised me for being so dumb. "Why didn't you leave at least two hours for check in with an international flight?" they said!
So you dreamed about being cussed out?
Yeah, it was great!
I remember saying "OBVIOUSLY it was a dumb mistake, guys. It'll never happen again; now I know to always leave plenty of time to get to the airport!"
And when you woke up you remembered that moral!
Exactly!

I'm now learning life lessons WHILE I SLEEP, Utahraptor. I'm pretty sure I've moved on to the next stage of existence. I'm pretty sure when I wake up tomorrow, I'll be a being of PURE ENERGY. I'm pretty sure I'll come back and visit though, so no worries!

transcription.title: sometimes a bunch of us get together and call ourselves "the smiletime gang" and this summer we all awarded each other medals that say "#1 Friend"! SORRY EVERYONE, MEMBERSHIP TO OUR AWESOME GANG IS BY INVITATION ONLY

panel.line: Medal stores will totally sell you whatever medal you ask for!
I - why are people competing for first prize in a track meet when they can go out and buy a bigger trophy that says "ACTUAL FIRST PRIZE IN THE TRACK MEET: WAY BETTER THAN THAT OTHER GUY"?
Probably for the fun of sport, T-Rex! The goal isn't actually the trophy.
Then I'm sure nobody will mind when I'm at the awards ceremony, making a big deal of my way more awesome prize!
There's a way we can turn this realization of yours into something more positive, T-Rex!
Oh?
Yeah, what if instead of ruining track and field ceremonies, we bought awards for each other? Yours could say something like "SASSIEST DUDE" -
And yours could say "CHUMLY PAL"! Oh my gosh, YES. Let's award each other medals!
LATER:
T-Rex, thanks for the award, but I'm not wearing a gold medal that says "DROMICEIOMIMUS: THE CLASSY DAME WITH THE SIX-SYLLABLE NAME".
I understand, Dromiceiomimus!
I didn't know they'd be engraving it live

transcription.title: the history here is taken from "the secret life of words", by henry hitchings, wherein "arse ropes" are described (tautologically) as "delightfully graphic"!

panel.line: In the 1300's, the regular chicks and dudes in England were speaking what we'd call "Middle English", a rapidly developing alternative to the Latin and French used in religion and government.
It was an exciting time to be saying "Forsooth"!

And some of these dudes were big into English being developed as a "real" language, particularly one John Wycliffe, who decided to translate the Bible - one of, if not THE most important book of his time - into casual English. This would allow John's less educated countrymen to read it since, as it'd been written in Latin since the 5th century, currently required either formal education or a priest to interpret it for you!
But when they started translating, they ran onto some problems!
Papal Resistance?

That, but also a lot of English words they needed didn't exist yet! So John invented them, and we still use his "behemoth", "puberty", and "zeal". But he also needed a word for intestines", and the phrase he came up with - FOR THE BIBLE, I REMIND YOU - was "arse ropes".
Hilarious!
And that brings us to today"#8217;s Proof We"#8217;re Not Living In The Best of All Possible Worlds!
[[In a Scroll]]: "Doctors never talk about inflammation of the arse ropes"

transcription.title: i did a google search for "Walter Theodore Freemont", hoping he'd be a billionaire industrialist from centuries past, but thus far it seems no parents in history have seen it fit to give their child such a name, or at least give them the name an

panel.line: Today is a good day I think for revenge!
REVENGING MYSELF UPON MY ENEMIES, THAT IS!
Specifically, revenging myself upon my enemies by finding out what their full names are, and then popularizing an insulting or embarrassing acronym that uses those initials.
Huh?
Like WTF! If I had an enemy named "Walter Theodore Freemont" I could invent WTF and then he'd be annoyed.
But WTF is already an invented acronym.
I know! It was an example, GEEZ.
I'm going to invent a NEW acronym that goes along with some enemy's initials, then ensure it gets super popular! Revenge: COMPLETED.
It seems like it'd be way easier to just make enemies with one W.T. Freemont that to try to direct the acronymic course of an entire language! IMHO.
Oh my God, people who say "IMHO" in real life are just - Utahraptor? I am having trouble dealing with our friendship at the moment.

panel.line: I want to be Dick Tracy for Halloween
But my mom says I should be a witch
Oooh, she burns me up!!! Only pussies dress up as witches
I want to be a witch
I heard you were going as a witch this year
Who told you that?!
Your mom.
Pussy!
Harry Potter's not a pussy!

transcription.title: my friends, i just had an imagination that demands my full attention

panel.line: Yesterday I saw one of those mugs with a super cute drawing of a bear on it with the text "Good friends make life BEARABLE." Adorable!
Only I didn't immediately notice the bear!

And the "BEAR" part of "BEARable" wasn't capitalized. So my impression was simply of a mug with black text stating "Good friends make life bearable". It was this amazing mug of depression, a mug that broadcast to all who can read that life is pain, nothing but pain, that life will kill you and that only good friends can make it even briefly sustainable.
Let's sell them!
I know, right?
People are done with mugs that say cute things like "I Hate Mondays" or "World's Best Dad". We want realist mugs! Mugs that say things like "Maybe Mondays Aren't The Problem; Maybe I'm The Problem."
"I've Realized: Other Dads Are Almost Certainly Better."
Oh man! Can you imagine a secretary drinking coffee out of an "Is This All There Is?" mug?
I can!
[[T-Rex imagines tiny Batman head on left talking to tiny Spider-man head on right]]
Batman: You can be my new roommate, Spider-man. I GUESS.
Spider-man: WOOOO!
...LATER.

transcription.title: it is built-in protection against sexiness inflation, a strong statement against the growing trend of elevens on tens.

panel.line: Man, Dromiceiomimus has been looking fantastic lately! I would DEFINITELY rate her current attractiveness as AT LEAST a nine point five on ten!!
I-
[[T-Rex and Dromiceiomimus look at each other awkwardly]]
Hah! This is what you get for thinking out loud, my friend!
Man!
I should've went with it when I saw her; stopping in mid-sentence just admits guilt. I should've said, "That's right, Dromiceiomimus! YOU HAVE BEEN LOOKING GREAT LATELY."
Except you didn't rate her a perfect ten.
Only because I always reserve point five for emergencies!!
A HYPOTHETICAL EXAMPLE OF AN EMERGENCY:
Dromiceiomimus, you're a perfect 9.5 on 10!
But what if I... dressed up like a flapper, and said "Here's the news?"
That's a perfect ten and luckily I reserved some extra points for this scenario, listen I gotta go lie down.

transcription.title: we do the best with what we have

panel.line: Man, I totally missed out on my window for skydiving. I should've done it when I was younger!
I had WAY less to lose then!
What do you mean, T-Rex? A catastrophic dive in either case and you're still dead.

True, but if I die at, say, 50, that's 50 years of accumulated experience, knowledge and responsibility that die with me! But if I die at 16 then all the world loses is one wacky teen and one handful of pages of wacky teen fan fiction.
But at 16 you had way more potential than you would at 50!
Ouch!

At 16 you've got the potential for both you at 50 and the potential for trillions of alternate future and alternate yous, possibilities which are trimmed each instant you're alive. At 50 you've already exhausted tons of your options!
.... Interesting.
You know, life's funny, Utahraptor. I woke up this morning convinced that it would be better to die in a skydiving accident at 16 than at 50. Now I don't know what to believe!
That's funny?
Actually I guess not

transcription.title: I call my tale, "I Stapled An Introductory Page To The Front, And A Concluding Page To The Back, Of A Curtain Catalogue".

panel.line: Most detective stories reveal clues to the reader as they progress through the book, allowing them to unravel the mystery with the characters, and, if they're good, figure out the mystery before the detective does!
Not my detective story, you guys!!

My detective doesn't show all the clues to the reader! He's always detecting stuff that the reader doesn't know and can't know, and at the end when he figures out the mastery, he arrests the murderer for reasons that we aren't privy to and that no careful reading of the text will ever reveal.
The end!
Sounds pretty boring AND frustrating, T-Rex!
It's not! I added in some NARRATIVE TENSION too!

AS the story progresses, the narrator increasingly gives up on mystery ever being solved, and instead of describing the actions of the detective, indulges his interest in interior decoration and describes the curtains on the wall.
Riveting!
It is!
I call my tale, "The Stabby Murderer Who Got Detected, Or, Wow Will You Look At These Curtains?"
Man, they say to write what you know, but I think they're just jealous of my awesome imagination!

transcription.title: maybe it's a good idea that animals don't live forever. rhetorical animals, i mean! like me and my human friends!

panel.line: Maybe it's a good idea that people don't live forever. Rhetorical people, I mean!
Like me and my dinosaur friends!

If everyone lived forever, then there'd still be folks alive today who feel PERSONALLY AGGRIEVED by the ancient Koban culture, or who hold true to their born belief that the Earth rightfully belongs to, I dunno - the Visigoths? We'd never get anything done because we'd all be bickering over ancient wrongs, real or imagined. If we can't forgive, death at least gives us the option to forget!
T-Rex: coming out strongly in favour of death?
Apparently!!
Obviously I'd rather have an alive grandparent than a dead one, but I can see the advantage at the societal level in not having folks with mores thousands of years out of date still rinning around!
I suppose 3000 years ago there were people who DID hate the Kobans!
Exactly! And now they're all dead, and the Kobans are dead, and we can all go through life without dealing with their irrelevant racism.
Progress! Progress through everybody dying anf their kids eventually not caring who their parents hated!

transcription.title: a more accurate line would be "Well-established trails for riding a horse along? Where we're going, we don't need... well-established trails for riding a horse along."; either will be enough to concede the point.

panel.line: How come there wasn't science fiction a thousand years ago? I gotta say...
The serfs certainly dropped the ball on that one!

It's weird, isn't it, Dromiceiomimus? I don't see any reason why past dudes couldn't have written stories about what life would be like down the road. Why couldn't they have imagined horses that, when ridden fast enough, travelled back through time and allowed you to sass up your parents?
Maybe they were too busy trying to survive?
Or maybe you're just being narrow in your definition of science fiction!
Explain!

Okay, well, nobody was talking about flying cars, sure, but people did conceptualize Pegasus, and that's a friggin' flying horse. Horses being the cars of olden times, remember? Just because Peggy didn't have a scientific underpinning doesn't mean he wasn't the result of people imagining better technologies!

Okay, that's a good point. However! I will not concede until at least ONE ancient manuscript is uncovered that includes the line "Hay? where we're going, we don't need... hay." And then the horseman has to flip down the visor of his armour, okay?

transcription.title: the red spiders are colonizing outside of their native reality

panel.line: Yep!
Pretty sure I just ate some spider eggs!!

There were gross red egg-sac things at the bottom of my drink, Dromiceiomimus! And I thought "Gross" and then I said "At least I didn't consume any of them though!" and then I forgot about how you should never say things like that because then I found some sacs stuck between my teeth too.
Gross!
I KNOW
You can either be optimistic or pessimistic about this, T-Rex!
Today, my friend, I choose pessimism!

Maybe THESE are the spiders who thrive on stomach acid! Maybe in a week I'll be vomiting up millions of tiny red spiders, over and over again. And maybe that won't be enough, and the rest will eat their way out, tunneling through my stomach, muscles, and finally, skin.
Gah!
LATER:
Pessimists say that by expecting the worst, they're pleasantly surprised when things don't go that badly! I thought I'd give it a try, but honestly...
I don't think pessimists are imagining hard enough

transcription.title: A.F.S. said the only reason life is APPARENTLY thriving is because nature doesn't want the death of an individual to end things forever. With enough life running around and eating other life, you can have tons more misery to go around AND avoid the dange

panel.line: Man, speaking of pessimism, you know who's pessimistic?
Arthur Friggin' Schopenhauer!

Not only did A.F.S. not believe that this is the best of all possible worlds, he supplied a proof that this is, in fact, the WORST of all possible worlds! First he assumed that the worst possible world would be sustainable, since if it ended, nobody would be around to suffer. Prolonged suffering across millenia beats instant death!
Clearly!
CLEARLY.
Then he observed that our world is good enough to support life, but just barely!
Life's everywhere, man!

Sure, but one small shift in orbit, a slight change in temperature, and it's a catastrophe on a global scale. There's no wiggle room; if our fragile world was only a little worse there would be no life on it at all!
Therefore ours is the worst of all possible worlds?
Yep! Because any worse and it wouldn't be a world, it would just be an empty planet without suffering, and nature ABHORS an empty planet without suffering.
Anyway!
I believe it was after this proof that A.F.S. added the "Friggin'" to his name!

transcription.title: based on the time i stubbed my baby toe and it broke and my FRIEND pat who is supposed to be my FRIEND did NOTHING

panel.line: LITERARY TECHNIQUE COMICS
today's technique: LEITWORTSTIL
Today is a good day I think for leitwortstil!
Leitwortstil is the purposeful repetition of words or phrases in a story, you guys!

For example, a dog might always be described as "that wacky jerk" in a story, to underline what a wacky jerk that dog turned out to be. Or in a collection of stories, the same phrase might appear in each story, which helps tie them together as a whole! Leitwortstil ALSO happens when a character says the same word over and over and over again.
You mean like a catch phrase?
Sure!
I'm not sure that counts as leitwortstil, does it? If it's just someone saying "Gee golly jeepers!", and there's no theme or motif associated with it - then it's just there for laughs, isn't it?
My friend, I believe you are unfortunately TOTES WRONG on this one!
MEANWHILE IN TUDOR ENGLAND
I stubbed my toe! Frig frig frig frig frig! ...Hey, Shakespeare! I just leitwortstiled "frig"!
Shakespeare: t-rex i am from when "rowboat" could be spelled "rhowbhoatte" and even i don't think that's a word
...I think it's broken!

transcription.title: followers of my @ryanqnorth twitter account will realize that t-rex's creepy raccoon neighbours have broken out of fiction and are now pooping all over my deck. man, raccoons in toronto need to pay more attention to what they're eating, that's all i'll s

panel.line: I'm not afraid to admit it: I've nurtured some talents and have become particularly good at certain things.
For example: stomping on things!

I am really good at stomping on things. Years of practice have enabled me to put my foot above an object, shift my weight to the foot with force, and thus compress whatever is beneath my foot. And should I see someone struggling with stomping, something SO HARD for them and yet so easy for me, I would gladly help them out!
Assuming they want it, of course.
Of course!
And you agree that this is the right thing for me to do, assuming nobody is hurt through the stomping.
Absolutely.
But I'm STILL not cleaning raccoon poop off your porch, T-Rex!
UTAHRAPTOR we just LOGICALLY PROVED that if raccoon poop makes me puke and you can handle it fine, then you should be the one cleaning it!!
Please, Utahraptor, I-
I can't handle the fact that my neighbours are poopy raccoons

panel.line: Dinosaur Comics Presents: Fun-Pun Corner! Today: Fun-Puns with t-Rex's Fave Activity! By Steve Carey
Hey T-Rex, why won't you lend me $20?
Because I have to put my foot down!
Hey T-Rex, why are you putting in all these long hours?
I'm just trying to get a leg up!

I'm stepping out!

The Blue Man Group!

transcription.title: ironically, in panel 2 when t-rex said "that's right, i said it!", referring to the idea that some people's true selves are total chumps, he had not ACTUALLY said it, merely implied it. i guess this really just goes to show you that irony can be super bo

panel.line: People who say "Always be true to yourself" fail to consider that there are completely unrepentant murderers.
That's right, I said it! Some people's true selves are total chumps!
I would like it if the chumpified chicks and dudes were true to other selves, please.
There's lots of good ones.
...Batman's an obvious choice.
Shakespeare wrote it, didn't he? "To thine own self be true"?
Sure!

But Shakespeare wrote it for a CHARACTER, which doesn't mean that he personally believed it. You can write a story about a mad scientist and not actually want to wear retro aviator goggles all the time.
You can?
I mean, the RHETORICAL "you" can.
*sigh*

transcription.title: can we make a single raised eyebrow sound louder, can science help us there or something

panel.line: Time for some new punctuation marks, bitches!!
And double exclamation marks don't count, bitches!!
I thought we'd agreed - on your urging, actually - that we'd all be saying "bitches" less.
That's right, britches!!
See, that's still basically "bitches".
I concede the point easily, backstitches!!
So, new punctuation marks?
Yes! New punctuation marks!

Okay, so I want one that conveys all the sass of saying "x, bitches!!" without the casual cussing and for any value of x. I want punctuation that when read causes all readers - regardless of who or when they are - to whisper a frank and awed "oh snap!"
So invent it and convince everyone it's a good idea!
Utahraptor, were you using my new punctuation there? Did you mean to convey "Convince everyone it's a good idea, bitches!!"?
Utahraptor (from outside the panel): Nope!
Okay!
It's just - I don't really know what it sounds like yet

transcription.title: at least they're still talking about you, that's something

panel.line: Maslow was a dude who put all of our needs and desires into a hierarchy! The whole idea was that you can't satisfy any desire at the top of the hierarchy until you satisfy those beneath it.
Nice going, Maslow!

At the top is SELF ACTUALIZATION, which sounds pretty great, right? Except you can't get there unless you've already satisfied the level beneath it, which is esteem. And you don't get esteem - both self and from others - without relationships, and you don't worry about friggin' relationships until your basic safety needs are met. And finally, you don't worry about basic safety if you need to poop!
"You don't worry about basic safety if you need to poop."
Maslow said it, not me!
Well, he said the gist of it.
He did, did he?
Okay, no, but he DID come up with the theoretical framework that allows a phrase such as mine to be reasonably constructed in a meaningful context.
Don't look at me like that, Utahraptor! If my life's work is only used by some guy decades down the line to crack wise about poopin', I'll count myself as one lucky dude with one awesome legacy.
I set 'em up, future generations knock 'em down!

transcription.title: utahraptor: the kind of guy who will sometimes fantasize about gift shoes being delivered before biting the bullet and going out to buy actual shoes

panel.line: T-Rex, from within a thought cloud: Today is the day I give Dromiceiomimus the nice book I bought for her!
T-Rex, from within a thought cloud: Yes! I am the thoughtful friend who buys presents for no reason!

T-Rex, from within a thought cloud: And even though sometimes I talk so much that I don't let her get a word in edgewise, I'm still happy to give her the book I got, called "I'll Talk Less And Listen More: A Book To Give A Friend Who Is Pretty Okay, More Than Pretty Okay, Even!"
*sigh*
T-Rex, from within a thought cloud: Utahraptor, I bought you some shoes!
Utahraptor, from within a thought cloud: Really? Wow! What size?
[[The owner of the thought cloud is revealed to be Utahraptor]]
T-Rex, from within a thought cloud: I asked for size AWESOME! ...And then I clarified that down to a size large. Here you go, my friend! Thanks for being so great!
*sigh*
Batman, from within T-Rex's thought cloud: The thing is, if I were real, I think we both know that I'd never have the time to hang out with a NON crime-fighting dinosaur.
*sigh*

transcription.title: dollar auctions were invented by martin shubik, okay, so listen, mr. shubik, i like your name

panel.line: Dollars for sale! DOLLARS FOR SALE!
Dollars for sale, you guys!
Dollars for sale in an auction where everyone pays their highest bid, whether or not they win!

So when you bid 1 cent, Dromiceiomimus - FOR A PERFECTLY LEGITIMATE DOLLAR - you'll be getting a great deal and you'll make a profit of 99 cents! But watch out, because if Utahraptor outbids you with 2 cents, then you could lose your penny! Remember you have to pay your high bid either way.
So it's in my interest to outbid him with 3 cents: that way I can at least make a profit of 97 cents!
But then I'll just outbid her with the exact same motivation!
True!

But then - if Dromiceiomimus bids 98 cents, I'll bid 99. Then she has to decide whether to bid $1: if she doesn't, she loses 98 cents, but if she does, she'll break even. So she does, and I'm left with the choice of either losing my 99 cents, or of bidding $1.01 and then only losing 1 cent.
So I bid more than the dollar is worth, just to minimize my losses! And it keeps on going, and we both end up bankrupt! This is the worst ever auction, and I'm not bidding.
Would you say... "The only winning move is not to play?"
No, I think that movie's been referenced enough lately

transcription.title: the lava lamp thing wasn't actually that recent, it was in 2004, but it has taken me this long for me to be comfortable talking about it. IT COULD'VE EASILY BEEN ME, LAVA LAMPS TAKE SO FRIGGIN' LONG TO WARM UP

panel.line: You know those guys who die in really stupid, preventable ways that are entirely their fault? I'm pretty sure there's like a billion different timelines where I'M that guy!
Dromiceiomimus (from outside the panel): I'm sure there's not a BILLION of them, T-Rex.
Hah!

Dromiceiomimus, just recently this dude was found dead with shards of glass in his heart! You know what happened? His new lava lamp was taking TOO FRIGGIN' LONG to warm up, so he put it on his stove and heated it, and it got too hot and exploded on him and he died.
Whoah! That's terrible.
I know! And I'm not the only one who heard that story and thought, "Wow; glad he got the lava lamp before I did."
A man died, T-Rex! That's not funny!
Utahraptor, I'm not joking!
I truly believe I could've been the one who died. The sort of thing he did is exactly the sort of thing you do when you're home alone and frustrated with a lava lamp! You SOLVE PROBLEMS.
And sometimes you die.
Yes! But we recognize that one dies so that others may live.

By we, I mean of course the membership of the People Who When They Hear A Story About An Avoidable And Crazy Death, Laugh As Is Expected Of Them And Then Make A Mental Note To Not Do That Thing Anymore.
Our slogan is "Hi, you are probably already a member of our awesome club!"

panel.line: Today is a good day, I think, for a guest comic.
I'm in a comic!?
It appears that by informing me of my current existence within a medium of entertainment, the guest comic author has already broken the so-called "fourth wall".
Why should that matter? Your existence now is in no way different than it was before.

but as a character in a comic, I am required to be a source of entertainment. This is a demand that I have up to now been unaware of. Thus I must provide the reader with some semblance of comedic banter... perhaps a pun using the phrase "breaking the fourth wall" and my current action of crushing many walls.
I believe that particular point would have been better off remaining a subtle irony.
Since I do not have a joke readily available, I will just have to resort to entertainment through violence.
But you don't NEED to come up with a joke or rely on entertaining violence!
How so?
As a character in a comic, you have no true free will of your own. Nor do you think at all! It is the author that will com up with the joke.
But what if he forgets to come up with a funny punchline? If I have no free will, does that mean that I will be forced to just take up space in the last caption and say nothing at all?
If the author is a lazy bum, yes.
I don't see a punchline!
Just say "who the hell goes to Cornwall"
Seriously, who does that?
I know! Seriously!

panel.line: Maybe there IS actually a personal benefit to being mortal and dying one day.
I know, IT SOUNDS CRAZY, but stay with me!

We mortal people get an end to pain that immortal dudes never get. Unlike immortal dudes, there's a finite number of times I'm going to stub my toe so hard that it breaks. One time I'll stub my toe and it'll break and I'll be able to say, "There, that's done with. I'm never stubbing my toe THAT friggin' hard again. I can finally put this TOTALLY RIDICULOUS aspect of being alive behind me." - even if I could never know it at the time!
One time when you say it, you'll have to be right!
Exactly!
So now when something bad happens, I'll assume I'll die soon, so it's the last time it'll ever happen to me. I'll be able to sigh and just let it go.
"That's the last time I'm puking into my crotch"?
Exactly! I'm not stubbing THESE toes any more!

panel.line: Mylings are Scandinavian ghosts! They're way better than regular ghosts, you guys!
They're the ghosts of cheezed-off kids!

They're cheezed-off ghost kids who just want to be buried properly. And if you encounter one, it hops on your back and demands to be taken to the nearest graveyard. And as you approach the graveyard they grow heavier and heavier, until they're so heavy that you can sink into the ground under their weight. transcription.title: the best version of this story i read ended with the moral "some infinities are bigger than others". HOW TRUE

panel.line: David Hilbert was a mathematician and hotelier who was born in 1892. He built an infinite hotel, you guys!
THE INFINITE HOTEL
A TRUE STORY

So Hilbert built this infinite hotel that was infinitely big and had infinitely many rooms; I believe this was a matter of some investment. But build it he did, and soon after a bus with infinity people in it showed up, with each of them wanting a room! Lucky for Hilbert he had his infinite hotel, so each guest got a room, and the hotel was filled up to capacity. Nice! But just then another friggin' bus showed up, and it ALSO had infinity people in it!
Nobody builds for TWO infinite buses showing up right after the other!
Turns out they do!

He just told every guest already there to move into the room that was double their current room number. So the guest in room 3 moved into room 6, and so on! Thus, only the even-numbered rooms were occupied, and everyone on the new bus could have an odd-numbered room!
Amazing!
Yep! Anyway!
It's my understanding that he died an infinitely rich man infinity years later

transcription.title: history's chumps: a comic about chumps that belong to history. hence, the possessive.

panel.line: HISTORY'S CHUMPS
History if full of chumps, you guys!!

Today's historical chump is William H. Mumler (born 1832), who was a photographer guy who did portraits! Only he wasn't very good photographer guy because one time he accidentally double-exposed some film, and the resulting image showed the one portrait clearly but also showed a ghostly image of the other portrait!
So he threw away the photo and reminded himself not make that dumb mistake anymore?
Nope!

Instead he embarked on a career as a SPIRIT PHOTOGRAPHER and made a lot of money duping a lot of people, including Abraham Lincoln's widow. Only, peopleeventually started to notice that his "ghosts" looked an awful lot like living people around town!
Hah! Whoops!

They ALSO eventually noticed how he was breaking into their houses so he could look at photographs and figure out what his ghosts were supposed to look like. Anyway like everyone else from history he eventually died and now his entire life has been compressed to a short story, the end!

Yes! Today is the day for some tips on how to convince yourself that no matter what you'll never find anyone bett-
Okay! Today is the day for some tips on being romantic!
Flowers are nice, for all sexes and genders! They're pretty and also - smell pretty? Also! It can be romantic to tell someone you love them. Also, um.

Okay, so here's the thing. Probably there is someone out there who's better suited with you. The odds of you both having found the ONE person who's absolutely best for you, no matter what system you use to rank "bestness", are pretty small.
But!

BUT.

Let's say you're happy with person A (95% perfect) and you meet person B who is 99% perfect. It doesn't make sense to leave person A for B if you've been with them for years! You lose out on all your shared history, and that's like a times two multiplier!

Romance with a times two multiplier!

panel.line: Some folks got opinions, you guys!

BY WAY OF AN EXAMPLE, "vagina" comes from Latin, where it means "sheath" - as in something that goes around a sword! And some people are like, check it, MY vagina does tons more than the passive "sheath" implies, so let's call it something else!

panel.line: Say a friggin' word enough, and it loses all friggin' meaning!
SEMANTIC SATIATION

"Frig" is a bad example though because that word is great. But we've all spent an afternoon saying something like "waterpark" over and over until there's nothing there, just sounds, just the empty shell of a word, waterpark, the oral equivalent of a forgotten childhood toy found in adulthood, now strange and alien and no longer coloured by desire, by anything, waterpark. Did the word ever really have any meaning?
I think it's happening to me! Waterpark, waterpark, waterpark.
Waterpark, Utahraptor!
It's due to a repeated firing of the same cortex area which causes a reduction in the waterpark intensity, right? Waterpark.
It's too late to ask how or why. We're done for, Utahraptor. This is where our waterpark story ends.
LATER:
Utahraptor, I overdosed on semantic satiation! The word "waterpark" has been sandblasted right out of my mind!
How'd you use it just now?
That was the last instance I had!
...what word?

transcription.title: the great things about babies is that you can never be racist against babies, because you were totally a baby once. the only difference is, YOU grew out of it

panel.line: The words for "mother" and "father" are really similar, if not identical, across tons of languages! And the reason isn't because the languages are closely related. It's due to a way more awesome reason!
It's because parents totally assume their babies are talking about them!

It's so amazing: "ma", "pa" are some of the first and easiest language-like sounds babbling babies make - and what's the word for "mother" in English? "Mama"! And it's also "mama" in Dutch, and in Romanian, and in Catalan, Slovak, Quechu, Romanian, Chinese, German, Russian, and MORE. The languages have evolved such that the first language noise a baby makes sounds like it's saying "Hey mom, what's up?"
And dads make the seam deal too! "Papa" is in English, Cree, and Hindi!
Neat!
It's kinda awesome that these words are built to flatter new parents.
Man, it's great! Across language, time, and entire civilizations, we're united by pointing at our babbling babies and saying, "Yes. This child is DEFINITELY talking about me."
Hooray for egoism!

transcription.title: inspired by the tvtropes "weaksauce weakness" page. tvtropes it great, it'll remind you of how ridiculous your body is, AND also suck up endless hours of your time

panel.line: Our bodies are amazing things!
Check it, Everyone!

We use our mouths to talk. We invent, remember and teach entire languages with which to do the talking! And if that fails, We can TALK WITH OUR HANDS. We build planes and boats and cars and spaceships, all by either using our bodies directly, or by using instruments invented by our bodies. We compose beautiful music and tell amazing stories, all with our bodies, these fleshy bags with spooky skeletons inside!
And yet...
And yet?

And yet, if we have a severe enough peanut allergy, we can be killed IN SECONDS by a single friggin' legume. And hey, 70% of our planet's surface is water, but what happens if we spend too much time in it? WE DROWN.
Game over!
Game over, man!
I used to make fun of Green Lantern for being vulnerable to the colour yellow! Then I choked on my orange juice one morning and nearly suffocated.
*sigh*

transcription.title: a question for people who are in fact friends with someone who says "major snorefest" lightly: how do you even manage it

panel.line: Last night I dreamt I was preparing to buy a boat, and by "preparing to" I mean "stressing out about the confusing but necessary paperwork in order to".
Major snorefest!
And I am not one to say "major snorefest" lightly, Dromiceiomimus!
It's one of the reasons we're friends!
Exactly! But it helped me realize: even when I'm dreaming of interesting things like zombies or sexin', it's still kinda disappointing.
Man, what's wrong with zombies and sexin'?
Folks have already imagined those things!!

I want to dream about things I CAN'T otherwise experience: new colours and impossible shapes and sounds my ears could never process! In dreams my brain is decoupled from my limited senses; why doesn't it get ON this?
Sounds like you should be taking this up with your brain, not with me!
FINE
T-Rex (thinking): Hey brain, this is me, the conscious part!
T-Rex (thinking): Listen
T-Rex (thinking): I would like more dreams in UHF please

panel.line: I have led my life believing that people who write down cuss words have bad things happen to them.

And I made some great friends and did some cool things. Eventually, one of these things I did was to write a book about them. And that brings us up to the present!
So! Now I'm writing my book and stepping on this tiny woman. I'm kinda hungry?
Oh God, live autobiography!
My friend Utahraptor is sassing this book I'm writing. He's really insulting ALL of us!
I'm not insulting anyone, I'm just not a fan of live autobio.
", he said.
I'm not really sure how I did that!!
I'm REALLY NOT SURE how that happened

transcription.title: occam's razor OF REVENGE is very simple, entities that allow revenge should not be multiplied beyond necessity

panel.line: For every action, there is an equal and opposite reaction.
That's Newton's third law o' motion!

And it means that when I slam into a wall and bounce off and hurt myself, I'm not sore because the wall is solid. I'm sore because the wall hits me - LITERALLY hits me! The wall DECIDES to hit me back with exactly as much force as I hit it with, and I'm the one who gets hurt!
The wall hit you, but "decide" is misleading! The wall didn't make any decisions.
Man, how do we know?!

We call it Newton's LAW because all matter in the Universe follows it. But maybe every atom of matter in the universe is imbued with JUST enough consciousness to decide to be a retaliatory dick every chance it gets!
That's magical thinking, T-Rex.
Utahraptor, I can live in a world of immutable scientific laws, or I can live in a world where I need to revenge myself on my kitchen floor because it smashed up a glass I dropped.
Wait, when I put it that way it sounds kinda dumb!!

transcription.title: DELETED PHRASE: "the company did not respond by press time": any phrase that can meaningfully be employed after I say "Hey, do you have any comments?" and the company says "Well, actuall- " and I say "Too late!!" is not one worth putting in your article;

panel.line: PHRASES THAT MEAN NOTHING COMICS
"INSPIRED BY A TRUE STORY"
Anything can be "inspired" by a true story! One day I pooped to the moon.
INSPIRED BY A TRUE STORY??
"AWARD-WINNING"

There are awards for everything awarded by everyone, and if you don't specify I'm going to assume you won the "Worse Than Hitler Award For Real Terribleness". Unless it's the Nobel or the Pulitzer I'm really not interested!
Hey T-Rex, want to try my Pultizer-prize winning clam chowder?
Yes! See? YES.
THAT'S the sort of dinner experience that gets people's attention. That is the sort of dinner experience you put on your resume!!
T-Rex " Utahraptor: Proudly!!
SOON:
This chowder is good, but now I'm uncomfortably remembering how they only give out Pulitzers for books and stuff. No chowders.
The story of how delicious this chowder IS is what won the award.
Of course!!

transcription.title: i keep reading "love safety" as "love safely", which is a euphemism for "having sex while using protection", where "protection" is a nested euphemism for a prophylactic that inhibits both pregnancy and sexually transmitted infections. so KEEP THAT IN MIN

panel.line: BIKING TIPS FOR TEENS
Teens! Do you love biking? Sure You Do!
You're a teen!!
But did you know that biking without a helmet can be dangerous? Actually biking with a helmet can be dangerous too. Biking, regardless of helmet status, can be dangerous.
Getting out of bed can be dangerous.
Getting out of bed can be dangerous, teens!!
Who are you talking to? There's - there's no teens here.
But there might be teens ABOUT here!
You know, teens walking by on their way to somewhere else.
Eavesdropping teens.
Yes! Eavesdropping teens who'll overhear our conversation and say "Holy smokes! I'd better learn to love safety!" and then, they go and learn to love safety.
Do they do it in the comfort of their own home? Do they do it in the "skate park"? Who knows?! They're teens!
Wow, when did you become an old man, T-Rex?
It is something I am experimenting with

transcription.title: okay, new question: let's say you can live inside any person in history

panel.line: Let's say you can live in any time period in history. Which period do you choose?
I choose the future!

Or at least, I did choose the future until I realized that things might not ACTUALLY be better down the road. If I lived 300 years from now, I could be living in a post apocalyptic time where most life has been obliterated by a catastrophic asteroid impact - an impact so large that enough dirt has been thrown into the sky to BLOCK OUT THE SUN, disrupting the entire food chain and causing mass extin-
Anyway, that's a possibility or whatever!!
So the past is the only safe choice.
Exactly!

But then I thought, well, there's a lot we don't know about the past either. And I wouldn't want to choose a time where it turns out nobody could make poop jokes or they'd go to jail and also nobody thought to write any of this down, so the whole deal is lost to history!
So - that leaves the present?
No, that leaves us with changing the question so we can live in any time period, real OR imagined. I choose the time when everyone's awesome knights!
...IN SPACE.
...ENCLOSED IN STARSHIPS SO WE DON'T DIE.

transcription.title: A green dinosaur discusses his love of external holiday illumination and learns about actions having consequences

panel.line: I used to be against people who left their Christmas lights up on their houses all year long. It was lazy, I said!
Like this:
That's LAZY!
But then I realized one of the things I most look forward to about December is going on walks at night and seeing everything lit up. And it would be rad if we did that all the time!
You don't think permanent lights are less special?
Sure, but I don't like them because they're SPECIAL. I like them because they're awesome!
Ah yes, the ineffable appeal of an plastic snowman punctuating a July lawn!
OKAY, some folks are tacky.
But some are totally rad! You know when the edge of a house is lined with lights, so from a distance it looks like a solid wireframe model?
Yep!
...I like those ones.
LATER: T-REX'S EXTRAVAGENT CHRISTMAS LIGHTS LEAD TO A LARGE ELECTRICITY BILL
I'm so tired of all my actions having consequences!
OH MY GOD, is there SERIOUSLY no room on this planet for a dude who loves actions but hates their consequences??

Impossible.

If I were you I'd be polite when they show up with a cake!

panel.line: I've been thinking... If my decisions are based on my desires, and my desires are just the product of phsysiological and environmental factors beyond my control,
then I have no control over the decisions I make!
See, if I am just the psychological product of my environment, then each action I take I could not have taken in any other way. I HAD NO CHOICE!
like squashing this cat.
Free will doesn't exist!
Isn't that just a bit too convenient?
What?

Well your theory fails to account for the fact that we obviously CAN make decisions, and that we do so constantly. Can you really tell me that you think the brain is nothing more than a complicated computer with delusions of grandeur?
YES!
And you're DRUNK!

transcription.title: leafy greens the way brother lifeisrandom intended

panel.line: Folks say things like "Apples are a delicious gift from Mother Nature", or talk about how we can use things in the way Mother Nature intended.
That's WEIRD, you guys!

We have this "Mother Nature" metaphor that we all share but rarely consider critically, and it has all these connotations that are sublimated into our lives and thinking! It suggests the planet tries to care for us as a mother would, sure, but it also suggests that plants and animals are provided by this mother with the intent of our nourishment, and that nature can carry parental authority!
I say we adopt some new metaphors, cats and kittens!!
Like what? "Father B. Planet"?
No, that's the worst name I've ever heard.
I was thinking more like Brother Entropy or Uncle Everybodydies! You know? "Apples are a delicious gift from Aunt Thestrongwilleattheweak."
"Let's restore the beach to the way Sister Therearediseasesyoucantevensee intended."
"Climate change hurts Cousin Theplanetwontnoticeifwealldietomorrow"!

transcription.title: MORRIS I LOVE YOU

panel.line: Morris: hey there t-rex, how are you doin'? it's me, morris
Morris the tiny bug, it's been a while! How are you?
Morris: oh i'm fine, t-rex, it's very nice of you to ask
Morris: only to tell you the truth i'm not all that fine because i've been under a lot of stress lately!
Stress?!

Morris: oh, gosh, yes, i didn't even think things could get so stressful, but then they did! like for example i'm worried about how i'm ever gonna make friends when i get older. when you're just a kid, you've got people in your classes to hang out with and the best part is, every year you've got new classes and that means a heck of a lot of new friends! but when you're an adult you've got a job instead of class, and people don't normally change jobs every year from what i've seen, so maybe i'm wrong but it seems like if your old friends move away and you're not friends with the folks at work, then it might be awful hard to make new friends!
Aww, Morris, that's nothing you have to worry about now!
Yeah, you won't have to deal with that until you're way older!
Morris: but doesn't it worry you fellas to have problems waiting for you like that?

Morris: if i have a problem, my parents and role models always tell me that it's best to face it head on, rather than ignoring it and hoping it'll get better all on its own! because sometimes, that doesn't happen, and then you've got an even bigger problem to deal with! and that's just the worst
Well, that's right, but if you ever find yourself in this situation, you can just join a club or a team and meet new people that way!

Morris: shucks utahraptor, that's awful good advice, but wouldn't you end up liking your free time but then feeling bad taht you have to spend the biggest part of your day with folks that aren't even your friends? and it really doesn't seem like you're allowed to ask how friendly folks are during a job interview
Morris, I guess sometimes your problems really ARE difficult!
Morris: oh gosh, t-rex
Morris: don't i know it

transcription.title: PLATONIC FORMS

panel.line: Plato was a philosopher guy who said perfect dudes don't exist. Rather, all dudes are the imperfect instantiations of the perfect ideal of dudes, the essential dude, intangible essence of dudeness!
Plato also said things like "I'm hungry guys, frig!" but we're not remembering him for that right now!
Ours is an imperfect world, and as such there's no perfect dudes in it. All the dudes we have are imperfect instances - copies, if you will- of the ideal dude, who is so great he can't even EXIST.
But what about if you and I have different ideas about what the perfect dude is?
It's just I'm - I'm pretty sure we do.
Plato really said this about... dudes?
Okay, NO, not technically.
He was actually talking about everything, but that includes dudes! I used dudes because it's an example EVERYONE can get behind.
Wouldn't circles be a better example? We can all imagine the perfect circle, but we can't draw one.
Um, computers can??
Those are pixelated if you look closely, T-Rex! And before you say "robots can", they still draw on some medium, and that's made of atoms.
And atoms are NATURE'S pixels! You just proved my case for me! Awesome!
Okay now, bring it back to dudes!!

transcription.title: bedbug sex is just part of the beauty of Mother Someanimalsengageinterribleawfulsexyouguys

panel.line: When a man and a woman love each other very much, they share a very special hug!
It's not always that special though, you guys!
TRAUMATIC INSEMINATION COMICS

Sometime in the past, male bedbugs realized that since they have an open circulatory system, if a female doesn't want to have sex with them they can just CRACK OPEN HER BODY and inject their sperm right into her chest, where it will eventually reach her ovaries! And now all males have these HYPODERMIC STAB WEINERS, and the women are left with fully-functional genital tracts that are only used when it's time to deposit the eggs!
The ladies evolved some countermeasures though, didn't they?
Yep! In the form of EXTRA GENITALS.
They've got this paragenitalia - paragenitalia! - on their chests that's this target for the guys, but which also limits their damage and lowers the chance of infection.
Wow.
Yeah, when people talk to me about intelligent design, I yell "BED BUGS HAVE INSTITUTIONALIZED STAB RAPES".
That - that normally ends the conversation right there

panel.line: Today I made peace with the possibility that I might never get wrapped up in a madcap case of mistaken identity.
I also made peace with the possibility that I might never have kids!

Then I made peace with the possibility that even if I HAD kids, they could grow up to be superduds. Then, I went on to make peace with the possibility that there might be somewhere out there who doesn't like Batman, and literally NOTHING can change their mind!
Today I made peace with the possibility that some people might enjoy being wrong.
Totally what I just said!!
Today I made peace with the possibility that -
Yes?
Well, today I made peace with the possibility that if I die tomorrow, people might not say "Such a tragedy; he had so much potential."

THE NEXT DAY:

transcription.title: seriously tempted to put out a whole line of these novels: "CLASSICS OF WESTERN LITERATURE: THE ODYSSEY, NOW TOLD AS IF IT WAS THIS REALLY LONG COMMERCIAL INTERRUPTING A TEENAGE MUTANT NINJA TURTLES CARTOON, AND AT THE END, THE TEENAGE MUTANT NINJA TURTLE

panel.line: What day is it? It's December now, isn't it?
It's DEFINITELY time for me to fix the great works of fiction!

The great out-of-copyright works of fiction, anyway. My brilliant idea is to completely recontextualize them through the magic of framing stories! So for example, instead of Moby Dick being about this guy after a whale, it's this CRAZY SCIENTIST writing whaler fan fiction, and at the end, the scientist stops and says "Sheesh, I didn't mean to write so much whaler fan fiction."
And Moby Dick takes place in the middle?
Exactly!

And Pride and Prejudice is still this fancy romance story, but now it's framed by this dude being asked to describe the ultimate video game, and at the end the dude says "Anyway after that it becomes a turned-based strategy game with a focus on resource management".
...Huh.

Hamlet ends as it normally does, but then the framing play starts up again and it's Hamlet's dad looking into a crystal ball, and he says "Forsooth, now let's see what would happen if I won the lottery!!"
It's SO GOOD, Utahraptor!

transcription.title: OH, ALSO, THE SENDER OF THIS CARD WANTS TO LICK YOUR TEETH CLEAN, EVEN IF THEY DENY IT, THEY TOTALLY DO

panel.line: Narrator [[written as title of the comic]]: "HEY. HEY. YOU HAVE SOMETHING STUCK BETWEEN YOUR TEETH"
Narrator [[written as title of the comic]]: a web card
Hey. Hey! You have something stuck between your teeth!
And the sender of THIS card clearly thought the best way to tell you was to go home, boot up their computer, and email you a web card.
T-Rex, we're in the future! People have PHONES that can send emails now.
Hah! EVEN WHEN THE EMAILS CONTAIN WEB CARDS??
Yep, even then.
R...really?
Yep! So it's not so unreasonable that someone would send this web card. If the other person also had a fancy phone, it would be a discreet way of letting them know!
Okay, wow! That's cool. I didn't know phones could do that!
Anyway! It's like - broccoli or something between your teeth? Maybe pesto? Anyway, it's all over the place.
It's -
It's like your gums were replaced with green peanut butter

transcription.title: anyway, i'll show myself out, professor!!

panel.line: ASK PROFESSOR SCIENCE
Today's letter from Professor Science comes from Alexis, who writes:
"Dear Professor, how much would it cost to buy the WHOLE DANG PLANET??"
Wow! I guess we need to know how much our planet is worth, then. I'm guessing... a kabazillion dollars?
What if we took the sum value of all the world's currencies? That'd tell us how much everything is worth, in total!
That works, right? Because money itself isn't worth anything, but we all PRETEND it's worth the value of the goods it's traded for, right?
Except that doesn't include oceans and stuff - things you can't buy!
TRUE.
Plus, buying the WHOLE DANG PLANET means buying everything on it, and that means we now have to put a price on LIFE ITSELF.
I always knew this day would come, Utahraptor. I - I just never thought it'd be soon.
Alright! Life itself is, what - like twenty bucks?
LATER:

Professor Science, we can SCIENTIFICALLY PROVE that people are wrong for getting mad at me for saying life is worth like twenty bucks? It grows in crusty milk, it is like the most free thing ever!! ... PROFESSOR ARE YOU EVEN HOME

transcription.title: guys i think i made myself sad for bacteria with the phrase "those tiny lives"

panel.line: You know what? We totally can put an exact price on life, down to the nearest cent.
In fact, we do it all the time!

Every time we land somewhere on the gradient between safety and expense, we do it. If a new ambulance costs $100,000 but would likely save at least 100 lives while it was in use, and we decide NOT to buy it, then we're saying those particular lives aren't worth $1000. Ouch! Sorry, ambulance dudes!
But maybe we don't have the money to buy an ambulance anyway!
Sure! It's not a perfect measurement.

All I'm saying is we ESTIMATE it all the time. Heck, you do it whenever you're paid hourly and you speed into work! Divide the extra money you get by being there sooner by the increase chance of death the added speed brings you, and you've just VALUED YOUR OWN LIFE.
...I - I guess so!
On the flip side, whenever housecleaners clean a bathroom, they're PAID to kill the bacteria there! So those tiny lives are worth negative dollars. And there's SO MANY bacteria, Utahraptor!
There are like a decazillion of them I am ALMOST certain

panel.line: Maslow says I can only maximize my full potential and achieve the highest state of being in one way: realization of self.

To which I will reply, "Look at yourselves! Who is the REAL monster, my friends?"
You are!
"Look at yo--
You're an enormous dinosaur with fangs and claws!

transcription.title: Congratulations to my friend Amanda McCoy, who just got her PhD! That's just excellent. I'm really happy to list Dr. McCoy among my friends, pretty sure I'll never call her by her first name again

panel.line: So, um, I spent a few days putting a price on LIFE ITSELF, and now I've got a dollar figure for my own life!
Kinda depressing, you guys!
Well, you can bolster it some, right? Like, you could add on the price each your organs would fetch on a black market. That'd raise it some!

THAT JUST MAKES IT MORE DEPRESSING! I don't want to be commodified, Dromiceiomimus. When people said "You can't put a price on life", they didn't mean it was an impossibility - they meant it in the permissive sense! They were trying to give me GOOD ADVICE.
Not a fan of your entire life reduced to a single number? Then don't do it!
Huh?

These prices are estimates anyway, dependant on so many assumptions. Even if someone's dead, you can't say for sure how much they're worth! How much was Newton worth? Or Shakespeare? Or some dude who fathered Shakespeare's great-great grandmother? Or some OTHER dude who was there, encouraging him to do it?
{{in italics}} ...Weird.

transcription.title: i am a very mature fellow whose interests include maturity and whose primary hobby is being extremely mature

panel.line: The greatest proof that time travel isn't possible is that we're not being visited by tourists from the future. I call this Sexy T-Rex's Argument Against Time Travel!
STEPHEN HAWKING SAID THAT ALREADY
...fine! FINE.

Stephen Hawking is a smart guy; it makes sense he'd get there first. However, did he ever say maybe time tourists are ALREADY walking among us, but they've disguised themselves so well that we've never noticed?
No, but Carl Sagan did.
...He WOULD.
Turns out greater minds than yours have thought about time travel already, huh?
Sure, but that's fine!
I'm PERFECTLY CONTENT if nobody ever talks about T-Rex's Argument Against Time Travel. It's the idea that's important, not who gets credit for it!
Really? That's very mature of you.
Thank you! I am an extremely mature gentleman, and I'm flattered you noticed.
LATER: T-REX VANDALIZES A BATHROOM WALL WITH THE WORDS "STEPHEN HAWKING AND CARL SAGAN, YOU BOTH HAVE UNWITTINGLY DONE ME A SMALL UNKINDNESS"
It's as forceful as I could get; I love those guys!!

transcription.title: not the ADJECTIVEST NOUNS in the VESSEL is my favourite analogy. there's so many words you can substitute in there, there's no reason to use the same one twice! it's just a perfectly excellent analogy, and i wanted to share.

panel.line: A bunch of us want to find meaning and purpose in our lives and the Universe. Unfortunately, the Universe itself is indifferent, uncaring and meaningless!
Absurdism comics
woooo

So! Since the Universe is TOTALLY MEANINGLESS, looking for any sort of meaning in life is absurd, and we're all sorta stuck. But lucky for us, the absurdist philosophers came up with three ways to resolve this! The - the first resolution is suicide.
I've said it before, but I'll say it again: the absurdists were not the cheeriest potatoes in the bag.
But if we don't want to kill ourselves, we can find religion, right?
Right!

Religion can give hope of a kind and caring world beyond our absurd one. But since they see reason as the greatest tool we've got and religion relies on faith, it's rejected by the absurdists as a (just as deadly!) PHILOSOPHICAL suicide.
So what's left?
What's left? Only to accept the absurd and try to find any meaning we can in our own personal journey from life to death!
Anyway, this is how come I'm so into vegetables that look like celebs.
