panel.line: If honeybabe made a mistake, I might say "Honeybabe, you made a mistake!"
Or maybe I'd say "Honeybabe, you blew it!"

Maybe I'd suggest our honeybabe in question blundered. Did she just slip up, or did she totally botch it? Maybe it was just an error? A miscalculation? An oversight? A FAILURE? The words we choose indicate how severe a mistake it was, but ALSO suggest various degrees of culpability, and most of us are pretty finely tuned to their nuances of meaning - even honeybabes!
This just in, English has a lot of words for a bunch of stuff! Film at 11?
It's got real applications!
We're getting closer to computers that can choose their own words, and this shows how sensitive these choices can be!
If you misspell a word, "You made a boo-boo" is fine, but if you press the wrong button and lazer 5000 dudes, that's probably not the mot juste?
Yep! And I'm glad you said "mot juste" and didn't just write it down as text, as I'd have read it as "mott just-ee".
Utahraptor [off-panel]: Well, that'd be my fault for changing languages in the middle of a sentence.
Indeed, no-one can be expected to keep up with that sort of tromperie

transcription.title: this comic started life as a "old web design elements: where are they now", but man, those horizontal bars that look like they're cutting through websites are clearly the best part and high water mark of that or any other possible design aesthetic

panel.line: WHERE ARE THEY NOW? CELEBRITIES FROM THE 80S:
Some are dead, most are still around! Some are happy, others are not so happy, but I'm sure they hope to be happy soon.
Best of luck, unhappy 80s celebrities!!
THOSE HORIZONTAL BARS ON OLD WEBSITES THAT LOOK LIKE A CIRCULAR SAW IS MOVING BACK AND FORTH TO CUT THE WEBPAGE IN HALF:
They're still working on cutting that page in half, God bless 'em.
Nobody tell them HTML doesn't work like that, okay??
THAT DINNER FROM A FEW MONTHS AGO:
Some of it probably got turned into your body!
Niiiice.
OKAY, ATOMS IN YOUR BODY THEN:
A better question is "where were they THEN?" and the answer is "Originally, the big bang, where all that makes you was blasted out of the same stuff that your enemies also came from."
"Also, every bit of current day poop came from there too; pretty gross."
EVERYONE FROM 200 YEARS AGO:
All passed away, leaving behind only things others thought were worth preserving, if any, and memories of themselves in the minds of their equally mortal friends.
This is depressing, let's talk about poo atoms again!

transcription.title: i locked myself out but my girlfriend came home, close call! the last time i locked myself out before that i kicked in the back door in, it was awesome and remains a treasured memory

panel.line: Lock: *click*
Aw dang!!
SOON:
Frig Dromiceiomimus, I locked myself out! My keys AND everything else I own is trapped in a housethat, thanks to my thoughlessness, I no longer have access to!!
You can hire a locksmith to cut the locks open.
HOW CAN I PROVE I'M ME? All my ID is inside the house!
Just show them a photo once you're inside!
Ridicilous!
That is a huge loophole that ANY NUMBER of evil twins could exploit!

AHHHHHH-
LATER:
HHHHHHHHPARENTLY YOU HAVE BEEN SUBSTITUTED FOR HIM
IS HOW I WOULD SUMMARIZE YOUR SENTENCE

transcription.title: if the "you have to solve a crime for every dollar you receive" clauses aren't going to be enforced, why bother making a will at all??

panel.line: You guys! I just wrote the best will. It's the best will!
DOES IT HAVE NIGHTS IN A HAUNTED HOUSE
It DOES!

And that's just where it starts. After my would-be heirs spend the night in the haunted house, which is clearly specified in my will to be ACTUALLY HAUNTED, they have to successfully navigate a series of dares and challenges - punching bears, eating chairs, that sort of thing - all designed to bring them together and underline a valuable life lesson: "MONEY ISN'T EVERYTHING". Then they get the money.
They'll just contest the will,T-Rex!
What's that?
They'll contest it, or everyone will agree to redact the bear slappy clauses. Happens all the time.
The HELL? This is my last chance to make people to do things for money, and you're saying they're not legally bound to do it?
Man!
Dying DOES suck!

transcription.title: oh, also it can't be something illegal. you're not allowed to rob a bank because a will told you to do it. "SOCIETY", am i right?

panel.line: Cats and kittens, chicks and dudes!! I was wrong!
You CAN force your heirs to punch a bear in your will!
If I make a CONDITIONAL bequest while of sound mind and body and possessing FULL TESTAMENTARY CAPACITY, a probate court is entirely likely to honour those clauses!
Conditional bequest?
Yeah, like "You must punch out a bear within three weeks of my death, or the diamonds go to some charity instead!"
Only, I don't actually write "some charity".
You name the charity.
Exactly!

Utahraptor, I'm SO EXCITED. I kinda want to become super rich now, because the more money I have the more AWESOME CLAUSES I can put into my will! "Sure, you can have some money now that I'm dead... IF YOU KISS FIFTY DUDES IN THE NEXT THREE MINUTES, GO GO GO!!!"
Hah!
Man! I take it back, dying is AWESOME.
Um, parts of it, I mean!
The parts where the dead bribe the living seem pretty rad is all I'm saying

transcription.title: my friend eric worked at a phone survey company, and he often had to ask the elderly to tell him what their favourite gaming console was, xbox or ps2, and they'd have no idea and be completely lost, and he'd say "so hey, xbox is pretty good", and then he

panel.line: Surveys are kinda baloney, you guys! They're kinda phoney baloney to the ultimate max.
And I'm not one to say things like that often!!

Say there's a survey about applesauce: like most dudes, I don't really have APPLESAUCE OPINIONS, so I'm probably not going to answer a whole survey about it! But if I were big into applesauce (or big AGAINST applesauce) I'd be way more into answering the survey. The result is that surveys overrepresent extreme viewpoints, because the only people completing surveys are those INTERESTED in doing so.
The apathetic ARE typically underrepresented in surveys.
Precisely, my friend!
Surveys get people with opinions, and the bored, and the lonely. But not the apathetic and the jerkasses! You know what jerkasses do when some stranger calls up and asks them questions?
Hang up the phone?
Utahraptor
{{in italics}} sometimes they curse first
Yep!
That's why they're jerkasses!

transcription.title: the cursed nutrinomicon

panel.line: I have noticed that eating different foods has different physiological effects on myself. There must be some 'balanced diet' that maximizes the agreeable effects of such nourishment!
With this in mind, I have created... the Nutrinomicon!
The Nutrinomicon divides foods into four different 'groups.' These 'groups' have prescribed allowances per day.
By following the nutritional regime of the Nutrinomicon, you can be assured of a fine diet!
Your "Nutrinomicon" is nothing more than a Food Guide, repackaged!
What?

All the major governments have published Food Guides, which do exactly what your Nutrinomicon purports to do: divide food into groups, and describe how much of each group is allowable for a balanced diet.
I have to admit, your name is cooler, though.
But - I stayed up all night working on the celebrated and unmentionable Nutrinomicon.
I even skipped dinner, which is ironic, because I was working on a guide to nutrition!

transcription.title: the phrase is also oddly named because it suggests the involvement, even though he didn't help, of our mutual friend bubba

panel.line: Time for me to invent a new emotion! THIS is the feeling you get when you've said the wrong thing to someone by accident, and it's awkward and you've both noticed it, but it's days later now and you're still thinking about it!
And there's nothing you can do without making things MORE awkward!
I propose we call this emotion: HUGGA BUBBA LOVE
woo
The name seems at odds with the emotion!
What?! How so?
Um, "love" is there and it's not actually about love at all?
It's not ROMANTIC love, Utahraptor, it's hugga bubba love, which I just defined as lingering awkwardness that has nothing to do with love at all!
And before you say "adjective phrases can't fully replace noun semantics", let me warn you: THIS ONE CAN.
Someone: T-Rex! STOP UNDERMINING ENGLISH
HUGGA BUBBA NEVER

transcription.title: by end of week all parts of speech will be replaced with "hugga bubba", right here at qwantz.com

panel.line: Okay, so maybe "hugga bubba" ISN'T the best adjective.
Maybe it is though!!

But just in case it isn't, I've invented a new way for it to be used! JUST LIKE THAT, BABY. Now "hugga bubba" is ALSO the new "um", the new "ah", and the new "er". Instead of saying "Um, I have no idea", we can say "Hugga bubba, I have no idea!"
"I think I had about, hugga bubba, five drinks last night"?
Exactly!
Oh man, I can't wait to hear how awesome EVERY CONVERSATION EVER will be now!
One problem!
How are you going to convince people to use it?
Man, it SELLS ITSELF! I, hugga bubba, don't understand why you're fighting this.
It just sounds like you're saying your name is "Hugga Bubba".
OH MY GOSH that's the best name EVER. Well, looks my afternoon just got filled up!
Assuming they've removed the 5-day waiting period on me changing my name, that is!!

transcription.title: A false document is when you refer to or quote books and stuff that don't exist in real life, but your whole story pretends like they do. Like when Star Wars reads his electricity bill!!

panel.line: A false document is when you refer to or quote books and stuff that don't exist in real life, but your whole story pretends like they actually do. Like when Shakespeare reads the dictionary!
LITERARY TECHNIQUE COMICS
today's technique: FALSE DOCUMENTS
That's not a false document, T-Rex! Shakespeare was a real guy, and dictionaries actually exist. It's more like if, I don't know, the Necronomicon was read by a Shakespeare CHARACTER.
Hah! Shakespeare's already QUITE the character, believe you me!!
...He's sullen to me sometimes
Except Shakespeare did most of his writing before dictionaries!
Oh man, really?

Yep! The earliest English dictionaries we've got showed up AFTER he started writing plays: it's one of the reasons he's had such an effect on the language. He was around while the written form was crystalizing!
So I was TOTALLY partially right! That's EXCELLENT.
MEANWHILE, IN TUDOR ENGLAND!
Shakespeare, if you spell "assume" differently, you'll stop future generations from making that stupid "ass out of u and me" joke!
Shakespeare: T-REX
Shakespeare: LISTEN
Shakespeare: i have like no context to understand any of this
{{Shakespeare is off panel and not seen}}

transcription.title: ATTENTION ALL CIVILIZATIONS ACROSS THE UNIVERSE: HAVE A SIMULATED GOOD TIME

panel.line: It's possible that one day, an advanced civilization (and not necessarily our own!) might be able to reasonably simulate an entire universe, or at least fake it for simulated people living inside.
And these simulated dudes wouldn't even know they're in a simulation!

And if a civilization can do this once, it's likely that they'd EVENTUALLY do it more than once. They could even reach a point where simulations are mass produced: billions of disposable toy realities used for experiments, research, or given to children during Future Christmas!
Sure, maybe in some hyper-advanced future!
Sure!

But if we assume that SOMEONE can reach this level, then what's more likely: that WE'RE the ones who develop this technology without actually being in a simulation ourselves, or that we're all stuck in one of the TRILLIONS of simulations being run AS WE SPEAK??
*gasp*
DINOSAUR COMICS WISHES YOU A HAPPY AND PROSPEROUS 2010

transcription.title: again, i should stress, adam and eve are dinosaurs here in t-rex's story. i think it's fair to assume than any dinosaur society would have some pretty awesome religious imagery

panel.line: In the Garden of Eden story, Adam and Eve eat an apple from the tree of knowledge and then they're kicked out of paradise and THE AMAZING ADVENTURE OF NOT LIVING IN A GARDEN BEGINS.
Not in my version, peeps!

In MY version, this isn't an allegory or anything. Instead, it's an ALTERNATE HISTORY where Adam and Eve decide not to eat the apple! The entire book of Genesis grinds to a halt at the point where Eve says "Dudes, turns out I'm NOT hungry!"
Then what happens?
THEN they cordon off the tree of knowledge to prevent any future mistakes, finally burying it in cement Chernobyl-style!
But where'd they get cement? That's a technology.
They invented it!
They've got nothing else to do there all day, so they invented cement.
So in your story, Adam and Eve hang out in paradise, alone, inventing cement.
YES. It is an amazing tale!
I call it "What If Early Abrahamic Religions Had Not Been Concerned With The Origin of Sin, But Instead Contained A Viable Recipe For Cement".
WHAT IF, Utahraptor??

transcription.title: I got a postcard from a reader in antarctica a few years back, it remains a treasured possession and i keep it on my fridge. there's penguins on it! (the postcard)

panel.line: If I can't be a bog person, I can be the next best thing!
ALIVE
Better!
A person frozen solid at the north pole!
Or the south pole, I'm not picky. But I want to be perfectly preserved in some cavern somewhere, so that when future generations stumble upon me, they'll say "Oh, gross. There's a dead guy in here."
"...It looks like he died being awesome though!"
So you're in some sort of awesome pose?
Exactly!
Maybe I'll be wearing a Superman outfit, and in my pocket will be a note that says "I actually WAS Superman, comics were documentaries about me, make sure to tell everyone okay??"
"I was vulnerable to the south pole though."
"Yeah, I just found that out."
CONCLUSION:
People who pay for cryonic freezing are super chumps! All you need to do is go to Antarctica, guys.
You can die there for FREE.

transcription.title: to compare, we humans have only done like 1/1250th of a galactic orbit since we first evolved: dinosaurs were around for a LONG WHILE. and yet, they never invented a single internet in all that time! sheesh!

panel.line: The earth's orbiting around the sun, but our sun is orbiting around the center of the friggin' galaxy!
At a speed of over eight hundred thousand kilometers an hour, no less!

But the galaxy is so big that each orbit takes 250 million years. So every second that passes, we're orbiting to a new part of space hundreds of kilometers away, where NO OTHER LIVING THING ON THE PLANET has ever been!
Well, not exactly. Life here is 4 billion years old, remember, so older forms of life have been here before. 16 times before, actually.
...TRUE.
But dinosaurs have only been around for like 160 million years!
Yes!
So, at best, WE'VE only done a little over half an orbit - so we are exploring the universes! We're going where no dinosaur has gone before!
Sure, I'll give you that. Why make such a big deal about this though?
Because Utahraptor, it means that today is the first time in history, in ALL OF EXISTENCE, that a dinosaur - me! - did anything from the exact location in the universe that we're at right now!
MEDALS FOR EVERYONE

transcription.title: filmic techniques comics

panel.line: FILMIC TECHNIQUES COMICS
Oh boy!
I believe I'll offer some advice on employing everyday filmic techniques!
To begin: when filming, you always want to say on one side of the action. This is because if you suddenly start filming from the OPPOSITE side of the action, it will appear to be reversed!
Observe:
Notice how I appear to be stomping in the opposite direction!
Amazing!
Have you covered the "flashback" yet?
No, please be my guest!
The flashback can be used to provide more detail about a character's motivation! For instance:
TWENTY YEARS AGO...
T-Rex's Mom: I told you, son: no stomping!
You're not the boss of me!

transcription.title: everyone's a winner

panel.line: When you spend your time talking to a T-Rex...
Everyone's a winner!
SOON:
Hello, Dromiceiomimus. Would you care to have a little chat, perhaps?
Gosh, I'm sorry - I was just on my way to the grocery store. Some other time, OK?
Oh, OK.
Well, that neither proves nor disproves my theory!
Which theory?
Today I've been operating under the assumption that when you talk to a T-Rex (such as myself, you understand) - everyone's a winner!
"A winner"? How do you mean?
Like, everybody is better for the experience? Geez, man! It's not that complicated a sentiment!

transcription.title: 't-rex, your house is on fire!'

panel.line: What's the deal with people who quote other people all the time?
PEOPLE WHO QUOTE OTHER PEOPLE ALL THE TIME COMICS
Anyway, I'd better get on with my day!
THE END
'T-REX, YOUR HOUSE IS ON FIRE!'
T-Rex, your house is on fire!
I know! I'm trying to collect on the insurance money!
T-Rex, you don't have any fire insurance!
Oh no!
LATER...
What the hell was he talking about? I've got the insurance papers right here!

transcription.title: joy comics

panel.line: JOY COMICS
"Joy"?!
Who uses the word "joy" anymore? "Happy", sure - but outside of a religious context, is anything described as "joyous" anymore? Besides weddings, I guess. And childbirths.
Maybe you're too old and cynical and embittered to believe in things like joy, T-Rex!

The reason the word seems odd to you is that it is completely untouched by popularity or irony! "Awesome" has lost all its power through overuse, but "joy" still means something! I think perhaps you are a bit embarrassed by the idea of joy! Maybe because you've never experienced it?
I have so experienced joy! I have so!
It was awesome!

transcription.title: The punch that can punch other punches

panel.line: Dromiceiomimus, come quick! I think I might be...
...A GENIUS!
Um, why do you think you're a genius, T-Rex?

A few reasons! The main one is I heard that genius is the ability to come up with concepts that would otherwise have to be taught, and I'VE TOTALLY DONE THAT. Remember? Remember Punchette, The Power Punch Bear?
Yeah you do! The bear with the punch...that punched other punches!
Anyone could have come up with that!
I respectfully disagree!
Anyone intelligent could have come up with a "power punch", sure, but imagining a bear that can punch other punches? That requires what can only be called..."super genius".
Wish fulfillment
What just happened

transcription.title: i wonder what life would be like if i were a lady

panel.line: I wonder what life would be like if I were a woman!
I wonder!
Hello Dromiceiomimus! Do you want to go shopping for women's underwear? We are after all both women!
That is true! I see no reason why we both couldn't go out and buy some women's underwear!
Nor do I!
LATER...
Are you doing anything tonight?
Why no - besides going out with a strapping young man such as yourself!
Excellent! Shall we say, nine-ish?
It's a date!
I'm glad I keep these little fantasies to myself!

transcription.title: sarcasm comics

panel.line: SARCASM COMICS
What if people can't tell when I'm being sarcastic?

This is a serious question! What if in the past, when I assume somebody has picked up on what I took to be obvious sarcasm, they took me at face value? Oh my God! The misunderstandings would be legion! This is a huge concern!
I may have unintentionally lied or alienated every one of my friends!
Again?
Utahraptor! Can you tell when I'm being sarcastic?
Well, I think so, but say something sarcastic now and I'll tell you what it sounds like.
Ok- just give me a second to think of something!
*ahem*
Oh no! I'm so worried! What if people can't tell when I'm being sarcastic?

transcription.title: a hurricane!

panel.line: I just found out that a hurricane is expected to hit this area!
More specifically, the area including my house!
A category one! We hardly ever get actual hurricanes here!
I am the EXCITED one.
In fact - more like category fun! This is going to be awesome!
Aren't you afraid?
Why? I'll be able to don a raincoat and hat, go outside in the storm and pretend to give pseudo-meteorological reports!
"Back to you, Utahraptor!"
That - that actually sounds like a lot of fun.
LATER...
My house!

transcription.title: destruction justified via science

panel.line: Today is a good day I think for taking control of my life! No longer will I allow myself to be pushed around (by random chance or otherwise)!
My old push-over self is extinct - now I'm a self-motivated dynamo!
Stupid log cabin in my way! Prepare to be returned to the ground! Entropy is always increasing!
You justify your destruction via science?
You shut up! Don't try to push me around!
You too are in my way, little woman!
No she's not! You're in her way!
What did you say?
I said, maybe you should stop being such a jerk!
Maybe you should stop being a jerk also!
Maybe THAT!

transcription.title: computational linguistics

panel.line: T-REX IN: COMPUTATIONAL LINGUISTICS
Computational linguistics is the study of computer-based language processing!
A major area of computational linguistics is that of "ambiguity resolution". It turns out that many things people say in a language - English, for example - can have more than one meaning!
Consider the phrase "fruit flies like a banana". Is it describing the taste of fruit flies, or rather flying fruit? How can a computer hope to figure this out?
Many have focused on statistical modelling of language, but this approach is approximate.
I agree!
What do YOU know about computational linguistics?
Ever read a little paper called "Non-Statistical Models for Unsupervised Prepositional Phrase Attachment"?
That was me!
It was some of my earliest work on head word tuples!
Shit man, you know more about this than I do!
You know what? You should be the one doing the talking here!

transcription.title: a wedding invitation

panel.line: I received an invitation via the post last night! A very exclusive invitation...
...to a wedding!
Who's getting married?
A friend of mine! She's getting married to a woman she met four years ago!
Wow!
Ooh! Ooh! Can I be your guest for the wedding?
Sure!
Awesome! I've never been to a wedding before, much less a lesbian wedding! This is exciting!
I know! We'll get to see them KISS!
That's not what I meant!
Whatever, man! I bet I won't be the only one taking a picture!

transcription.title: at the wedding

panel.line: AT THE WEDDING
Being at my first wedding is exciting, but also makes me nervous!
Dromiceiomimus! What are YOU doing here?
It turns out MY sister knows your friend's bride! Small world!
Yeah, small world!
T-Rex! The wedding is about to start!
Oh man! How do I look?
Great! Great! How do I look?
Supoib!
Then let's go! I'll meet you in the third row!
Wait up!

transcription.title: at the reception

panel.line: AT THE RECEPTION:
Well, the wedding went off without a hitch!
Ha ha, not counting the slang meaning of 'hitch' of course!
What did you think of the wedding, Dromiceiomimus?
I promised myself I wouldn't cry, but I cried! It was a beautiful wedding. Are you going to see the brides?
I'm on my way there now!
I will congratulate them on finding happiness!
What are you talking about?
The brides are gone, T-Rex! Remember when they ran down the church stairs while we showered confetti on them? They've left for their honeymoon!
Oh yeah! But there's still cake for us, right?
Right!
I love lesbian weddings!

transcription.title: i didn't know he could read!

panel.line: This marriage has gotten me thinking about monogamy.
I did some research!
I found a book called "The Ethical Slut"!

Basically it gives advice for having loving polygamous relationships. A lot of it makes sense! Like say your girlfriend has a best friend, and they go out one night. You're happy for her, right? You love her, you want her to be happy. So why should that change when you add sex to it? The book also posits that an artificial 'economy of scarcity' in sex leads to jealousy and possessiveness.
You're saying that because sex is 'rare', it has increased value, and is therefore treasured unreasonably?
Yeah!
That's what the book says, anyway. It's not anti-monogamy, but it is pro-polygamy.
But don't you find that these things don't work in real life? I know I want my partner to be happy, but I also want all of his or her kisses.
Artificial economy of scarcity, my friend! Like diamonds!
Why are you so interested in this, anyway?
Who knows!

transcription.title: that's the coolest

panel.line: COMICS WITH EMBEDDED FASHION ADVICE
PART ONE
Man, did you see what that Triceratops was wearing at the film last night?
Yeah, he has really bad fashion sense!
You said it!
Did you see him last weekend?
No, what was he wearing?
Well, let's just say that a lime green t-shirt coupled with electric blue shorts is not exactly the most stylish of outfits.
W-
What's wrong with that?
That's the coolest!

transcription.title: dinosnore comics

panel.line: Paleontology Phunnies Dept. Once in a long while we come across a comic strip that is so mind-bogglingly bad, we can't help but wonder why it isn't already extinct! It's time for a MAD look at... DINOSNORE COMICS
T-Blech: It's a good thing I've come up with some things to talk about today! Otherwise, I could lose my job!
T-Blech: Hello Dromiceiolongname! People call me the T-Blech!
Dromiceiolongname: Because you're the king of dinosaurs?
T-Blech: No! Because I have such bad breath! How could I ever brush my teeth with these tiny arms?
Utahrapper: Yo yo, T-Blech! Can you help me and my home dinoz stomp out all the humans? If they don't die out soon, we'll lose the survival competition to these upstart primates, dawg!
T-Blech: I'm already on it, Utahrapper! I've been stomping on humans and their houses for months now! Haven't you noticed their population getting smaller?
Utahrapper: Yo, I thought I was just getting bigger!
T-Blech: That is an interesting philosophical point! Is everything relative?
Utahrapper: Forget it, T-Blech! We've philosophized instead of taking action, and now the humans have won! We'll all be extinct by tomorrow!
T-Blech: Oh well! For some reason I feel as if the world would be better off without us! I only have one fear, Utahrapper: that the humans might one day invent reality television!

transcription.title: things i've read on the internet comics (mild anti-vegetarian sentiment)

panel.line: THINGS I'VE READ ON THE INTERNET COMICS
also featuring: mild anti-vegetarian sentiment
I once read how to make bombs!
I once learned how to hypnotize anyone!
I once read how to make a really good salad!
That's it? The whole Internet and you look up salads?

Is it meat salad?
Because if not then I doubt it would be a very good salad!

transcription.title: thanksgiving day comics

panel.line: Today is Thanksgiving Day!
THANKSGIVING DAY COMICS
I'm excited! I always look forward to all the food you get to eat during Thanksgiving!
My favourite is mashed potatoes! I've left extra room in my stomach for mashed potatoes!
But, T-Rex, Thanksgiving was-
Sorry to interrupt, but I must be on my way! I'm having dinner with the Utahraptor!
T-Rex, where the hell were you?
Huh? What do you mean?
I cooked all day and you didn't even show up!
But - that dinner's tonight!
No! You always have the big meal the night BEFORE Thanksgiving Day!
You missed out!
Aww boo!
This time, I've disappointed even myself!

transcription.title: the white lie that spiraled, out of control!

panel.line: T-REX IN: "THE WHITE LIE THAT SPIRALED OUT OF CONTROL"
I stayed at home last night and watched a movie!
But as not to appear nerdy, I told everyone that I went out "clubbing"!
PRESENTLY:
How was the club, T-Rex?
It was great! I had a great time dancing with, uh, three different women!
Three women?
Yeah, at once! It was awesome! I have pictures!
Wow! Can I see your pictures?
Sure! I'll make enlargements for everyone!
Great!
And David Suzuki was there too! I boogied with him!
Awesome!
Wow T-Rex, I can't wait to see those incredible pictures!

NEXT: HIJINKS

transcription.title: relationships take time and effort

panel.line: Man... after what happened yesterday, I guess there is a certain tension between myself and the Utahraptor. Well, I'm going to make sure that tension ends...
... right now!
Hey, do you know how I could stop the Utahraptor from not being friends with me?
Dromiceiomimus- Maybe if you stopped stomping on things - that seems to annoy him more than anything else.
Forget it! Stomping is who I am!
<<S T O M P>> [[T-Rex stomps the house]]
I will have to find another way to win his friendship!
You're talking about me again?
Look, I appreciate the sentiment, but you've got to stop trying so hard. It's just got to happen, naturally, over time.
Relationships take time and effort. They can't happen overnight.
HEY!
That's not what your Mom said!
Last night!
When we had SEX!

a comic

Perhaps!

transcription.title: post hoc ergo propter hoc

panel.line: Well, that's another house gone. I seem to be going through houses like other people go through -
um
- some manner of disposable goods!
Do you think this might be the result of all the bad house-related karma you've earned by stomping on other people's houses every day?
I don't believe in karma!
So: "Probably not!"
You have to admit you've got through a lot of houses lately!
So?
That doesn't imply that there's some cosmic judge keeping score of my actions. You're making a logical fallacy, namely "after which, therefore becasue of".
That's not a logical fallacy.
Yes it is.
Really?
Yep!

transcription.title: i'm going to solve mysteries!

THAT EVENING...
Wow... Grandfather sure knows how to throw a party!

Last year I was a bear!
That was not so awesome.
Working on costume ideas, I see!

Oh yeah? What are you dressing up as?
I haven't decided yet! I might go for a CONCEPT.

panel.line: I need to have the best costume ever this Hallowe'en!

Lame.
A puppy?
Lame!
I know! I'll go as a robot!
A robot?!
What's cooler than a robotic T-Rex?
THE. EVALUATION. OF. THAT. STATEMENT. RESULTS. IN. A. NULL. OUTPUT. SET

NEW. PROGRAM. ENGAGED: 10 IGNORE WHAT UTAHRAPTOR SAYS 20 UTAHRAPTOR IS LAME 30 GOTO 10

transcription.title: the t-rex costume

panel.line: Maybe I'll dress up for Hallowe'en as a Utahraptor!
That's a great idea!
Then I'll be able to walk up to his friends and insult them! They'll think it's he who is the one who is insulting them! I could wear this costume ALL THE TIME.
Then it's decided! I will be a Utahraptor for Hallowe'en.

First off, dressing up as a member of a RACE for Hallowe'en is insanely racist. Second of all, you don't have the skill necessary to pull it off!
I'll show you!

HALLOWE'EN:
(actually the Utahraptor) [[arrow pointing at Utahraptor disguised as T-Rex]]

Off-Camera Person: Ooh! What a scary costume!

transcription.title: i don't like where this one is going

panel.line: Man, I totally blew it yesterday with the Utahraptor. Why did I make a joke about his mom?
Why oh why did I make a joke about his mom?
Hey, I need some more advice. How can I apologise to the Utahraptor for saying that I had sex with his mom last night?
You didn't.
Yeah... I kinda shouted it after him.
Three times.
Man. Well, here's what you have to do...
Don't you take a day off? Quit stomping on things!
now's my chance!
Uh - well, what I want to say is that I'm sorry I said I had sex with your Mom last night. I actually didn't have sex with anyone last night.
Or ever, for that matter.
WHAT?
What about us?!
I can't help it if I can't remember it!
And I can't help it if you are a stupid dinosaur! I wish I never met you!
oh, give me a BREAK!

transcription.title: the difference between what is transmitted and what is received

panel.line: I just realized that if I transformed what people say to me into something I want to hear, I will only hear things that appeal to me!
Genius!
I should have thought of this years ago!
THE DIFFERENCE BETWEEN WHAT IS TRANSMITTED AND WHAT IS RECEIVED an allegorical comic and comic allegory
Hello, Dromiceiomimus!
Hello, T-Rex!
Why yes, I am super-sexy today!
T-Rex, stop it! You can't just go around putting words in people's mouths!
Says you!

Where there is lexical or syntactic ambiguity, you could argue that you are free to choose a preferred meaning - granted - but you cannot arbitrarily transform someone's words into what you want! That process undermines the very foundation of language, as words are robbed of any fixed meaning, rendering communication arbitrary and pointless!
That will be my epitaph, then!
"Here lies T-Rex, who undermined the very foundation of language"!
Awesome!

transcription.title: delightfully sexy double entendres

panel.line: I have been thinking about what the Utahraptor said yesterday, and by extension the ambiguity allowable in language!
Take the Bible, for instance!
There's a text passed down for hundreds of generations, translated, re-written, re-edited.
Even if you don't assume that it's the word of God, the difference in meaning between what was written THEN and what you read NOW must be staggering!
It's often said that the only way to be immortal is through your words and ideas!
I agree!
But the Bible shows us that language is mutable! So what's the solution? How can I ensure that the ideas I have in my head when I communicate are the same as those you get in yours when you hear me?
I propose a rigorously defined language without syntactic or lexical ambiguity!
But how would we write puns in such a language?
Eh?
Or delightfully sexy double entendres?

transcription.title: fables told in such a way at to appeal to the greed of the reader

panel.line: FABLES TOLD IN SUCH A WAY AS TO APPEAL TO THE GREED OF THE READER IN AN ATTEMPT TO GET HIM OR HER TO ACT MORE MORALISTICALLY COMICS
Once upon a time:
Everything I have is mine, and mine alone!
If other people want to use what's mine, they will have to get their own.
There's only enough for me!
Sorry!
The very next day:
I just won the lottery!
What?!
Yep! It was on a SHARED lottery ticket that I SHARED with a friend of mine! Remember? The one you didn't want to SHARE with us because you wanted to buy your own?
Now my friend and I are richer! We have more money!
MORAL:
I should have been more willing to share!
(IMPLICATION: "Then I'd have more money!")

transcription.title: how to meet new people

panel.line: HOW TO MEET NEW PEOPLE
Meeting new people can be fun!
It can be tiring if you are meeting a lot of new people at once, however. Here are some tips on how to meet lots of people at once:
"#8226; Wear something that will identify you and make you easy-to-remember! I recommend a "crazy" scarf or a large disfiguring scar.
Listen attentively to people's names when you meet them! If their name is the same as yours, laugh!
I've got one!

Try to remember interesting stories about yourself. Having such stories close at hand allows you both to fill in awkward gaps in conversation, and also acts to give people a quick, hopefully representative picture of yourself!
Like when I lost someone's baby!

transcription.title: polygamy at home, a six-part miniseries

panel.line: So...
Polygamy!
I've discovered that the problem with researching this sort of thing (polygamy) (the subject of which I am speaking) is that everybody has an agenda!
It's like vegetarianism: all you hear is from the militant extremes ("Meat is Murder!" "Vegetarians are Sissies") and it's hard to find a balanced viewpoint!
Have you tried reading multiple sources and, then synthesizing your own viewpoint?
You are reading about polygamy, after all.
You know "more than one partner" ... "more than one book" ...
Polygamy!
Polygamous READING? What's next?
Eh?
"What's next?"

It was awesome!

That poem was so BAD!
How could you make something so crappy?!
Okay! It was just a poem! I'm not married to it!

transcription.title: recipe comics

panel.line: RECIPE COMICS
today's recipe:
CHICK PEAS IN COCONUT MILK
CUT AND SAVE!
Tonight is a good night I think for having Chick Peas in Coconut Milk for dinner!
I believe I will combine in a saucepan 2 cups of canned chickpeas, drained; 1 tomato, chopped; 4 whole cloves; 2-3 cloves of garlic, minced; and 1 1/2 cups coconut milk!
But aren't you forget about 1 1/2 teaspoons of turmeric and about a half a teaspoon of salt?
Indeed I am! The turmeric gives the dish its distinctive yellow colour.
Then you bring it all to a boil, reduce heat and let it simer for 20 minutes!
How did you know?
I make this dish all the time! It's great when served over rice, and feeds 2-3 people!
It does, indeed, old friend!
Any final comments, T-Rex?
Only that if you want the food to be less watery, let it simmer longer - for up to 30 minutes!

transcription.title: sexual double standards

panel.line: I think it's time for me to get out and meet some fine new ladies!
Fine new SEXY ladies!
Any fine new sexy ladies, please identify yourselves to me!
I will be pleased to seduce you after introductions have been made!
I am the strapping young T-Rex stomping on things!
You can't honestly expect to get results by walking around shouting for "fine new sexy ladies"!
Says you! If a woman was walking around shouting for fine new sexy dudes, she'd be chased by men from all over!
Hmm...that's true.
Alright, continue shouting! I wouldn't want to support a sexual DOUBLE STANDARD.
HOURS LATER...
I don't get it! Why isn't this working?!
(Is it me?)

transcription.title: compressed origin story comics - batman

panel.line: COMPRESSED ORIGIN STORY COMICS
Today's origin story: BATMAN
Well, I'm perfectly content!
I may be a bit idle, a bit unfocused, but at least I haven't had a night where all sense left my life! That's for darn sure! Incidentally, criminals are a superstitious, cowardly lot!
Want to go to the cinema, son? "The Mark of Zorro" is playing!
Oh boy!
Can you get mom to wear her pearl necklace?
The one that symbolizes our family: each precious family member connected to the other? The necklace which, if one pearl is removed, is shattered forever? Sure, I don't see why not!
LATER:
My parents!

transcription.title: compressed origin story comics - superman

panel.line: COMPRESSED ORIGIN STORY COMICS
Today's origin story: SUPERMAN
I am the last son of the doomed planet of Krypton!
Found, adopted and raised by the kindly Kent couple, who could not have a child of their own, I was taught about Truth, Justice and the American Way!
As I grew, I found that I could run faster than a speeding bullet! I was more powerful than a locomotive! I was able to leap tall buildings in a single bound (as so)!
In times of trouble, I am there, as SUPERMAN!
Clark?
No, I'm Superman! Clark Kent and I are two different people!
Oh - ha ha! For a second there, you looked like him, only without the glasses!
Ha ha ha!
Anyway, I'll tell him you said "hi"!

transcription.title: a rare pleasure indeed

panel.line: With that Utahraptor out of the way I feel better! A rare pleasure indeed, to have your problems put behind you and the future full of promise!
Imagine if that Utahraptor slipped in the shower?
He'd certainly wish he'd stomped the soap out of the way (much as I now stomp this little house) as he passed on!
Perhaps in his last moments, the irony of the situation - from my perspective - would become evident.
Yes, I will freely enjoy stomping more now that he is gone!
Stop!
You?
You have retreated too far into the realm of fantasy and have forgotten that I did not in fact expire in the shower!
I must guard against such self-absorption in the future!
I GUESS THERE IS A LESSON HERE FOR US ALL!

transcription.title: two weeks later...

panel.line: TWO WEEKS LATER...
After all the crazy adventures in sexy exciting locales we've had over the past two weeks, it seems that the Utahraptor and I are friends again!
It's been a memorable two weeks indeed!
Do you recall a few days ago, when we had that hilarious conversation?
I thought I would die laughing!
It was good times!
So many memories of the past two weeks...
Hey, good buddy!
How are you?
Great! AND, I finally thought of the perfect answer to the question you asked me, two week ago!
Oh?
"No"!
[thinking] Genius!

transcription.title: compressed origin story comics - green lantern

panel.line: COMPRESSED ORIGIN STORY COMICS
Today's origin story: GREEN LANTERN
"Green Lantern"?!
I'll be honest, I haven't read any Green Lantern comics. He's got that power ring, right? And he can make giant green fists with it? And robot suits? Can he make robot suits sometimes?
Anyway, um - one day Green Lantern found a power ring!
It doesn't work on yellow, right?
Yeah! Yeah, that's right! It doesn't work on yellow.
That's pretty weak.
No argument here.
COMPRESSED ORIGIN STORY COMICS
Today's origin story: GREEN LANTERN
One day Green Lantern found a power ring and used it to fight crime that wasn't yellow!

transcription.title: compressed origin story comics - "balls to the wall"

panel.line: COMPRESSED ORIGIN STORY COMICS
Today's origin story: THE PHRASE "BALLS TO THE WALL"
Many people assume the origin of this phrase has to do with testicles!
In fact, it's quite the opposite. The phrase originated with pilots of fighter planes!
The "balls" in question referred to the knobs on top of the plane's throttle control. When the throttle was at full, the "balls" would be "to the wall" of the cockpit!
And that's the origin of the phrase "balls to the wall".
You are incorrect! The phrase comes from olde-fashioned steam-powered trains!
What?

It's true! Basically, the engines had two weighted balls, attached to a vertical shaft that was connected to the engine. As the engine speed increased, these two balls would be raised higher because of centrifugal force! At top speed, they would be parallel to the ground, nearly touching the "walls" of the shaft!
Hence, "balls to the wall"! Man!
That's sweet!

transcription.title: compressed origin story comics - your sense of disenchantment

panel.line: COMPRESSED ORIGIN STORY COMICS
Today's origin story: YOUR SENSE OF DISENCHANTMENT
Your sense of disenchantment comes from a realization that the world is not as you believed!
People lie and get away with it. Murders go unsolved! There are people who only interact with you because they think it might be profitable for them.
You were raised on fairy tales, where there were no moral grey areas, where good and bad were clear, where there was never any real doubt over which side would win in the end!
Each lurid death reported in the paper akes you a little more cynical: a little more dead inside.
Wait!

What if this sense of disenchantment came not from a flawed world, but rather a growing realization that they themselves are flawed? Nothing's more depressing than realizing that you can't live up to your hopes, that you'll never live out your dreams, that you probably let those you care about down, everyday!
Holy!
Why don't you tell me what you really think?

transcription.title: It was crazy!

panel.line: I had the strangest dream last night...
It was crazy!
Or at least, I think it was crazy. I don't remember much of the dream: all I remember is waking up and thinking, "Wow, what a crazy dream!"
I wonder what could have happened?
Oh well!
That's it? That's all you have to say?
What? It's all I remember!
Well, there's not really much for us to talk about, is there? You had a dream that may have been crazy, but you don't remember it.
Whoo! Let's get this conversation started!
Well, what are YOU doing here, if we have nothing to talk about?
Yeah, that's what I thought!

transcription.title: the horse raced past the barn fell

panel.line: "Garden path" sentences are those that trick you into thinking that they will mean one thing, but then as you read more of the sentence, that meaning is shown to be false!
For instance: "The horse raced past the barn fell"!
Why, that sentence is senseless!
Aha, my friend, so it would seem! But it actually refers to a horse, which at some point in the past was raced past a barn, and now that same horse has fallen over!
That sentence is stupid!
What are you saying?
What I'm SAYING is that nobody would ever say that. They'd say, "The horse that I raced past the barn has now fallen over"!
Well, they could, but they could ALSO say my sentence!
Only if they were incurably insane! Do horses even fall over?
Sure man, all the time!
Farmer's call them nature's dominoes!

transcription.title: happiness comics

panel.line: HAPPINESS COMICS
Many philosophical systems seem predicated on increasing your happiness, either of yourself, or more globally!
I wonder, is happiness such a valid goal?

Furthermore, if I had a machine that I could press a button on, and it would make me happy - perfectly content, indistinguishable from the real emotion - would I do anything but press the button all day long?
It's hard to say!
Aren't you describing an addiction to drugs? Something that makes you artificially happy?
um
Yeah, I guess you could see it that way.
I guess
[[T-Rex thinking]]
Hmm!

transcription.title: american thanksgiving

panel.line: Seeing as i missed Thanksgiving last month, I am celebrating a new holiday today, one which I just invented! I call it, "American Thanksgiving"!
AMERICAN THANKSGIVING COMICS
(similar, but distinct, from regular Thanksgiving)
Dromiceiomimus, would you like to come over tonight for a big "American Thanksgiving" dinner?
Sure! I'll bake a delicious pumpkin pie for dessert!
Excellent!
What's the deal with this "American Thanksgiving" holiday you invented, T-Rex?
Well!
It's a time for us to reflect on all the great things we have, such as food and shelter! You spend an evening with friends and family. Want to come over for American Thanksgiving?
Sounds great! I'll bring some of my famous pumpkin pie!
You can never have too much pie!
CONCLUSION:
American Thanksgiving is similar, but distinct, from regular Thanksgiving.

transcription.title: comics with long contextualizing titles

panel.line: COMICS
IN WHICH A POINT IS EFFECTIVELY PROVEN BY ANALOGY
BUT ALSO
COMICS IN WHICH THE READER LACKS SUFFICIENT CONTEXT BY WHICH TO MAKE THE POINT CLEAR TO HIS OR HER SELF.
Well look at it this way, T-Rex! What's more important in a song: the words or the music?
Um - well, they're both important. It's not a song without music, but for most songs, the words are important too.
See my point?
hmm...
Oh yeah!

transcription.title: nostalgia for the present

panel.line: Suddenly I feel as if my future is full of new choices, new directions!
My choices are mine to decide!
But yet, I feel troubled. If I make some change in my life, what of those I leave behind?
I am happy here, but I know I won't be happy if I stay here forever. Leaving becomes a bitter-sweet necessity.
If only there were some way that I could come back to now... some way I could save this world to peek in once in a while.
Why so glum?
I was just thinking how, if I were to leave, that would change many things.
Nostalgia for the present?
Yeah, I guess so.
I'd be careful with that, T-Rex... nostalgia can be a powerful drug!
I'm high right now!

transcription.title: pirates!

panel.line: I wonder, what's the best thing that could happen to me today?
Maybe I could win the lottery!
Or maybe when I stomp on this house, it will crack open to reveal treasure! Gold doubloons!
PIRATE'S doubloons!
How come all your fantasies involve you becoming fantastically rich?
Not true!
My fantasies also involved pirates.
You know, pirates weren't the romantic figures you think they were. They raped, murdered and ruined lives! Just because they had (admittedly) awesome ships doesn't make them good role models!
Debateable!

transcription.title: compressed film comics II

panel.line: COMPRESSED FILM COMICS
TODAY'S FILM:
BACK TO THE FUTURE
Awesome! I get to be Marty!
"This is heavy"!
First things's first! We have to travel back in time to 1955!
Saturday, November 5th, 1955
That was easy!
Ok, I've got to make sure my parents meet, otherwise I'll be erased... from existence!
But the Delorean needs power for the flux capacitor: 1.21 jigawatts worth!
Oh no! Am I to be trapped in the 50s forever?
My only hope is to get them to kiss at the "Enchantment Under the Sea" dance!
Hey, butthead!
Why don't you make like a tree, and get out of here?
I will, assuming lightning strikes the clock tower at exactly 10:04 p.m.!
I made it back to good old 1985. But now Doc is back - back FROM the future! And he's talking about my kids!
Something's got to be done about my kids!
[in Back to the Future font] TO BE CONTINUED

transcription.title: i never knew my father

panel.line: PERSONAL REVELATION COMICS
Forget it! I'm sick of everybody acting like they know what's best for me!
From no on, I'm doing what I feel like, when I feel like doing it!

And today, I feel like stomping on a house full of people I don't know, and then I think I feel like finding a loose woman and running off to some tropical country without an extradition treaty, where I will set up a home where we can live comfortably, and there I'll have sex with this woman!
So there!
How can you act like this!?
What are you talking about?
Well, it just seems that this kind of activity isn't how your parents raised you to behave!
What would your father say?
I never -
I never knew my father!

transcription.title: shakespeare punchlinez

panel.line: I have thought of the perfect prank to play on the Utahraptor! I will confide in him personal stories about my youth...
... stories that, it turns out, are false!
That way, years down the road if he ever chances to mention one of these stories, I will be able to say, "Got you!"

He'll say, "What?", obviously confused since my prank was years in the making. But once i explain that I was in fact LYING to him when he though he had my trust, he will laugh heartily and concede that I did indeed "get him"!
Hi, T-Rex! Do you have any personal stories of your youth you'd like to confide in me?
I do!
These stories wouldn't happen to be FAKE stories, would they?
um
T-Rex! Were you going to tell me fake stories?
You were!
Hoisted by my own petard!

transcription.title: i'll kick his ass!

panel.line: Brrr... it's getting cold out!
This means that winter is coming!
Luckily, as a warm-blooded being, this cold weather means little to me!
That's a matter of some debate!
Oh?
Yes, some would argue that you are in fact a cold-blooded being!
Who'd say that?
Um - you know... people!
Who?
Just this guy I know, alright?
I'll kick his ass!

transcription.title: paid by the 'awesome'

panel.line: I have been thinking, and I have come to the conclusion that it would be pretty sweet to be called as a witness in some sort of murder trial!
Pretty sweet indeed, my friends! Pretty sweet indeed!
Why do you think it would be so great to be called as a witness in a murder trial? Do you want to have witnessed a murder?
Not hardly! But I do want to be able to testify under oath, that I, T-Rex, am an AWESOME DUDE. It will go in the official court record! It will probably be reported in the papers!
Yeah, it will probably cause a mistrial!
What? No!
Yes! They'll say, "Objection! Witness is causing a mistrial!"
No they won't!
"Additionally, witness is clearly not an awesome dude, as awesome dudes need not point out their own awesomeness!"
But wouldn't it be SO AWESOME to discuss your own awesomeness in open court, that it would be a special case?
I would argue, "yes"!

transcription.title: talking dinosaurs discuss objectivism

panel.line: OBJECTIVISM COMICS
Everyone (including me) is an end in himself: not a means to an end for others!

This means I should exist for my own sake, neither sacrificing myself to others, nor sacrificing others to myself! The pursuit of my own rational self interest, and happiness, is the highest moral purpose of my life!
If I must deal with others, it should be as TRADERS, in a pure capitalist system. No charity! No sympathy! Just business, an exchange of value for value.
But where does love fit into this system of Objectivism, T-Rex?
What do you mean?
Well if everything is viewed as a business arrangement between traders without charity, then how can you have love? Love is selfless.
Nope! Love is selfISH. You see value in someone, and they see value in you! You want access to this value, so you arrange a spiritual exchange.
Hey, that rhymes!

transcription.title: the middle ground

panel.line: LOGICAL FALLACY COMICS PRESENTS:
"THE MIDDLE GROUND"
This fallacy is when you assume that since a position is between two extremes, it must be right!
It seems to occur because often, this IS the case. For instance, eating a moderate amount of food is better than eating to excess, or eating not at all.
However, just because a case is between two extremes does not make it automatically correct! It must be JUSTIFIED.
Well, what's an example where the middle ground is not correct?
Easy!

Say you think I should go on a trip around the world, while I assure you that I can't afford it and that I should stay home. From that, we would conclude that I should go on a trip exactly half-way around the world, where I'd probably run out of money and get stuck!
Sounds good to me!
Luckily, we have arrived to that conclusion via a fallacy so I will be making no such trip!

transcription.title: the lady at the supermarket

panel.line: I was asked by a friend of mine how he could tell his sweetheart that he loves her in a new, exciting way! He's worried that he's said the same old thing too often, and that it's getting stale.
I assured him that there are infinitely-many ways to say "I love you"!
For instance, you could say "I love you", but you could also say "I really love you"! Or, for that matter: "I really really love you!"
Therefore, since you can have an arbitrary number of 'really's, there are an infinite number of ways to say "I love you".
That's not very helpful, is it? You're just adding the same adverb over and over again!
So?
So, no woman would sit around while you said "really really really really" for two hours. Anyway, after the third 'really' you move from "emphatic" to "damn creepy"!
Well that explains why that woman at the supermarket never replied to my letters!
Also they were anonymous!

transcription.title: story of my life

panel.line: Last night it occured to me that an evening at the theatre would be a delightful distraction!
However, when I arrived, they were out of tickets!
"THE STORY OF MY LIFE"
It's the story of my life!
What does that mean, "story of my life"?
It means that that one incident is indicative of a larger trend in my life.
What larger trend are you possibly talking about? The trend of theatres being full?
Yes!
But in a METAPHORICAL sense.
A metaphorical sense. What metaphor would that be, exactly?
You know! Theatres! Full! No tickets!
I'm sorry, T-Rex, I really don't follow.
You were THERE!

transcription.title: one page from 'on the origin of species'

panel.line: DINOSAUR COMICS PRESENTS:
"ONE PAGE FROM 'ON THE ORIGIN OF SPECIES' BY CHARLES DARWIN"
Any variation which is not inherited is unimportant for us.

But the number and diversity of inheritable deviations of structure, both those of slight and those of considerable physiological importance, is endless. Dr. Prosper Lucas's treatise, in two large volumes, is the fullest and the best on this subject.
No breeder doubts how strong is the tendency to inheritance: like produces like is his fundamental belief.
Doubts have been thrown on this principle by theoretical writers alone.
When a deviation appears not unfrequently, and we see it in the father and child, we cannot tell whether it may not be due to the same original cause acting on

both; but when amongst individuals, apparently exposed to the same conditions, any very rare deviation, due to some extraordinary combination of circumstances, appears in the parent--say, once amongst several million individuals--and it reappears in the child, the mere doctrine of chances almost compels us to a-

transcription.title: awkward moments

panel.line: Today is a good day I think for people volunteering unwanted personal information about themselves!
Should be awkward!
AWKWARD MOMENTS COMICS
You know, I've never really been comfortable with being a vegetarian Dromiceiomimus.
Oh.
I see.
[thinking] Hmm... that was KIND of awkward.
Hey, I had a dream about you last night, only you had my mother's body, and, um-
Father's genitals.
Uh
LATER...
Wow...
That was awkward!

transcription.title: it's the only thing i really wanted

panel.line: I Think it would be nice if I gave presents to people, once a year! Furthermore, it would be nice if I did this on a set day.
I will call this day "Dinosaur Present Day, Featuring T-Rex"!
Dromiceiomimus, did you know that Dinosaur Present Day, Featuring T-Rex, is coming up?
How can Dinosaur PRESENT day be coming up?
Ho ho ho, I get it. No, "present" as in the gift!
Ha ha ha!
LATER:
You're going to be giving out presents, T-Rex?
I am!
Awesome! What am I getting?
It's a surprise!
Is it a... DOG?
No.
Is it a... SANDWICH?
No!

transcription.title: i will do this using capitalism

panel.line: I need to think of awesome presents to get all my friends!
Then I'll go out and buy these gifts! I will do this using CAPITALISM.
Dromiceiomimus, If you could have anything in the whole world, what would you want?
Peace and love and joy and hope and truth and beauty.
Really? Hmm...
What's the matter, T-Rex? You seem preoccupied.
I am!
I'm worried that my Dinosaur Present Day, Featuring T-Rex, has become too commercial! We've forgotten about the true spirit of the day.
How can a one-day-old holiday have a true spirit?
That's the magic of Dinosaur Present Day, Featuring T-Rex!

transcription.title: sexy exciting presents

panel.line: I've decided that despite the commercialism of the season, I will still be giving out presents to all my friends!
However, I will achieve this by sneaking into their houses and leaving the presents there!
SHORTLY...
Dromiceiomimus, I think you should examing your house carefully tomorrow morning!
Why's that?
I have a hunch you might find some surprises there, is all!
We'll still know it's you who put the presents there, T-Rex!
True!
So, if it's not the anonymity you want, why are you going to all the trouble to sneak into our houses?
It's no trouble!
I just like the excitement of giving people presents!
It makes me feel kind of sexy, you know?

transcription.title: i would like to have that portrait

panel.line: Dinosaur Present Day, Featuring T-Rex, has been a complete success!
People even gave ME presents! It was awesome!
Thank you so much for the little gloves, Dromiceiomimus!
Dromiecieomimus: Well thank YOU for the chocolates, T-Rex! They were very nice.
Nice chocolates for a nice lady!
This holiday of yours seems to have spread a lot of goodwill!
Indeed!
Wouldn't it be great if EVERY day could be Dinosaur Present Day?
Featuring T-Rex? That would be a lot of presents!
Speaking of which: thanks for the portrait! It's a very good likeness.
Yeah man!
I am giving a "thumbs up"!

transcription.title: disappointed dentist re: flossing

panel.line: Today I am excited! Today I did not forget my dentist appointment!
Today I will be the one to impress my dentist with my personal oral hygiene!

I spent an hour this morning making sure that my teeth were sparkly clean. I practiced in the mirror saying "Of course I floss after every meal", "Of course, Doctor! I floss after every meal", and "Floss after every meal? Of course!"
I practiced until I got it RIGHT.
Well, do you floss after every meal?
Not hardly!
But every time I go he asks, and every time I feel like I let him down - personally, you know? Like he has twenty kids and I'm the only one who doesn't floss and he doesn't know why.
That's very sad.

It gets sadder! Sometimes I imagine he's bought books on how to get your kid to floss, and he's tried everything the books say but still, I don't floss - and he's started to wonder if there is something wrong with HIM. Has he failed me as a dentist? As a FATHER? Where did it all go wrong?

transcription.title: everybody dies (anti-pun)

panel.line: COMICS IN WHICH THE MAIN CHARACTER IS TIRED OF PUNS AND SO EVERYBODY DIES
I wonder what the longest word in the dictionary is!
Dromiceiomimus, do you know what the longest word in the dictionary is?
Hmm... is this a riddle? Is the answer "longest"?
Ha ha, no, this isn't a riddle. It's a real question I'm investigating!
Ooh! T-Rex! I know the longest word in the dictionary!
What?
"Smiles"!
"Smiles".
Because there's a "mile" between the first and last letters!
That's it!
Everybody dies!

transcription.title: history teacher (pro-pun)

panel.line: THE HISTORY TEACHER
Many hundreds of years ago, things were done in different ways!
Many things were more primitive. All of the modern conveniences you take for granted did not exist!
People died at a younger age.
Travel was harder and took much longer!
T-Rex, your history lesson has no value!
Why would you say that?
Because you're not giving any real information, just general trends!
I'm sorry, but I don't think you'll make a very good history teacher.
Then I guess my career as an educator is...
...history?

transcription.title: new year's resolutions

panel.line: NEW YEAR'S RESOLUTIONS
New Year's Resolutions are used to make changes in your life!
Classically, one would make private resolutions and endeavour to carry these out over the new, unblemished year. However, this tradition has changed over time!

People now choose to announce their resolutions, perhaps in the hopes of making their pledges more likely to be fulfilled. Worse, in some families members make resolutions for each other: a recipe for fighting and snide, sarcastic suggestions!
Hey, that sounds like a great idea, T-Rex! Let's make resolutions for each other!
Huh?
Weren't you listening? This will only lead to conflict!
No, it'll be great! Do me first.
No!
Come on!
Utahrapror: I've got one for you!
Y-you have one prepared?
You jerk! You brought a list!

transcription.title: unambiguous answers to old rhetorical questions

panel.line: WHY DO WE DRIVE ON A PARKWAY AND PARK ON A DRIVEWAY?
Because the words have two different origins.
UNAMBIGUOUS ANSWERS TO OLD RHETORICAL QUESTIONS COMICS
WHY DON'T THEY MAKE THE ENTIRE AIRPLANE OUT OF THE SAME STUFF BLACK BOXES ARE MADE OF?
Because that would be impractical.
WHAT DO THEY USE TO SHIP STYOFOAM?
They use boxes!
Yes, boxes.
IF ONE SYNCHRONIZED SWIMMER DROWNS, DO THE REST DROWN TOO?
No, they would not.
That's silly.
IS IT TRUE THAT CANNIBALS DON'T EAT CLOWNS BECAUSE THEY TASTE FUNNY?
ARGH!

transcription.title: comics for the easily confused

panel.line: I have received complaints. Apparently I can be difficult to follow, and sometimes people get confused.
I hope that will not be the case today, with...
COMICS FOR THE EASILY CONFUSED
I will go for a walk and talk about the weather.
Nice weather today, isn't it?
Yes, the weather has been very nice lately.
The two dinosaurs are talking about the weather.
Hello. Would you like to hear a joke about dinosaurs?
Yes.
Here is a joke about dinosaurs: What makes more noise than one dinosaur?
What?
Two dinosaurs!
I get it!
Two dinosaurs would make more noise than one dinosaur.
If you are still confused, re-read this comic and I will things for you again.

transcription.title: tweens

panel.line: I received some excellent news last night: that I've been accepted in a part-time job at the local middle school (grades 6-8)!
I'll be teaching TWEENS!
Look, um, T-Rex - don't say that word. No real person ever uses that word.
Then I will be the first!
No, please, T-Rex, don't use that word.You know who uses that word? Jerks use that word, T-Rex.
SOON:
I don't care what she says! I'm using the word "tweens"!
No you're not!
Not you too!
"Tweens" is a totally illegitimate word! Older children are either adolescents or teenagers. No "tweens".
"Tweens".
Can you taste it on your tongue? "Tweens".
SHORTLY...
Ok tweens, I'll be your substitute teacher for today!
And I was once a tweenager too, so I don't want any tween tricks played on me! Alright, tweens?

transcription.title: ahh... much better!

panel.line: I feel as if I've spent the past year in some sort of alternate reality! Indeed, if I were to describe my adventures over the past several months, I would describe them as...
Non-canon!
SHORTLY...
Today is a beautiful day to be stomping on things, out here in the REAL world! How are you today, Gertie?
Just fine, Manospondylus Gigas!
Ha ha! That of course is my name, which is why I am responding to it! I'm fine today, Gertie!
Manospondylus G.! Want to go out and get hammered?
Hell yes!
Great. Me and my wife'll meet you at the Nisti Drinker, say, around seven?
Great! I too will bring my wife.
T-Rex + Utahraptor: We're both married!
Ha ha ha!

transcription.title: compressed bible comics - today's genre: teen magazine confessional

panel.line: COMPRESSED BIBLE COMICS
today's genre: TEEN MAGAZINE CONFESSIONAL
Dear Seventeen,
I was in the Garden of Eden, and I don't know what I was thinking, but... I ate the forbidden fruit!

It was SO embarrasing! My fave crush was there and he saw everything! Just when I thought things couldn't get worse, God showed up, and he kicked us both out of the Garden... for good! I could have died!
Then, when we were outside, I suddenly knew shame for the first time... and my crush did too! I swear I never blushed so much in my enitre life!
There is a silver lining though - we are now completely in love, despite what happened!
Eve!
You're not writing to another teen magazine, are you?
S-sorta?
Eve! The whole world doesn't need to know that stuff!
I'm totally breaking up with you, Eve! For real this time!
THAT EVENING...
And he never called me again!

transcription.title: things that don't exist

panel.line: Unicorns and flying submarines are two things that do not exist!
T-REX IN: "THINGS THAT DO NOT EXIST"
Other things that don't exist include talking plants and ham and cheese sandwiches that are made out of neither ham nor cheese!
These things DON'T EXIST.
Also: Objectivity.
Why are you listing things that don't exist? You could be here, literally, forever!
So?
At the end, I'll have an exhaustive list of Things That Don't Exist. Then in the future if anybody ever wants to see if something exists, they could just consult my list!
But people will always be coming up with new things that don't exist!
Mine the task eternal!

transcription.title: i wonder what life would be like if i were never born

panel.line: I wonder what the world would be like if I had never been born!
I wonder!
Christmas a humbug, uncle! You don't mean that, I am sure?
I do. "Merry Christmas!" What reason have you to be merry? You're poor enough.
Come, then. What reason have you to be morose? You're rich enough.
Bah! Humbug!
Ebenezer, I am the Ghost of Christmas Past!
Long past?
No. YOUR past.
What business brought you here?
Your welfare - take heed! Rise, and walk with me.
What the- ?! That's not what I wanted to dream about at all!

transcription.title: this is more than enough excitement for me

panel.line: I'm in the prime of life!
Ha ha ha!
Hey, Dromiceiomimus, would you say it's great to be young?
I - I guess so!
It's great, eh?
Yeah, it's pretty great.
It sure is!
If youth is so great, how come you're wasting it, T-Rex?
T- Rex: I'm wasting it?
You are! At this rate, the only memories you'll have to fondly look back on when you're older are those of walking around and saying how great it is to be young!
You're right!
However, that will be more than enough excitement for me!

transcription.title: swimming naked

panel.line: COMICS IN WHICH ALREADY-NAKED DINOSAURS DEBATE THE MERITS OF SWIMMING NAKED
I believe today I will go down to the beach and swim!
Naked!
Good morning, Dromiceiomimus! Beutiful day, isn't it?
It is indeed, T-Rex. A fine day for going to the beach - is that where you're headed?
It is, my friend! I'm going to swim naked!
Off to the beach?
I am, good sir!
Mind if I join you?
Not at all!
Let me go get my swimming trunks!
Why?
To swim in?
Go naked!
No! I'll be right back.
I'm swimming naked!

transcription.title: how to win arguments/friendships

panel.line: HOW TO WIN ARGUMENTS
Winning arguments is easy!
The secret is to convince your opponent that arguing with you isn't worthwhile! When they abandon the argument/friendship, you win!
It's really that easy!
I feel your technique isn't one for winning arguments; rather, it's one for losing friendships!
No!
I SPECIFICALLY specified that it's for winning arguments/friendships.
First: Annoying your opponent doesn't mean you've won. Second: You can't "win" a friendship. It's not a competition. There are no winners or losers.
Hmm... sounds to me like somebody lost their last few friendships!

transcription.title: the cutest phrase

panel.line: WHAT'S THE CUTEST PHRASE YOU CAN COME UP WITH?
That's easy!
"Happy machine!"
Now granted, it's not the cutest phrase if you just look at it. But if you think about what a happy machine would do - what it would look like, you end up with something that is just so cute!
A happy machine!
So - what? It's a machine that is happy? A happy robot?
No!
It's a machine to create happiness. A happy machine!
That - that IS pretty cute!
But what happens if the happy machine fails? If it breaks into pieces?
Oh noo!

transcription.title: how to turn any love song into a sea shanty

panel.line: I've made a fantastic discovery: a discovery bound to send the music theorists back to their dusty old drawing boards! For you see....
I've discovered how to turn most any love song into a sea shanty!
A sea shanty? Like, a pirate song?
Indeed!
And how do you plan to accomplish this miraculous transformation?
Easy! I simply replace every instance of "baby" with "matey"!
There's no way that would work, T-Rex! No way!
Try it yourself!
Alright! Hmm.. well - "together you and me could be so special matey"...
"Hush little matey/Don't you cry"...
Ma ma ma ma matey / Don't you forget my number!"
See?
It's amazing!

transcription.title: i have to say i love you, in a song

panel.line: Everytime I tried to tell you
the words
just came out wrong
So, I have to say I love you
IN A SONG!
