transcription.title: adults vs children title match

panel.line: THE DIFFERENCES BETWEEN ADULTS AND CHILDREN COMICS (note that if you already have a full grasp on such differences, this comic will probably be of no help to you)
The differences between adults and children are many!

For example: while adults are by definition fully grown, children are much smaller! Adults have more life experiences than children, who may have very little! Adults, legally, are fully-recognized people, while children are not! They do not have the same rights.
Yes, there are many differences between adults and children!
Hey, T-Rex!
What is it, Utahraptor?
I was just babysitting my adult neighbor. But then I realized: wait, you don't babysit adults! You only babysit CHILDREN!
How embarrassing!
Oh, I know it!
Well, to be fair, that IS one of the differences between adults and children!

transcription.title: prizes for being a friend

panel.line: As the fantastic fellow that I am, I've decided to reward my friends for their hard years of friendship!
I will be rewarding them by giving out prizes: anything their heart desires!
SOON
Dromiceiomimus, I would like to reward you for being my friend! What would yo like?
T-Rex, I didn't become your friend because of the chance of a reward! I'm not sure this is a good idea: people might find it insulting!
Is that true? Could others take my offer of prizes to be an insult?
Easily!

Here's why: it implies that being your friend is somehow deserving of recompense. You insult yourself, but you also insult us, because if we were truly your friends, we wouldn't want prizes! The fact that you are offering them implies you think we'd take them, which implies that you think our friendship is insincere!
Good God, you're right! Let me make this up to you. We'll go to the movies!
That'll be fun, eh?
My treat!

transcription.title: a comic about cooties

panel.line: I find "cooties" to be an interesting idea. We hear about this 'disease' as children, and we never forget!
Nobody wants to have cooties, despite the fact that they have no effect on anyone whatsoever!
T-Rex, you have cooties?
What? No! I don't have cooties! Nobody has cooties!
Okay, but I heard you had cooties! I heard you had them bad!
T-Rex, you have cooties?!
No I don't!
What's with everyone asking me if I have cooties? Maybe YOU have cooties!
Ha ha, nice try! We all know that you're the one with cooties!
I'm not!
I don't know...seems to me like you are!
IT IS CLEAR THAT I DO NOT IN FACT HAVE COOTIES!
Off-panel: Everyone! This T-Rex here has cooties!
No! Don't listen to him!

transcription.title: you're the world-renowned authority on you

panel.line: I just realized: I'm almost certainly the one person who knows me the best! This has many implications...
For one, it means if I think I'm awesome, no-one can dispute it because I'm the authority!
This is great! I intend to make all sorts of pronouncements about myself, pronouncements that people will be forced to accept, because who would know myself better than me? Nobody, that's who!
Looks like my weekend just got filled up!
Unfortunately, your reasoning is flawed, T-Rex!
I don't see how!
While you may well be the authority on all things T-Rex, this does not mean that people should accept your judgments without question!
It doesn't?
Nope! Even authorities must justify themselves!
I guess you're righ- Hey!
Is there some political undertone to what you're saying?!

transcription.title: these inappropriate games are tearing me apart

panel.line: I have been secretly programming in my spare time! What's more, I have completed my first game. I call it...
"Monkey Whore!"
Like all my work, the exclaimation mark belongs in the title. It's that exciting a game!
Dromeceiomimus: What do you do in "Monkey Whore!"?
Well, it's great. You start out as a monkey whore and then you collect coins and at the end of the game you are the Champion of the Monkey Whores!
Where did you pick up a word like "whore", T-Rex?!
I saw it on the Internet!
And- you know what a "whore" is?
I have the basic idea! A whore is someone who collects coins, yes?
T-Rex, a whore is someone who has sex for money.
Holy cow!
My game's not appropriate AT ALL!

transcription.title: the evolution of social graces

panel.line: ORIGINALLY:
Who cares about feelings?
I tell it like it is!
THE EVOLUTION OF SOCIAL GRACES
VICTORIAN TIMES:
My lady, wouldst thou be so kind as to prepare me my dinner and birth me my babies?
Good sir, my heart is aflutter! I will do as you ask.
You have my thanks!
Quickly, now.
THE SEXUAL REVOLUTION:
Let's have (emotionally speaking) consequence-free sex!
What's the secret word?
Please!
THE PRESENT DAY:
Is it still alright to hold a door open for a lady?
Hmm... I think so, as long as you'd let her hold it open for you.
Now that's fair to BOTH genders!
THE FUTURE:
Who cares about feelings?!
Cybernetic Collective Consciousness: We tell it like it is!
Damn right! That's because we're all part of a cybernetic collective consciousness.
Cybernetic Collective Consciousness: AGREED

transcription.title: the sex scene

panel.line: I have finished a new novel! This is my best novel yet, for the simple reason that it includes one critical aspect:
A sex scene!
You wrote a sex scene?
Yep! It's HOT, if I do say so myself!
But what if someone you know reads it? What if your MOM reads it?
Shit! I hadn't thought of that!
Damn damn damn! What am I going to do? I'm doomed!
Well, has the book been published?
Not as such.
So? Problem solved!
I - I guess so!
BUT TWO MONTHS LATER, THE BOOK IS PUBLISHED...
I'm sabotaging my own life!!

transcription.title: the ultimate personification of society

panel.line: Today I am not going to make any decision, except for this decision, just now, not to make any decisions!
This is great! I can't be held responsible for my actions!
SOON:
Dromiceiomimus, should I stomp this house FAST, or should I stomp this house SLOW?
You should stomp that house not at all!
I'm sorry but please limit your answers to the suggestions provided!
I'm disappointed, T-Rex! You're not living up to the possibilities of your decision!
Oh?

Yeah, you could completely subsume your personality and only do what people tell you to do, thereby becoming the ultimate personification of society, and, likely, a very poignant example! Instead you're framing your questions so you do what you want to anyway.
Oh man, I should totally become the ultimate personification of society! Everything I did would be instantly symbolic
Imagine the symbology if I committed suicide?
WITH THE TV ON?

transcription.title: houston, we have a problem

panel.line: ENTHUSIASTIC USE OF OUTDATED CATCH-PHRASES COMICS
"Houston, we have a problem!"
Ha ha ha!
Hey, Dromiceiomimus! These people in this house, you know what they're saying?
Huh? What?
"Houston, we have a problem!"
Ha ha ha!
"Houston, we have a problem!"
"Houston, we have a problem!", little lady!
Give it a break, T-Rex!
Your catchphrase is not only annoying, but OUT OF DATE. You should find a more modern catch-phrase!
Like what?
Like... I don't know...
"The ravages of puberty leave no-one unscathed!"
TWO HOURS LATER:
"Houston, we have a problem!"
Ha ha ha!

transcription.title: philosophy comics i and ii

panel.line: PHILOSOPHY COMICS
We can't trust our senses! The entire world could be an illusion!
Oh well. It doesn't really matter either way, I suppose.
Are we still on for dinner?
THE END
PHILOSOPHY COMICS II
T-Rex! Science tells us everything is relative!
This means that there is no such thing as truth! Your idea of what is right could be just as good as mine!
You misrepresent the science. All vantage points are relative, however, this does not mean that all THINGS are relative. That would be absurd.
But please, continue to take simplified scientific results and apply them naively to philosophical thought!
fin

transcription.title: dreams

panel.line: I dreamed last night that I was sleeping in av ery tiny car.
When I woke up, my arms were sore!
True story!
But of course I don't try to read too much into that...
It was probably just some random neurons firing in my brain!
a very tiny car... COINCIDENCE? What does it all mean?
I had a crazy dream once!
Do tell!
I had this dream where I was playing basketball with Bill Cosby.
He kicked my ass!
Good Lord!
How is it that I have the same dream...
EVERY NIGHT?

transcription.title: i dunno, it always worked for me

panel.line: With new understandings coming from the field of Science, we no longer have to give God all the credit for creating the Universe!
It's great!
In the past, we did not have a very good understanding of our world, and so attributing storms and such to God made sense.
But NOW, we understand things! We don't need a God to make hurricanes and babies for us. We can make them in a lab!
In effect, WE (and by 'we' I mean 'dinosaurs') have become the all-powerful Gods of old!
I'm afraid your reasoning is flawed T-Rex! Fatally flawed!
I don't see how!

Well, say when you're a kid your father builds the house you live in. You'd give him the credit, right? And say that you're older and NOW, you understand how to build a house. Can you then conclude that your father didn't build your childhood home?
The answer is "no", T-Rex!
Well I still have plenty more proof that God doesn't exist! Remember all those emails I sent Him back in December?
They BOUNCED!

transcription.title: comics in which matters take a sudden turn for the worse (and zombies!)

panel.line: COMICS IN WHICH MATTERS TAKE A SUDDEN TURN FOR THE WORSE
Well, I'm perfectly content!
Yes indeed, life is good!
Wait - what's this?
A growth on my leg?
THE END
COMIC IN WHICH THE DEAD COME BACK TO LIFE TO HARASS THE LIVING
Run away!
Run away!
Wait - what are we running from?
Remember? The dead have come back and are harassing the living! They want to eat our brains!
Shit, no!

transcription.title: i'ma gonna be a superhero

panel.line: I've decided that I will put my tremendous height, strength, abilities, intellect, and colour to good use!
I will become...
A superhero!
First I need a secret identity, but I've already god that. Then I need an origin story, but I can figure that out later. What's most important is fighting crime!
Shouldn't you be having these thoughts in your private lair, rather than out in the open?
Silence, citizen!
Ooh! Ooh! I want to be a superhero too!
No! You're stealing my idea!
I'll be The Raptor, and my ability will be to sneak up behind you, jump on your back, hook my claws into your flesh, and tear you apart!
No, but I was going to -
Oh! And the Dromiceiomimus can be my sidekick! We'll have our own base!
No fair! I was going to ask her to be MY sidekick!
You can't just -
My base is going to be better!

transcription.title: handshaking classiness

panel.line: I have heard of the perfect way for one, and all of ones friends to be the classiest group of people ever!
How to appear to be classy!
The secret is the HANDSHAKE. If you greet all of your friends with a handshake, then, WITHOUT FAIL, people will start commenting on how classy you are!
This is going to be great!
And when people do compliment me on my classiness, I'll shake their hand!
I think you may be on to something!
I do believe I am!
But you didn't shake my hand just now. It is LESS CLASSY to run up behind someone shouting than to give them a firm handshake!
Oops! My mistake. I'll shake your hand right now! Ready?
Ready!
Okay, hold out your arm!
Ha, ha! Here I go!

transcription.title: valentine's day comics

panel.line: *VALENTINE'S DAY COMICS*
Valentine's Day?!
*Oh no!*
I need to find myself a Valentine, STAT!
T-Rex, I was hoping I'd run into you! Would you be my Valentine?
Aww! Of course I'll be your Valentine, Dromiceiomimus!
T-Rex and Dromiceiomimus: Hooray!
Hey, T-Rex! I wanted to ask you a question!
Sure!
But before you say anything, I want to share with you some happy news: that Dromiceiomimus wanted to be my Valentine!
Oh!
Great!
Well! I guess you've got no need for me then! I GUESS I'LL JUST GO HOME AND DIE ALONE!
Stupid manufactured holidays!

transcription.title: musavada veramani sikkhapadam samadiyami

panel.line: I have recently discovered a new philosophical system of beliefs!
Buddhism!
Buddhism allows me to forgo material things.
All I have to do is sit around all day and think, then I become enlightened!
It is a sweet deal.
Truly, Buddhism is the way for me!
Then why are you stomping on that woman?
Huh?
You're not supposed to go around killing people if you're a Buddhist. It's the first of the Ten Precepts!
I think it's pretty clear that you have only the most superficial grasp on the philosophy, T-Rex!
Perhaps culled only from cartoonish stereotypes!
I also saw a statue!

transcription.title: maybe HE didn't

panel.line: You know how sometimes you wonder what your life would be like, if only you made some decisions differently?
Well, I intend to find out!
It'll be great! I'll move to a new town and START OVER. Then every chance I have, I'll make the other decision: the one I didn't make the first time!
It'll be great! And if things turn out worse with these new decisions, well then--lesson learned! I'll just move back here and never speak of it again.
Then it's settled: I'll move to a new town, make new friends, and start a whole new identity!
Why?
"Why"?
Yeah, "why", as in "why move away and start life again?" What, did you commit some horrible crime?
Ha ha!
NO, I didn't commit some horrible crime!
Right?

transcription.title: having a propensity to the overuse of lengthy language

panel.line: I have finally decided to add another word to my List of Favourite Words!
The word?
Sesquipedalian!
The reason this word is so great is that it means "given to the overuse of long words" and it itself is a long word!
i can't get enough!
So - what? You enjoy the irony of the word, T-Rex?
Yep!
Is that alright?
Sure! It's great!
Alright then!
Super!
Fantastic!
Well then!
I'm glad we had this little talk!

transcription.title: hilarious outtakes comics

panel.line: HILARIOUS OUTTAKES COMICS
It's been a memorable two weeks indeed!
Do you recall a few days ago, when we had that hilarious conversation?
I thought I would die laughing!
I - um.
Line?
HILARIOUS OUTTAKES COMICS II
So what meaning do you see my actions representing?
The futility of life?
Oh man!
Now I - um...
Line?

transcription.title: that's perfect

panel.line: I have been thinking of registering a domain name...
... on the Internet!
This domain name will have to be something that reflects me and my interests!
Something that says, "This is an awesome dude!" but also says "You should sign the guestbook!"
Hmm...
I've got a great domain name for you!
Oh boy! What is it?
AS THE UTAHRAPTOR GIVES HIS SUGGESTION, THE T-REX'S FACE FILLS WITH EXCITEMENT...
That's perfect!

transcription.title: reuters article

panel.line: Sept. 6th, 1999: "A new series of fossilized dinosaur tracks was discovered today near Drumheller, in Alberta, Canada. The tracks appear to be those of a fully grown
Tyrannosaurus Rex
but paleontologists are confused as to the origin of what appear to be fossilized wood fragments contained within, and scattered just beneath the footprint record.
These remarkable tracks are joined by those of an adult Utahraptor who apparently stopped and
stood face to face with the T-Rex (one almost wants to speculate that the two were engaged in sparkling conversation) before returning the way he came...
The tracks seem well-travelled, as if these two dinosaurs met on a daily basis." - Reuters News Service

transcription.title: ice cream night

panel.line: ICE CREAM NIGHT
Who wants some ice cream?!
Dromiceiomimus, come over tonght! I'm going to have an ICE CREAM NIGHT.
Ice cream night?
Yeah! We'll all go out for ice cream! It'll be fun!
Ice cream!
Hey, T-Rex! Beautiful day, isn't it!
It IS!
It's so beautiful, you should come over tonight for ice cream!
Ice cream night?
You know it!
I'm there!
THAT NIGHT...
Shit, it's still winter!

transcription.title: righteous indignation

panel.line: So, if you'll excuse the pun, I think you'll agree: one cannot have a "will to" something without first a "will through" something, yes?
Utahraptor?
Utahraptor?!
Where the hell did he go? He was right here!
We were talking!
I was being CLEVER!
T-Rex! Wait up!
Where were you?
You were a bit boring, so I went somewhere else!
R-Really?
Ha ha, just kidding. I went to get some smokes.
Since when do you smoke?
Since WHEN?!

transcription.title: the taste of burying your ass

panel.line: I can't believe the Utahraptor's a smoker! I can't believe it!
Doesn't he know he's damaging his LUNGS?!
Dromiceiomimus, did you know that the Utahraptor is a smoker?
Sure I did! We smoke together sometimes!
YOU smoke TOO?! I could stomp a house, I'm so shocked!
Later...
My shock is continued!
It's MY choice, T-Rex!
So don't get all holier-than-thou on me! Maybe I just like the taste of nicotine!
Maybe I'll just like the taste of BURYING YOUR ASS!
You heard me!

transcription.title: holy peer pressure

panel.line: I guess I shouldn't freak out too much about people smoking. I'm not sure if it's my place... I'll try to be more "cool" about it!
Plus, I don't want to become a big old sanctimonious bastard!
So, Dromiceiomimus! How long have you been smoking?
Oh, I only smoke once in a while, and only when I've been drinking.
Wait- you DRINK?!
Am I a prude? Am I out of touch with the youth of today?
Maybe a little!
Not to say that smoking is great, but I too only smoke the occasional cigarette when I've been drinking! There's worse things I could be doing, like murders!
I - I just would prefer it if you'd consider quitting the habit!
That's right!
I said it!

transcription.title: t-rex what's going on

panel.line: T-REX WHAT'S GOING ON
Who said that?!
IT'S ME GOD
Oh yeah? Prove it! What am I going to do next?
YOU'RE GOING TO STOMP ON A WOMAN AGAINST MY WISHES
Ha! I'd like to see that!
Oh my goodness! He was right!
Who was right?
God!!
God's talking to me and he can tell the FUTURE!
HEY GUYS
Huh? I don't hear anything. Maybe you're going CRAZY, T-Rex!
DON'T LISTEN TO HIM HE STILL DOESN'T KNOW HIS TIMES TABLES
Hah hah hah! No way!

transcription.title: the dinosaur at the end of the comic

panel.line: the DINOSAUR at the end of this comic
starring lovable, scaly old T-REX
Hello, everybodee!
This is a very dull panel. What is on the next panel?
WHAT DID THAT SAY? Did that say there will be a dinosaur at the end of this comic?
It did? Oh, I am so scared of dinosaurs!!
Listen, I have an idea. If you do not read any panels, we will never get to the end of this comic.
And that is good, because there is a dinosaur at the end of this comic.
so please do not read the next panel.
THEY READ THE PANEL!
Maybe you do not understand! You do not know what you are doing to me!
I, T-Rex, am begging you not to read the next panel!
The next panel is the end of this comic, and there is a DINOSAUR at the end of this comic!
Oh, I am so SCARED! Please do not read the next panel. PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE!
Well, look at that! This is the end of the comic, and the only one here is ME!
I, lovable, scaly old T-Rex am the dinosaur at the end of this comic!
And you were so scared! I told you and told you that there was nothing to be afraid of!

transcription.title: comics in which disaster strikes!

panel.line: COMICS IN WHICH DISASTER STRIKES!
Here is a list of things that I've burnt:
- Toast!
- My house!
- Dinner!
- My Fingers!
- RUBBER.
You're forgetting one!
Which?
- Bridges?
Oh, that's very funny, Utahrapt-
JUST AT THAT MOMENT, DISASTER STRIKES!
Look out behind you!!

transcription.title: a quiet portrait

panel.line: How can I possibly be late for my important meeting AGAIN?
How is this even possible?!
I got up early, I ate breakfast early, I showered early, and yet: I am late! Again! Still!
Why I am always late for my very important meetings?
I do not understand this!
If there were an award for lateness, I would be the winner, two years in a row!
Hey, T-Rex!
Hello Utahraptor! How are you today?
I'm fine, fine! But it sounds like maybe you're a little late!
Oh, ha ha! Don't worry about me!
It's just something I have to take care of, you know?

transcription.title: the time machine

panel.line: Last night I built myself a machine...
... a time machine!
This time machine is a watch, one that allows me to travel through time at the fantastic rate of one second per second.
It will show me what tomorrow is like, tomorrow!
(What a great adventure!)
That sounds like a pretty useless time machine!
Hey!

Besides, everybody knows that the smart way to build a time machine is to spend your life building it, but then have your future self send it back in time to you right now, thereby saving you the effort! You've been wasting your time!
What?
SUDDENLY, THIS COMIC'S PUNCHLINE, AND THAT OF THE SYNDICATED COMIC STRIP "CATHY", ARE SWITCHED!
Ack!

transcription.title: the group autobiography

panel.line: I'm going to write my autobiography! But rather than writing it myself,
I'm going to get lots of other people to write it for me!
Then, wouldn't that be a biography?
I guess so. But different! Everybody I know gets to write one chapter, and they don't see what other people wrote until the book is published!
This sounds like fun, T-Rex!
I think it will be, and flattering too!
Flattering? What if everyone writes the same complaint?
Huh?
Yeah, what if we all say "He's good, but he smells funny on Tuesdays?"
What? I don't smell funny on Tuesdays!!
Who smells funny on a specific day of the week?

transcription.title: the group autobiography

panel.line: I'm going to write my autobiography! But rather than writing it myself,
I'm going to get lots of other people to write it for me!
Then, wouldn't that be a biography?
I guess so. But different! Everybody I know gets to write one chapter, and they don't see what other people wrote until the book is published!
This sounds like fun, T-Rex!
I think it will be, and flattering too!
Flattering? What if everyone writes the same complaint?
Huh?
Yeah, what if we all say "He's good, but he smells funny on Tuesdays?"
What? I don't smell funny on Tuesdays!!
Who smells funny on a specific day of the week?

transcription.title: i see all my relationships in economic terms

panel.line: "THE MEASURE OF A MAN"
A CAUTIONARY TALE
TOLD VIA DINOSAUR PROXY
PART ONE
I see all of my relations in economic terms! You provide value to me by providing me a "sounding board" for my ideas, and also (potentially) as a mate!
Conversely, this house provides no value to me, and my relation with it is understandably strained!
please leave me be
You too provide no value to me, young woman! That is why I stomp you with impunity.
Hold it!
Does not seeing everything through the lens of economics ultimately reduce all relationships, in fact all of life, to mere line items on a hypothetical statement of earnings?
Shit!

transcription.title: the day of rage

panel.line: THE DAY OF RAGE
All right!
I'm pissed off, so everybody get out of my way!
My rage brings destruction!
My rage brings DEATH!
What the hell are you doing?!
Today is my "day of rage".
I thought your "day of rage" was yesterday.
Shoot, you're right! Oh man...
I've got some 'splainin to do!

transcription.title: the mind-control ray

panel.line: THE UTAHRAPTOR IN: THE MIND-CONTROL RAY
Dear God!
The Utahraptor's mind-control ray experiment: it finally succeeded!
It gives him dominion over the minds of men, and his absolute power has corrupted him, absolutely!
T-Rex, he's going around making people give him all their money!
Somehow - SOMEHOW - we've got to stop him! The fate of the free world depends on it!
T-Rex! Give me all your money!
NO! You'll never get away with this!
Maybe this mind-control ray I've hidden in the palm of my hand will make you change your mind?
I -
ALL THE MONEY
LATER THE UTAHRAPTOR USES THE MIND-CONTROL RAY ON HIMSELF, AND BECOMES... A KINDER PERSON!
Thanks for the cookies!

transcription.title: an awesome week - o - dreams come true

panel.line: DREAMS COME TRUE
I had a horrible dream last night! Real nightmare!
In my dream, everything had turned into plasticine! Do you ever have nightmares, Dromiceiomimus?
I guess, but I never remember them at the morning!
I wish I wouldn't either!
Hey T-Rex, are you sure it was just a dream?
What do you mean?
Well, you look quite plasticineish to me!
You're just trying to scare me!
I'm not, you should take a look in a mirror!
But mirrors don't exist yet!

transcription.title: an awesome week - zole - dinosaurz with attitude

panel.line: DINOSAURZ WITH ATTITUDE
Straight outta prehistoric Compton, a crazy motherf***er named T-Rex!
I mack on hoes in hopes of having sex!
I don't need an AK, cause I've got a foot! That can stomp your house into a pile of soot! Sucker MCs see me bend my knees-
Please don't stomp on 'em, T-Rex!
Dromiceiomimus please!
Stomping on fools is my favourite sport! Here comes the Utahraptor with a witty retort!
My skills are ill cause I predate time! Ain't no mics been invented to amplify my rhymes!
Sucks to be you!
That is certainly true!
My rhymes are so oldschool, the school is still new!

transcription.title: an awesome week - steve carey - crime stomper 2 / dress up

panel.line: This is MY town - a dirty town, but I'm gonna clean it up...
T-REX IN: CRIME STOMPER 2
T-Rex! You can't stomp that house! You don't have a warrant!!
Don't try to stop me - this cabin is a FRONT!
... for DRUGS!!
You wanted to see me, chief?
Dammit Rex! That cabin belonged to a well-respected businessman!!
Yeah, well respected... for DRUGS!
That's it Rex! You're a loose cannon and I want your gun and badge!!
You're suspended - indefinitely!
But - but I have low self-esteem! Remember??

transcription.title: an awesome week - elliott g. garbauskas - lasagna

panel.line: Pterodactyl 1: I made us a lasagna for dinner- we just have to heat it up.
Pterodactyl 2: Great!
Pterodactyl 2: Man, I already had lasagna for lunch
Earlier that day
Pterodactyl 2: Lasagna!

transcription.title: an awesome week - dave bort - rabbits!

panel.line: Dromeceiomimus: Hey,T-Rex!
What? Oh, yes! That's right, other dinosaur, it's me, your life-long friend, T-Rex!
Dromeceiomimus: Huh?
Hey T-Rex, it's almost noon. You hungry?
Of course I'm hungry! I could eat my weight in carrots -- er -- raw meat.
Because I'm a carnivore!
Hmm...
Say, what do you think about stomping on some houses and stuff?
No way! I might accidentally hurt some rabbits!
...which would actually be okay because, as a carnivore, I... eat... rabbits.
Okay, hold it right there, you impostor.
but--
Gotcha!
Wha?

panel.line: People in Car: Oh honey! I've never been so excited!!
Person 1: Our first home!
Person 2: Dang right, Honey Buns! It's darn near as perfect as perfect can be!!
THE PLIGHT OF THE LOWER CLASS WILL NEVER BE UNDERSTOOD BY THE WEALTHY
Person 2: What is that?
Person 2: Damn you, Opportunistic real estate agency!!
Person 1: Our dreams
Sign: Qwantz Realty
"No refunds"

transcription.title: an awesome week, continued! - joey comeau - the fourth wall

panel.line: Today, gentle reader of the comic in which I am a character, (perhaps the TITLE character?) we are going to break the 4th wall.
We may, in fact, be doing it now!

It's called the fouth wall in theatre because of the three walls of the set, isn't it? In comics, wouldn't we call it the fifth wall? The first four walls would be the four sides of the panel, wouldn't they?
N... No?
I think she's right, T-Rex.
The question you have to ask yourself now, is which of the four walls did you break?
Oh no!
{{alt-text: it would be funny to do another one that is the same, but then the side panel on the right breaks, and he's like, 'oh.'}}

panel.line: What's all this then? I appear to be made of crude sticks and dots! And I feel mildly chunky!
ALTERNATE UNIVERSE!
Dromiceiomimus, in this universe, instead of being my ex-girlfriend, you are a street-wisened homicide detective named "Lenny"!
Spread 'em, perp!
I will be a racially stereotyped informant named "Miguel Sanchez"!
WAIT.
That's not an alternate universe, that's "Law and Order". And it doesn't have anything to do with stick figures.
Oh YEAH? Well,
Executive Producer DICK WOLF

transcription.title: the portrait of a dinosaur in crisis

panel.line: "THE MEASURE OF A MAN"
A CAUTIONARY TALE
TOLD VIA DINOSAUR PROXY
PART TWO
I can't believe that I didn't see that obvious flaw in my new philosophy!*
I've got to start thinking these things through.
Wait - that's it!
* see last ish! -Ed.
From now on I will be pensive, considerate. I will be a reflective and thoughtful T-Rex!
Oh?
Yes, I am a new, more thoughtful dinosaur.
Really! How much thought did you put into stepping on that woman just now?*
* last panel! -Ed.
He's right!
Is this the portrait...
... of a dinosaur in crisis?
TAKE HEED
fin

transcription.title: an awesome week, continued! - pieter serkeyn - the lion king

panel.line: The Lion King is a great movie!
It has everything a good movie needs.
Plus a beautiful message, without making the movie too corny.
Yup. Great movie it was.
What about the discrimination? The female lions aways have to hunt while the men sleep.
That wasn't in the movie.
Exactly. They totally avoided the subject.
*gasp*

transcription.title: an awesome week, continued! - dave cheung - alternative rendering comics!

panel.line: ALTERNATIVE RENDERINGS GUEST COMICS!!! by Dave Cheung
I may look different, but I assure you...
I am as much myself as I have ever been!
Why, I still take immense pleasure in stomping on this conveniently placed log cabin.
And of course, a young lady that is in a prime position for a good stomping herself.
THIS CANNOT BEEE!!!!!
<<CRACK!!!>>
RAAAARG!!!
Well, I do hope you've learned something from this unfortunate episode.
Indeed I have. Indeed I HAVE!
STOMP HARDER!!!

transcription.title: an awesome week, concluded! - matt shepherd - contradiction city

panel.line: Know what I hate? Comics that break the "fourth wall!"
Damn straight!
It's cheap lazy writing by talentless hacks with no creative muscle!

You heard me! If anyone were to debase this comic with cheap "fourth wall" jokes, I would crush not only this house and family, but the "fourth wall" joke-teller him- or herself! That is the extent of my rancor and wrath!
Take that, self-aware nincompoops! Feel the foot wrath of my feet!
Hold it!
Stop!
Don't you realize that by going on this tirade you are not only revealing the "fourth wall" of this strip, but coming of as a phony who criticizes the very flaws he indulges in for comic effect?
I must have taken a wrong left turn near Albuquerque!
Because now I am trapped in Contradiction City!

transcription.title: an awesome week, concluded! - justin pierce - godot / dinosaur battle alpha 2k

panel.line: I should go.
But I can't!
And why not?
I'm waiting For Godot!
You're sure it was here?
What?
That we were to wait.
He said by the tree. Do you see any others?
What is it?
I don't know. A willow.
Where are the leaves?
It must be dead.
No more weeping!
Or perhaps it's not the season.
Looks more to me like a bush.
A shrub.
A bush.
LATER...
Godot! Where were you?
Godot: Hey, man! What's the haps?

transcription.title: an awesome week, concluded! - steve hogan - jester regular

panel.line: Okay! Time to get down to some squashing! Hey... what gives? What's with the word balloon and the jester regular font?
There's a real gay looking Josie and the Pussycats type background too!
There's only four panels, no little people, no dromiceiomimus, and we look all different! Everything's changed!
We've broken free from the endless cycle! From here on, anything can happen!
Let's eat a flintstone!

transcription.title: an awesome week, concluded! - phiip - something's wrong today

panel.line: something's wrong today...
what?
things are not the way they should be
why not?
I usually star in the first panel, then you, my sidekick, come only three panels later...
oh...
but there you are today...
sorry
and all panels are identical!
sorry again
you should be
aaaaah!! we're moving!!
what the...
I'm scared!!
we're going to die!!! aaaaaaaaaaaaaah!!!
no, we're saved!
how's that?
it always ends in the sixth panel!
oh...
so it's ending now, right?
well...
please hold my hand, I'm scared!
I can't, I'm stuck here!
and I'm not gay!

transcription.title: an awesome week, concluded! - ryan armand - the greatest t-rex in the world

panel.line: I am such a great T-Rex!
In fact, I must be the greatest T-Rex in the world!
Hey, Dromiceiomimus! Look at me as I crush this small building! Don't you think I possess the greatest building crushing form in the world?
It's ok. I guess...
What? By "ok", do you mean GREAT? And by "I guess", do you mean "know with absolute certainty?" If so, then I agree!
Utahraptor! Take a look at what I'm going to do to this unsuspecting woman!
Huh?
My stomp exhibits far more grace than any other T-Rex! Just another example of why I'm the greatest!
It was a pretty good... stomp... I suppose. But you're not the greatest T-Rex. That title belongs to Steve on the other side of the river.
What!?
I must defeat him!

transcription.title: an awesome week, concluded! - lick my jesus - biscuits and gravy

panel.line: I would like to start a biscuits and gravy club.
I LOVE biscuits and gravy!
I believe I would call it "Get Biscuits, Pal, Or Go To An Early Gravy."
T-Rex, that sounds like an ad slogan, not the name of an organization.
It does?
Something more official sounding would be better. Might I suggest "Biscuits and Gravy Associated"?
At least we can agree on one thing...
Biscuit fever is here to stay!

transcription.title: choose your own adventure: dinosaurus rex

panel.line: CHOOSE YOUR OWN ADVENTURE
YOU'RE THE STAR OF THE STORY! CHOOSE FROM 2 POSSIBLE ENDINGS!
DINOSAURUS REX
You are a T-Rex, undisputed King of the Dinosaurs. You are out stomping when you see a log cabin! Turn to panel 2.

As you walk up to the cabin, you notice there are other dinosaurs here. Nearby there is a small Dromiceiomimus, watching. Off in the distance you see what looks like a large Utahraptor. Utahraptors were the natural enemies of your species. A meeting might lead to conflict. Do you want to try your luck in an encounter with the Utahraptor? Turn to panel 4. If you think it's better to play it safe, turn to panel 3.
You turn to run away, but the Utahraptor chases you! Luckily, you end up becoming friends and live happily ever after. THE END

As you approach, you realize that the Utahraptor is friendly! The two of you begin a conversation. Things are going well until he starts to point out flaws in your philosophical beliefs! No matter, I'll shout something clever after him. Turn to panel 5. Forget it! I'm leaving. Escape to panel 3.
Before you can say anything, a giant meteor strikes the earth! The impact wipes out 65% of all life on the planet, including your own. Better luck next time! THE END

transcription.title: you can see the wheel between his hands

panel.line: I've been practicing a little something in my spare time!
Mime!
Amazing, eh, Dromiceiomimus?
What, that? You were supposed to be miming?
Driving a car! Uncanny, yes? Don't worry, there is no invisible car!
That's not what driving a car looks like!
Oh yeah? You can do better?
Watch this!
Oh, whatever!
whatever, man!
That's nothing! You wanna see what driving a car REALLY looks like?
beep beep

transcription.title: solving problems by declaring parts of your life to be non-canon comics

panel.line: I have received a stern letter from the "government"! They are angry because I didn't pay my "taxes" last year! Well, guess what, government?
Last year is now officially non-canon!
T-REX IN: SOLVING PROBLEMS BY DECLARING PARTS OF YOUR LIFE TO BE NON-CANON
I got the idea from TV! From now on, whenever something I don't like happens to me, I'll just declare it to be non-canon!
Is this conversation canon?
So far!
You can't apply ideas from FICTION to your own life!
Sure I can! I just did!
Remember that time I got beat up in Grade 2? Guess what? It's not canon anymore! And remember that time I lost a baby? Guess what?
It's not canon anymore?
CORRECT!
In summary, any event in which I was embarrassed is now non-canon!
I've also retroconned my name to be "Mister Awesome", by the way!
JEALOUS?

transcription.title: emergent behaviour

panel.line: IDENTITY THEORY COMICS
The identity theory is that all states of the mind are identical to all states of the brain!
This means that for every perception, every emotion, even for every thought that I have, there is a corresponding state in my brain to match.
My sense of self itself is nothing more than the physical state of the chemicals and neurons in my stately skull!
Your theory has appeal, T-Rex!
It does?
Sure! It seems rational, plus it gives up hope that we could design a computer with a consciousness and - dare I dread - a soul!
But it's not that simple!
Sure it is! If you're hung up about consciousness, consider it to be emergent behavior!
Dude, I don't even know what that is!

transcription.title: the magic ring

panel.line: I've had a great idea! I'm going to convince one of my friends that I have a magical ring. But the catch is, the ring only works if you are pure of heart!
So, this friend of mine will undergo a regime of self-improvement!
However, when they finally have bettered themselves and are "pure of heart", they will realize that there was no magic ring: the magic was in them, all along!
But "#8211; that doesn't really make sense.
Sure it does! It's a magic ring!
LATER...
T-Rex, do you want to come over this evening to watch a movie?
Sure!
Actually, I was hoping I'd run into you. I have a MAGIC RING that I'd like to give to you! But the catch is, it only works if you are pure of heart.
Oh "#8211; thanks, but never-mind. I had one of those before, and it turns out the magic was in me, all along.
Well, would"#8211;
Would you like another?

transcription.title: spring has proceeded to spring

panel.line: It's my favourite season:
Spring!
In spring you get flowers popping up, new fresh air, young lovers walking hand-in-hand...
It's all very pretty!
Do I detect a note of melancholy in your voice?
Perhaps!
It's just like - I wish I were part of that young couple walking hand-in-hand, you know?
I do! Sometimes, I feel like my youth is slipping away from me, like I should be doing more...
Yeah...
Anyway, who cares? It's spring!

transcription.title: dinosaurs were scallywags

panel.line: Yes, it's spring! Time to go for long walks in the springtime sun!
It's extra nice, since today I have a full stomach! Life is good!
Fancy meeting you here, Dromiceiomimus! Out for a walk in the springtime?
I am, T-Rex, and you as well, I see!
It is a popular pasttime on the first warm day of the year!
There you are, you jerk! You ate all my cookies last night!
Ha ha, yep! Sure did!
I didn't invite you over to eat all my cookies, T-Rex!
You went to the washroom and I was hungry! Let us just enjoy this fine day together!
I'm not going to enjoy it with you when you stole all my cookies, you scallywag!
Whoah, hold up!
"Scallywag"?

transcription.title: [whispering] i made this for you

panel.line: I've come across a way of making any otherwise-simple sentence sinister and creepy! The secret is simple:
The secret is whispering!
It works as follows: assume it's your birthday today, Dromiceiomimus. If I were to say, "Happy birthday, Dromiceiomimus!" that would sound normal, yes?
Yes!
But check out what happens if I whisper!
[[whispers]] happy birthday dromiceiomimus
Oh my goodness!
Ooh, do it on me! Pretend I got a new shirt or something!
Okay, I'll try!
[[whispers]] that shirt looks good on you, utahraptor
[[whispers]] it looks good on your body
Oh wow!
See? Creeeeepy!

transcription.title: vegetables for bachelors

panel.line: RECIPE COMICS
today's recipe
VEGETABLES FOR BACHELORS
CUT AND SAVE!
Eating vegetables can be a pain for today's breed of young, cool, somehow single men!
The trick, Dromiceiomimus, is NOT to make vegetables fun. Nothing makes vegetables fun except using them as weapons (carrot swords, etc).
The TRICK is to put all the vegetables into one easy-to-make, delicious dish!
How do you do it?
Well, I'm glad you asked!
You chop up two potatoes, two tomatoes, and one onion, and throw them all in a pot!
Then, you add about 3 cups of spinach, and 1/2 cup of water, and maybe a few chopped-up chili peppers if you like your vegetables like you like your women (spicy).
Cover and cook over medium heat until the potatoes are soft!
Awesome! Okay, once more, from the top!
This is going to be the best talent show ever!

transcription.title: gambling makes you appear more attractive in the eyes of women

panel.line: LOGICAL FALLACY COMICS PRESENTS: "THE GAMBLER'S FALLACY"
The gambler's fallacy is when one assumes that a deviation from what occurs in the long term...
...will be corrected in the short term!
This is most often seen when people play games of chance. They'll assume that, say, since they've had such bad luck with rolls of the dice recently, they are somehow "due" for a good roll!
However, in most cases things are independent. The results of the previous roll has no bearing on the current roll!
And just how is this a logical fallacy, T-Rex? It sounds more like basic probability!
Well...
"Well..."
Whatever!

transcription.title: gambling makes you appear more attractive in the eyes of women

panel.line: LOGICAL FALLACY COMICS PRESENTS: "THE GAMBLER'S FALLACY"
The gambler's fallacy is when one assumes that a deviation from what occurs in the long term...
...will be corrected in the short term!
This is most often seen when people play games of chance. They'll assume that, say, since they've had such bad luck with rolls of the dice recently, they are somehow "due" for a good roll!
However, in most cases things are independent. The results of the previous roll has no bearing on the current roll!
And just how is this a logical fallacy, T-Rex? It sounds more like basic probability!
Well...
"Well..."
Whatever!

transcription.title: compressed film comics V

panel.line: COMPRESSED FILM COMICS
today's film:
STAR TREK II: THE WRATH OF KHAN
Oh man!
Khaaaaaaaaan!
Hah hah, OK. You are my son, David, and we are trying to locate the Genesis device, which has been stolen, and which has the awesome power to reshape worlds!
I just hope my arch-nemesis, Khan, a genetically engineered superman from Earth's Eugenic Wars of the 1990s, doesn't show up!
I stranded him on a planet years ago, and he never forgets a face!
To the last, I will grapple with thee! From hell's heart, I stab at thee!
Khan!
That's right Kirk! And though I may think, tactically, in 2 dimensions, I can still destroy your precious Enterprise!
Not if I disable your ship first!
Then I'll engage the Genesis device and blow us both out of the sky!
Scotty, I need war speed in three minutes or we're all dead!
Although I somehow feel as though we'll warp away just as Genesis goes off, and that Spock will die at the end (needs of the many)!

transcription.title: i feel today that my actions will be charged with symbolism

panel.line: I feel today that my actions will be charged with symbolism.
*gasp*

As a male, I take on the position of the Everyman - with the latter syllable perhaps the most important from our post-Feminist perspective. The house clearly represents repressed femininity, at once recalling the blissful days of the past, while reminding us of their fundamental injustices. My action in destroying the house remains a puzzling enigma.
The emphasis on male oppression is continued as I stand poised to crush this woman beneath my man-foot.
No!
I've always seen you more as representing the essential struggle between man and his darker half.
Oh, that is a part of it, to be sure.
...but the desires of my darker nature manifest themselves as misogyny! Surely that must enter into your analysis!

transcription.title: choose your own adventure: free will

panel.line: CHOOSE YOUR OWN ADVENTURE
You're the star of the story! Choose from any possible ending.
FREE WILL
Another beautiful day! Today is a good day you think for some new variety, some new excitement in your life! Turn to panel 2.
You are hit with the sinking realization that you're in a rut: everday, you do the same old things. There must be more to living than this!
You vow to start making changes in your life, today. You can make the big decisions. You can make the small decisions. You are in control. Turn to panel 3.
You are trying to think of some way you can change your life when an old friend of yours happens to stop by. Turn to panel 4.

You chat for a while. You tell him of your day; he tells you about his. It's a pleasant way to pass the time, and soon you have forgotten all about your decision to effect some change in your daily routine. Turn to panel 5.
Only later, in the evening, do you realize that you've spent another day stuck in your self-imposed rut! Another day, down the drain!
Damn. Well, there's nothing you can do about that now. Tomorrow is another day, and you'd better get to bed. Have a nice rest then turn to panel 1.

transcription.title: prequels and faked, um, orgasms

panel.line: HAVE YOU EVER FAKED IT DURING SEX COMICS
No!
Have you, Dromiceiomimus?
Yep.
Yeah...
*sigh*
... yeah, me too.
fin
COMICS IN WHICH EVERYBODY DIES
a prequel
I say we kill all of them!
Seconded!
All: MOTION PASSES!
Meeting adjourned!
NEXT: EVERYBODY DIES! :0

transcription.title: good gossip

panel.line: I demand instant gratification!
SECONDS LATER...
I'm not gratified!
Maybe instant gratification isn't-
Dromiceiomimus! How long have you been standing there?!
Long enough!
POSTSCRIPT: THE NEXT DAY
I'm T-Rex and I demand instant gratification!
Those were my private thoughts! She had no right to tell you!
Hah hah hah! It's good gossip!
Haha, I guess I was being kind of silly!
Listen though, don't tell my mom, okay?

transcription.title: bicycle puns can get tireing

panel.line: I've bought myself a new means of transportation!
A bicycle!
Do you want to go on a bike ride, Dromiceiomimus?
I don't have a bike!
You can watch me!
No thanks!
I'll go on a bike ride with you, T-Rex!
Great!
We can race! We'll ring our little bells as we zoom by pedestrians, making their hair swoosh in the direction of our travel!
This is once race you're going to lose, T-Rex!
Oh really? I think you might find you SPOKE too soon, my friend!
That's a bicycle pun, by the way!
(You can use it if you want!)

transcription.title: political protest poetry (not yet set to music)

panel.line: I've entered a poetry contest!
I can't lose!
Right, Dromiceiomimus? I'm a good poet, right?
Sure! Although I've not heard much of your poetry!
I can assure you that my poetry is great, unlike our current department of state!
Your poetry sounds a little political, T-Rex!
It's how I express myself!
But is this poetry contest for political poems or for, you know, poems about the sky and how magical it is to wake up in the morning?
I can do both! Observe:
I like the flowers and the sky, They light up my spirit and let it fly, They keep my happiness in high supply,
Unlike our current political leadership!
The End, by T-Rex, ps: my soul is chaos!

transcription.title: irresistible to women

panel.line: Lady 1: Whooo!
Lady 2: Hey there, hot stuff!
Lady 3 / Puma: Rrrawl!
Ladies, please! One at a time!
Dromiceiomimus!
Dromiceiomimus, you've got to help me! I've doused myself in a chemical I discovered that makes me seem irresistible to women! Only I've become TOO irresistible! It's out of control!
Sure, I'll help you! Why don't we start with my helping you out in the ways of... PLEASURE?
Oh no! It's affected her too!
I'm doomed!
Well, isn't this what you wanted?
Utahraptor!
You've got to help me, Utahraptor! I don't know what to do!
Why? You're living every teenage boy's fantasy!
It's a stupid fantasy! It doesn't even make sense!
I mean, a chemical that makes me seem irresistible to women? What is that, reverse alcohol?
I like to keep my sexual fantasies grounded in good science, thanks!

transcription.title: fisticuffsmanship

panel.line: Spurred by an insatiable need to better myself, I have taken up a new sport!
That sport, my friends, is fisticuffs!
Do you think I would be good at fisticuffs, Dromiceiomimus?
What is it?
Boxing! The word is a seventeenth-century alliteration of 'fisty' (of the fists) and 'cuff'!
You haven't thought this through! You're just interested in fisticuffs because of the name!
So?
Cheerfully conceded!
Well, you know that you need bigger arms than yours to box with, right? You need arms like mine!
What are you talking about? My arms are powerhouses!
VESTIGIAL powerhouses!
My fists are named "Knuckles" and "Chuckles", for your information!
Spread it around, dig?

transcription.title: treasure hunt, 1950s

panel.line: Okay, so here's the plan! I send cards to all my friends giving them the first clue on a treasure hunt!
Then, they go on the treasure hunt!
Each clue leads them to a further clue in a new location, sending them on an across-town adventure!
The final clue leads them to my house, where they find not only a party with potato chips and barbecued corn, but also the moral that the REAL treasure is friendship!
(I like all my parties to have morals at the end!)
Oh boy, this treasure hunt which I have just explained in detail including the twist at the end will be great!
Agreed!
And since the Dromiceiomimus and I already know what's going on, we can help! We should make it a block party, and invite everyone!
Yeah, like in the fifties! Everybody was neighbourly in the fifties!

And all the men wore hats while the women baked pies! Sure, we had the stability we craved after the turmoil of WWII, but at what cost? Repression both sexual and sociological left lasting scars, leading in many ways to the cultural self-doubt of the 60s but who cares, we've got to plan this party!

transcription.title: parties ruined by god

panel.line: So, I've laid out all the clues around town and I've got the party and barbeque all set up!
I think we're good to go!
Is everything ready Dromiceiomimus?
Yep! I made drinks and set up lawn chairs and even a croquet set!
Excellent! Nothing could possibly go wrong! Not even GOD HIMSELF can wreck this party now!
Bad news, T-Rex: we don't have any cups!
The party! It's ruined!
Wait, did you check the cupboard above the fridge? I usually keep some cups there.
Oh no, I didn't check in there. Hold on a second.
Yep, here they are!
Ha-ha, super!
For a second there, I thought that GOD HIMSELF had wrecked our party, but nope! NOT THIS TIME, ladies!

transcription.title: so anyway, god, he's bad at telling jokes

panel.line: Off-screen character: Great party, T-rex! Hey, do you have any more chips?
Sorry guys, those were the last!
HEY I BROUGHT SOME POTATO CHIPS, T-REX
God! You came!
THAT'S RIGHT SORRY I'M LATE BUT THESE ARE SOME GOOD CHIPS
CHICKEN FLAVOUR
Classy! Glad you could make it!
Who are you talking to, T-rex?
God! But it seems that AS USUAL only I can hear him!
SORRY ABOUT THAT BUT I'VE GOT A GREAT JOKE FOR YOU TO TELL
Got any new jokes, T-rex?
Y-yes?
THIS'LL BE GREAT TELL HIM A SKELETON WENT INTO A BAR AND ORDERED A BET AND A MOP
Utahraptor, a skeleton went into a bar and ordered a beer and a mop!
To clean up the beer; yeah, I get it. That's not a very good joke, T-rex!
SORRY IT'S NORMALLY BETTER THAN THAT
I WAS JUST TRYING OUT SOMETHING NEW
Dude, try it out somewhere else!

transcription.title: corker

panel.line: Yes, my friends, I would have to confess:
Last night was the best party ever!
Wouldn't you agree, Dromiceiomimus? You seemed to be having a great time at the party last night!
Yes, it was quite a corker!
A "corker"? What does THAT mean?
It's old slang! It means something was really good!
LATER...
Hey T-Rex, I left some music at your house!
I know!
I listened to a bit of it: one album was quite the "corker"!
Glad you liked it!
I did! In fact, I thought ALL the music you brought over were corkers!
Great!
"Corker" means something is really good!
I know!
Hah hah! Imagine if we were at a vineyard?

transcription.title: the soundtrack to a life

panel.line: If there were a soundtrack to my life, what would it sound like I wonder?
Imagine if it had vocals! And a drum solo!
It'd be awesome!
Here there would be some ominous music - FOR WILL THE GIRL SURVIVE?
Wait!
The idea of a soundtrack to a life is a stupid idea. You're just going to come across a band of musicians that wants to follow you around?
well, it - - um it's not like they wouldn't get paid
*sob*

transcription.title: mother's day

panel.line: Yesterday was a very special day for many people!
Yesterday was Mother's Day!
Did you give your mom some flowers for Mother's Day, Dromiceiomimus?
I had some delivered!
Excellent! And, attached to the flowers, a note?
You know it, baby!
What about you, T-Rex? What did you do for YOUR mother?
Lots!
I got her some seeds (she likes to garden) and some chocolate (she likes chocolate) and a card I made with a drawing of me hatching from my egg!
Aww! That's cute!
Yeah, but when you open it, it's actually a robot version of me, and I'm shooting red lasers from my eyes that spell out "HAPPY MOTHERS DAY"!
(Mom said it was "very creative"!)

transcription.title: online usernames: bi-curious, bi-plane, bi-centennial_man, bi-nary_boi

panel.line: You know what's the best thing ever?
The word "bicurious"!

It's funny when people use it, because how long can you be bicurious? You don't sit around all day saying, "Hmmm... I wonder what will happen!" - you look it up on the Internet, or you go out, meet someone in the gender you're interested in, and then afterwards roll over and say, "Curiosity satisfied!"
Then it's high fives all around!
You could say it like, "Curiosity: SATISFIED!"
Talking up the word bicurious again?
It's a great word!
For someone who says he isn't "bicurious" you sure spend a lot of time talking about it!
I almost wish I was bicurious, just so I could say, "Curiosity satisfied!"
I'd say it like,
"Curiosity... SATISFIED!!"

transcription.title: holy shit, single bicurious lesbians!

panel.line: "Bicurious"!
Hee hee!
I can't get enough!

The sad thing is that the word is rarely used sincerely anymore - the only place you see it is in those sleazy newspapers with back-page advertisements for "bicurious teens!". Bicurious teens don't need to advertise!
Yeah, or like, "single bicurious lesbians".
Holy shit! Single bicurious lesbians!!
Damn it T-Rex, you're obsessed! You want your "bicuriosity" satisfied?! We'll satisfy it right now!
oh hey utahr-
Wh-
Did you just squeeze my bum?
There! It's done! Now you can stop talking about your damn bicuriosity: it's satisfied!
"Bicuriosity: satisfied"? More like, "Bicuriosity: disappointed by a fumbling and frankly clumsy grope!"
That's right, my friend!
CLUMSY

transcription.title: an adventure through time

panel.line: AN ADVENTURE THROUGH TIME
Oh boy! Today is a good day I think for an adventure through time!
So long, Dromiceiomimus! I'm about to travel back to the age of di- back to long ago!
So long T-Rex! I hope you don't become your own grandfather!
Ooh, can I come along on the adventure through time? Please?
Well... okay!
But you have to promise to let ME choose the time period, and you're not allowed to try to set things up so you become king, alright?
Sure! Fine!
Cause I read your weblog last week, and you were all, "I want to go back in time and set it up so I become king!"
Your current mood was 'kingly'!
I thought to myself, "T-Rex, you'd better make a note of this!"

transcription.title: a moment of empathy

panel.line: Who knew that designing a functional time machine was so difficult?
Not me: that's for darn sure!
Oh, T-Rex! Back from your adventure through time?
NO! It's freaking impossible to build a time machine! My enthusiasm yesterday was clearly UNWARRANTED.
But T-Rex, you really got my hopes up!
I know and I'm sorry!
But you're the skeptical one! You should have realized that I couldn't invent a time machine overnight!
I guess I just got swept up in the enthusiasm.
Oh well.
T-REX HAS A MOMENT OF EMPATHY:
[[Thinking]] Aww!

transcription.title: giant robot suits

panel.line: Alright, so I'd like to build a time machine for Utahraptor so he'll feel better, but building one is clearly way too hard!
Clearly way WAY too hard!
But T-Rex, what if time travel is not just hard, but impossible? If time travel is possible, where are all the tourists from the future?
B-busy?
Maybe they're wearing their invisibility suits!
Or MAYBE all my friends are tourists from the future, sent to observe me!
Good morning, T-Rex!
Good morning! Say, if you were sent from the future to observe me, you'd let me know, right?
I wouldn't be allowed to. But, I would get drunk once, and start asking you why it's taking you guys so long to come up with flying cars and robot suits.
Robot suits?
Yeah, they're like these giant robot suits that you can strap yourself into and--
You're crazy!

transcription.title: fresh prince of bel air

panel.line: Now this is a story all about how my life got flipped, turned upside down. And I'd like to take a minute - just sit right there -
I'll tell you how I became the prince of a town called B el-Air!

In West Philadelphia, born and raised: on the playground was where I spent most of my days! Chillinh out, maxin', relaxing all cool and all shooting some b-ball outside of the school, when a couple of guys (they were up to no good) started making trouble in my neighbourhood! I got in ONE LITTLE FIGHT and my mom got scared, and said
You're moving with your Auntie and Uncle in Bel-Air!
I whistled for a cab and when it came near, the license plate said "fresh" and it had dice in the mirror!
T-Rex?
ssh!
If anything I could say that this cab was rare, but I thought, "Nah, forget it: yo home, to Bel-Air!"
You
pulled
up to a house about seven or eight and you yelled to the cabbie, "Yo homes, smell you later!"?
Looked at my kingdom, I was finally there, to sit on my throne as the prince of Bel-Air!
Awesome! Okay, what was it you wanted to talk about?

transcription.title: ticket restrictions

panel.line: Fares are not guaranteed until paid in full and tickets issued.
Check restrictions: tickets may be non-refundable!
We recommend that sufficient insurance be purchased to cover all of your travel requirements.
Tickets are not transferable. No one else can travel with this ticket.
No refunds are permitted on this fare.
What are you talking about, T-Rex?
I'm explaining the rules of travel!
Well, the rules of travel for the particular set of tickets I bought. Rerouting is not permitted!
But the number of people who would be interested in this is small, is it not? Small enough to be limited entirely to yourself?
You act as if the purpose of my life is to entertain others!
Any changes to dates are subject to availability.

transcription.title: you know what's funny? death.

panel.line: You know what's funny?
Death!
Hah hah! Cause you're just walking along, and then it's "whoops! I'm DEAD!"
Eh, Dromiceiomimus?
"whoops!"
That's not funny, T-Rex! It's tragic!
What, death?
Yes, death! Would you find it so funny if you died?
Well, my friend: that depends. Did I die in a funny way? For instance, did I smoke a cigarette, and then my eyes exploded?
Hah hah! The dangers of smoking!
Seriously though, you should quit.

transcription.title: what's for dinner? societal norms.

panel.line: What's for dinner tonight, T-Rex?
Well T-Rex, I don't know!
What would you like, T-Rex?
I always choose what's for dinner, T-Rex! You decide tonight.
Hmm... in that case, T-Rex, let's have nachos tonight! It'll be fun!
My friend, I'm afraid you've gone insane! You're coo-coo crazy!
Why's that?
You're talking to yourself like you are two different people, and it is a societal norm that people who do that are insane.
Don't talk to me about societal norms! We walk around naked!
Observe!

transcription.title: the secret to being loved

panel.line: I have determined something exciting! Brace yourselves, for what I have discovered is nothing less than...
the SECRET to BEING LOVED!
It's so easy!
[text covered by Dromiceiomimus]
Have you seen my keys?
huh?
Oh, no.
so anyway, the secret I discovered to being loved is simply -
Hey!
Hey, what's up?
Not much!
I was just talking about the secret to being loved.
Yikes! Count me out!
Ok, some other time!

transcription.title: that's not really what you want to hear your band founder say, but shoot, sign me up!

panel.line: Okay, so who wants to join my bluegrass band?
I have decided that I am starting a bluegrass band!
Dromiceiomimus, do you know how to play any bliuegrass instruments? Do you know how to play the banjo, or fiddle, or a mandola?
I do not!
Then I am sorry but you cannot be in my bluegrass band!
What is your bluegrass band called and what instrument do you play, T-Rex?
The band is called "Burned Bluegrass" and I play the lyrics!
You mean you sing the lyrics.
Yes. I will be honest with you: I am new to this "band" thing.
However, I do know what I like! At present, I like the idea of starting a bluegrass band.
Hah hah! Who knows what tomorrow will bring?

transcription.title: that's what your jaws are for

panel.line: I certainly didn't sneak into the Utahraptor's house and eat his food again, that's for darn sure!
Blaming others removes suspicion from myself!
Dromiceiomimus, are those crumbs on your chin? Did you sneak into the Utahraptor's house and eat his food?
No and no! I, unlike YOU, never do stuff like that.
I don't know... seems to me like maybe you did!
Stop eating my food, damn it! You have the ability to go find your own nourishment!
Who, me?
Yes, you, T-REX. Somebody's eaten my food and whenever that happens it's always you.
I can tell because all the cookies are gone, but you left behind anything with vegetables in it!
Hah hah! Yep!

transcription.title: your verb tense is inappropriate, my dear

panel.line: DINOSAUR COMICS
Dinosaurs were giant ferocious lizards!
They were a constant threat to everyone around them! They were known to destroy human property with impunity!
Dinosaurs were also known to destroy human LIFE with impunity!
I notice you're using the past tense!
Yes indeed. I'm experimenting with it.
You're experimenting with using inappropriate verb tenses.
Yes, well- It seemed like a good idea at the time!
Or should I say, it will have been seeming like a good idea at the time?
Perhaps not!

transcription.title: emails

panel.line: Hey, I wonder if I got any emails while I was out?
Oh boy! Emails!
BACK AT HOME:
What? No emails?!
SHORTLY...
Dromiceiomimus, how come you never send me any emails?
I see you in person often enough! What do you want emails for?
I want emails!
You'd get more emails if you sent more out!
But I already do!
I sent you four surveys AND an email where if I forwarded it, some charity would get 3 cents AND a list I found of reasons why T-Rexes are better than Utahraptors (green is the new black!)
Man, I don't need that sort of stuff in my mailbox! I meant REAL emails.
Do you mean to imply that T-Rexes are not better than Utahraptors?
Because if so, I would advise you to check your email!

transcription.title: emails

panel.line: Hey, I wonder if I got any emails while I was out?
Oh boy! Emails!
BACK AT HOME:
What? No emails?!
SHORTLY...
Dromiceiomimus, how come you never send me any emails?
I see you in person often enough! What do you want emails for?
I want emails!
You'd get more emails if you sent more out!
But I already do!
I sent you four surveys AND an email where if I forwarded it, some charity would get 3 cents AND a list I found of reasons why T-Rexes are better than Utahraptors (green is the new black!)
Man, I don't need that sort of stuff in my mailbox! I meant REAL emails.
Do you mean to imply that T-Rexes are not better than Utahraptors?
Because if so, I would advise you to check your email!

transcription.title: indian food

panel.line: So the Rajasaurus down the street and I went out for dinner last night. It was great!
It was an oppertunity for me to showcase my sparkling wit!
For Instance: she mentioned how even though she had been raised outside of the Indian subcontinent by non-traditional parents, she still really liked indian food.
I put down my fork and said that was good, since anything she ate would be, by definition, Indian food!
(She's Indian!)
That's pretty clever, my friend!
I know!
Since she's an Indian dinosaur, she cant help but have anything she eats become Indian food!
That's the joke I made!
Clever!
Thanks!
I mean it, that's really clever!
Hah hah!
Okay!

transcription.title: compressed origin story comics - spider-man

panel.line: COMPRESSED ORIGIN STORY COMICS
Today's origin story: SPIDER-MAN
I'm Midtown High's only professional wallflower!
Oh boy, a science demonstration! What's this, a spider?
ONE SPIDER BITE LATER...
Outta my way, kid! I'm a thief fleeing from a crime I just committed!
Ha ha, that's OK! While I HAVE recently gained the proportional speed and strength of a spider, not to mention my keen "spider sense", from now on I just look out for "Number One" - that means... ME!
What's with you, mister?! All you hadda do was hold him just for a minute!
Save your breath, buddy!
I've got things to do!
Okay, but with great power comes great responsibility!
Oh, I'm sure I'll learn that in time! For instance, if that thief went on to kill my Uncle Ben, then that moral would certai-
- would certainly present itself...

transcription.title: hey, i heard you were pissed off!

panel.line: Off-frame: What's the matter, T-Rex? You look down!
I'm just fine!
Off-frame: You look a little down!
I said, "I'm fine!"
LATER...
...and so the REASON I 'look a little down' is that suddenly everybody's talking about me and acting so concerned for my feelings! It's unnerving and it makes me mad!
Mad enough to stomp on a house?
I do that anyway; you know that!
Hey, I heard you were pissed off!
You heard right, my friend!
Do you want to talk about it?
Talking about it is what's made me angry!
So, no!

transcription.title: comics about homecare

panel.line: COMICS ABOUT HOMECARE
Homecare is when doctors or nurses visit you in your own home!
While some feel this leads to better care and increased comfort for patients...
...others feel it places an unnecessary strain on our already-burdened hospitals and health care system!
What's your opinion on the issue, T-Rex?
I have none!
I feel as though I haven't considered enough information in order to form a defensible point of view!
Really! That's quite restrained of you.
BUT... WHAT IF THE T-REX HADN'T BEEN SO RESTRAINED?
FUCK homecare!

transcription.title: flying kites

panel.line: I note that it is certainly windy out today.
Holy cow! We should go fly kites!
Dromiceiomimus, want to go fly a kite with me?
I don't have a kite!
We'll make them! All we need are some sticks, fabric, string, ingenuity!
I have ample kite-making experience!
You do?
Wow. You know, you never cease to surprise me, my friend. I thought I was breaking new ground by having an interest in kites, but here it turns out you have ample experience!
The interest dates back to my childhood!
[[T-Rex is flying a kite while wearing an exuberant expression]]

transcription.title: the verbose garden

panel.line: I've planted a garden around my house, and it is very pretty!
Best garden ever, if I do say so myself!
Do you have a garden, Dromiceiomimus?
Yes I do, T-Rex!
Is it nice, Dromiceiomimus?
It's very nice, thank you, T-Rex!
Glad to hear it, Dromiceiomimus!
There you are! I need my gardening shovel back.
Aww, you wrecked it!
Wrecked what?
We were playing a game! You were SUPPOSED to say my name at the end of each sentence.
That's a stupid game.
T-Rex (thinking): Two days later, I would come to realise the truth of his words.

transcription.title: hilarious differences between the sexes

panel.line: HILARIOUS DIFFERENCES BETWEEN THE SEXES
presented using a primarily-male cast of dinosaurs
Oh boy!
I bet I can figure out hundreds of hilarious differences!
For instance: as a male, I can be impatient, sometimes to my own detriment! Notice how I destroy this house rather than walking around it.
I am a more patient woman and I did not resort to violence to solve my problems!
It is as if we are from two different planets!
Yes, the two sexes certainly do have some hilarious differences!
Indeed!
For instance, my mother was left, at the age of 22 and with two children to care for, by a sometimes-abusive, always-absent husband.
I know this may be sexist, but I don't believe a woman is capable of such neglect.
LATER...
Hey!
I can also pee standing up!

transcription.title: l'esprit d'escalier

panel.line: "L'esprit d'escalier" means, literally, "the wit of the staircase"!
(It's French!)
It refers to when you think of a witty comeback too late, and you've already left the room!
Of course, this idea is largely alien to ME, as I'm never at a loss for a witty riposte!
However, it seems for others, thinking of the perfect comeback hours, or even days later, is a more-than-rare occurrence.
You've got a pretty high opinion of your wit, T-Rex!
As usual!
Yes, as usual. What if I made a stinging insult in your direction - would you be able to come up with the perfect rejoinder?
I would!
Well then, how are you going to answer ... THIS!
SHORTLY
Good one!
Thanks!

transcription.title: t-rex in: a contract with god

panel.line: T-REX IN: "A CONTRACT WITH GOD"
T-REX LET'S MAKE A DEAL
Sure thing, dude!
OKAY SO HERE'S THE DEAL
BUILD ME A TEMPLE
Oh-kay!
LATER...
Damn it, it's too hard to find temple building materials!
What?
Ah, forget it! I was going to build a temple for God, but it's too hard. I will simply VIOLATE our VERBAL CONTRACT.
I have no idea what you're talking about!
I HEARD THAT YOU KNOW
Whoops!

transcription.title: generic rooms

panel.line: I had some companions over to my house last night and gave them a tour! It was a smashing success, except for one thing:
Some of them thought that my rooms "lacked identity"!
When I (politely) pressed them to explain, they said that while the rooms were decorated nicely, they were decorated generically and little to off that was unique to me.
How did this make you feel?
A little miffed, a little peeved: a little upset!
Well, what do your rooms look like?
You haven't seen them?
No: you haven't invited me over since you got your new place.
Well, do you want to come over now?
To see generic rooms? No thanks!
BACK AT HOME...
I like the white!

transcription.title: comics with twist/non-twist endings

panel.line: COMICS WITH NON-TWIST ENDINGS
I declare this to be "stomp on houses" day!
LATER:
Whoooo!
THE END
COMICS WITH TWISTS AND TURNS!
Hey T-Rex!
Hey there!
Listen, I was wondering if you -
HOLD ON TIGHT!
Um, listen, I-
SUDDENLY!
... so, um, I was wondering if-
JUST THEN!
THE END!
I can't hear you!

transcription.title: quick! save your game!

panel.line: I have been wondering what it would be like if people could "save" and "restore" their life, just like in a computer game.
Things would be different!
I predict every guy would, when he has his first sweetie break up with him, spend YEARS restoring to an earlier point, trying to find a way to get it to work!
Additionally, I would use this power to save my game, tell people off, then restore!
The only problem is everyone would always (eventually) have the perfect comeback!
But we'd be stuck in a certain time period, because people would never die!
Sure they would!
You know how sometimes you save at a bad point and it's half a second before you're going to die, and you keep restoring, but there's nothing you can do?
Sure...
Well, I guess you could just restore to an earlier save point.
I have failed to prove my point!

transcription.title: home movies

panel.line: Okay - um, okay!
"I - I've been awakened by nuclear testing!" um
"Rawr!"
"Oh boy, I see in the distance a villag- CITY that I can destroy!"
"Look out humanity! For I embody... um...
Post-war nuclear paranoia!
Right, right! "LOOK OUT, humanity! I embody post-war nuclear paranoia!"
Was that okay?
Cut! Cut, cut, cut!
What? That was perfect!
It was awful! Look, I know you're trying your best, and your my friend, T-Rex, but you didn't even memorize your lines!
I did!
You didn't! Look, it's my movie, and I'm going to put the Dromiceiomimus in the lead.
WHAT

transcription.title: a case of cuttlefish

panel.line: A CASE OF CUTTLEFISH
I believe I shall take a brief repose to calm my agitated nerves!
Ah, 'tis something soothing to discover yourself engaged in something you very much enjoy.
Stomping for me is one such pass-time!
Good sir! I pray that you stop!
What knavery?
I ask only for your attention, for my sister is deathly ill with the cholera!
Why, we dined together just a fortnight ago, did we not?
I remember it well; I had a disappointing dish of cuttlefish.
Do you not recall how I remarked on my disappointment?

transcription.title: life-sized cardboard cutouts

panel.line: T-REX IN: "THE LIFE-SIZED CARDBOARD CUTOUT"
It's the perfect plan!
And so simple!
whenever I don't want to face my problems, I'll send, in my stead, a cardboard cutout of myself!
Ideally, he'll have an intense, yet thoughtful expression on his face. People will say, "Oh, I'd better just leave T-Rex alone: he's intense yet thoughtful!"
And you believe people will fall for this, no doubt!
I do!
LATER:
Oh, that's clearly a cardboard cutout.
LATER:
See, that's clearly you standing very still as IF you were a cardboard cutout.
[[thinking]] just a little closer...

transcription.title: credit card fraud

panel.line: "CREDIT CARD FRAUD"
Credit card fraud is a growing problem in today's society!

I believe the fault of this lies in the inherent design flaws of the credit card system. If I give a credit card to someone, that should authorize one purchase, for a specific amount, at that specific time! Instead, knowing someone's credit card information allows you to make charges to it for any amount, at any time, all over the world!
This certainly is a lot of talk about credit cards! Aren't there any more pressing issues, T-Rex?
Like what?
Oh, like, I don't know... WORLD HUNGER?
But I don't know how to solve that problem! I do have opinions about the broken credit card infrastructure, however.
It's my blessing and my curse!

transcription.title: these just showed up in my mail, unsolicited!

panel.line: "DINOSAUR COMICS" by Morley Callaghan.

It is true that as a dinosaur, the T-Rex should have been inclined toward gnashing his ferocious jaws and making claws of his little hands, but he had been stomping on things for so long that no one remembered a time when he had gnashed instead of stomped.
Inside, he wanted to gnash, but he doubted himself. He knew that he could stomp. He was not sure he could gnash.
"DINOSAUR COMICS" by Robert Service.
Well it was long ago, on some grim plateau, When this story first was told, About a land in fear made more severe By a terrible threat of old.
And though the men were brave, the risks were grave In these misty days of yore; None could ever be safe, in this ancient place, From the threat of Dinosaur.
Now the dinosaurs had their fearsome roars, But they had their friendships, too; And while they stalked they often talked, And debated what was true.
"DINOSAUR COMICS" by Kurt Vonnegut.
Dinosaurs were giant reptiles that lived long ago. They looked like this:

transcription.title: a mirror universe, if you will

panel.line: I wonder, are there any universes parallel to our own?
A "mirror" universe, if you will!
But perhaps in this universe, different decisions were made. Choice piles upon choice, until the world is a strangely different place!
It raises many philosophical questions!
For instance: is there any true Self?
What a brave new world it would be...
Interesting!
Your self-vocalized musings provide the perfect segue into my announcement that I have discovered a way to travel between universes!
Seriously?
Just watch!
All I have to do is concentrate, and...
Noo! Don't do it!
<<POOM>>

transcription.title: things it is cool to do

panel.line: THINGS IT IS COOL TO DO
Two chicks at once!
Hah hah! Awesome!
Dromiceiomimus, do you think it's cool to do two chicks at once?
I object to the word "Chicks"! Change it to "women".
Okay, it's cool to do two women at once!
I object to the fact that this includes chicks, but excludes dudes!
FINE.
It's cool to do two non-gender-identified people at once.
That's super cool!
Then we're agreed!
LATER:
Hey ladies!

transcription.title: something to do with history

panel.line: Historically speaking, all I know are broad stereotypes! For instance, most people in the Middle Ages all wore dumpy clothes and spent all day hoeing.
Now, I know that can't be accurate!

What I need is some cultural context, but it seems like most of that is lost. What was it like living as a teenager 40 years ago? I have no idea! And anyone who did know has now grown up, so they don't REALLY know either, on account of memories altering over time.
So much information is lost!
It's the beauty of life, T-Rex! You can't really know anyone, even in the present, except for yourself!
And that's beautiful?
Well, it might as well be, since it's all we've got.
Hmm, I guess this is why people keep diaries: to fight against this inexorable loss!
Too bad they lose!

transcription.title: ryan in ny / per jorner fills in: mary sue comics

panel.line: T-REX IN: MARY SUE COMICS
I have finally completed my theory of everything, toiling in selfless, unappreciated obscurity.
Surely a little recognition is more than I could ever hope for!
T-Rex, I read your brilliant theory! It puts every other scientist to shame - indeed, all of dinokind!
Thank you! I did only what came naturally to me.
You are so wise and modest, T-Rex! I hope I can be your friend forever.
I'm the one who's been working against you in the faculty! Please accept my apologies, T-Rex!
I see now that I've been petty and unfair and all I really wanted was to have a little of your attention. Can you ever forgive me and let me admire you from a distance?
Well...OK! Let's hug!
A LITTLE SOMETHING JUST FOR YOU T-REX
A Nobel Prize! You shouldn't have!

transcription.title: ryan in ny / per jorner fills in: pragmatism

panel.line: I finally figured out how to gain the upper hand on that stupid utahraptor. I will adopt for my own the philosophy of pragmatism.
From now on, I'll be sticking to things that WORK!

For instance, some might say that the destruction of this log cabin violates fundamental principles. But if I were to show that it is a necessary means to a noble end, such arguments are revealed to be petty and ideological!
Pragmatism!
But you didn't... oh well, too late.
Similarly -
T-Rex, stop! you cannot invoke pragmatism itself as an argument!
Any pragmatic view must still be rooted in an idea of what's good and desirable. Stating what does and does not "work" is not a moral and philosophical passkey!
According to your fancy logic, perhaps, but I happen to live in the REAL world.
Oh, I see. "Questioning everyone's motives but your own" mode today, huh?
You're just jealous because you didn't think of it first!

transcription.title: ryan in ny / per jorner fills in: disasterous events

panel.line: BASED ON A TRUE STORY!
Disastrous events seem less horrible when they happen: a) As part of an ongoing process over time...
b) To people we do not usually identify with, and...
c) Far away!

That's why we are shocked and horrified by a shoot-out at the local cafeteria, but barely bat an eyelid when we read in the paper that 20,000 Bangladeshi have drowned in the Pacific. It's just the way of things!
That's silly! Bangladesh isn't even on the shores of the Pacific.
Um, that's right. I was thinking of something else.
