Morbidly funny image, though - makes you wonder what they were all doing there.
Yeah! See?
It's funny because it's far away!

transcription.title: ryan in ny / per jorner fills in: treasure map

panel.line: Today is a good day I think for stomp, stomp, stomp, stomp, stomp and eggs.
Minus the eggs!
Lovely stomp, wonderful stomp! Little house, how would you like a moderate dose of stompage today?
Don't mention it!
Some time later...
Stomp! Stomp!
T-Rex! Exciting news!
My uncle left me this treasure map which shows the location of buried doubloons in relation to several carefully placed log cabins!
Let's go look for them!
Those pirates should have used more permanent structures for reference!
Like TREES!

transcription.title: ryan in ny / per jorner fills in: derivative comics

panel.line: VAGUELY SELF-REFERENTIAL AND DERIVATIVE COMICS
I had the most disturbing thought today...
By being true to yourself, you are forever derivative!

Novice artists spend years looking for their "own voice" only to find they've painted themselves into a corner or waited for a bus that never comes! And what of myself? Do I stomp tis house because I want to, or because I can't think of anything else?
There! I did it again.
To be free we must give ourselves up to being totally protean and chameleonic!
Sigh.
You're assuming that no voice is better than another. But it's perfectly natural to seek variety of expression within a set format, in the arts as well as in life and society!
The totally unpredictable is also void of interest!
Oh yeah?
Maybe I'll expect a new format of rebuttal from you next time!

transcription.title: a brief history of charles babbage

panel.line: A BRIEF HISTORY OF CHARLES BABBAGE AND HIS WONDERFUL CALCULATING ENGINES COMICS
Charles Babbage spent a lot of his time working on mechanical calculating engines!
These were machines that could add and subtract, and later multiply and divide (through repeated addition and subtraction), forecasting in many ways the design of modern-day computers!
Unfortunately the machines, with thousands of tiny gears and cogs, were too complex, beyond his means to fully manufacture at the time (early 1800s).
While some see Babbage as the father of modern computers, he had little actual influence!
Yes, quite right!

This is because many of the innovations in his Analytical Engine, such as conditional branching and a separation of processing and memory, were left to be re-discovered by a new generation of pioneers!
Indeed!
This concludes the brief history of Charles Babbage and his wonderful calculating engines!

transcription.title: self-improvement: time to make some changes around here

panel.line: It's time to make some changes around here! Some things have been allowed to slide for too long!
T-REX IN: "IT'S TIME TO MAKE SOME CHANGES AROUND HERE"
But rather than point out the failings of others, I will first endeavour to improve myself!
A WEEK LATER...
Hey! Where have you been all week?
Off improving myself!
Really! So I'm talking to the new improved T-Rex?
Yep! Ask me anything.
Y-You don't-
Self improvement isn't a trivia context, T-Rex!
WHAT IF... SELF IMPROVEMENT REALLY WAS A TRIVIA CONTEST?
Brussels!
Person off-panel: Incorrect!
This contest doesn't even make sense in the first place.

transcription.title: sexual ambiguity

panel.line: Sexual ambiguity!
What's it all about?
I mean -
Am I right?
You seem a little less persuasive than usual!
Hmm!
Perhaps it's because instead of arguing a point, you're just asking us if you're right?
Well - come on!
SEXUAL ambiguity!
What's it all about?

transcription.title: LODGE a complaint

panel.line: MIRROR UNIVERSE COMICS
Say "goodbye" to your house, Dromiceiomimus! If you don't like it, you can LODGE a complaint... with my foot!
Ha ha ha!
I love being bad - I mean I love being good! Because "bad" is "good" to us! And by "us", I mean the entire Universe.
T-Rex, is that you?
The Utahraptor?
Uncanny! I seemed to have switched places with my mirror-universe alternate!
T-Rex, you've got to stop the madness that seems to grip this Universe! There is another way to live: a way based on peace and mutual respect!
T:Rex: Where's your goatee?
I don't have a goatee! That Utahraptor has moved to... Good God! He's in my universe!
Sweet!

transcription.title: god vs. the stolen bike

panel.line: T-REX IT'S BEEN A WHILE
God! How's it going?
OH YOU KNOW SAME OLD SAME OLD
Good to hear it!
YEA IT LOOKS LIKE THINGS ARE OK WITH YOU TOO
Yep! Things are pretty okay! So, um, any particular reason why we're talking?
YOU KNOW JUST CHECKING IN WITH MY MAIN MAN
Somebody stole my bike, T-Rex!
Oh no!
DON'T WORRY GUYS I'M ON THE CASE
Don't worry! God and I will help you look for your bike!
Well, with God on the case, it will be returned for sure! One giant hand reaching down from the sky, with bike, coming up!
TELL HIM I DON'T DO THAT ANYMORE
He doesn't do that anymore!
MY HAND GETS SORE

transcription.title: this summer: the earth stops and everybody flies into a wall

panel.line: I have an idea for the ULTIMATE disaster movie: basically, what happens is the Earth stops dead in its orbit one day, and everybody flies into a wall!
(Or, if they're outside, into the sky!)
Hah hah!
Best movie ever!
So It'd be told in a series of shorts: each short starts a little before everybody flies into a wall, and ends with everybody flying into a wall.

It would be SO GOOD! You start out small: regular people, a fat guy at a buffet, building up to a parking lot full of cars tumbling into the sky, the star quarterback kicking the ball and then he, and everybody else in the game, flying up after it.
Your movie sounds awesome!
I know!
But wouldn't it get a little repetitive?

No way! The viewers would know what's going on after the first few shorts, so you play off those expectations. Like, there's this shot of a really elaborate wedding, and the audience is all, "Oh man, all those people are going to fly into a wall SO HARD!"
And?
And then we cut to years afterwards, when they're old and stooped, holding hands out on the porch, and THEN the Earth stops in its orbit and they fly off together into the sky!
Hah hah! Two tickets, please!

transcription.title: the bad news is there's finitely many songs about sad robots

panel.line: I submit that there are a finite number of songs! Therefore, the art of writing music is the art of exploring a closed space of possibility.
Consider the following!

There are effective limits on what constitutes music. If we take a week as a very generous upper-bound on the length of one song, then we have a temporal limit. Furthermore, since our ears are not able to distinguish between very similar tones, we do not have a continuum of notes, but rather, a finite set. Therefore, there are only so many songs that can be written!
I am forced to disagree with you, my friend!
Surely not!
I think that you're omitting many dimensions of song. What about the way it's played, the lyrics? These too can be varied almost indefinitely.
Almost, but there are still effective limits, therefore: finite number of songs!
SHOCK ENDING:
Or are there?

transcription.title: and i didn't even get to ken thompson's "reflections on trusting trust"

panel.line: T-REX AS: "THE COMPUTER SCIENTIST'
Computers store information in binary code, which is a series of 1s and 0s!
In fact, ALL information in a computer - text, video, sound, even PORNOGRAPHIC IMAGES - are stores in the same fashion, as 1s and 0s. Here's the interesting part:
Any series of 1s and 0s can be converted (quite easily) into a regular number! So, for instance, your favorite song is contained - quite literally - in one single, 4 million digit number.
So copyright las is in a state of self-contradiction!
Quit right!

You can't copyright a fact (like a number), but you can copyright a creative work, like a song or a piece of software. But since one can be transformed into another, copueight law is logically INCOHERENT.
That's really cool!
I know!
But, being really cool IS one of the perks of being a computer scientist!

transcription.title: compression schemes

panel.line: T-REX AS: "THE COMPUTER SCIENTIST"
part 2
Okay, so we covered how everything in a computer is stored in binary code!

And we covered how any series of binary digits (called bits) can be transformed into a number. But these numbers are really large! They take a long time to send to someone. Luckily, it's possible to send any number, and therefore any file of ANY size, using only two
single
bits.
Sure, all you need are sychronized timers! Send one bit to say 'start counting' and a second to say 'stop!'
What?
Yeah! Then all you have to do is count the amount of time between when you got the 'start' and 'end' bits, and that's your number! Transform it into binary code, and you've got your file!
Well - yeah!
Ha ha, I knew it! I am the smartest dude!
Yeah, but there's more to being smart than knowing compression schemes!
No there's not!
[[Thought bubble]] T-Rex: He knows the secret!!

transcription.title: movie etiquette

panel.line: T-REX IN: "MOVIE ETIQUETTE."
Okay, so I can accept that nobody applauds at the end of a film anymore.
(Even though it is the classy thing to do!)
But what is up with the staff coming in to clean up before the credits are even half over? That's just rude!
You're a dying breed, my friend! There are only a few credit watchers left!
Yeah, why do you watch the credits?
I like them!
It gives me time to think about the movie I just saw.
Man, I hate to stay for the credits!
This is why we can't see movies together!
T-REX FROM THE FUTURE TRAVELS BACK IN TIME TO THIS EXACT MOMENT
This is why we can't see movies together!
HEY!
Stay away from women named "Susan"!

transcription.title: i like my rum like i like my women

panel.line: I like my women like I like my cars!
Expensive!
I like my women like I like my cars!
Foreign?
Good one! Um...
Fast?
Low-maintenance?
Freshly waxed, with a GPS tracking system?
T-Rex, this is insanely sexist!
hee hee!
Besides, I like my women like I like my databases!
Manageable?
Out-of-panel: Corrupted?
Eww!

transcription.title: a moral allegory

panel.line: A MORAL ALLEGORY
T-Rex [[whispers]]: T- oh my gosh!
T-Rex [[whispers]]: I've lost my voice!
T-Rex [[whispers]]: This is a disaster! Dromiceiomimus, you have to help me!
Ha ha, nope! Maybe this will let US get a word in edgewise!
T-Rex [[whispers]]: I let you guys talk! I am always interested in what you have to say!
LATER...
I heard you lost your voice!
It's back!
And, I've learned my lesson: always listen to others!
THE END
JUST IN CASE:
I represented vanity!

transcription.title: the old 'culture by association' trick

panel.line: I've never seen the world, but that's going to change...
...today!
Dromiceiomimus, I am going to go on a trip around the world. Would you like to be my "travelling companion"?
Sure! Although, the emphasis you placed on "travelling companion" does fill me with some suspicion.
Ha ha! Little does she know!
Little does who know what?
Little does the Dromiceiomimus know that I intend to show her the great vistas of the world, and by doing so, make her fall in love with me!
Ah, the old "culture by association" trick!
Wait-
It's been done before?

transcription.title: math jokes: eigenvouch for that!

panel.line: The other day I heard a math joke that I just had to share! So there's this party, right?
A party of functions!

All of the functions are there: e^x, (pi)r^2, i^2, even some old-school guys like abs(x). Anyway, poor e^x is alone in a corner, acting all morose. His good friend 2^x comes over and says, "What's the problem? Come on, integrate yourself into the party!" And e^x looks at him and he says, "Why? It's not going to make a difference!"
Hah hah!
Oh boy, are we telling math jokes?
We are!
I didn't know you liked math jokes!
Oh, eigenvouch that I do!
BOO!
Ha ha! You know, some people say pi r squared, but I know they're round!
That's it!
Friendship annulled!!
Well, I hope wherever the Utahraptor ended up, he's alright. Maybe he landed in a Universe just like ours, but where one simple thing has undergone a sinister - and illustrative - change!
Or maybe he's travelled to the Universe of the Lesbains!
But I guess no matter where he is, this is the end of our daily conversations... I don't know what I'm going to do with the second half of my day if he's not around.
*sigh*
Alternate Utahraptor: T-Rex?
Utahraptor, it's you! You're back from the alternate universe! But... something's different...
Alternate Utahraptor: No! Nothing is different!
Alternate Utahraptor: I am the same Utahraptor as always!
Prove it!
Alternate Utahraptor: I frequently debunk your theories!
*gasp*

transcription.title: you are great: a web card

panel.line: YOU ARE GREAT
a web card
Dear recipient of this comic:
Whoever sent this to you thinks you are great!
Let's assume this person is a guy. Boy, does he ever like you! He likes you so much he lets someone else do his writing for him and uses pre-packaged sentimen-
- But that's not the point.
The point is, this card is to tell you that you are great.
Wait, what were you saying about pre-packaged sentiment?
Nothing!
Were you perhaps implying that the emotions of someone who feels he can't properly express them are somehow less valid than those of someone who can?
Nope!
Well, good! Cause that's wrong!
THE END:
Dear recipient of this comic, whoever sent this to you thinks you are great!

transcription.title: neoclassical pastiche

panel.line: "Life is a neoclassical pastiche"!
This is gold!
Dromiceiomimus, would you agree that life is a neoclassical pastiche?
I would not, as I think you couldn't even define what a neoclassical pastiche is, my friend.
Well, Dromiceiomimus, I think it's pretty clear.
Ah, yes indeed! Life is a neoclassical pastiche, and I, a great philosopher.
No you're not!
And you should stop saying that, because saying life is a neoclassical pastiche is ridiculous, and nobody agrees with you.
Oh yeah? Let's put it to the public, shall we?
Fine! Let's do it right now!
Excuse me! Everybody? Would you say it's true that life is a neoclassical pastiche?
Somebody say yes!

transcription.title: compressed novel comics: lolita

panel.line: COMPRESSED NOVEL COMICS
today's book: LOLITA by Vladimir Nabokov
Lolita, light of my life! Fire of my loins! My sin, my soul!
Ha ha, so seriously, I have a thing for 12-year-old girls. I'm ashamed of it, and yet -
- and yet, I certainly enjoy marrying widows in order to gain access to their pubescent daughters!
What you're doing is wrong!
Oh, but I love her, my Lolita!

I love her SO MUCH that I never let her out of my sight and try to keep her locked in the house as much as possible! AND, I deny her her allowance if she, in her childish way, won't give me certain favours. My love for her is THAT POWERFUL.
Makes sense.
LATER:
She ran away?!

transcription.title: life is beautiful but sad sometimes

panel.line: Another beautiful day: such nice sun, a fresh scent in the air, and I'm out for a walk!
Yes indeed, it's good to be young!
Hmm, but would it be better to be both young and in love.
*sigh*
Life is beautiful but sad sometimes!
Maybe you should write something about it!
Sometimes writing lets you explore your feelings better.
"Explore your feelings"? Shuck that jive, man! Feelings are for sissies and the elderly!
Whom, it's worth noting, I respect!

transcription.title: how to attract women!

panel.line: HOW TO ATTRACT WOMEN
Attracting women is easy!

Personally, I rely on my rugged physique and piercing orange eyes (in which, because they are so deep and soulful, one feels they could drown), coupled with my delightful conversational skills and coquettish flair!
This is not much help to people who do not have such coquettish flair!
True!
In that case, I would advise them to meet women on the Internet.
That's your advice. "How to meet women: use the Internet."
Yes!
If you don't have the Internet, put up flyers around town!

transcription.title: another wedding: dance with all the pretty girls

panel.line: This weekend, I go on a trip! I trip DOWN SOUTH.
Another friend of mine is getting married!
This will be my first heterosexual wedding. I'm excited! I got a nice card and everything!
The only thing I'm worried about is the dancing. I have such big, manly feet that sometimes they get in the way!
I can teach you how to dance!
Oh, would you?
Shortly:
You're getting better!
Whoo!
Thanks!
Now all the pretty girls will want to dance with me for sure!

transcription.title: The King of the Dance

panel.line: Oh man... best wedding ever!
And with my new dance moves, I "tore up the dance floor"!
Are you sure it wasn't just a confidence thing? A sort of "the new dance moves were in you all along" thing?
I was - until you asked! Hmmm...
So, T-Rex! How did it go?
It went fine!
But I'm beginning to suspect that the dance moves were in me all along!
No, that's wrong. I taught you the dance moves.
Are you sure? Cause I sure felt like I was the King of the Dance that night!
To clarify, I meant to imply that the King of the Dance was self-taught!
I should have mentioned that sooner; otherwise, my statement makes less sense.

transcription.title: this is all the ID i need

panel.line: HEY T-REX THE NEXT TIME SOMEBODY ASKS YOU FOR ID YOU SHOULD PULL DOWN YOUR PANTS AND SAY THIS IS ALL THE ID I NEED
Genius; only I don't wear pants!
You know that, God.
OKAY WELL IF YOU WORE PANTS IT WOULD WORK REALLY WELL ON ALL SORTS OF THINGS
THIS IS ALL THE THESIS DEFENSE I NEED
THIS IS ALL THE BIKE HELMET I NEED
THAT SORT OF THING
OH MAN
I CRACK MYSELF UP SOMETIMES
Listen, God-
T-Rex?
Utahraptor, am I glad to see you! Listen can you explain to God that His joke would be funny if we wore pants, but we don't wear pants, so He can stop talking about it?
I'd like to, but I don't believe in your God! I think he's all in your head.
Well?!
HUH

transcription.title: turning a global disaster into a chance for sex with multiple partners

panel.line: Yes indeed! If I were the last man on Earth...
...things would be different!
Hi, I'm the last man on Earth!
My, my! Hello!
Would you say you and your girlfriends find that... attractive?
Daydreaming again, I see!
Aww, why'd you do that? I was imagining I was the last man on Earth!
And no doubt turning what's clearly a global disaster into a chance for sex with multiple partners!
Heh. Well, you know me!
Always up to my old tricks!

transcription.title: oil of olay, twice a day

panel.line: It's a real shame that all those great careers I wanted as a child will probably never come true for me. I'll never get to be an austronaut, a race car driver, or a movie star!
It's a sad realization - I always sort of hoped such a job would just... fall into my lap!
Have you ever imagined what it would be like if you WERE a movie star, T-Rex?
Sometimes! But I don't have a very good imagination for that sort of thing. What would I be, a romantic lead?
Mostly I just insert myself into the commercials of my youth.
OIL OF OLAY
Don't I know you from somewhere?
Oh, that's original!
Emerson High, 1975: you were in my class.
I was your teachah!
Mrs Fitzherny?!
Bugsy... Brown

transcription.title: afterwards we'll discuss philosophy or something like that

panel.line: I'm not as gullible as everybody seems to think I am. I know that the Utahraptor is not the one from my universe!
I've got to rescue the real Utahraptor!
But how? I don't really know how to do anything besides stomp on things. Maybe if he needed something stomped I could help!
I could also contribute to a discussion re: philosophy.
Alternate Universe Utahraptor [[with a goatee]]: Hey, I need you to help me to build a machine that will destroy all life on the planet.
Alternate Universe Utahraptor: And then afterwards we'll discuss philosophy or something like that, OK?
I'm torn!!

transcription.title: social ruin comics

panel.line: SOCIAL RUIN COMICS
I am sick of cold, emotionally distant women!
That is: in theory!
In practice, I guess I would need more experience with women, emotionally distant or otherwise.
What, are you talking about me? You're saying I'm emotionally distant!
No!
Well, who are you talking about then, T-Rex?
Just - you know, in general! I wasn't talking about anyone in particular.
Yeah, but you were complaining about ex-girlfriends in front of a woman whom you've dated in the past! That's not exactly a recipe for social harmony.
Hi, Megan!

transcription.title: presentism

panel.line: T-REX IN: "PRESENTISM"
Presentism is when you interpret the historical past with a view from the present!

Its danger is not just that it is often self-congratulatory, but also that judging historical figures by present-day moral standards is likely not a fruitful line of inquiry. What we see as questionable (say, sexism!) would have seemed completely routine to someone brought up in such a time, and we can't really blame historical figures, I think, for not questioning it!
This seems awfully close to ethical relativism!
Huh?

Well, aren't you saying we can't judge historical figures in a modern context, because they lived their lives during different times? But then what's the point of having our advanced modern ideals, if we can't apply them? I think we SHOULD be able to judge historical figures!
Anyway! In conclusion, presentism has good points and bad points and is not as interesting as I thought it was!

transcription.title: futurists, plus i can't get enough of the plop takes

panel.line: T-REX IN "FUTURISTS"
Stupid futurists!

They think they're so great just because they talk about the future all day long. Ooh, look at me! I think that the future will have Internet robot nano-maids! Put me on the news!" Anyone can call themselves a futurist: it doesn't mean anything!
Argh! I even hate the TERM "futurist"!
You, ah - you seem a little more vehement than usual, T-Rex!
They pus my buttons, is all!
I think it's because most of the predictions are either really dumb or blindingly obvious.
Sounds like you already have your own idea of what the future will be like!
Yeah... full of Internet robot nano-maids!

transcription.title: historiography comics, featuring "good ol' t-rex"

panel.line: HISTORIOGRAPHY COMICS featuring "Good Ol' T-Rex"
Historiography is the history of history, and includes the study of how history is understood!

We tend to think that history is just a record of what goes on in the past, but this overlooks the fact that two different people can view the same event, and even the same series of events, differently.
For instance! Is history the story of progress, from savage to cultured Man? Is it rather the study of Great Men and their Characters? Perhaps it is the story of cultural challenge and response!
What's with the sexist language, T-Rex? You're all "great MEN, cultured MEN"!
Sorry!
Most of these theories of history are over 50 years old, and reflect the sexism in the language at the time.
Well, if I were a woman, I think I'd be a little offended
I had to be careful not to let him know I'd considered this situation before.
Ha ha!
H-how do you mean?

transcription.title: why am I here? batteries.

panel.line: So - wait. What am I out for? I remember meaning to pick something up, but now I can't remember what!
Was it batteries, maybe?
Why am I here?
Well T-Rex, I think you're here - as I think we're all here - in order to make the world a better place. That is the purpose of life, I believe!
I actually meant my question in the most basic sense, but I want to appear deep. I'd better act angsty and play along.
Oh, my existential angst! Is there no happiness without knowledge of purpose?
Hey, I'm happy!
This is because I believe we're here in order to be witness to Creation. What greater purpose could there be, than to be the eyes and ears and souls of a Universe?
Ha ha, yeah, that sounds good!
So - heck. Batteries?

transcription.title: it's a party in this comic and everyone's invited

panel.line: IT'S A PARTY IN THIS COMIC AND EVERYONE'S INVITED
Whoo!! Does anybody here like to party?
Does anybody here like to STOMP on HOUSES?!
If so, then I propose you join my party, featuring T-Rex! Whoo!
Stomping on houses!
Extreme!!
You're a one-man party, my friend!
As usual!
But do you think you could take the party DOWN a notch?
Nope! My parties only ever go UP notches! They go all the way to the top! Extreme!
EXTREME!!

transcription.title: my new boyfriend is exactly like you, only with none of the faults

panel.line: So, I accept that I am the epitome of the male form with typical grace. But what is with my getting a sunburn?
Huh?
Clearly, my body is UNDEREVOLVED. Being able to be burnt by the sun - which, I don't have to remind you, Dromiceiomimus, shines on the Earth EVERY DAY - seems to be a pretty big limitation!
Does that mean your body is...less than perfect?
My brain rejects that sentence as semantically invalid!
What if there was someone exactly like you in every way, only HE didn't get sunburns?
Oh no!
I would be doomed to being a second-tier character in my own life! No one (including myself) would care what I was up to, when there was someone exactly like me only he didn't get sunburns!
Well, let's be glad no such person exists then!
ACTUALLY I THINK THERE'S A DUDE LIKE THAT JUST DOWN THE STREET
Aw boo!

transcription.title: circle wipe double equals sign comedic gold

panel.line: My favourite cross-cutting technique of all time?
Why, the circle wipe!
I can't get enough! All you have to do for comedic gold is have someone say "Boy, I sure hope <x> doesn't happen to me!"
Then we have a circle wipe to 8 hours later, and <x> has happened to them anyway! Ho ho! Whoops!
Hey T-Rex, what's your favourite cross-cutting technique of all time?
G-
I was just talking about my favourite cross-cutting technique of all time. ALREADY.
Well, how -
ALREADY I had covered that material.
ALREADY.

transcription.title: being polite, also: your mom

panel.line: Hm... maybe social relationships would be much easier if everyone said exactly what they were thinking!
This gives me an idea! My idea is what I was just talking about!
Hello, Dromiceiomimus, and I am glad to see YOU! Today I've decided to heck with being polite, and I'm saying whatever's on my mind, and you get to be the first person to talk to me!
Oh boy! You've justifies being uncouth! Who cares about the past 1000 years of evolving social graces?
Sarcasm!
I think she's got a point, T-Rex!
You know, I figured you would!
Too often we support something just because it's new, and forget that if an idea or process been around for a long time, that's usually - but not always, granted - because it has something to offer.
Oh yeah? Well, I think that maybe your MOM has something to offer!
How is she, by the way?
Fine!
That's cool!

transcription.title: a cautionary TRUE tale about hermit crabs

panel.line: I was down at the beach last week and there were all these adorable little hermit crabs running around! They were so cute that I scooped up a bunch and brought them home!
They were my new pets!
But then after a while I got tired of my new pets so I gobbled them up!
Tra la la!
You didn't really eat them, did you?!
I gobbled them up!
T-Rex, they're hermit crabs! HERMIT crabs! They live in whatever vessel they can find, and if you eat them, they'll take over your body as their new home!!
T-Rex's Stomach: NO WE DIDN'T

transcription.title: in a MANOR of speaking

panel.line: MIRROR UNIVERSE COMICS
I see you've rebuilt your house! Too bad I'm the personification of its destruction... in a MANOR of speaking!
Ha ha ha! Two in a row!
Yes, house-themed puns come courtesy of me, the Evil T-Rex!
LATER...
Youuuutahraptor!
Oh Youuutahraptor!
What do you want?
I was just wondering if it bothers you when I senselessly step on people.
Yes, it does.
Oh, that's too bad!
Cause here I go!
God damn you, Evil T-Rex!

transcription.title: web blog comix

panel.line: SUBJECT: hee hee hee hee
MOOD: {{sad face}} Groggy
MUSIC: Cibo Matto - Birthday Cake
Sry people for not updateing lately!!!
I haven't updated in awhile, mainly because my puter has been annoyingly slow. I need to ask my 'rents to buy me a new one!
neway not much is new with me.... i really need to go out more... worried i might be in a rut...
4 COMMENTS |
POST A COMMENT
*hugses*
*big big hugs* THANK YOU!!!!! :)
Hey no problem. I actually meant it to be anonymous but I click too fast and didn't actually click the box I thought I did. Oh well.
I sometimes make that mistake too.

transcription.title: fatalism comics

panel.line: FATALISM COMICS
Fatalism is when - ah, screw it!

I'm sure if you were meant to know about fatalism, you'd find out about it eventually. In any case, fatalism is the belief that future events are predetermined for the whole of time and are entirely unalterable!
You just defined fatalism... despite your best efforts not to!
Oh my God!
It was FATE! I was destined to define fatalism as the belief that future events are predetermined for the whole of time, and are entirely unalterable!
You just did it again!!
OH MY GOSH! Is this my role in life? Am I to be forever DEFINING FATALISM?
PROBABLY NOT
Looks like nope!

transcription.title: what if...?

panel.line: WHAT IF... DINOSAURS HAD NEVER GONE EXTINCT?
I feel about the same.
Unidentified Interlocutor: Me too!
"WHAT IF..." COMICS
WHAT IF... T-REX WERE VERY VERY TINY?
Luckily, everything else in the universe has shrunk to the same scale!
Yes, from any given perspective there is no change!
CRAZY
WHAT IF... THE TINY WOMAN WAS ACTUALLY A TRANSGENDERED MALE?
T-Rex! Don't stomp on her!
good pronoun use!
WHAT IF... T-REX HAD SUCCEEDED IN BUILDING HIS TIME MACHINE?
Well, I guess I'll talk to you yesterday! See you... SOONER?
You keep going back one day to tell me that stupid pun, but I'm never going to laugh!
WHAT IF... THE FANTASTIC FOUR HAD LOST THE TRIAL OF GALACTUS?
My comic has a slightly different ending...?!

transcription.title: The Man Who Died And Came Back As A Ghost

panel.line: I have written the spookiest ghost story ever! It is called, "The Man Who Died And Came Back As A Ghost".
It's spooky! It says so in the first sentence!
It says, "It was spooky night, with a ghost! The ghost was the spookiest ghost in the world, and he was so spooky that if you saw him you'd be scared, for real!"
The, um
The next paragraph is "BOO!"
T-Rex, you have to make your readers feel scared! You just can't tell them they're scared.
Sure I can!
"The ghost explains that even if you were just reading about these events later, you'd still be scared. You realize with a chill that he is right."
It's a "Choose Your Own Adventure" book?
It is now! It is if that's the format I have to use to tell my readers that they're scared!
LATER T-REX GIVES A READING OF HIS NEW BOOK:
Turn to page 32 to be spooked by the spooky ghost! Turn to page 14 if you'd rather see the same ghost and be TERRIFIED!

transcription.title: compressed film comics VI

panel.line: COMPRESSED FILM COMICS today's film:
I'm Bill S. Preston!
BILL AND TED'S EXCELLENT ADVENTURE
Esquire!
GREECE, 405 BC

Thanks to Rufus' excellent time-travelling telephone booth, we can travel to any time period! Thus, Ted and I are gathering some ancient history dudes so that we don't fail on our MOST BOGUS history report!
Whoah - historical BABES!
FRANCE, 1802
We are in danger of flunking most heinously tomorrow, Bill!
THE OLD WEST
Party on, Bill!
Party on, Ted!
T-Rex and Utahraptor: WYLD STALLYNS!
Be excellent to each other!

transcription.title: time to visit all my wacky dinosaur friends!

panel.line: T-REX AND HIS WACKY DINOSAUR FRIENDS
Time to visit all my wacky friends!
SOON:
Oh hey, Dromiceiomimus, my wackiest of wacky friends! What are you up to? Some crazy scheme, no doubt!
I'm selling unwanted possessions on eBay!
Ha ha! That's WACKY.
T-Rex!!
Utahraptor!
YOU, I think, are surely my wackiest of friends! What news?
The school is burning down! Quick, we need your help to fight the fire!
Certainly! But I warn you: a school burning down?
Pretty wacky!

transcription.title: crazy vs wacky / god vs t-rex

panel.line: T-REX YOUR FRIENDS SURE ARE CRAZY EH
Huh? God, my friends aren't crazy. Crazy's insane. My friends are WACKY.
Wacky.
THEY"RE PRETTY CRAZY
Probably not, cause they're wacky!
LOOK IN A LITTLE BIT THE UTAHRAPTOR IS GOING TO ASK YOU AN UNNECESSARY FAVOR AND IT WOULD BE COOL IF YOU SAID YES
Why? Lets get this crazy/wacky issue settled first.
SERIOUSLY MAN JUST DO IT AND I PROMISE I'LL YOU A COSMIC TRUTH AFTERWARDS
God! FINE.
Hey, T-Rex, I've a favor to ask! Can you tell me when seven minutes have passed?
"Okay!"
SEVEN MINUTES LATER:
Seven minutes have passed.
Good! My Kraft Dinner is ready!
You could have timed this yourself! I guess this is kind of an unnecessary favor.
HA HA T-REX YOU SURE HAVE SOME CRAZY FRIENDS
No I don't!

transcription.title: you're fired, and i can talk!

panel.line: I'm going to write a great novel! It will be about one man's struggle to make a life for himself in the modern world, and it will be wonderful. He will achieve all he desires, and be at the peak of his career!
And then, in the last sentence, a filing cabinet says "You're fired, and I can talk!"
Hah hah! Best ending ever!
Why?
Didn't you hear the ending? A talking filing cabinet? "You're fired, and I can talk!"?
Hee hee!
It seems like a really crappy ending to me!
No!
It RECONTEXTUALIZES the book. People will be like, "I thought this book was transcendental until that last sentence when the talking filing cabinet showed up!"
Is it a metaphor?
Nope! It's just a talking filing cabinet that undermines the whole book.
I will call the book, "An Unexpected Ending".

transcription.title: heard any new jokes lately, god?

panel.line: Are you there, God? It's me, -
YO RIGHT HERE
WHAT'S GOING ON T-REX
You know, not much!
I was just wondering if you'd heard any good jokes lately.
MAN NOPE CAN'T SAY THAT I HAVE
Really? You haven't heard ONE good joke?
Maybe even a joke that was just alright?
T-Rex?
Who were you talking to, just now?
Oh, I was just chatting up God to see if He had any good jokes - but no dice!
I'm not sure we'd even be able to UNDERSTAND a joke God would make!
Come to think of it, yeah! I bet He'd do something lame like making all of the Universe the joke or something!
AW GUYS YOU GOT ME

transcription.title: the Perfect Haiku

panel.line: The night started cold - Too cold, and it got colder: A night for murder.
Alright everyone! There's no need for any more haiku: the art form has peaked!
This is because I've just composed the Perfect Haiku. It has intrigue, a cold night, and perhaps, a hint of gunplay?
truly, the best haiku ever. To Japan!
You might want to hold off on that trip for a bit!
Huh?
Like most things taken from another culture, haiku have been transformed in their assimilation. You should know that a simple 5-7-5 syllable structure does not a proper haiku make!
Oh I disagree! As you are clearly wr-ong, And I am quite right!
AND IN LESS THAN 24 HOURS, "A NIGHT FOR MURDER" TAKES JAPAN BY STORM!
But what to do...
... for a SEQUEL??

transcription.title: make a note of that, in my LOGS

panel.line: MIRROR UNIVERSE COMICS
Rebuilt again, eh? I'll have to make a note of that, in my LOGS!
Ha ha ha!
Wait... does that even make sense?
Ah, who cares! The Utahraptor's been having a bad time here, and I'm to credit! I wonder how long he'll stay?
(I can't wait till he finds out I replaced his toothpaste with a COMPETING BRAND OF TOOTHPASTE!)
Goodbye, Evil T-Rex! I'm returning to my own Universe!
No, wait!
Stay!
Brush your teeth!
POOM
THE NEXT DAY...
And then, just as fast, I was back here again... back in my own universe!
And you say NOBODY had goatees?
Nope!
Huh! Well, tell you what. I'll stomp on her first, then you go, OK?
It's good to be back!

transcription.title: if there's one thing i know, it's women

panel.line: If there's one thing I know...
... it's women!
Isn't that right, Dromiceiomimus? Wouldn't you agree that I have an uncanny understanding of the female gender?
I wouldn't put it that way!
Come now, don't be shy!
I disagree with you as well, my friend!
But why? It's clearly TRUE.
T-Rex, your relationships with women have been characterized by confusion and misunderstanding and briefness, and AWKWARDNESS, as far as I can tell!
If there's one thing you know, it's not women!
T-Rex (thinking): In truth, I had only the loosest grasp on female anatomy, but I'd take that secret to my grave.
Nuh-uh!

transcription.title: from where do you hail, you attractive individual?

panel.line: I have faith in random developments of chance of a potentially divine nature. From where do you hail?
You attractive individual!
I have faith in what may appear to be miraculous occurrences, Since you entered my immediate locale,
You attractive individual.
Where is your place of origin, youngster? By what means were you cognizant of my need for you?
How were you aware of the extreme extent of my desire? How were you aware that I would offer my affections without hesitation?
During the previous diurnal cycle, I counted myself among the ranks of the lonely! Now you're lying in quite close proximity.
Engaging in intercourse!

transcription.title: i think we should break up: a web card

panel.line: I THINK WE SHOULD BREAK UP
a web card
Dear recipient of this comic:
It isn't working out!
Maybe it's not you, it's me! MAYBE there were many small things that added up to this relationship not working.
I don't know. This card isn't very personalized.
Come to think of it, I'd be pretty pissed if someone broke up with me like this!
Yeah, this is even worse than a break-up email! You have to at least compose an email.
Too true!
I think whoever is being dumped here is better off without this person!
Me too!
Dear recipient of this comic: You're better off without this jerk!
I would still like to hear about the sex, however!

transcription.title: the angriest dog in the world

panel.line: T-REX HAS GOTTEN A NEW PET DOG:
I've gotten a new pet dog!
Hooray!
My last pet dog ran away because I never fed him. But THIS new dog I'm sure to feed every day!
That's very resp - actually, T-Rex, that's exactly as responsible as you should be.
I know this now!
What's your new pet's name, T-Rex?
It's also his description!
I named him, "The Angriest Dog In The World".
Wow! Is he really that angry?
He's LIVID, man! He's TENSE. Bound so tightly with tension and anger, he approaches the state of rigor mortis!
Good listener, though!

transcription.title: naked people? hot?

panel.line: naked people
Hot!
Dromiceiomimus, what's your opinion on people who are naked?
I would think that they are hot!
I would be forced to agree with you my good lady!!
I too would agree with you re: hot naked people, my friend!
THE END
POSTSCRIPT:
Hott!!

panel.line: naked people
Hot!
Dromiceiomimus, what's your opinion on people who are naked?
I would think that they are hot!
I would be forced to agree with you my good lady!!
I too would agree with you re: hot naked people, my friend!

Hott!!

transcription.title: he who dies with the most parents, wins

panel.line: Okay! So, we get a couple - no! - a polyamorous CROWD of people, who all want to have a child, but who are all infertile. So! Then we get a donated fertilized egg...
... and bring it to term with a surrogate mother who is herself married!
THEN, you give the child to the polyamorous crowd, who have new members replace old ones quickly and quite often. Um, infinitely often.
THAT'S, I think, how you get a child with the highest number of people who could possibly claim parentage. Tada!
You've outdone yourself this time, my friend!
How's that?
Well, you're raised pretty much every socio-reproductive issue in the book, and also RUINED THE LIFE OF AN IMAGINARY CHILD.
I haven't ruined any lives! The kid has like bazillion parents: think about his birthday!
PRESENTS

transcription.title: time travel advice comics

panel.line: TIME TRAVEL ADVICE COMICS
If you ever find your consciousness (your self) sent back in time to a much younger you, there are some changes to be expected! Remember:
It can be frustrating to live out your life again!
But - there is hope. Small changes compound into large ones, and soon you will be encountering situations that you don't recall.
If you're going to impress by making predictions about the immediate future you should do so early on! They may become increasingly inaccurate.
It can also be difficult to convince people you've traveled from the future!
Quite so!
This is why (if you've gone back into your own life far enough) using words and knowledge that are far beyond your means can help impress upon people the truth of your story.
Be careful though! Overplay this, and you may become separated from your familiar world!
Anyway!
Enjoy being 6!

transcription.title: it was all a dream

panel.line: IT WAS ALL A DREAM
Phew, it was all a dream!
The mission to find the treasure, the car chase: all a dream!
My high school math teacher naked and smiling: all a dream!
That bizarre thing with the Utahraptor that I don't want to talk about: all a dream!
Wait, what was this about me?
It was nothing: just a crazy dream!
You must have had crazy dreams before!
Yeah, but are we talking crazy insane or crazy sexual?
Crazy sexual!
I've said too much!

transcription.title: dinosaurs had cell phones, i guess!

panel.line: So a friend of mine got a cell phone!
I know!
I'm of the belief that some businessmen who are never in the office could really use them, but that most people don't REALLY need one. Therefore, they are allowed to be teased by me!
Ho ho! They are allowed to be teased by me whenever they use their phone, even if it's in an emergency!
But you didn't tease this person, right?
Right!
Well, that's good. I think people with cell phones get teased enough.
It was going to be really good, though! I was going to call really early. I would have said, "DO YOU LIKE YOUR CELL PHONE NOW??"
"HELLO"

transcription.title: deities have cell phones, i guess!

panel.line: HEY T-REX YOU KINDA SHOULDN'T MAKE FUN OF PEOPLE WITH CELL PHONES
Huh?
Why not?!
WELL IN SOME PLACES PEOPLE DON'T REALLY USE REGULAR PHONES
I GOT A CELL PHONE YOU KNOW
You do?
YEAH IT'S PRETTY GREAT MY RINGTONE IS THE THEME SONG TO TELEFRANCAIS
Who are you talking to, T-Rex?
God, again!
He was just telling me that I shouldn't make fun of people with cell phones, because He has a cell phone too!
What does God need with a cell phone?
Huh! What DOES God need with a cell phone?
ALL OF MY FRIENDS HAVE ONE
Friends?!
UM I MEAN
LESSER GODS

transcription.title: lesbians!

panel.line: I had a friend (female) who dated her roommate (also female).
Lesbians!
Of course there's always a danger when you go down the 'date-the-person-you-live-with' road.
The House: oh baby i'm so glad we already live together and now are in a relationship; it's bound to make things smooth and not at all awkward.
They broke up a week later and still had to live together.
The sting of failed romance!
I know it well.
I too have consummated my love for my roommate of the same gender. Now when I see him (quite often, as it turns out), there is a tension that hurts me.
Right here.
LATER
I was his roommate.

transcription.title: back on good old earth prime

panel.line: The presence of the evil Utahraptor in this Universe has raised the very philosophical questions I had earlier been concerned about!
For instance!
Can the two Utahraptors be considered the same person? Is the evil one just the result of some decision made differently?
Are the actions of one the restrained impulses of the other, or are they really two different individuals?
Could one, in time, become the other?
Additionally, -
T-Rex! It's me - I'm back!
Utahraptor! It's you!
Hello! I had been in a mirror universe, where we all had goatees and were evil!
Let me just say, "It's good to be back on Earth Prime!"
Hey!
I lived in your house while you were gone!
I ATE SOME FOOD

transcription.title: Pretzels In A Lady's Lap

panel.line: Alright! New novel: done! This one is a romance, and is called:
"Pretzels In A Lady's Lap"!

It's named after a particularly striking scene from the book! We're at a party, and a young man accidentally spills pretzels, as he walks by, into the titular Lady's lap! She looks up: eyes meet, bosoms - on both sides - heave, passions smoulder, and, perhaps... romance blossoms?
Hey, what's so sensual about pretzels?
Dude!
No, really! They're dry and salty.
I've always found them to be pretty sensual.
I'm pretty sure you're the only one!
Really? Huh! Nobody else finds pretzels stimulating?
Well, this has been quite the anagnorisis (a moment of recognition or discovery)!

transcription.title: t-rex in: young parents

panel.line: T-REX IN: "YOUNG PARENTS"
Young parents!
What's the deal?
How come they want to have kids so quickly? Don't they want to live a hedonistic adult-child lifestyle, like mine, for just a little longer?
I don't understand! Marriage?
Did you think maybe they just found the right person?
Huh?
Yeah, maybe they know what they want, and that's to share their lives, and a beautiful child, with each other!
MAYBE, but how come I don't want that? I want all the cool things!
Also: how come my bed is so cold and empty at night?

transcription.title: time to go on a wacky adventure

panel.line: Time to go on a wacky adventure, which would be quite amazing to an imaginary third pary with the ability to see my actions rendered as a continuous narrative!
LATER:
Whew!!
Kick ass!
Well, that was pretty much the best adventure ever! Do you recall when we got trapped in that mine that was filling up with water very quickly?
I do! And or escape...!
Yes, it was quite amazing!
LATER:
Congratulations on publishing a book of your story, T-Rex!
Thanks!
LATER:
Congratulations on your book becoming the entire world's Global Narrative and Shared History, T-Rex!
It was unexpected but gratifying!
LATER:
So!
What's left?

transcription.title: a cheery nostalgia for a small town

panel.line: I wonder, did growing up in a small town influence my values?
Perhaps!
Though, I think, not as much as I would have liked it to. Sometimes I feel like I cling to my small-town origins as a substitute for a real identity.
You're suggesting that a small town provides a "ready made" identity?
Yeah!
You know, a certain touch of naivet?, a wonder at the accoutrements (subways, etc) of modern city living...
Well, we all tend to define ourselves with or against something: a home town seems as good a thing as any!
T-Rex's Memoirs: Years later, I would reflect on this exchange, and find in it so much of what I missed from that time.
Ah, those were the days!
T-Rex's Memoirs: It made me feel certain that, had I an old La Salle at the time, it would have ran great.

transcription.title: dinosaur improv troupe

panel.line: I can never let my father, whom I have a close relationship with, know my shameful secret! I never -
*choke*
I never meant to kill my best friend!
It was my first time drinking, and I thought that I was good to drive!
We tried to warn you! We, your other friends, tried to warn you that you had been drinking, but now our mutual friend is dead, BECAUSE OF YOU! We can't be friends anymore.
*choke*
Hello, son! You look a little upset! Is there maybe something personal you want to tell me?
No!
Yes!
I drank and drove tonight and I killed a man and last week I kinda date raped my date and I'm gay and I also am involved in a teen pregnancy!
Son, I -
I still love you!
Oh, Dad!
And... SCENE!

transcription.title: a vision... of tomorrow!

panel.line: I wonder what the future holds!
Hmm...
Whoo! Civilization's destroyed!
Whoah!
That was like - a grim, dystopian vision!
A vision... of TOMORROW!
You look troubled, my friend!
That's because I am troubled!
I just tried imagining what the future will be like, but what I saw was a world destroyed! And... I seemed excited about it!
T-Rex, it's just a daydream! Don't worry about it.
Okay, but if civilization is destroyed, you and I will have words!
Fine!
ANGRY words!
I'm just sayin'!

transcription.title: sex advice

panel.line: T-REX IN: "SEX ADVICE"
Woohoo! Sex Advice!
Our first letter comes from me!
I write, " Dear T-Rex: I love your show. I have a question, sex? Huh? What's the deal?"
Wow! Thanks for your letter, "T"!
You answer your question I-
Utahraptor [[interrupting]]: May I?
May you what?
May I answer the question?
Hey! It's MY sex advice show! Get your own!
You know what? Don't mind if I do!
SOON, UTAHRAPTOR'S SEX ADVICE SHOWIS THE MOS POPULAR THING EVER:
Awww cinnamon!

transcription.title: so! generalizations!

panel.line: So! Generalizations!
I don't understand them!

For instance, after being bit by three tigers, I'd start to generalize that maybe I shouldn't poke tigers, because then they'll bite me. But if I happened to meet three jerky citizens of a town, the same process could make me conclude that everyone there is mean! Or worse: what if I started generalizing across races? I'd be a big ol' racist!
Well, there are valid and invalid generalizations, my friend!
Yeah, that's true!
But I guess what bothers me is that it seems you determine whether or not a generalization is valid by evaluating its conclusion, which in turn is based on your own prejudices!
Well - it's hard to remove the "human factor" from any evaluation like this.
You mean the "dinosaur factor", of course!
Hah hah! Of course!
We're talking dinosaurs!

transcription.title: money

panel.line: Down with money!
We don't need it!

We can just return to our utopia of old, before money turned us all into greedy, money-obsessed, quasi-people! Right, Dromiceiomimus? Right! Money is an aberration that lessens us all! We don't need it!
But without money people would still trade!
And...?
AND, currency is just an abstraction of trade! One unit of currency equals three goats, for example. Some form of money develops naturally from trade and is thus, I think, pretty much inevitable!
I guess you could say your remarks are. . . RIGHT ON THE MONEY?
Ho ho! Five stars! Also, I value our friendship.

transcription.title: social skills comics

panel.line: Social Skills Comics
Social Skills are very important things to have!
They are what allow us to get along with others, and are the foundation of society!

With the invention of the "#8220;internet"#8221; and "#8220;email"#8221; and "#8220;instant messaging software"#8221;, people are more social than ever "#8211; and this increased chance for communication leads to better social skills! Hooray!
Ah, but this electronic communication can take away from face-to-face interaction!
Doesn"#8217;t matter!

Actually, it does "#8211; because they"#8217;re not the same thing! Online, if you don"#8217;t like someone, you can ignore them easily and completely. But in real life, you have to talk to people you disagree with or dislike all the time! I"#8217;m worried the skills for dealing with such people will become ATROPHIED.
Unnamed: What do you-
Unnamed: T-Rex?
Smile and wave and back away"#8230;

transcription.title: compressed relationship comics

panel.line: COMPRESSED RELATIONSHIP COMICS
Oh oh...
Sounds like another emotional roller coaster...
And here we go!
I have much to offer a potential mate! I am big and strong and oh so sexy!
If only I could find someone, preferably in my own neighbourhood, to be my companion and also to have sex with!
Hello!
Why, hello!
I notice you are attractive!
You as well!
Care to put our emotional stability on the line in exchange for a chance at happiness?
OK!
So...
So...
I'm leaving you!
*sob*
Alone again.

Do I ever!
They're like generalizations across races, only socially acceptable!
Dromiceiomimus, did you know that Latin women are passionate and fiery?
That is the stereotype!
And British men are cultured and maybe a little stuffy!
Well what's the stereotype that applies to you T-Rex?
Oh, there isn't one!
My people and I don't fit into your boxes, man
And you recognize the double standard here?
Heck yes! I'm largely in favour of it!
I say largely because I like to keep my options open. Anyway!
Passionate Latin women?

Men!
ok then, chillin', chillin', mindin' my business
word!

Brother, wanna thank your mother for a butt like that!

So what you wanna do?
What you wanna do

transcription.title: the strangest dream

panel.line: I had the strangest dream last night! There was this disease going around that made people really - violent, I guess?
Anyway, it affected these two women who I guess lived at my house!
It was really creepy, because these women would SEEM fine, but then they'd just keep trying to get close to me, no matter what I did. They wanted to kill me!
Whoah! Sounds like somebody is afraid of women!
No I'm not! It's just that dreams always sound really symbolic when they're described, that's all!
I don't know, sounds like you think women are a threat!
I don't!
It was a DREAM I had. Just cause I dreamed it doesn't mean I believe it!
Hey T-Rex, is it sexist in here, or is it JUST YOU?
What? No! It's not sexist in here!

transcription.title: i just had a snooze... and didn't lose!

panel.line: MID-AFTERNOON:
Whew! What a fantastic nap!
It seems I just had a snooze... and didn't lose!
Ho ho! Did you hear that, Dromiceiomimus? I had a snooze... and didn't lose!
Yes! Very clever, T-Rex.
Because normally people say "You snooze, you lose", but in my case I didn't lose anything!
But T-Rex, no matter what you do, you lose! Economics teaches us that there is an opportunity cost for every action.
And so by "snoozing", you are "losing" out on the chance to do anything you could have done - cure cancer, perhaps!
That's stupid, and since when did we start personifying social sciences?
My friend, I am simply asking the questions that need to be asked!

transcription.title: emotions are for the weak!

panel.line: New theory:
Emotions are for the weak!
Wouldn't you agree, Dromiceiomimus?
But I like emotions, T-Rex! I like feeling happy and content and loved!
Okay, new theory: BAD emotions are for the weak!
But feeling depressed might encourage you to go out and improve yourself, so bad emotions are good too!
Fine!
New theory: Emotions?
That
That's not really a theory, T-Rex.
YEARS LATER, T-REX IS GIVEN THE CHANCE TO GO BACK IN TIME AND CHOOSES NOT TO REVISIT THIS EXCHANGE!
I've said my goodbyes!

transcription.title: truth / volunteer-information serum

panel.line: T-REX HAS INJECTED HIMSELF WITH TRUTH SERUM OF HIS OWN DESIGN:
Indeedy! Now everything I say will be the truth!
The path to enlightenment is truly through homemade drugs!
Go ahead, Dromiceiomimus! Ask me anything!
Okay, um... What's ten times two?
Twenty. Oh my gosh; it works!
Oooh! Hey, I've got some questions!
No way dude!
I'm afraid you'll ask me some personal questions (of a sexual nature) that I don't want to answer! Wait, what the hell? This was supposed to be a truth serum, not a VOLUNTEER INFORMATION serum!
You're out of control!
I've recently discovered the joys of sleeping naked, by the way! Don't listen to me!!

panel.line: I wrote some fan fiction last night!
I know!
But T-Rex, most fan fiction has characters from TV and movies acting implausibly in implausible situations, and also kissing each other! Does - does yours?
Perhaps! There are many twists and turns and revelations in my exciting non-canon tale, Dromiceiomimus!
So what show is it about?
No show!
It's actually - surprise! - UTAHRAPTOR and DROMICEIOMIMUS fan fiction!
You didn't.
Indeed I did, good sir! And may I just say, "smoochie smoochie"? Hah hah!
(You kiss in my story!)

panel.line: Powerful images for the passage of time:
A clock's hands, sweeping past 12!
A sped-up landscape scene, with urban growth and decay happening in mere seconds!
The Earth spinning in orbit!
An old woman holding aged lace and gazing at a faded photograph of herself, posing in her prettiest dress!
Brightly coloured fall leaves, being gently covered in snow!
Ooh, good one!
I think my favorite was the old lady with the photograph of herself.

So?
There's nothing wrong with appreciating the work of somebody else!
Oh no, no, that's true! I just thought you were implying it was your own linguistic invention.
Ha ha! What a silly thing to say!
Because that would be plagiarism, and plagiarism is wrong!
Yes!
Now, to change the subject, isn't today election day somewhere?
POLITICS, huh?

transcription.title: the meaning of life

panel.line: What is the meaning of life? By this I mean, how should I best live my life?
THE MEANING OF LIFE
More concretely: what can I do NOW that is meaningful and justified and purposeful and justified and purposeful and not - pointlessly absurd?
These are big questions, my friend!
I know, Dromiceiomimus I know! But I'm sick of that being used as an excuse. I am demanding BIG ANSWERS. There must be some way to arrive at a solution!
I don't know if there is, T-Rex!
Well - I have an idea.

Okay: so I don't know what the meaning of life is; fine. But, I do know that others MIGHT. So, inductively, the only thing I can do is try to make life easier for these other people, until such a time that they figure it out and let me know!
So you become a dentist?
Hah!
What?

transcription.title: comics for french kids: 'je suis un loup garou!'

panel.line: CUTE COMICS IN FRENCH written for the now-abandoned project "COMICS FOR FRENCH KIDS"
Allo bonjour!
Moi, je suis un dinosaure!
Je suis un dinosaure EXTRAORDINAIRE! Je suis grand et vert.
J'aime des choses et d'autres choses!
Moi, je suis un loup-garou!
Ah oui?
Oui, je suis un loup-garou!
C'est quelque chose incroyable, ca!
Oui, je sais!
Ne me mange pas, s'il vous plait!
D'accord, mon ami! D'accord!
Ah, merci bien, monsieur!
J'aime toi et des choses et d'autres choses!

transcription.title: the power of language

panel.line: I'm sick and ornery! I just want to be left alone today, so give me my distance!
With this in mind, I'm going for a walk!
Haven't we gone over this before? Declaring yourself to be angry doesn't excuse personal responsibility, T-Rex!
Forget it, Dromiceiomimus! I don't want to hear anyone's voice all up in my earhole!
Ewwwwww!
"All up in my earhole"? That's disgusting! "Earhole"! Man! Friendship annulled! You're gross!
"The Power of Language"

transcription.title: another rocketship built to prove a point

panel.line: Well, yesterday I seemed to annoy my friends with my choice of the oddly-obscene word "earhole". Excuse me!
Sheesh, I was just being myself!
Well, we all prefer when you're yourself, but also not a rude jerk. You can be both!
But there's a rude side to me too! It's who I am!
And this is where, once again, social constraints come into play!
So you're implying that society serves a useful purpose, by encouraging me to be - nice? Polite?
Yep! If you don't like it, go live on the moon!
LATER, ON THE MOON!
HEY I HOPE YOU GUYS CAN HEAR ME BECAUSE I'M PERFECTLY HAPPY UP HERE! EAAAAARHOOOOOLE

transcription.title: world politics segues into women in the mood to kiss

panel.line: T-REX IN: WORLD POLITICS
Okay!
So you've got lots of countries, right? Only, you can dismiss about 90% of these, since they don't really affect the agreed-upon "world scene".
So then you've got this small collection of countries that make all the news! World politics is how these countries relate to one another, and, internally, to themselves.
That's good, but this definition seems a little unnecessary!
How so?
Well, people know what politics are, and "world politics" is just a straightforward application of the adjective.
Man, you're nerding up the place! I don't need to hear this talk about "applying adjectives".
To make up for THAT, I'm going to have to spend the rest of the day talking about women I've had the opportunity to kiss!
It's much more interesting than world politics was anyway. It's got women! Women in the mood to KISS!

transcription.title: the little red-scaled dinosaur

panel.line: Ah, long-forgotten childhood friends!
LONG FORGOTTEN CHILDHOOD FRIENDS COMICS
I miss them! Sure, we were probably a little petty and -- well, kids, but it feels like those friendships were somehow simpler... more pure!
I wonder what all my old friends are up to now... I haven't seen most of them since grade five!
Well, you're in luck! I ran into one of the old neighbourhood kids today!
You did?
Yes! Remember that little red-scaled dinosaur you had the biggest crush on?
Oh my goodness! The little red-scaled dinosaur? How is she?
Well she's all grown up now!
Oh, wow! Did she mention me at all?
I used to hide in the bushes outside her house!

transcription.title: constraints and the nature of argument structure

panel.line: Does "Betty put butter on the bread" mean the same thing as "Betty buttered the bread"?
I would argue: no!

In the second example, there is an implication that the bread is wholly buttered, while in the first, this is not necessarily the case! And this applies not just to butter: there are many other examples. For instance, "Gary wrote for many TV shows" leaves open the possibility of a co-author on the scripts, a possibility that "Gary wrote many TV shows" does not!
Wow! These small changes in semantics (he meaning of a word or phrase) are quite interesting!
Yes!
But hard, too.
Agreed.
Thanks to chapter three of Steven Pinker's 1989 book "Learnability and Cognition", upon which most of this comic was based.

transcription.title: sweet dinosaur kissing

panel.line: Whoo! It's cool to be cool!
And I'M the coolest!
This guarantees me POPULARITY. Who would not like to hang out with someone who's the coolest? The answer is no-one!
Whoah! That's some unrestrained ego you've got going, my friend!
Yep!
I'm experimenting with it. They say that women like a man with confidence, so I will be the most confident man ever!
But not all women are alike! I bet you some women like a man who is a push-over.
Sucks for them! They won't get any of my SWEET DINOSAUR KISSING.
I find that disgusting, yet can't articulate why!

transcription.title: Stereotypical male fantasy number one

panel.line: Guess who kissed two ladies at the same time yesterday?
If you guessed "T-Rex", you are CORRECT!
Woo-hoo! That's Stereotypical Male Fantasy Number 1 checked off! Now I can move on to Stereotypical Male Fantasy Number 2 at my earliest convenience!
Congratulations my friend! I am supportive of your sexual proclivities. What's Stereotypical Male Fantasy Number 2?
I'm a man, and I don't know what Stereotypical Male Fantasy Number 2 is either!
Really?
I'm surprised! You don't have any idea?
I bet it has something to do with ladies acting improbably!
Well YEAH, but it's the specific nature of the improbable actions that matters! Remember?
We had this discussion after I showed you my "One day lots of people have sexy sex" erotic fiction.
T-Red: Remember?

transcription.title: compressed film comics VII

panel.line: COMPRESSED FILM COMICS: "THE BUTTERFLY EFFECT"
Time to fix all my relationship issues with my girlfriend, Kayleigh, by going back in time...
...using the power of my MIND!
SHORTLY:
Off-screen: Everything's fine, CEPT YOU GOT NO LEGS!
Shit!
SOON:
Everything's fine, except now Kayleigh's father has become a crazy pedophile!
Huh?
Oh well! I can fix THAT!
SOON:
Everything's fine, except now Kayleigh dropped out of school to become a prostitute!
Sheesh!
SOON:
Okay, everything's fine, except you accidently killed Kayleigh's little brother Tommy! Whoops!
Darn it!
THIS time...
SOON:
Off-screen: Everything's fine, except now you totally never meet Kayleigh!
That's okay!

transcription.title: discrete math

panel.line: LECTURE NOTES COMICS
TODAY'S LECTURE: DISCRETE MATH
Pay attention, now!
if you do not like math then skip this comic (seriously)
The circuit satisfiability problem is determining if there are some inputs that make the outputs of a circuit "true"!
A closely related problem is the formula satisfiability problem, SAP, which can be mapped one-to-one, and in linear time, to the circuit satisfiability problem.
So what does this mean?
If we can solve SAT problems in f(n) time, then circuit-SAT can be solved in 0(n) + f(n) time!
But circuit-SAT can not be solved quickly.
Indeed. Therefore, SAT is as "hard" as circuit-SAT.
Similarly hard problems are "Clique", "Vertex-Cover" and the Travelling Salesman Problem.
Solving these problems (P) can be accomplished in polynomial time!
Verifying solutions (NP) can also be done in polynomial time!
The question is... does P = NP?

transcription.title: cautionary tale comix

panel.line: CAUTIONARY TALE COMIX
"This too shall pass!"
Hah hah hah!
Isn't that right, Dromiceiomimus? Wealth and power and knowledge and love and friendship are all fleeting and pointless! Whoo! One day will we all be dead!
You seem awfully cheerful about all this!
That too shall pass!
Normally the saying is only applied to BAD things, T-Rex!
It applies to all things!
Well, okay, but nobody want to invite someone to a wedding whose toast is going to be "This too shall pass"!
Man, I'm not trying to get invited to any weddings!
LATER: EVERYONE GETS INVITED TO A WEDDING EXCEPT T-REX.
Ouch!
For me!

transcription.title: ryoma

panel.line: Today I am talking about the made-up desease "ryoma", and there are many kinds of ryoma one can contract!
Festering ryoma, for instance!
Eww!
Creeping ryoma.
Salacious ryoma!
MEPHITIC OCULAR RYOMA.
Aw man, these all sound disgusting!
I know! It's amazing!
Ryoma doesn't even exist, and yet it's the most disgusting desease ever.
Hah, it really is! "Uvular ryoma".
"As we kissed, I could taste the ryoma on her lips."
Hah hah! Gross!
"When I woke this morning, my thighs were slick with ryoma"
T-Rex and Utahraptor: Ewww!

transcription.title: the manliest thing in the world

panel.line: The manliest thing in the world? Easy!
Wastin' food!
Oh man, imagine a guy who orders a big steak dinner with all the fixings, and then when it's delivered, he just flips it onto the floor!
That would be one tough dude! I would rate him, "Super Manly".
Okay, you've lost me: how is wasting food manly?
It just is!
It captures the ESSENCE of masculinity: doing stuff that we think is cool, even though there's many a good reason not to do it!
Like flipping plates of food onto the ground?
Like friggin' draining a lake, filling it with Sloppy Joes, and then spraying the whole thing with pesticides!
And piloting the crop duster PERSONALLY. I tell you, wasting food: the manliest thing in the world!
That and punchin' stuff!

transcription.title: philosophical progress

panel.line: I wonder: are we actually making progress?
(Where "we" refers to the general population, of course!)
How do you mean, T-Rex?

Well - what about philosophy, for instance? We've had thousands of years to think about what it means to be alive, yet we're still no closer to an answer! Where's the progress when we're still grappling with the same questions as the ancients?
You assume there exists an answer to such cosmic questions!
I do!
What about the whole idea of "the only questions worth asking are those that can't be answered"?
Self-justification from philosophers who can't reach a conclusion, my friend! I want ANSWERS, not debate! I want a one sentence SUMMARY of LIFE.
Something like, "too bad we'll all be dead"?
Yeah, only catchier and more informative!
And less depressing!

transcription.title: no burying t-rex alive

panel.line: I hope I never get BURIED ALIVE!
Yep, that sure would suck!
Boy, would I ever hate to be buried alive. I can't think of anything I'd dislike more! I mean - damn! Buried alive!
Why are you talking like that?
Like what?
Like you're trying to lead someone on, goading them into burying you alive.
Woah, is that what I sound like? Oh my gosh! I don't want to get buried alive at ALL!
I thought stressing that fact would make it clear, but apparently NOT. I drop the subject now! But don't forget! No burying T-Rex alive!

transcription.title: isn't it crazy that are minds are IN OUR HEAD?

panel.line: So, I'm not really comfortable with the fact that my mind is actually something physical.
It implies that everything I am, everything I think, can be altered!
It's scary! Some people who suffer brain damage can have their entire personality rewritten. Heck, add some chemcials and you can alter how and what a person thinks!
That's crazy!
Crazy!
And this freaks you out?
It really does.

You know what freaks me out the most, though? It's those remote control cyborg cockroaches they've made by pretty much taking over the animal's nervous system. I can just imagine the insect screaming endlessly in it's mind as its own body is made alien.
Oh my God!
Anyway, that was sort of tangential! Getting back to the subject: isn't it CRAZY that our minds are something physical!

transcription.title: thigh fives all around

panel.line: What a good mood I am in today!
I declare: high fives all around!
Hey Dromiceiomimus! Give me a thigh five!
A what?
What? Whoah, I meant to say "A high five", of course!
Oh man. What an embarrassing slip of the tongue! I have to go now!
LATER:
What the heck? A thigh five? Where did that even come from?
What's going on?
Oh, hey Utahraptor. DID YOU KNOW that I just accidentally asked the Dromiceiomimus to give me a thigh five?
Hah hah! I did NOT! What would that be, anyway? You both on your backs, slapping your legs together in the air?
My friend, thigh fives are a ridiculous way of expressing enthusiasm. I am aware of this!
This is not the issue here!

transcription.title: typos in heaven

panel.line: I hope I don't run into the Dromiceiomimus today! She probably thinks I'm crazy since I asked for a "thigh five" the last time we met.
Oh shoot, there she is! Time to go INCOGNITO!
Hey T-Rex, what's up? Out for a walk, I see?
T-Rex? Who es T-Rex? I am a different, um, Tyrannosaurus Rex.
Hah hah, really? You're not the T-Rex who demands thigh fives from his friends?
Darn it!
She remembers! I'll never live this down!
What are you so concerned about?

It was just a wacky slip of the tongue! It's funny - this one time in high school, a friend of mine meant to type "I raised my HAND to block the sun" but instead wrote "hind", and since he wasn't the slimmest guy... oh man!
Good times, good times!
OH MAN I FORGOT ABOUT THAT ONE
People laugh at typos in heaven?!
SOMETIMES WE DO

transcription.title: well-adjusted dinosaurs

panel.line: I've come to accept that I will be able to live down anything I do, given enough time!
So: no worries!
That's a healthy attitude, T-Rex! It'll let you explore things you otherwise might not, because you won't be worried about what others think!
Exactly! I am a well-adjusted dinosaur.
Wait, let me talk to you before you go too far with this!
Sure! What's up?
Well - it's just, you tend to take ideas to comedic extremes. So I just wanted to make sure you remember that you shouldn't dismiss the opinions of others entirely!
Of course! "Social Constraints Serve A Useful Purpose"!
I remember from the trial!

transcription.title: twenty-nine cent prints

panel.line: I just discovered that I can get digital prints for only 29 cents!
DINOSAUR COMICS PRESENTS: 29 CENT PRINT COMICS
Did you know that you can now get digital prints for only 29 cents? This will change the world!
T-Rex, that service has been available for a while now.
B-B-But... 29 cent prints!
Hey there Utahraptor! Have I ever told you that you're a prints among men?
You have not!
And let me just say: thanks, T-Rex!
A 29 cents prints, that is!
Utahraptor (off-panel): That doesn't even make sense!
Still! Burnsauce!!

transcription.title: april fools

panel.line: Today is my favourite day of all!
April Fool's Day!
Chief among my loves is the love of tricking people! I bet I can totally fool the Utahraptor today.
How do you intend to fool him?
I feel certain the opportunity will present itself.
here he comes!
Hey, T-Rex!
Hey! Don't try to trick me.
Huh? Oh, April Fool's. No, I just wanted some help moving something heavy.
Sorry, I'm busy.
Oh.
Ok.
April Fool's!

transcription.title: so crazy it's off the hook

panel.line: The craziest thing happened to me yesterday!
It was the CRAZIEST!
It was so crazy, I don't feel comfortable talking about it.
And yet, you're talking about talking about it, so do you want me to ask what the crazy thing was?
No thank you! It was too CRAZY.
You know what? I bet it wasn't even very crazy!
Was it very crazy?
My friend, it was so crazy it was OFF THE HOOK.
That's pretty crazy!
I know!
As I say, it's analogous to leaving one's phone off the hook.

transcription.title: science means that not all dreams can come true

panel.line: Hmm...
Yep, it's certain! I can find NO DOWNSIDES with being immortal.
What about a world-weariness that can only come from watching everyone you know and love age and die while you remain stuck in a perpetual youth?
That's okay! Come on: living forever? I could do anything! I could do EVERYTHING - twice!
But what if there's no food, and you're hellishly starving for an eternity?
Could that happen?!
Well, I don't see why not.
But then, where would I be getting my energy from?
Hmm... I guess the idea of immortality DOES clash with the scientific principles of conservation of energy.
And so, once again, I am forced to reject a fantasy because it is based on bad science!
(Science means that not all dreams can come true!)

transcription.title: t-rex and his dinosaur friends in: old photographs

panel.line: T-REX AND HIS DINOSAUR FRIENDS IN: "OLD PHOTOGRAPHS"
You know those early photographs? The silent, gloomy, sepia-toned ones?
They're so sad!

What gets me every time is the faces of people I'll never meet, people long dead, trying not to move as they stare into that early camera lens... but what ESPECIALLY always gets me are the faces of the people who did move. This was for some the only time their face would be recorded, and they happened to shift.
That's so sad! That's profoundly sad!
Is it because those blurred faces remind you that no matter what, the past can never be completely known?

Kind of! But I think what affects me the most if the idea of someone coming that close to achieving at least a type of immortality, and then losing it to something as natural and ordinary as glancing away.
Early photography does have its own sense of sad nostalgia, doesn't it?
It does indeed! It makes me want to go home and sit, alone and sober, in a darkened room.
Whoooo!

transcription.title: man, i've always wanted to travel to the future!

panel.line: Man, I've always wanted to travel to the future!
Always!
It would be SO COOL to see how things work out. Wouldn't you agree, Dromiceiomimus?
I guess!
Also, I'd take back future technology with me and claim it as my own invention.
You can't do that, T-Rex!
Says you!
Says LOGIC. Think about it: if you did that, then where did the idea for the invention come from? You didn't have it, and now the future inventor won't have it either...
A paradox!
Yes!
There's nothing funny about paradoxes.

transcription.title: tonight i am going to bed early

panel.line: Tonight I am going to bed early.
Sweetness!
More sleep for me!
Hey Dromiceiomimus, what time are you going to bed tonight?
Well, I don't know... I guess around eleve-
Cause I'm going to bed early tonight!
Me! Early!
LATER:
Word has it you're bragging about going to bed early?
Word has it right!
But why? Usually people brag about awesome things, not lame-o things like going to bed early.
What are you talking about? It's cool to get a good night's sleep!
YEARS LATER:
what?
It's cool to get a good night's sleep!

transcription.title: teen magazeen, the magazeens for teens

panel.line: Hmm...
*sigh*
Maybe I should just accept that I'll never be on the cover of a magazine!
Why would you ever want to be on the cover of a magazine?
Because it means you're famous!
Well, if that's your idea of fame, why not just publish your own magazine and put your face on the cover?
Hey! Yeah! I'll make my own magazine! AND it'll be my magazine for TEENS!
Aw, no, no! Not that teen magazine idea again!
