transcription.title: immortality through art

panel.line: For we can always see and feel much that the people in old photos and newsreels
I have conceded that literal immortality is impossible!
could not:
However!
that their clothing and automobiles were old-fashioned, that their landscape lacked skyscrapers and other contemporary buildings, that their world was black
I am comforted by the fact that a type of immortality may still be possible. I speak of course of immortality through art!
and white
I get it! You intend to express all that you are through art!
Yes!
and haunting
And in doing so, it will remain forever fixed, for all future generations to see!
Oh man, I want in! Let's make a documentary about our lives.
That's a great idea!
and gone. -Robert Rosenstone, "Visions of the Past"
We'll live forever!

transcription.title: imagine if santa claus worked at a newspaper?

panel.line: Imagine if Santa Claus worked at a newspaper?
"Ho-ho-hold the front page!" he'd say!
Hee hee!
Or if he worked on a boat: "Ho-ho-hoist that mainsail, lads!"
Or if he worked as a chipmunk, he'd say "I'm going to ho-ho-hoard all these nuts!"
I bet he would!
"If he worked as a chipmunk"?! Your wit seems a bit off today, my friend!
Ho-ho-hold up?
Ahem. My wit is CHRISTMAS THEMED
That doesn't make it good though! Lots of Christmas themed stuff is REALLY BAD.
You may be right! However: I still think my wit is stellar!
Come on, tell me that if Santa Claus worked as a chipmunk, he wouldn't talk about ho-ho-hoarding nuts!
That's not a job!
It's a calling, I know; answer the question!

transcription.title: people on the internet: so dumb!

panel.line: Argh! People on the internet:
So dumb!
I can't take it any more, Dromiceiomimus! Everyone is off posting their dumb theories based off incorrect facts, and nobody even recognizes subtlety! So many people are so lame!
Is there such a thing as an incorrect fact? Doesn't being a fact imply correctness?
Aaah! That's not the point! RAGE!
So why are you raging here against people on the internet? Why not post a scathing reply online?
Argh!
I have too much rage! All these people are writing dumb things with incorrect spelling and grammar, and when you correct them, they just get angrier! Its really annoying!
Aha! You just used the wrong "its" there, my friend!
IT WAS SUBTLE IRONY. Sheesh, everyone! Subtlety!
Also!
Noticing such things in spoken language is impossible!

transcription.title: hooray for christmas cards!

panel.line: Hooray for Christmas!
Hooray!!
Hooray for getting Christmas cards!
Hooray!!
Hooray for getting Christmas cards with no return address signed with names you don't recognize!
Wait - I take it this happened to you recently?
Sure did, Skip!
Well, it looks like we've got a Christmas Mystery on our hands!
And that's one mystery I'd prefer to leave unsolved! I'm really enjoying this feeling of mysterious popularity.
Who could it be? Who have I forgotten?? MAYBE it's a pretty lady who wants to kiss me sometime!
Oh man!
Hooray for potential Christmas smooching, my friend!

transcription.title: a window into his very soul

panel.line: Another day full of possibilities!
I wonder what adventures I'll have today...
I wonder!
Hello everyone, it's me!
Yay! The T-Rex is here! I love you, T-Rex!
Ho ho! Good to see you too, D.!
I'm sorry I was ever mean to you in the past, T-Rex!
That's OK!
You are an awesome dude and we should play beachball sometime soon!
You - you really mean it?
Yep! I'd love to play beachball with you.
Just say the word!
If only!
*sigh*
If only.

transcription.title: i slept last night qu?bec style

panel.line: Time to do it up...
Quebec style!
Time to wrap up some presents for all my friends...
Quebec style!
Time to STOMP ON THIS HOUSE - Quebec style!
Alright, I'll bite: what's "Quebec style"?
It's new and exciting!

I invented it because it sounds, as I say, exciting and full of promise! "Let's go see a movie, Quebec style!" Oh, wow! what does it mean? What's so different? I dont know, but I'm excited to find out!
I'm not!
LATER:
Hey guys, I brought a nice salad- Quebec style!
Guys: Oooh!

transcription.title: t-rex in: 'wrapping presents in the plastic bags they came in'

panel.line: T-REX IN: "WRAPPING PRESENTS IN THE PLASTIC BAGS THEY CAME IN"
There's nothing wrong with that!
It saves the environment by using less paper!
But where's the magic? Where's the love and care that is shown in a well-wrapped present?
Replaced! Replaced with a healthy respect for the ENVIRONMENT.
Plus it was cheaper!
Wrapping gifts can be a complicated issue!
Not really!
Sure it is! Do you stay traditional and wrap presents nicely, in fancy paper - this can carry a lot of meaning - or try a more modern, environmentally-sensetive approach?
Like wrapping them in the plastic bags they came in!
Or maybe something just a LITTLE bit classier.
YEARS LATER, THE PRESENTS ARE GONE, BUT THE PLASTIC BAGS HAVE YET TO BIODEGRADE!
Just like my memories!

transcription.title: life reduced to clich?, AGAIN

panel.line: Seeing all my old friends and family over the holidays has been fun. Good times!
But, it has also been SAD.

We've all changed! It makes me more nostalgic for how things were before, just a year or two ago. Not because things were better, but because they were different! I always feel like I missed some opportunity, like I could have done something then that I can't do now.
It's over now!
I know!
But I feel like everyone - all of us - could have done so much then, if only we handn't spent so many nights at home watching a movie or sitting in front of a computer!
"Live every day to the fullest"?
My life reduced to cliche!

transcription.title: nostalgia AND folk quotations, together at last!

panel.line: Bah! Nostalgia!
What use does it serve?
All it does is make us want things that we can't have, and can't even work towards having. Forget it! It's WASTED TIME.
From now on, I will not spend time remembering the past, nor will I be sad when circumstances change! From now on, I'm all about TOMORROW.
Are you sure that's a good attitude, T-Rex? Those who cannot remember the past are condemned to fulfill it!
And those who cannot remember to attribute their quotations are condemned to commit academic offences.
It's common knowledge who said it! Sheesh! GEORGE SANTAYANA.
HELPFUL ONE-PANEL SUMMARY.
Nostalgia can make you sad.
Attribute carefully!

transcription.title: mountaineering leading to cannibalism

panel.line: Man, you'll never find me on a mountaineering expedition or on a voyage to find the Northwest Passage. No thanks!
Do people not realize what's bound to happen?

As I see it, you're pretty much asking to be put in a situation wherein the food runs out, people betray one another, frozen corpses of friends are found in the morning, and eventually everyone resorts to cannibalism.
Well, you won't fool me! I know the stereotypes!
But not all arctic exploration ends in cannibalism, T-Rex!
Says you!
You're just thinking of one or two famous instances! The problem is that nobody ever remembers when the food DOESN'T run out, the times when nobody ends up getting munched on.
I can't help it if no cannibalism is less memorable than tons of cannibalism!
AN IDEA WHICH LEADS TO DISASTER TWO WEEKS LATER:
Wait! Or can I?

transcription.title: time has become unglued!

panel.line: A FAILED EXPERIMENT HAS CAUSED TIME TO BECOME UNGLUED!
Oh no!
EFFECT PRECEDES CAUSE!
It's a disaster!
CAN NOTHING BE DONE TO RESTORE THE NATURAL ORDER?
T-Rex, this is no time to begin stomping on houses!
What? I already stomped on it like 5 seconds ag-
OH MY GOODNESS
IS THE WORLD DOOMED?
T-Rex! I have a desperate plan to save us all!
Hooray!
OUR LAST, BEST HOPE:
All we have to do is re-run the temporal experiment BACKWARDS, thereby forcing time back into its usual lattice inversion structure!
That sounds just scientific enough to work!
BUT THAT MAKES THINGS WORSE THAN EVER! EVERYBODY IS GOING TO BECOME A BABY OR SOMETHING!
Let my last words be an incentive against the words "blog" and "blogosphere"!
I have lived as few men dared dream!

transcription.title: we can sexy all night long

panel.line: Man, forget verbs!
You heard me!
From now on, I am all about other, less complex parts of speech. Verbs don't understand me!
Maybe you don't understand verbs?
Maybe ADJECTIVES wouldn't force us to have such conversations!
Okay T-Rex, I'm not sure what's going on here, but without verbs we cannot run or play or smile or even be!
True! But, we can awesome!
And we can sexy!
We can certainly sexy, that's true!
"We can sexy" is totally going to be my epitaph!
For reals!

transcription.title: canadians drink bags of milk, i guess you should know this

panel.line: Someone at my house finished off a bag of milk, and then put it back in the fridge without replacing it with a new bag!
That's so annoying!
Also, it's very confusing since I live alone!
What do you think, Dromiceiomimus? Am I going crazy? Am I finishing off the milk and then COMPLETELY FORGETTING ABOUT IT?
It seems unlikely!
What else could it be? Is someone breaking into my house just to drink my milk? I don't really mind, I guess - I'd just like to know.
How come these things always happen to you?
It's not my fault!
Well, I'm just pointing out that across all these wacky situations, you're the one element of continuity.
Why would I screw myself over by not putting a new bag of milk back? That's crazy!
I USUALLY DON'T PUT A NEW BAG BACK EITHER
Was it you?!
NO JUST-
VOLUTEERING INFORMATION

transcription.title: SECRETS OF THE MEDICAL PROFESSION

panel.line: Ssh! Come closer!
I know secrets!
SECRETS OF THE MEDICAL PROFESSION!
T-REX IN: SECRETS OF THE MEDICAL PROFESSION
Oh, is this one of those dumb Conspiracy Secrets, wherein fluoride is actually designed to induce pregnancy in freshly married women or something?
What?
Huh?
So what's the secret?
Oh right! Well, the secret is that when doctors and nurses are "taking your pulse", they're not actually doing that!
Really?
Really! They're actually discreetly observing your breathing. They do it on the sly because if you're aware of it, it changes!
Aw man, way to ruin me for any doctor! Now I might have a respiratory problem and I'LL NEVER KNOW.
Hah hah! I am an agent of CHAOS!

transcription.title: chicks dig a guy who eats a lot

panel.line: Oh man, I ate too much last night.
Ooooh man!
I had SO much food, Dromiceiomimus. I thought I'd be smart and cook enough food for lunch the next day, but then I ate it all.
G-great?
Ooooh man!
Hey, here's a friendly tip: you shouldn't try to impress women by bragging about how much you can eat!
Dude! I wasn't trying to IMPRESS her; I was just relaying an amusing anecdote from my own recent history!
Amusing?
Yeah, I ate a lot!
Ha ha!
YEARS LATER, A PARTY:
So, I thought I'd cook enough for the next day as well!
Woman: I'm not impressed!
Not YET! But, allow me to continue...

transcription.title: good times

panel.line: Last Thursday was a big day!
Let's recap!
I have much to offer a potential mate! I am big and strong and oh so sexy!
If only I could find someone, preferably in my own neighbourhood, to be my companion and also to have sex with!
Hello!
Why, hello!
I notice you are attractive!
You as well!
Care to put our emotional stability on the line in exchange for a chance at happiness?
OK!
So...
So...
I'm leaving you!
Ahh....
Good times!

transcription.title: fifty-two movies in fifty-two days

panel.line: "FIFTY-TWO MOVIES IN FIFTY-TWO DAYS"
I challenge myself to watch fifty-two movies in fifty-two days!
FIFTY-TWO DAYS LATER:
Some of them were pretty okay, I guess.
*sigh*
Hey, YOU look like you're feeling a little disillusioned about film!
Good eye!
I am, a little! It wasn't the point of my experiment, but holy, there are SO MANY BAD MOVIES.
There's so many bad everythings!
It's true! My friend, have we become elitist snobs? Are we too good for anything?
Have we - finally - become "too cool for school"?

transcription.title: no more secrets of the medical profession

panel.line: Man, my source for medical secrets won't tell me anything now, because I "broke her confidence" when I told everyone about the breathing thing!
Hah hah!
Oh well!
I know tons of secrets about other professions anyway! Dromiceiomimus, did you know that restaurants want you to fill up on bread?
But if you've already ordered your meal, why would they? They still get their money either way.
It is the essential paradox of the restaurateur!
Your medical secrets were much more compelling!
Yes, well - that's over now!
The only other medical secret I know is that doctors may discreetly ask an elderly patient about his central vision by asking him if he has any trouble reading the numbers on his stove.
Lame!
I guess there's consequences to breaking confidences, eh T-Rex?
Whatever, man!
WHAT to the EV to the E R!

transcription.title: quite adequate for a man of my racial denomination

panel.line: Submit it to me, youngster!
Indeed, indeed!
Submit it to me youngster!
Indeed, indeed!
Submit it to me, youngster!
Indeed, indeed!
And all the ladies proclaim that I'm quite adequate for a man of my racial denomination!
You are aware of the difficulty entailed in simply managing one's life today!
The one whom we're considering is not popular, but he attempts to five off that air nonetheless.
He may be unaware of certain pertinent pieces of information, and he may not be urbane...
T-Rex " Utahraptor: But that which he does not possess, well, be assured that he substitutes for it in his own mind!
Attention! Attention! Engage that neoteric device!

transcription.title: everyone always talks so classy-like

panel.line: I'm tired of movies and plays and radio dramas in which all the characters have such snappy dialogue!
It's unrealistic!
It really yanks me out of the moment. How am I supposed to imagine myself being there, when everyone talks like they know their lines?
And also, sometimes like they're part of a larger work with a distinct thematic focus. Forget that!
So you want "natural" dialogues in your constructed fictions?
Yep!
And, um -
Sorry, what were we talking about there? I just remembered I have to mail a letter today
Man, never-mind!
Oh ho! Did I just do that on purpose? AM I REALLY THAT CLEVER??
What's for dinner?

transcription.title: the laws of thermodynamics, personified for reals

panel.line: The first law of thermodynamics:
Important!
The second law of thermodynamics: somewhat less important.
If the laws were personified, I'd feel sorry for the second law! He'd be the affable loser, dressed in his brothers second-hand patchy tweed. Aww!
Well, I'D invite him over for dinner! We'd have chops!
Hey, T-Rex?
Oh hey, I'm glad you came by: I was just imagining how nice I'd be to the somewhat-less-important law of thermodynamics if it were personified. I'd have sympathy dinners!
Wow, that's crazy! I'll come back when you're less INSANE, because the second law is still really important!
LATER:
HEY I CAN PERSONIFY THEM FOR REAL IF YOU WANT
No worries!

transcription.title: clap clap clap

panel.line: The Devil: T-REX WHAT'S GOING ON MAN THINGS ARE PRETTY GREAT EH
What?! Who is this?
The Devil: IT'S ME THE DEVIL
Leave me alone!
The Devil: HEY
The Devil: I HAVE MY OWN PLAYSTATION
So?!
I have my own refrigerator, and you don't see me bragging!
Who are you talking to?
The Devil! He won't leave me alone, and all he's doing is bragging about the video game consoles he owns.
Man, you've got your own personal theology going, eh?
The Devil: I GOT THIS NEW GAME WHERE YOU HAVE TO CLAP TO THE BEAT TO WIN
Nobody cares!!
The Devil: YOU GO CLAP CLAP CLAP
The Devil: LEVEL THREE IS A PARTICULAR CHALLENGE

transcription.title: best friends edit each other's work

panel.line: Ohhhhhhhhhhhh!
There's water in the basement and I don't know what to do!
If the basement keeps on flooding, then I'll certainly be blue!
The water heater's leaking and my showers are all cold!
I wouldn't mind so much, but it makes me feel so old!
Oooh, boo on the last line of your song, my friend!
Boo?
Yeah! The story was holding together pretty well until you got to that point, but cold showers make you feel old? Not really! They wake you up, mostly.
On the other hand, I thought "feeling blue" tied into the water theme well!
Thanks for your thoughts!
Hey, anytime!
"Best friends forever"

transcription.title: Time to discuss my lovemaking technique!

panel.line: So!
Time to discuss my lovemaking technique!
whoa whoa whoa! T-Rex! Nobody wants to hear about your lovemaking 'technique'!
Okay, how about my lovemaking strategy?
No! Good gosh, this talk belongs in the bedroom, IF ANYWHERE!
Wow, you sure got shot down there, my friend!
I don't get it!
I wasn't going to BRAG! My lovemaking technique consists of a series of awkward fumbles and whispered apologies.
Whoa!
I whisper apologies over and over while maintaining unbroken eye contact.
Holy shit!
Hah! Just kidding!
I guess this is how rumours get started, huh?

transcription.title: profits!!

panel.line: By mining the Earth's outer (liquid) core, I can sell precious iron, thereby giving profits to myself and my business partners!
Profits!!
Would you like to buy some PRECIOUS IRON, featuring nickel and trace amounts of lighter elements, Dromiceiomimus?
No thanks!
That's okay! I'll keep mining it, in case you change your mind.
T-Rex, we were fools! The Earth's core has destabilized because of us!
We'll all be dead soon!
Maybe this isn't the best business idea ever.
Maybe! I've got a better one anyway.
Come one, come all to the Circus of the Improbable!
Featuring me!

transcription.title: the best science fiction story idea ever

panel.line: I have come up with the best science fiction story idea ever!
It's about a man...
A man who can only see well when a light is turned on!
Most guys I know are like that, T-Rex.

But this guy can only see ANYWHERE when a particular light is turned on! Even when he's outside of the room with the light! Even when he's on the BEACH. If the light switch is turned off, so too are his eyes!
So what's the hook? As science fiction, where's the thinly-veiled social allegory to our world?
Huh? There's no allegory. Just a twist at the end when we find out the whole thing was psychosomatic!
But then how would he know when the light is actually on?
That's part of the fiction!
The SCIENCE fiction!!

transcription.title: secret handshakes and laffs a-plenty

panel.line: "SECRET HANDSHAKES"
I had a friend once who joined a sorority.
We were all like...
"At least I don't have to buy my friends!"
It didn't really make sense, because we were already her friends, for free. But we ran with it.
Whatever became of this woman?
She ended up married, I think.
THE END
"LAFFS A-PLENTY"
T-Rex, guess what?
Oh my gosh! What?
My brother is going to be a daddy!
Oh my gosh!!
THE END

transcription.title: the fallacy of balance

panel.line: TALKING DINOSAURS IN: "THE FALLACY OF BALANCE"
The fallacy of balance occurs when news agencies claim truth by reporting "both sides of the story"!
In most cases, that's not balanced at all!
For instance, if you're doing a story on how the sun is hot (assuming it's a slow news day), you don't spend half the story presenting a guy who thinks the sun is cold! You ignore the crazy minority.
But often, when science is reported, equal credence is given to the kooks and their kooky theories! Science is presented as merely an opposing viewpoint.
Wow, I had no idea you were so fascist!
I'm not!
"Hey everyone, look at me! I'm T-Rex! My truth is the right truth!"
That's not me!
There's degrees! Science is based on repeatable observation!
Sounds like a fine line to me, my friend!
HEY TELL HIM ABOUT MY BUSINESS IDEA
Dude! I'm busy!
MAN

transcription.title: FRIENDS SHOUT THEIR THOUGHTS AT FRIENDS

panel.line: Such a nice day! YES, MAYBE A LITTLE BRISK BUT THAT'S OKAY!
Yes indeed, it is a nice day, to be sure!
What's with all the shouting, T-Rex?
I THINK THAT'S PRETTY CLEAR, BUT I GUESS I SHOULD ANSWER HER QUESTION. I figure our innermost thoughts are kept privae too often, so I've decided to shout mine to the world!
HEY, WHY AM I HUNGRY? I JUST ATE A FEW HOURS AGO. I HAD A CHICKEN SAMMICH. I THINK?
T-Rex!!
Dude, keep your voice down! What's the big deal? I could hear you a kilometer off!
I am having an inner dialogue!
So? You don't need to shout it!
MY FRIEND, IT'S CLEAR THAT SHOUTING IS THE BEST WAY TO HAVE INNER DIALOGUES. I AGREE

transcription.title: mmmmmmm an excellent game indeed

panel.line: HEY
T-REX
IT'S THE DEVIL
Leave me alone you crazy bastard!
HEY
HAVE YOU EVER PLAYED THE VIDEO GAME "COMMAND AND CONQUER: RED ALERT"
No!!
THE MAMMOTH TANKS ARE ONE OF THE MORE POWERFUL UNITS IN THE GAME
THEY PRESENT A FORMIDABLE FORCE TO ANY OPPONENT
Argh!! So inane!
Who's inane?
The Devil!
All he wants to do is talk about these stupid games I've never played! He KNOWS I've never played them, and yet - the chatter CONTINUES!
At least he's not tricking you for your soul!
I'd PREFER that!
THE TESLA COILS ARE A WISE DEFENSIVE STRATEGY
Never played it!!
FEW CAN SURVIVE THEIR ELECTRICAL ONSLAUGHT

transcription.title: sisterhood

panel.line: So what's the deal with SISTERHOOD?
Hah hah!
Am I right?
Oh, T-Rex! Are you upset because as a male, you'll never be able to know the small joys and frustrations of having and being a sister?
No way! I know all about sisterhood! I know all about all sorts of things.
I don't think you do! I think this is something which almost by definition is unknowable for you.
Well even if it WAS, I could always get a sex change and a new family or something. I don't know! How nuanced can it be to be a member of a set of two mutually female siblings?
You'll never know!
Do you ever wonder what the pillow fights are like?

transcription.title: freezing time to live longer

panel.line: I no longer wish to die someday! It's true! I have decided that aging is for CHUMPS.
And as a non-chump, this means I must find a way to be immortal!
T-Rex, we've gone over this before! Remember? Immrtality could violate conservation of energy laws? Science means that not all dreams can come true?
This is true! But I have found a LOOPHOLE. A loophole... in science!
Mind describing this "loophole", T-Rex?
Sure! I will simply freeze TIME ITSELF.
That way we ALL get to live forever without breaking any universal laws! Watch!
Wait, WAIT! We'll never be able to become unfrozen, because that action requires time!!
I'm sure I have no idea what you're tal-
TIMELESS AGES LATER:

transcription.title: our first look at the french rap universe

panel.line: There are a few moments in my life at which, I can now see in hindsight, critical events took place.
These events set in motion other events which finally led to the person I am today!
For instance: Dromiceiomimus! Had you and I never met, I would never have become so good at Scrabble!
Well, ah ha, I'm not sure that you wouldn't have picked it up somewhere else!
Still! Things would be different!
That's the best example you can come up with? Scrabble?
Well!
All I really wanted to point out was that it's cool to think about these things sometimes. You know, like chance jobs where you met friends (or perhaps LOVERS?) - things like that!
I'm not convinced that such small events can have that large an impact!
MEANWHILE, IN A PARALLEL "FRENCH RAP" UNIVERSE:
Oui oui tout le monde - et ca n' arret pas!!
Je veux une petite quelque chose quelque chose!

transcription.title: amusing observations about everyday life

panel.line: Here are some amusing observations about everyday life!
1) Men stereotypically leave the toilet seat up!
2) Parking spaces can be rare.
3) Airplane food?
Well... that's it!
The first of your "amusing observations" seems almost reverse sexist!
Explain!
Well, you're making jokes about men, but that's because they're the safe target! They're usually seen as having power in society. Would you make an equivalent joke about a woman?
Sheesh, of course I would! I make jokes about whomever I please!
OUR STORY TAKES A SUDDEN DIVE... INTO GRAMMATICAL SCRUTINY!
Is "whom" a necessary English construction? Its role as object is already indicated by syntax.

transcription.title: sexualized bikes

panel.line: I discovered some bad news yesterday: my bicycle needs a new seat!
The SHAFT upon which the seat is MOUNTED has become bent!
Whoah, T-Rex! Such sexualized language!
I'm sorry! It's just hard to talk about bicycles without sexualized language. That's the nature of the beast!
I also need a new PUMP for my tires.
I'm pretty sure you could avoid this if you wanted, T-Rex!
I really don't think I could!
To summarize: the THRUST of what I'm saying is -
"Thrust"?
- apparently unable to PENETRATE your skepticism -
You're not impressing anyone, T-Rex!
YEAH I'M NOT IMPRESSED EITHER
Really?
OKAY MAYBE JUST A LI'L

transcription.title: spring break!!

panel.line: Spring Break!!
Woooo!
Wooo!
SPRING BREAK!
Woah, hold up! WHICH spring break, T-Rex? You don't go to school!
Nevertheless, I feel I am entitled to one!
Woooo!
Spring break WOOO!!
You think that if you shout "woo!" enough, a party will form, don't you?
The thought DID cross my mind!
Well it won't work! It takes more than shouting "spring break" and "woo" to make a party happen!
My theory and teen movies would disagree with you my friend!
Spring break!
WOOOOOO!
DANCING LADIES AND TASTY SNACKS SUDDENLY APPEAR JUST OFFSCREEN:
Excellent!

transcription.title: spring is my favourite season

panel.line: Yes my friends, spring will be coming soon!
Hooray!!
Spring is my favourite season, Dromiceiomimus. Do you know why?
Nope!
It is my favourite season because it is so pretty!
Wait - just a few months ago you told me summer was your favourite season!
Oops!
Could it be that you've been LYING to us, and that you don't really HAVE a favourite season?
No, I wasn't lying!
I just -- um!
NO ONE BELIEVES T-REX EVER AGAIN:
Fuuuuck

transcription.title: how quickly we find ourselves in the positions of adults

panel.line: The Utahraptor's brother is having children - it seems the time of parenthood is upon us!
How quickly we find ourselves in the positions of adults!
Dromiceiomimus, do you think you might have children some day?
I don't know - I don't feel qualified to have children.
That's exactly how I feel! You've articulated it perfectly.
Will I ever feel qualified?
I hope so!
I'm sure you'd make a great parent, T-Rex! I can imagine you running around with all your kids behind you, teaching them how to stomp on things...
5 little baby T-Rexes, each with their own pair of cute little arms!
What do you mean, "cute"?
"Cute"?!

transcription.title: you cannot step into the same river twice

panel.line: Today I believe in temporal presentism! Only the objects around me are real. They exist in space, but not in time!
Neither the past nor the future actually exists!
Each moment is unique, and life is but series of moments, connected by our memories! We speak of events occurring in the past only as a matter of convenience.
So the past is an illusion, eh?
Yep!
Yet we're having a conversation and you remember what's going on!
Aha, my friend! That's only because this present moment is predicated on past moments being as they were.
This is a stupid theory! It doesn't get you anything!
It does explain why time travel isn't possible! You can't visit a past or future that doesn't exist!
Th- That's pretty much it!

transcription.title: valentine's day: personal politics

panel.line: Today is Valentine's day!
Hah hah! Sucks to THAT!

I believe it to be a MANUFACTURED HOLIDAY. Last year it brought me nothing but trouble, so this year I am going out of my way to make sure that everyone knows they don't have to celebrate their love if they don't want to!
Isn't that kind of a jerky thing to do?
Perhaps!

More than perhaps! Lots of people just use Valentine's day as an excuse for spending time with their sweeties, commercialism or not. Nothing ruins a romantic evening like a T-Rex barging in and calling it a corporate-sponsored fraud!
IT'S TRUE:
Voice from outside the panel: You jerk!
You'll thank me when you share my politics!

transcription.title: dinosaur laffs featuring t-rex the dinosaur

panel.line: "DINOSAUR LAFFS" featuring t-rex the dinosaur
Hey God! Check this out!
OKAY
A horse walks into a bar and the bartender says "why the long face?"
T-REX I'M GOD AND I SAY THAT IS NOT A VERY GOOD JOKE
What?! It was awesome!
HORSES have long faces!
LITERAL long faces!
I bet you don't know much about good jokes anyway!
WELL ACTUALLY
Hey T-Rex!
Oh hey Utahraptor! Check this out: a dog with a missing foot hobbles into a bar and drawls "I'm looking for the man who shot my paw"!
Huh?
Because sometimes cowboys' parents got shot?
Oh! Oh man - that is an awful joke!
TELL HIM I'M GOD AND I AGREE WITH HIS ACCURATE ASSESSMENT
I won't!
BUT YOU AGREE IT'S AN ACCURATE ASSESSMENT THOUGH RIGHT
IT'S PRETTY ACCURATE

transcription.title: facts which may or may not be true about motorcycle enthusiasts

panel.line: FACTS WHICH MAY OR MAY NOT BE TRUE ABOUT MOTORCYCLE ENTHUSIASTS COMICS
Motorcycle enthusiasts call cars "cages"!
Motorcycle enthusiasts enjoy "souping up" their rides almost as much as anime fans enjoy the classic "Battle Angel Alita" graphic novels!
Wow!
Utahaptor: Motorcycle enthusiasts tell each other apart by their helmet "street tags"!
I know!
But did YOU know that some motorcycle enthusiasts refer to long motorcycle rides as "numb bumming"?
In fact I did! Did YOU know that some enthusiasts subscribe to magazines focused on their particular enthusiasm?
DEDICATED TO MOTORCYCLE ENTHUSIASTS AROUND THE WORLD
YOU GUYS SURE DO LIKE TO RIDE MOTORCYCLES

transcription.title: happy dog the happy dog

panel.line: My friends, I have written a new book!
A book for CHILDREN!
My book is called "Happy Dog the Happy Dog" and it mixes the story of Happy Dog with important lessons I've chosen about life! It also features adorable drawings of happy dogs. Amazing!
So let's hear some of this amazing book!
I'd be pleased to give a reading!
"Happy Dog the happy dog is the happiest dog on his street! He loves to play in the grass. Everyone you know will one day be dead!"
Whoah, what?! T-Rex! That's awful!
"Happy Dog loves to play fetch with a young boy named Timmy! Timmy is Happy Dog's best friend. Timmy is made out of meat. Your whole family is made out of meat."
What's up?

transcription.title: guest week: allene! lessons in sharing

panel.line: [[T-Rex is holding a strawberry milkshake. A woman is next to him, reaching for it.]]
Lessons in Sharing: Featuring T-Rex
mm! strawberry, my favourite!
Woman: C'mon T-Rex! We got 2 straws for a reason!
{{alt-text: WHAT}}

transcription.title: guest week: jeph jacques! stop slouching

panel.line: Having proper posture is very important!
Stop slouching!
Having proper posture enables me to stomp this house without injuring my delicate, ladylike ankles!
Here, I'll demonstrate again, this time on a tiny human lady!
Uh...T-Rex?
First of all, you're hardly qualified to talk about proper posture. Yours is awful! Second, what's the deal with you talking about how ladylike your ankles are? That's just weird!
No it's not! You're just jealous!
Whatever. I'm outta here.
Stand up straight!
Voice from outside the panel: I'm a dinosaur! We're not supposed to stand up straight!
We...we're not?
<<*SNAP*>> [[from T-Rex' legs]]
Oh nooooo!

transcription.title: guest week: james turner! one hundred tiny ninjas

panel.line: [[Ninjas are attacking T-Rex throughout panel 1-4]]
Man, I'm getting fed up with fighting these ninjas all the time...
...REALLY fed up!
Don't you get fed up with fighting ninjas all the time t-rex?
Do I? Hell Yeah! Maybe if I smash their log dojo and ninja-mobile they'll leave me alone.
Still figting ninjas t-rex?
You know it! Perhaps if I stomp their beautiful (yet deadly) leader, 'Black Lotus', I can end it for good!
Black Lotus: you will never defeat us! AIE!
[[The Ninjas are now all dead]]
Wow, I thought you'd never finish fighting those ninjas!
Me either!
So what are you going to do with your life now?
I don't know, settle down maybe. I always wanted to be a farmer.
[[Mars bats are flying towards T-Rex]]
Later, at the farm...
Mars bats: squee! squee!
Oh no! Mars bats!

transcription.title: guest week: nicky gurewitch! being a magician

panel.line: Too much of my life has been spent on not being a magician. It's time to change all that.
For my first trick, I will make an entire house disappear!
ABRA-CAD-
I can magically change myself into a raptor.
See?

transcription.title: guest week: justin pierce! space rex

panel.line: People of space, I hear your plea...
"Avenge me, T-Rex!"
Space Rex: Or, should I say...
Space Rex: Space Rex!
Soon...
Space Rex: Do you hear it, my trusted sidekick?
Space Rex: The silent screams of millions?
No, I... guess it's just you. Mister, uh...
Space Rex: Space Rex!
Professor Utiarty: Bwaha!
Professor Utiarty: With my killing ray, I...
Professor Utiarty: Professor Utiarty...
Professor Utiarty: Will take over the world!
Professor Utiarty: The world of space!
Space Rex: Utiarty, the only thing you'll be killing is time...
Space Rex: In space prison!
Professor Utiarty: Ah, but you see, as easily as I can swap my monocle..
Professor Utiarty: I can steal your goggles, Space Rex!
Professor Utiarty: Or, should I say, T-Rex!
He... He knows!
They all know!
Oh no! With his secret identity no longer a secret, is this the end of Space Rex?! Find out on the next exciting episode of... Space Rex!

transcription.title: his name means "tyrant lizard king" after all

panel.line: I can't believe the Utahraptor thinks that T-Rexes are cute. I am not cute! My daily romps inspire fear in all who meet me!
Fear!
Dromiceiomimus! Do you think me and my little green arms are cute, or do they rather inspire a chilling fear in your very SOUL?
Heh. I never noticed before, but they are kinda cute.
But look: I'm crushing a house! It is very frightening!
What could be more terrifying than being crushed by a T-Rex?
Being mauled by a Utahraptor?
What?
I'm just sayin'.
THAT EVENING...
Does no one realize that this is a very sensitive issue for me?!

transcription.title: guest week: aaron farber! another beautiful day

panel.line: Ah, another beautiful day.
...OR IS IT!?
...What? What kind of question was that?
I'm attempting to build dramatic tension!
I really don't think you can turn the relative beauty of weather into a dramatic event, T-Rex.

Oh, but that's where you're wrong! Even as we speak, listeners are inching closer to our conversation, sweat beginning to form at their brows. "What is it," they wonder, "good... or bad?" Each moment we delay... their anticipation grows... ever... stronger....
And now, the exciting conclusion!
Actually, it's a bit brisk for my tastes!

transcription.title: guest week: andy hirsch! change

panel.line: It's decided!
Change is good!
If I change this cup: recyclable material!
Gasp!
My children's children would thank me!
Wait!
You're ignoring some of the immediate consequences of your actions.
My root beer!
Change can be very bad

transcription.title: raccoons: nature's most sinister mammal

panel.line: Oh man, there were a whole bunch of raccoons hanging around outside my house last night! I was like,
Aaaaaahhhh!
Hah hah! I don't believe it! T-Rex - you're afraid of raccoons!
There's nothing funny about this! They're damned freaky animals! They're SMART and CUNNING and they sit on the heads of dogs to drown them!
What?
They do!
And their hands - their little, nimble, probing hands!
Wow - you're really afraid of those cute little guys!
They're not cute: they're freaky! They know too much! They open up jars and stuff!
That night:
Raccoons: T-REX, WE PUT OUR MINDS TO IT AND TAUGHT OURSELVES ENGLISH!
Holy Shit! Leave me alone!
RACCOONS: T-REX -
RACCOONS: WE WERE NOT MEANT TO BE

transcription.title: cephalopods: oh my goodness what went wrong

panel.line: Damned sinister raccoons are still hanging around outside my house! And just when I thought things couldn't get more freaky, their cephalopod friends showed up!
I was like,
"What? AAAAHHHHH!"
Cephalopods? Like squid?
Squid cuttlefish, and other similarly baleful creatures are all members of the cephalopod family, characterized by HUGE EYS, BEAKS, INTELLIGENCE, and AMBITION.
I thought cephalopods were underwater animals!
They played us for suckers!
Well, maybe they're friendly! Maybe they just want to be your friend?
They're jet powered, did you know that? They're jet-powered animals and their heads are covered in PREHENSILE TENTACLES. They're carnivorous and most are cannibals!
THAT NIGHT:
I don't want any trouble, cephalopods!
Cephalopods: T-REX, WE'RE GOING TO SNEAK INTO BED WITH YOU TONIGHT!
Cephalopods: WE'LL BE LIKE
Cephalopods: "HELLO T-REX"

transcription.title: guess who's coming to dinner

panel.line: So the good news is that the raccoons and cephalopods aren't hanging around my house anymore!
The BAD news is that they've moved in together next door!
Really! Wow, that's quite a development!
Yeah, quite a sinister development! The two animals I find the freakiest develop the ability to talk and move in next door? I do not need to know animals with these abilities!
Hey, do you think these recent events in your life could be an allegory for racism?

Not really! It's not racist to like some animals and not others. Besides, I'm not irrationally against raccoons and cephalopods: they've threatened me! They wait menacingly outside my house for me to come home!
And "some of your best friends are raccoons and cephalopods", right?
THAT NIGHT:
Cephalopod and raccoon neighbours, I respect your unique worldview!
Raccoons and cephalopods: YOU ALWAYS HAVE SUCH NICE THINGS TO SAY, T-REX.
Raccoons and cephalopods: COME CLOSER, T-REX
Raccoons and cephalopods: GIVE US A KISS

transcription.title: in which t-rex walks around telling people stories

panel.line: We join our story as T-Rex is relaying dumb stories he's heard and believes to be true.
Time to educate my peers...through the medium of incredibly true facts!
Hello Dromiceiomimus! Did you know that if you held your eyes open when you sneezed, the could pop out? Pop!
Really? That seems pretty improbable, since I know that eyelids closing is just incidental to the sneezing refl-
It's true!! They could just pop out like CRAZY.
Hey, are you going around telling people stories?
True stories! FACTS! Want to hear one?
These wouldn't happen to be URBAN LEGENDS, would they, T-Rex?
Of course not! Ha ha! So, um... here's a fun fact about trumpet players: each saves the contents of their spit valve in a mason jar, and chugs it at the end of the year!
I don't know why!

transcription.title: sad comics

panel.line: SAD COMICS
It's true!
Sometimes I get a little sad!
You wouldn't guess it from my rugged exterior, but beneath my tremendous frame beats the heart of a sensitive man. So sensitive!
T-Rex, you're talking about how sensitive you are while simultaneously stomping on things!
Yes, well - I realize that now, Utahraptor, and it makes me very Sad!
You don't look very sad to me!
I'm sad on the inside!
Seriously, check it out:
"Boo hoo hoo! Let's have a lengthy discussion about FEELINGS."
Wooo! I'm talking the talk!!

transcription.title: from the greek nostos ("a return home") algos ("pain")

panel.line: I've changed my mind! You know what's great?
Nostalgia!
Hot Wheels(TM) cars!
Simpler videogames!
Less swearing on the radio?
Woooo!
LATER:
...BMX(TM) bikes!
Are you listing things that you find nostalgic?
I am!
But doesn't it take more than simply listing old things to really be nostalgic?
Nope!
LATER:
Ninja turtles!

transcription.title: the devil in: mmorpgs

panel.line: GREETINGS TO YOU T-REX
The Devil!!
What's that matter: run out of video games?
NO THE VIDEOED GAMES ARE QUITE PLENTIFUL INDEED
I HAVE BEEN PLAYING SEVERAL MMORPGS OF LATE
Huh?
THEY ARE GAMES PLAYED ONLINE WITH A LARGE NUMBER OF STRANGERS
THE EXPERIENCE IS UNPARALLELED
Man, I don't want to hear about it!
Talking to the Devil again?
He's the one talking to ME! I didn't ask for this!
Well, have you tried getting rid of him? Hey T-Rex, isn't it great how the Devil is PRETTY LAME?
I WOULD DISAGREE WITH THAT PARTICULAR ASSESSMENT
T-REX YOUR COMPANION IS CLEARLY UNFAMILIAR WITH MY PROWESS IN THE REALM OF MMORPGS

transcription.title: spam protection systems / TOUCH FOOTBALL!

panel.line: I sent an email to some dude today, and it came back with a verification message I had to reply to in order to prove I was "legit"!
Stupid whitelist spam protection systems!
Huh? You don't like spam protection systems?

Not these ones! They're inherently flawed, assuming you ever want to hear from someone you don't already know. If two strangers have a whitelist system, then either they can never talk to each other, or they still get spam!
They'll still get spam?
Of course!

Because if verification emails can get through, then it won't be long until spammers send messages that look enough like them to also get through. There's still a hole! And if you seal it, you miss real verification emails.
I guess so. Anyway! Let's go play TOUCH FOOTBALL!
SOON:
I'm open! I'm open! I'm open!

transcription.title: extraordinary claims

panel.line: The realization that I've had a homosexual affair with the Utahraptor THAT I CANNOT REMEMBER AT ALL profoundly disturbs me. How could I forget such a thing?
I wonder what it was like? Maybe I was really good!
Or MAYBE he's making the whole thing up! That would explain why I don't remember it.
Extraordinary claims require extraordinary proof.
Yes! Thank you!
I feel alot better about the whole thing now.
But I have proof!
You?
What manner of proof have you?
uh
well
i know that it's green
*gasp*

transcription.title: dino-pets

panel.line: I have been thinking, and I have come up with the perfect solution to the problem of my being considered, by others, to be "cute".
I will get a pet!
A little animal that will follow me around on my adventures, be my companion... someone to keep my bed warm at night!
Also, this pet will have to be cuter than I am, thereby making me look even tougher in comparison!
A small pet, perhaps something bite-sized...
Looking for a pet?
Yes; have you any suggestions?
I have no input of value relative to this specific situation.
Thanks anyway!

transcription.title: nothing you can say will scare me!

Not me!
The ONLY advantage I can think of is that it'll be cool on Hallowe'en. That's it! And that's not even much of an advantage, actually! Not even!
T-Rex, did you ever think that maybe they're just as scared of you as you are of them?
Hah!
Seriously! You could be quite imposing to someone who doesn't know you!
Man, these animals are WITHOUT FEAR. I don't see how acting like I'm not afraid will help things!
THAT NIGHT:
Raccoons/Cephalopods: ARE YOU AFRIAD OF US, NEIGHBOR?
No way dudes! Nothing you can say will scare me!
Raccoons/Cephalopods: COME BLEED WITH US. COME BLEED WITH US, T-REX.

transcription.title: adjectivizing is the new verbing

panel.line: Oh man, I'm still a little tired from last night!
Time to go and get some HEARTY MAN SLEEP!
"Hearty man sleep"?
Damn straight Dromiceiomimus! I am recently ALL ABOUT adding "man" in front of things to make them sound all the more manly. You should see me man snooze! I man snooze with a pure MAN FURY.
Does this work for "woman" too?
Possibly!
But I definitely have no interest in finding out! All I want to do today is have lots of man naps and stomp on things with my stern man foot.
That's your call, I guess!
Utahraptor (Not seen): By the way, "man naps" sounds pretty suggestive!
I know, but I can't figure out a way to stop that!
I live with my man failings.

transcription.title: post-communism

panel.line: So what's the deal with...
...POST-COMMUNISM?
You're going to have to define that for me, T-Rex!
It's what comes after communism, I think. Basically, what's the deal with it?
You don't have any idea what post-communism is, do you T-Rex?
I freely admit that I do not!
But I ask: assuming it exists, what is its deal?
Are you really interested? Is this your way of showing interest? I could tell you all about it if you want.
Please!
SHORTLY:
Really? No state has ever claimed to have reached a fully communist system, and so the term is inaccurate, etymologically speaking? That's pretty cool!

transcription.title: averaged emotions

panel.line: Would it not be pretty neat to average out your emotional states across your entire life?
I bet I'd never be sad again!

But you'd never be happy again either! You'd probably be in this grey state of apathy for every second of the rest of your life! That doesn't sound appealing to me: always being out of sync with your friends, never knowing when to smile...
No way Dromiceiomimus! I bet that I would be on average at least KIND of happy.
But what if you ended up being sad?
Sad?
Yeah, what if you ended up being sad? It would be so tragic, especially if you had been pretty happy up to now! You'd feel - and you'd KNOW - that one day it's all going to go horribly wrong.
That would be pretty awful, knowing that on the whole, your life is one of sadness!
MEANWHILE, IN THE UNIVERSE WHERE THIS HAPPENED AND T-REX DIED IN A REALLY TERRIFYING WAY:
AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAH
hhuuh
AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAH

transcription.title: supportive sounds for post-breakup dudes

panel.line: Here are some bad things to say to someone who just broke up with his long-term girlfriend!
"Wasn't she the best ever?"
"I was always impressed with her wit, her beauty, her intelligence and her sense of humour."
"It's too bad you never go married, eh?"
"I had a bit of a crush on her too! She was a cutie."
"I bet shew was a good kisser, huh?"
"Was she a good kisser?"
"Do you remember kissing her?"
"Was it nice?"
"Pretty nice?" "Are you worried that one day you'll forget what it was like?"
"Wouldn't that be sad?"

transcription.title: politeness and insincerity and what have you

panel.line: I concede that, sometimes, it's nice to be polite! However!
I also believe that it's NOT nice to be insincere. I am in conflict!

This is because there are situations in which being polite implies being insincere. For example, I may think someone looks pretty ridiculous in their fancy new hat, but if they ask me what I think, I'll try to say SOMETHING positive about it! In order not to hurt their feelings, I am polite in sharing my opinion.
But it's understood that people will try to be polite, so this insincerity is okay!
Huh?
If everyone knows people are being insincere, then what's the point of polliteness? We end up in the same place, semantically speaking.
Not really! Since there is always SOME doubt as to whether someone is just being polite, one can always take something as a compliment!
Hold that thought.
HEY YOU! ACROSS THE STREET!
I LIKE YOUR FRIGGIN' HAT!

transcription.title: okay so i didn't use the british spelling of 'manoeuvre' but whatever!

panel.line: Today is a good day I think for more SECRETS of the MEDICAL PROFESSION!
Wooo! Secrets!!
Dromiceiomimus, you know how doctors will hit your knee with a hammer to test your reflexes?
Indeed I do!

WELL! In some cases the patient will be too aware of what's going on, and the test won't work. In such cases the patient is asked to lock their hands togetehr and pull them in opposite directions. This distraction allows the test to succeed!
I believe this is called the "Jendrassik Maneuver"!
That's a pretty sinister name!
You're telling me! What's neat about it, though, is that it's AUTOMATIC. Even if you're aware that it's a distraction, the Maneuver still works!
Really?
Yep! It's a neurological distraction affecting the pathways between the central nervous system and the motor neurons, dishibiting any tonic (i.e.: baseline) inhibitions. DOCTORS, huh?

transcription.title: let history be the judge

panel.line: Today is an excellend day I think for walking aroudn like I own the place!
Woo! Looks like my day just got filled up!
Dromiceiomimus, would you say that I'm an excellent dude for walking around like I own the place?
Actually, my friend, I would disagree! I think there are more productive uses of your time.
I'll let history be the judge of that!
That's a pretty suspect saying, don't you think?
WHAT

Seriously! It's predicated on history always being a story of progression, with the future assumed to be a better judge of what's right than the present. I'm not sure that's valid! Plus, I'm certain there's things that have been variously judged to be good and bad at different points in history!
Okay, so what if I said "I think I'll let an assumed future history which agress with my current position be the judge of THAT!"?
Then I'd cancel our bowling plans on Saturday!
Noooo!

Then when it blows up in my face, I'll - Um!
Anyway, to the internet!
OPTIMISM COMIS
Hello T-Rex! How are you today?
Hello my friend! I'm fine!
Great! Listen, T-Rex, we've known each other for a long time, right?
Right!
Right! Well, there's something I've been meaning to tell you - something I should have said when we first met...
Sweet!

transcription.title: explode is often a transitive verb in dinosaur land

panel.line: In order to make things easier for myself AND my peers, I am construction a personl Enemies of T-Rex List (Enemies List)!
Featuring: corporations!
First on my list are the people who make those cans of frozen concentrated juice at the grocery store. When I open them, they sometimes explode a little juice on me!

I think it's because water expands when it's frozen and so the can is under pressure, and there's a little melted juice at the top? I don't know. But they're on the list! Also: 1970s American popular culture.
Listen T-Rex, are you really sure you want an Enemies List?
Why wouldn't I?
Well - it just doesn't seem very charitable, that's all. Plus, if you need a list to remember your enemies, maybe it's better if you just forgave and forgot?
I guess I just don't see what you gain by having such a list, much less a well-publicised one!
Dude! You're coming close to questioning the very IDEA of an enemies list!

transcription.title: criminal record: helicopter theft

panel.line: Man, the coolest thing ever?
Skateboarding out of a friggin' crashing helicopter!
The ONLY way it could be better is if you yelled "EXTREME!" on the way down. "Whoah! Extreme!!"
That is pretty extreme!
You know it! And plus, you could do extreme tricks on the way down - like a backside lipslide 50-50 fakie!
Oh man, what if people continued skateboarding INSIDE of the crashing helicopter?
I hadn't even thought of that!
Yeah, and when it crashes everyone thinks they're dead, but then they burst out of the rubble on their skateboards yelling "EXTREME!" and do ollies on the crumpled-up chassis!
That is pretty friggin' extreme!
Extreme!
T-Rex " Utahraptor: EXTREME!!
Whoaaaaah!

panel.line: Last night I started to write my own autobiography! However, I had to stop after a while because, as it turns out, my life is NOT THAT INTERESTING.
Imagine my dismay at coming to such a realization!
Therefore I have resolved to make my life better "copy" and will, from now on, style my activities such that they'll be appealing to a hyopthetical audience!
I will be forever on stage, performing!
This is a very common fantasy among children!
Oh yes?

Yeah! It's the idea that they're being watched on TV or by aliens or something. Not only does it make one feel important, but it's comforting to think that someone is there to share in your victories and defeats.
I imagine that is very true!
HEY T-REX IF YOU'RE TRYING TO MAKE THINGS INTERESTING THIS CONVERSATION TOTALLY ISN'T HELPING

I'M COOL

transcription.title: three years before the great war

panel.line: "Mary was a young girl, 15 years old, and desperately in love with her next door neighbour, Tom."
"It was three years before the Great War!"

"Tom sat on his porch in the cooling night. 'How do you do?' said Mary, curtseying slightly. 'Hullo Mary,' said Tom, 'How are your folks.' He raised his voice so slightly that it was not a question, but Mary didn't notice. She was wearing here prettiest dress, the one with the blue floral print that her mother had sewn for her on her birthday. Mary smiled."
What are you doing, T-Rex?
I'm writing a story!
It's a heartwarming story about two children growing up in a simpler time, a time when gender roles were clear and children played hopscotch on their way home from school!
Wow, that's pr-
Hah hah, just kidding!
Oh man, did I get you? Did I get you?
I - I guess?
What if I said I'm not really kidding?

transcription.title: t-rex and his dinosaur friends in: "gender? huh?"

panel.line: I've been thinking about gender roles! Is gender a social construct?
Or, does it refer specifically to the persuasion of one's naughty bits?
Well T-Rex, it can't be a purely biological construct, because there are people born intersexed!
This is true! Plus, people's ideas of "masculine" and "feminine" change over time and across cultures. I don't think either a purely social OR biological explanation satisfies!
It's a very tricky question, and one that many people feel strongly about!
Indeed!

Besides, even if we do assume that gender is some mixture of both societal and biological self, all that gets us is a murky combination of influences, predisposition and societal feedback that may be impossible to untangle.
Hey, let's try though!
AMAZINGLY, T-REX AND UTAHRAPTOR SOLVE ALL POSSIBLE ISSUES OF GENDER... BETWEEN PANELS!
You the man, my friend!
No, YOU the man!
Hah hah! How delightfully droll!

panel.line: I've been thinking about gender roles! Is gender a social construct?

This is true! Plus, people's ideas of "masculine" and "feminine" change over time and across cultures. I don't think either a purely social OR biological explanation satisfies!

transcription.title: a letter to grandmother

panel.line: Alright, alright. Things I Need To Do Today:
Get dog food for my very angry dog!
Buy some food for me while I'm at it. Write a letter to my Grandmother whom I love dearly. Laundry!
Sounds like you've got a lot of chores to take care of today!
I do!
Oh, but the Grandmother letter isn't a chore. I like writing letters, and especially letters to my Grandmother!
You're a good grandson!
I know it!
BUT T-REX FORGETS TO WRITE FOR LIKE THREE MONTHS:
I AM THE WORST GRANDSON EVER.

transcription.title: logical fallacy comics: the straw man

panel.line: LOGICAL FALLACY COMICS: today's fallacy: "THE STRAW MAN"
The "Straw Man" fallacy isn't so much a fallacy as it is a way of life!

In this fallacy, you present an altered version of your opponent's argument in order to make it appear absurd! You then tear apart this weaker, ridiculous argument and claim victory. Basically it can be summarized as "make stuff up and attribute it to your opponent"! Haha! EXCELLENT.
What? It's not excellent, T-Rex! It's bad argument technique!
Maybe!
BUT, it's also a great way to win debates. And if anyone calls you on it, you just say "Come on. Your attack on me is the real straw man fallacy here; let's be serious."
But that's wrong! Oh man, remind me never to debate you on the internet EVER.
Hah! Hey how did you know I use the internet?

transcription.title: the world revolves around me / probably

panel.line: MONDAY:
The world revolves around me The world revolves around me
(Probably)
TUESDAY:
...around me!
(Pro
Bab
Ly)!
WEDNESDAY:
Ohh, the world revolves around me!
Yes, the world revolves around me!
(Are you certain?)
(Probably!)
THURSDAY:
Yes, the woooorld, she revolves around me! (Probably!)
ENOUGH!
Holy cow, T-Rex! I didn't mind you singing your song the first time I heard it, but it's been four days! Four days! TIME FOR A NEW SONG!
Sheesh, okay! It was just an amusing little ditty. I wrote it myself, you know!
BY THE WAY THAT IS A PRETTY CATCHY TUNE T-REX
Thanks, God!
I'M GONNA STEAL IT OKAY

transcription.title: give me a break

panel.line: COMPRESSED THESIS COMICS: today's thesis: "Computational Measures of the Acceptability of Light Verb Constructions"
Light verb constructions (LVCs) are constructions like "take a stroll" and "give a smile"!

They are formed by combining a light verb (such as "take" and "give") with a complement ("stroll", "smile"). Most of the meaning of a (non-idiomatic) LVC comes from the complement ("stroll" and "smile").
Amazing!
I know!
But aren't some LVCs more acceptable than others?
Yes, this is true!
It would be really nice to be able to measure that computationally.
Sure would! Hmm, I wonder if statistical measures of association would correlate well with human judgement of construction acceptability?
TWO YEARS LATER:
Hot crackers! They DO! I should totally write this stuff down!

transcription.title: i dunno, they look about the same to me

panel.line: Bad news, everyone!
I'm not as skinny as I used to be!
Dromicieomimus: Oh, whatever, T-Rex! You're as trim as always. meanwhile, I must have put on at least 20 pounds since January!
Whatever, Dromiceiomimus! You're fine. But look at MY thigh: it's somewhat larger than before
You both are crazy, and you both look fine!
I'M the one who's putting on weight. I'm getting old and chubby!
Whatever, man! I'm getting OLDER and CHUBBIER.
YOU GUYS ARE ALL MAKING A BALUE JUDGEMENT ABOUT BODY TYPES
Oh, are we gonna talk about cultural relativism? Cause I can talk about cultural relativism!
DUDE
I KNOW

transcription.title: feed the dog

panel.line: I've got to remember to feed my pet dog!
THE NEXT DAY...
I forgot to feed the dog! I'll do it tomorrow.
THE NEXT DAY...
Got any plans for the summer?
Actually, I might go up north for a bit.
Shoot! You know what? I was supposed to feed the dog today!
THE NEXT DAY...
Hey T-Rex, have you fed your dog yet?
Oh hell!
THE NEXT DAY...
Did you remember to feed the dog?
God damn it! Can you believe I forgot again?
TWO WEEKS LATER...
SHIT!

transcription.title: t-rex is a motivational speaker!

panel.line: People are always like, "Boo hoo hoo! I'm not motivated!" Well, not anymore! Not since I, T-Rex, have decided to become...
... a motivational speaker!
It'll be fantastic, Dromiceiomimus! I will motivate through a combination of folk wisdom and "uncommon sense" advice couched in clever stock market analogies!
Sounds great?
Sounds MOTIVATIONAL!
I don't think the world needs what you are offering, T-Rex!
Think positive, friend!
No, really! I don't know anyone who's ever been motivated by an insincere catch phrase. I think you need to get back to basics, if you're serious about this!
Basics, eh? Hmm...
LATER:
Excuse me! Unmotivated people? I'm T-Rex, your motivational speaker!
So! Has anyone here ever tried setting goals, and then achieving those goals?

transcription.title: the problem of specialization

panel.line: So, throughout time, people have spent their youth learning, and the time after that applying what they've learned. Not a bad system!
... For a first try!

The problem is that we're spending longer and longer studyin. If you do a PhD, you could be 30 years old when you graduate! And since there's so much to know about the world, people are forced to specialize. Even at 30, there just isn't enough time to learn it all!
It's a necessary tradeoff! Millions of people specialize and make tiny contributions to knowledge.
It's true!
But what if it didn't have to be that way? If we lived forever, we could learn so much! We could make connections between completely unrelated fields.
This is true, but the older generation would always remain! If they became stuck in their ways, they might inhibit progress instead of helping.
MEANWHILE, IN THE UNIVERSE WHERE NOBODY EVER DIES:
Sure, borrow my four-seater rocket car whenever you want!
Person: Thanks man!
Hah hah! I'm totally glad I invented it.

transcription.title: guilt over tasty things

panel.line: So I went for a walk last night before bed, simply because I wasn't tired yet and had nothing to do.
True story!
After walking for a bit, I found myself in a 24-hour grocery store! Why? I didn't need any groceries. I guess I just found the bright lights and the prospect of buying snacks enticing!
Did you get anything?
Yes, just some chips and a drink. I didn't need either of them!
So are you concerned, T-Rex, that going shopping was your default activity?
Yeah man!
And shopping for food that I didn't even need, no less. I suspect that the symbolism of this at both a personal and societal level is pretty damning!
"Western man gets bored, goes and buys food he doesn't need."
Exactly!
BUT A FEW EVENINGS LATER T-REX DOES THE EXACT SAME THING!
Man, whatever! These chips are overwhelmingly delicious!

transcription.title: the devil raises an interesting question

panel.line: GREETINGS T-REX
I HAVE AN INQUIRY TO POSE TO YOU
WHAT DO YOU THINK OF ADVENTURE GAMES AS A GENRE
Man! I don't!!
IT IS INTERESTING TO PONDER WHY THEIR POPULARITY HAS FALTERED WHILE THAT OF THEIR SISTER GENRE OF RPGS HAS REMAINED REMARKABLY RESOLUTE
I don't think about video games as much as you do! Okay? You've got to understand this! T-REX EQUALS DOESN'T WANT TO TALK ABOUT VIDEO GAMES ALL THAT OFTEN!
You seem unusually quiet!
I think I got rid of him!
Who?
The Devil! I told him off pretty harshly and I guess I hurt his feelings? Does that make me a bad person?
I ASSURE YOU THAT I HAVE NOT GONE ANYWHERE MY MOUTH WAS MERELY OCCUPIED WITH DORITO-RELATED ACTIVITIES
Great! Let's talk about that instead!
I LIKE RANCH FLAVOUR

transcription.title: block slumber party

panel.line: My sinister raccoon and cephalopod neighbours are having a sleep-over party. Okay! That's innocent enough. I don't judge!
But putting up fliers for it around town?
That's creepy! That's odd! That's OFF. Who indiscriminately invites people to a slumber party?
Your neighbors, apparently!
Apparently!
So are you going to go? You are their neighbour, after all!

I've TOLD you all the creepy things they've said to me! I don't want to put myself in a situation where I'm UNCONSCIOUS and pyjama-clad around them! Holy heck!
I think maybe you should go! How bad could it be? They're your NEIGHBOURS.
THAT NIGHT:
Neighbour: COME TO OUR SLUMBER PARTY, NEIGHBOUR?
I'm sorry, I - I think I'm busy that night!
Neighbour: YOU CAN SLEEP IN MY ROOM, T-REX.

transcription.title: i disagree with you now!

panel.line: I have discovered the secret of being totally famous! I will now share this secret.
The secret is to be CONTROVERSIAL!

That way, everyone is talking and thinking about you.You become famous simpy from holding a contested opinion! And the best part is yuo don't actually HAVE to hold the opinion, you just have to say you do. It's so easy! Dromiceiomimus, what are your thoughts on gay marriage and prohibition?
Prohibition? Why prohi-
T=Rex: I DISAGREE!!
Wow, people are going to think you're an ass!
A CONTROVERSIAL ass, though! Of fame!
No, not really! It's annoying, insincere, and unattractive! Nobody likes someone who is controversial just for the attention.
Maybe they do!
TURNS OUT THEY DON'T:
Well, that's it for me!

transcription.title: talking dinosaurs on the internet in: young marriage

panel.line: Isn't it CRAZY how young some people are when they get married?
It's CRAZY!
My parents were only twenty when they got married. Twenty! I was nowhere near marriage material at twenty. I was and still am a loose cannon!
Maybe they just found the right person?
Twenty, though! You're almost still a teenager at that age! A baby! How do you know enough to get married?
I think that marriage is a very personal thing, T-rex!
Well, yeah!

No, really! It's an expression of love, which is almost by definition inexpressible to someone else. Marrying young probably just seems crazy to you because you didn't meet the right person at that age!
So it's essentially unknowable to me unless I had married at that age myself...Hmm...
ANYWAY, T-REX GOES BACK IN TIME TO WHEN HE WAS 20, FINDS THE LOVE OF HIS LIFE, AND MARRIES HER:
Kick ass!
So THAT'S what that feels like!

transcription.title: post-pubescent!

panel.line: So I was talking up my post-pubescent body the other night, and this guy was like "Post-pubescent isn't a word, because you can never get past puberty!" I was like, "Whatever"!
It was some party!!
That guy was right though, T-Rex! Puberty is more of a toggle, isn't it? You're either pre-pubescent or pubescent - you never get to be post-pubescent.
I maintain that you do! You're pre-pubescent, then pubescent, and then post-pubescent when the changes stop!
No no, you're pubescent as soon as the changes start! That's how it works.
I disagree!
Let's look it up in a dictionary! Then we'll see what's what.
Fine! Let's look it up right now!
Fine!
Fine! I'll go do that!
Go ahead!
I'm gonna!
SHORTLY:
Dude, come quick!
There's PICTURES!!

transcription.title: i sure hope i'm not the only one who finds film theory really cool!

panel.line: It turns out that you can't escape politics in the media! Every song I hear, every book I read and every movie I see has some political agenda, even if it's just tacit support fo the dominant ideology!
Well! I'M going to create the first POLITICS-FREE film!
What are you planning - a documentary?
That's a start! It'll document the world around me to ensure that my own beliefs can't enter the frame.
Oooh! And it'll be in one long take, so that I can't be accused of using editing to privilege some images over others! It's going to be great! Great and APOLITICAL.
It's not going to work, my friend!
It'll work! Don't be such a downer!

T-Rex, as soon as you place the camera somewhere, you're making a value judgment about what's worth seeing and what's not. You're privileging what's in front of the camera over what's behind it: that's political!
Hmm. That - that's true.
ATTEMPTS TO RECORD THE ENTIRE UNIVERSE FROM ALL POSSIBLE ANGLES AT ONCE FAIL:
Man, forget this!
My politics are the right ones ANYWAYS.

transcription.title: t-rex might have to get glasses! ruh roh

panel.line: WE JOIN T-REX AFTER THE EYE DOCTOR HAS TOLD HIM HE MIGHT NEED GLASSES:
The eye doctor had told me I might need glasses!
Me! Glasses!
Man, glasses are gonna cramp my style. I'm not a glasses dude! I'm a NON-GLASSES dude!
I don't know - maybe they'll look fetching on you!
Perhaps! But still, my style will be totally CRAMPED.
Utharaptor: What style do you have that can be "cramped", T-Rex?
Plenty!
Sleeping face down style! Rubbing my eyelids with the palms of my hand style! Glasses would interfere with BOTH these activities.
I've never seen you do either of those things. Besides, if the biggest worry you have in life is glasses, then I think you're doing pretty well!
T-REX IS SUDDENLY REMINDED OF SOMETHING MORE IMPORTANT TO WORRY ABOUT:
Shit!
Global warming!!

transcription.title: adulterous affairs comics

panel.line: I have a friend, of my own age, who is having a relationship - the only word for it is "affair" - with a woman who is engaged to be married!
It's time for...
ADULTEROUS AFFAIRS COMICS
It kind of came out of nowhere... she is into him and he is into her, so where's the problem? What's the big deal about polygamy?
The problem of course is the fianc?, who (as I understand it) does not support his wife-to-be sleeping around with another man.
Further complications: both men look the same! It's a little weird.
How am I to advise this friend - should he break it off? Should he let the woman make her own decisions?
Hmm!
I didn't realize such situations occurred in real life... a young woman, engaged to be married to an older man, meets a dynamic young one and falls in love!
Yes, it's a hackneyed situation, but one which all involved are living, as we speak!
Hey, wait!
Come back!
YOU FORGOT TO GIVE ME THE ANSWER TO MY PROBLEM!

transcription.title: second base is first loser

panel.line: What is the deal with second base? Nobody actually knows what it represents!
(Second base in the sexually euphemistic sense, of course!)

Everyone knows what second base is, T-Rex! First base is significant glances across a crowded room, second is quietly holding hands, third base is eating the same strand of spaghetti and a home run is totally smooching!
I find these bases to be highly improbably, Dromiceiomimus!
I think that people know what the bases are - but if they don't, that's cool too!
Why?
I don't know! I think it's because it makes the whole crass "how far did you go" talk a lot more adorable if the guys invovled are just making up what the checkpoints are as they go along.
It's cute that these tough guys have no idea what's going on?
Yeah!
But wimpy guys talk about women too!
Wimpy guys talk about a lot of things!
hah hah! Like COMPUTERS.

transcription.title: people > machines

panel.line: I know one thing that puts us (living people made out of meat) above machine intelligences.
That thing is the ability to feel physical pleasure!
For instance, I'd like to see a machine intelligence feel the relief of a cool breeze on a hot summer's night. They can't, because they're machines!
We are the much more sensual people.
I'm not sure what you're trying to argue here, T-Rex!
People > machines!

Yeah, but - couldn't a machine intelligence just press some mental button to emulate a cool breeze or any other sensual sensation? And since they don't really exist yet, I'm not sure why you're arguing small points about them?
Well, I -

featuring

panel.line: I have a question that I can ask all my friends! The question is, "would you rather kiss a music student, or a psychology student?".
Hee hee! I am the best friend to have ever!
Dromiceiomimus! Listen, I have a question for you: would you rather kiss a music student, or a psychology student?
A psychology student, I guess! That's just because I don't really know any music students, though.
How INTERESTING.
So what's the deal here, T-Rex?
The deal?

What? No, of course not!
You can't apply broad generalizations to heterogeneous groups. Each person has their unique properties and outlook on life.

transcription.title: anger management (not the film. the comic.)

panel.line: Let us talk today about a very important topic:
Anger management!

One must always manage their anger, lest it become under- or even un-managed and therefore out of control! But we should also remember that emotions aren't good or bad things - it's what we do with them that matters. For instance, anger can help us break things that would otherwise remain unbroken! Like with...
...pi?atas?
So what's your anger management technique?
I'm glad you asked!
Whenever you feel angry and think maybe you shouldn't be upset, just repeat to yourself, "Don't be so angry okay? Sheesh!"
That's the most facile anger management technique I've ever heard!
One might expect me to become hilariously angry at such a comment, but I'm managing my anger.
Still! Ouch!

transcription.title: i can turn sammiches into thoughts about further sammiches

panel.line: Man, I'm amazing! I'm a machine that turns FOOD into IDEAS!
T-REX IN: "MAN, I"M AMAZING."

I'm a machine that turns chicken wings into things being stomped on. I turn a who friggen' bag of chips into new ideas about gender relations! What other new creation (besides the dinosaurs, OF COURSE) can turn physical things into abstract ideas? I'm totally great!
T-Rex, you're forgetting about Babbage engines!
Shoot, I am!

Though they never advanced beyond the prototype stage, his engines were some of the first machines that transformed physical labour (turning a crank) into mental labour (summing two numbers). It was a revolutionary idea!
Exactly!
And yet - bag of chips! Gender relations!
I could probably turn all-you-can-eat ribs into a freakin' aria!

transcription.title: utahed-raptor

panel.line: Ye Olde Narratore: A Hiftory of Dinofaurs

Ye Olde Narratore: Being a Survey of the Fielde, tolde with equal parts Flourish and Paedogogy, epitomized by a plain and familiar Manner, without and unnecessary Mixture of useless Curiosities and needless Repetitions.
Ye Olde Narratore: [Price 6d.]
Ye Olde Narratore: Dinosaurs, or Man-Lizards, to-day knowne as G-d's Mistake, had assum'd Domain over all the Worlde, including the dark Lands of China-Men.

Ye Olde Narratore: By no means Fit for their Purpose as Kings and Queens, the Dinosaurs spread Fear and Incontenience, along with several similar Inconve-niencies, which neither can be Described nor Understood without having first seen one of the Faersome beasts for oneself; thy Stars are indeed Fortunate, for in to-day's Moderne Age, the only such Animale thy shall see is in a rare Wood-Cut or handsel Picture-Book, where thou art Protected from the joyn'd Devourment and Digestione by the Fictionality of the Beast in question.
Ye Olde Narratore: The plague of their Times, the Dinosaur was known for taking Plaesure in rendering one's abode or Self flatten'd.
Ye Olde Narratore: This being the Case, there was great room to Fear, for many chylds would not survive the certain Mis-chief done them by the Tyranno-saurus Rex, Utahed-Raptor, "c.

Ye Olde Narratore: The stern voice of Science tells us that these Monstrosi-ties, once having exhausted the Novelty of Death-giving, simply took it as a Matter-of-Course, and paid it little Attenshon, likely dedicating the remainder of their Facu-lities towards some Conversation and Jokery.

Ye Olde Narratore: Being thus provided with a Compleat exposi-tion of the Dinosaurs, take care, gentle Reader, that you do not deviate from the strait and Upright path set before you by our Father, lest you find thyself in the same Posi-tion as these Beasts, and there be no roome for you on the Ark.
Ye Olde Narratore: MDCCXLIX

transcription.title: a good day for talking about ex-girlfriends

panel.line: Today is a good day I think for talking about ex-girlfriends!
Woooooooo!
Maybe this isn't the best idea ever, T-Rex!
But maybe it is! What could possibly go wrong?
You offend your ex-girlfriends by betraying their trust, and look like a pretty big jerk in the process?
No, no! Come on, it'll be great.
I think I agree, T-Rex! This is the worst kind of kissing and telling.
The worst?
Yeah, it's kissing and telling years later, which, for serious, will not lead to good things.
But what if I have only good things to say about them, hmm? What about THAT?
AND SO:
I still love all my ex-girlfriends, and remain good friends with them to this day.
T-REX WINS!

transcription.title: everyone's favourite topic: se^H^Hrelationships!

panel.line: Time to talk about everyone's favourite topic...
Relationships!
Have you ever found yourself in a relationship that required at least a few sentences to explain what was going on, that couldn't be summed up in a single word like "boyfriend" or "ex-girlfriend"?
Well, actually, the thing you and I have is sort of-
Exactly! I'm glad you understand, Dromiceiomimus.
So what about relationships that can't be summarized into one word?
Um.
They're...pretty okay?
They're "pretty okay".
Okay, honestly, I wanted to talk more about how deep and important some friendships can be, but we've somehow moved away from that.
I have no one to blame but myself!

transcription.title: t-rex, what are you doing

panel.line: So - dating ex-girlfriends? I've heard this can be a bad idea, but I don't know...
What's the worst that could happen?!
But T-Rex, assuming you and the lady broke up for a reason, won't these problems still be there?
Maybe, but I don't think so! We're different, more mature people now, and if we make sure it's more casual - less high expectations, less intense - I really think it could work!
More casual, eh? More like more casual KISSING, probably!
No!
I've really tried to separate sex from it. I don't know. I'd just like to try it again: hanging out, doing things together, having fun, only now with a non-zero chance of smooches!
You think it could be different?
I really do!
THIS LEADS TO SEVERAL MUTUALLY-SATISFACTORY, CONSEQUENCE-FREE MAKEOUTS WITH EX-GIRLFRIENDS:
Hah hah hah!
How AGREEABLE.

transcription.title: this just in: some ads are dumb

panel.line: Anyway! Relationships are for the young and the criminally insane. What's of real importance is that I saw a car dealership ad yesterday advertising that "no reasonable offer will be refused"!
Well, yeah!

Oooh, ads like that burn my biscuits. Of course they're not going to refuse a reasonable offer! That's what makes it so reasonable! And worse, since "reasonable" can be a very subjective word, it's not really saying anything beyond "Hey, I won't refuse an offer for reasons that I personally find irrational."
It sounds like you've put a lot of thought into this, T-Rex!
It's a thought fueled by rage!!
It just bothers me that they're trying to make it sounds like a big thing when it's just business as usual! That's deceptive.
That's advertising!
So annoying! Plus, I saw this other ad on the same day that said "everyone approved O.A.C."
O.A.C. stands for "on approved credit"! Everyone's approved if they're approved?! Aaargh!
I could make some joke about tautological advertisements, but I find them too annoying to laugh at right now.

transcription.title: self-doubt shenanigans

panel.line: T-REX THE TALKING DINOSAUR IN:
"SELF-DOUBT SHENANINGANS"
Self-doubt!
While it can occasionally help us re-evaluate bad ideas, it can also be crippling. People who are too self-doubting can become (figuratively)
paralyzed, unable to have even the smallest faith in their abilities! USUALLY, this is unfounded.
Why all this talk about self-doubt, T-Rex? Are YOU self-doubting?
Hah, of course not!

Besides, if I was, it would be self-skepticism, not self-doubt. Doubt can be irrational and unfounded, but skepticism relies on a critical evaluation of the facts at hand, and an informed judgment of their merit.
Hah!
No, but I don't have any doubt in myself, see?
T-Rex rules the schools!
I cannot stress this enough!!

Come Mr. Tally Man, tally me banana!
Aw, T-Rex! Now I'll have that song stuck in my head ALL DAY.

You've got a song stuck in your head, great. FANTASTIC. But the rest of us don't need to hear it, okay? You can keep SOME things to yourself.
