transcription.title: reason as the source of knowledge

panel.line: Where does knowledge come from? Does it derive from our obsercations of the world, or could it possibly be... innate?
Let's settle this question once and for all!
Well, what do you mean by knowledge being innate?

I mean that all knowledge can be derived just by thinking about it! That it can be deduced from just a few axioms that we all start out with, such as a knowledge of self and an understanding of causality.
This seems like a position one would take only if one wanted to hear one's own voice, T-Rex!
Not even!
Come on! It only works if you make all sorts of assumptions, like, oh I don't know, that the ENTIRE UNIVERSE is deterministic and logical!
Well perhaps it is!
Hey, let's go flip a coin to decide! And then we can deduce the outcome by thinking about it!
Oh ho, I'm sorry, is it BITCHY in here?
I mean witty?

transcription.title: t-rex in: programming advice

panel.line: T-REX IN: PROGRAMMING ADVICE
Are you having trouble programming your computer?
Let me give you a few pointers!
Ooh, ouch. Was that a bad pun?
It was an... indirect reference?
I suspect that these are all bad puns!
Don't worry - they're the least significant bit of my speech. Oh ho!
JOKES EXPLAINED:
Aren't pointers programming tools, T-Rex?
They are!

They allow one to reference the address of data, instead of the data itself. It's like how knowing someone's phone number lets you get in touch with them personally! Hence the delightful "indirect reference" pun.
I too think these are pretty awful.
CONCLUSION:
Everyone! Program harder!!

transcription.title: why you got to get all up in my public spaces

panel.line: let us discus public spaces, such as parks and sidewalks! Does nobody own them? Or, are they in fact owned... by everybody?
An interesting distinction, if I do say so myself!

If nobody is seen as owning a public space, then nobody is motivated to care for it, and so care falls to the government. Spaces become bland and inoffensive, due to the nature of governance! However, if everyone owns them, then everyone can take care of them, and they can become vibrant and challenging.
Challenging how?
Challenging ARTISTICALLY.
People could put up posters and stuff on telephone poles, along with ads! And anything that anyone didn't like, they could take down. It would be an anarchic art show or something!
Somehow I don't see this happening.
I'll show you!
T-REX PUTS UP POSTERS AROUND TOWN AND THEY GET COVERED WITH ADS FOR YOGA SCHOOLS:
Argh! Friggin' yoga schools!
This is not the first time in my life I've had incident to shout this!!

transcription.title: thoughts of mortality

panel.line: Today...
*sigh*
Today, I am troubled.
Troubled by thoughts of my own mortality!
What if I don't live forever? Then there would be no more T-Rex - no more me!
I would be gone!
Have I done anything worthwhile with my life?
Thoughts of mortality, I see!
I believe that when we die, our bones will be transformed over geologic time into rocks, and that these "fossilized" bones will one day be discovered, reconstructed, and displayed!
That is our ultimate destiny?
So I believe!
T-Rex (thinking): I hope people like my bones!

transcription.title: burying books for fun and profit

panel.line: We can only imagine what it must have been like -
the conversation!
- during that time period. In one place were gathered the T-Rex, Utahraptor, and Dromiceiomimus - together, in one location, the greatest minds of our time.
"I recall we talked about T-Rex a lot," Utahraptor once famously remarked.
What's up?
I'm working on a group biography about us! But get this: I'm going to bury it when it's finished, so when it's discovered, it will be published for SURE. It'll be historical!
Of course! I should have guessed THAT'S what you'd be doing with your time today.
History does not record, unfortunately, what must have been a stellar retort on the part of T-Rex. Of this, however, we can be certain: he was an awesome dude. One is advised to tell one's friends!

transcription.title: dynosoar cawmics

panel.line: THE ETYMOLOGY OF THE WORD "WOMAN" - IN COMIC FORM!
Many people believe "woman" is a sexist term, due to its apparent base in the word "man"! This has led to crazy alternative spellings like "womyn" and even "wimmen".
However, this is not the case!
The word originally derives from the old English "wifmann", where "wif" meant "female" and "mann" meant a person of either sex: thus, a female human!
Man didn't mean male?
Nope! It derives from the Latin "humanus" (earthling), from "humus" (earth, soil)!
And while "wif" meant female, "wer" meant male!
Exactly!
We can still see this today in words like "werewolf", which means, literally, a manwolf.
So "werewolf" is actually a more sexist word than "woman"!
According to me: yes!
This is why I spell the word "wheirwolf", and why I ask that you do the same! You wouldn't want to be SEXIST, would you?
I don't really see h-
You'd also be respecting my unique worldview!

transcription.title: (whispering) i like to look at their bodies

panel.line: Have you ever noticed that summer is when pretty girls come out?
I suspect that you have, because it's totally true!

I also suspect that I'm not supposed to notice - but wow! There are pretty girls EVERYWHERE. They're just walking around, chatting with their friends, being attractive. I like to look at them! They're so pretty!
Are you worried that you sound a little creepy?
How so?
Walking around saying "girls are pretty"? I don't know! It's the sort of thing that everyone things but nobody says. How would you like it if a girl came up to you and said you were pretty?
Hah hah! I would be like, "Hello!"
I'd lick my lips while I said, "Hello!"

Here is a list of things to do while waiting in an airport!

Tha-
That's pretty much it!
There's probably more things that you can do in an airport, T-Rex!
I can't think of any right now!
REALITY INTRUDES

Or talking, for that matter?
BACK TO NORMAL:

transcription.title: expiry date comics!

panel.line: EXPIRY DATE COMICS!
Expiry dates on food and juice products?
WHATever!
What do you mean, whatever? They tell you when food has gone bad. If you ignore them, you're eating expired food, and that's gross.
Counterpoint! I drank some recently-expired juice yesterday, and it was exceedingly delicious. The only reason people have such faith in expiry dates if because of the Star Trek TV shows!
That's going to need some explaining!
Star Trek! Star Trek: The Next Generation?
T- That's not an explanation, T-Rex.

Whenever there's a problem, their computer is always all "15 seconds until fatal radiation exposure", as though if you get 14, you're fine, and if you get 16, you're dead for sure! Expiry dates, like those on ST:TNG, are false and needlessly strict.
MAN T-REX YOU'RE ABOUT 3 SECONDS AWAY FROM FATAL RADIATION EXPOSURE YOURSELF
It's different when you do it! Sheesh!
Also what?

transcription.title: pretension

panel.line: Today is a good day I think to talk about pretension!
Pretension! Ah, pretension!
Where would we be without pretension? We'd be short a few critical essays on Leonard Cohen, that's for sure.
Hey, what do you have against singer/poetsmith Leonard Cohen?
Nothing! Of course!
Pretension's pretty subjective, huh?
Alas, it's true!
One person's pretension can easily be another's well-argued piece of literature.
I'd like to set up some authority for pretension, but that itself would be pretentious.
That's probably why nobody's done it before.
T-REX DOES IT ANYWAY:
Heck, I've got the time!
I'm UNEMPLOYABLE.

transcription.title: some of my best friends use that phrase.

panel.line: People who cut me off on the road are usually taxi drivers. The two acidents I've had have both been hit and runs where I'm the one hit, and they've both been with taxis.
I think I'm becoming racist against taxi drivers!
I don't think it's called racism if it's against a heterogenous group like taxi drivers, T-Rex.
Nevertheless, it's the same emotion, the same irrational distaste! I don't know what else to call it! I'm PREJUDICED. It's terrible!
So if you were throwing a party, would you invite a taxi driver?
Of course I would!
I jsut wouldn't like it if they showed up in my living room in their cab, that's all.
So you only dislike taxi drivers when they're driving taxis? Maybe you just hate the game, but not the player!
In other news, I'm now also racist against that phrase!

transcription.title: there's a lot i don't know about stuff

panel.line: There's a lot I don't know about being a professional chef. There's a lot I don't know about a lot of things!
T-REX IN: THERE'S A LOT I DON'T KNOW ABOUT STUFF
What do you know about building a car out of cardboard, T-Rex?
Does it have to work?
Yes.
Nothing! Oh man, I wouldn't even know where to start!
Okay, what about the principle of semiconductors?
I know they conduct... semi- well?
There's a lot you don't know about semiconductors, too!
Oh, it's true! I'll probably NEVER know everything about everything at this rate. Time to fall back to Plan B!
T-REX IN: THERE'S A LOT I DO KNOW ABOUT ME
Looks like I'm still the world authority on myself, everyone! Go ahead!
Ask me ANYTHING.

transcription.title: philosophical zombies? shit, no!

panel.line: Oh man, let's talk about zombies! They're the coolest by far!
PHILOSOPHICAL zombies, that is!
Philosophical zombies? Do you mean like a zombie Plato or Ayn Rand or something?

While that WOULD likely be more fun to talk about, I am instead referring to the idea of a person who acts externally like a real, sentient person, but who actuall lacks consciousness. A mental zombie! A philosophical zombie.
But these "zombies" act human?
Sure do! But inside they are DEAD.
So there's no real way to tell if anyone is a philosophical zombie. This is the same old "I'm only REALLY sure of my own consciousness" argument, only sexed up with the living dead!
You must admit that it makes the whole debate a lot more interesting.
Not really! Philosophical zombies never even eat the flesh of the living!
Well, they probably could, if they wanted!
We all probably could, if we wanted.
You know?

transcription.title: competitive eating / the saltine challenge!

panel.line: HEY T-REX I BET YOU COULDN'T EAT 12 SALTINE CRACKERS IN UNDER A MINUTE
I'm instantly convinced that I could!
T-REX IN: "THE SALTINE CHALLENGE!"
How hard can it be to chew and swallow 12 desiccated dry and salty crackers in under a minute?
Oh, the Saltine Challenge! It's actually really hard, T-Rex. Your mouth is going to dry out and you'll find it impossible to swallow.
Come on. I've heard THAT before!
Hey, care to make it interesting?
Absolutely!
I'm so convinced in my own abilities that I'll bet you FIVE DOLLARS that I'll pull this one off.
Five dollars! You're ON.
BUT IT'S ACTUALLY REALLY HARD AND KIND OF GROSS:
My body has failed me for the first time ever!
Also, I'm not sure how I feel about competitive eating.

transcription.title: trouble in paradise

panel.line: Well, my dog ran away. I know!
Can you believe it?
I guess some people just aren't cut out for having pets!
But, aren't you simply avoiding any responsibility here by transforming a personal failing into something cosmically fated?
I said, I guess some people just aren't cut out for having pets!
I agree, T-Rex; I think you are to blame here.
I say I am not!
SHORTLY...
My dog ran away by his own free will!
Yes, he chose to run away, but he made that choice because you didn't feed him for two weeks five days straight! God, just forget it! I'm so tired of your poorly-thought-out plans!
I'm sorry we ever had a homosexual affair!

transcription.title: les quatre cents annees

panel.line: Man, if I were sent back in time 200 years, I could easily make myself into a serious king by "inventing" things two hundred years too early!
Easily!
I couldn't invent penicillin because I don't know what mold is used, but I could do stuff with electricity! Like... magnetically levitated trains? Oooh, and electric fly swatters!
I could approximate some great works of fiction!
With our powers combined, we'd be unstoppable!
I'm not really sure that I could invent anything useful, though!
Why not?

I don't have much of a great mechanical understanding. could I design and build an internal combustion engine? The answer is no. ALTHOUGH, come to think of it, I could invent modern foods like chips and poutine!
Dude!!
We could also invent women's rights, and then totally take all the credit for it!

transcription.title: jokes nobody need ever make again

panel.line: Hot enough for you?
IS IT ADJECTIVE ENOUGH FOR YOU??
JOKES NOBODY NEED EVER MAKE AGAIN COMICS
Oooh, and that one in which, after stumbling, one is advised to have a nice trip, and offered hope of a reunion come autumn!
Hey, how's the weather up there, T-Rex?
Aggravating! Thanks!!
Also, these martinis are more like marTINIES!
I see.
Ho ho!
(I actually REALLY like that one!)

transcription.title: a long december

panel.line: Man, it sure has been a long December! Maybe this year will be better than the last.
The days sure do go by so fast!
Hey Dromiceiomimus, do you think that I could be forgiven? I wish you would!
Aw no, not this again. Come on T-Rex, passing off lyrics as conversations ONLY AMUSES YOURSELF.
I-is that a light attaching to you?
LATER:
Anyway, I guess It's just one more day up in the canyons for me!
Boo on you, T-Rex!
What? Dude it's been so long since I've seen the ocean.
Man, nobody wants to hear "A Long December" by Counting Crows passed off as conversation. Yes, that's right! I've heard the song before! I recognize your CONVERSATIONAL PLAGIARISM.
It's a song?!
Holy shit, what are the odds?

transcription.title: what's for dinner? unique, rare, and tasty animals!

panel.line: I think I'll go visit some places overseas. Why not? I could plan a trip to the island nation of Australia!
The worst that could happen is ADVENTURES!

Why Australia, T-Rex? Are you intrigued by its myriad tourist attractions and locations of geographical splendour, including the Outback, coastal reefs, tropical rain-forests, crocodile farms, and the beaches?
Not to mention the many stunning parks of natural beauty, populated by unique, rare and tasty animals!
You know that Australia is really far away, right? Super far?
I know!
it's just - you're closer to outer space right now than you are to Australia.
Seriously? Wow, I guess you're right, huh? Huh! Well, that really puts my travel plans in perspective.
Why visit Australia, when it's closer to visit outer space?

transcription.title: birds are sad comics

panel.line: I think that there's no animal more symbolic than birds. They're so SAD!
BIRDS ARE SAD COMICS
Sad? I never saw them as sad. If anything, they represent freedom, the giddy joy of flight and exploration and the promise of a better tomorrow!

Yeah, that's true. but whenever birds settle in an environment where there are no predators, the first thing they lose is their ability to fly. It seems the evolutionary purpose of flight is simply to avoid being eaten!
And that's sad, T-Rex?
The idea of birds forgetting how to fly? Yeah, that's sad!
And man, imagine a pure white bird, a father of two baby chicks, lying dead and motionless on the sidewalk, killed because it flew into an office window? That's SUPER sad!
Go on, imagine it as hard as you can!
Okay.
THEY BOTH TRY:
T-Rex " Utahraptor: Awwwwwwwwwwwww!

transcription.title: asexuality!

panel.line: There are some people who identify not as gay or straight or bisexual or what have you, but rather as asexual. I find this really interesting!
It must be so different!
Some don't find themselves sexually attracted to anyone, while others do, but find all they want in friendship and have no desire to add kissing to the mix.
And you find this interesting?
I do, because it's so far removed from my own experience. I'm ALL ABOUT adding kissing to the mix! It's what I do best!
Have you ever met any asexual people, T-Rex?
Nope!
It's just - I can't get over the feeling that you're treating asexuality like an amusing trinket rather than a real sexual orientation.
Well - it's a fine line! I'm not asexual myself, so there's a distance between myself and the material. But I am trying.
T-REX DECIDES NOT TO KISS ANYONE FOR A MONTH TO SEE WHAT IT'S LIKE:
I feel - fine! Focused!
Heck, I probably wasn't going to kiss anyone this month ANYWAY.

transcription.title: female noun funnies

panel.line: It's not often you can see how language is evolving, but you can totally see it today with make and female nouns.
It's the coolest!
Some pairs (like "prince" and "princess' are complete accepted, while others (like teacher and "teacheress") seem insanely sexist and out of date. It depends on the word!
Female teachers used to be called "teacheresses"? That's so bizarre!
I know! But maybe one day people will think that about "princesses". Or MAYBE they'll wonder how we got by without the word "astronautrix"!
The coolest of all these words, though, are clearly those on the threshold of acceptability.
Such as?
Oh, "actress" and "stewardess", I guess - words which some people will use without hesistation, but which others will call sexist. There's no consensus!
Well, I can see the use of "actress", because the gender of the person affects what roles they can play.
Looks like you've come down on the side of "gendered professional nouns have their occasional uses"!
Looks like!
T- That's cool, man.
Are we still friends?

transcription.title: age of consent / pedophile comics ?

panel.line: I find age of consent laws pretty interesting because, for something so basic, they sure vary a lot from place to place! Again, they're something for which there is no consensus. Is that a pun? Consensus? That wasn't meant to be a pun.
ANYWAY!

Most people agree that a 26-year-old should be able to consent to sex, while a child should be protected from sexual predators, but where we legally draw that line is contentious! Some places allow 12-year-olds to consent to sex, while others believe that even people in their early twenties are unable to give knowledgeable consent to the INTERCOURSE.
This is a pretty dangerous topic, isn't it?
Dangerous how?
Well, isn't this one of those topics that you'd talk about with friends in private, but not while out in a public place? You don't want people to think you're a PEDOPHILE.
What? I haven't mentioned anything that would make people say that! I'm talking about legal ages of consent!
Though... why would I be talking about this if I wasn't a pedophile? Ah, yes.
Well played, my friend! Well played!

transcription.title: down this road leads CHAOS and a pretty kickin' fantasy life

panel.line: In "The Divine Comedy", this thirteenth century dude Dante describes all these circles of Hell where the wicked spend eternity for being so wicked.
Pretty heady stuff!

Anyway, what's remarkable is that Dante puts both homosexuals and money lenders in the same circle! He thought both were unnatural: interest makes something (money) from nothing (no action on the lender's part), while homosexuals make nothing (hot gay action doesn't count!) from something (their reproductive organs).
Hey, how do you know that that's what Dante was thinking?
It's in the book!
Well maybe he just decided to write a book that he entirely disagreed with.
Well MAYBE he wrote in his diary that he did agree, and I've read his diary!
Maybe he was lying!
Dude! You're not allowed to lie to your own diary!
A- Are you?

transcription.title: i have been so busy lately

panel.line: My stars, I have been so busy lately. And it continues! Up to Friday is going to be KRAZY for me.
Notice the 'k'!
The 'k' indicates extra kraziness, Dromiceiomimus.
I'm glad you specified that, T-Rex.
I value our friendship, Dromiceiomimus.
You've said that before, T-Rex.
Well! That was an unusual interaction!
Explain!

I'm not sure I can! I'd have to explain a lot about us in order for me to articulate why it seemed so unusual. I'm guessing she was just upset with something else, and wasn't in the mood for any of my shenanigans?
Maybe you should find out what she's upset about?
Shortly:
DROMICEIOMIMUS! ARE YOU UPSET WITH ME AND IF SO WHY?
I'm not upset with you! I'm just tired today.
DROMICEIOMIMUS! CAN WE SHOUT FOR A BIT

transcription.title: the utahraptor "wigged out" yesterday

panel.line: I wonder what's bothering the Utahraptor? He totally "wigged out" on me yesterday.
What a great expression!
Did you hear? The Utahraptor totally "wigged out" on me yesterday!
He "wigged out"?
He totally did!
Yesterday!
Yesterday, he "wigged out"!
Stop it, T-Rex!
How long have you been standing there?
Long enough! Look, about yesterday: I'm sorry I said what I did. I've just been a little stressed lately. Also, stop saying "wigged out". I know you like it, but it really annoys me.
Don't make me choose!

transcription.title: friends at the cottage good times!

panel.line: It's been warm and then hot and then uncomfortably hot and then warm again, which suggests to me that
SUMMER HAS ARRIVED WOOOO!
Dromiceiomimus, horray for summer!! Would you like to come with me and Utahraptor to the cottage this weekend?
I'd love to!
Woohoo! This promises to be the best weekend ever in the hisotry of time!
THAT MONDAY:
Thanks for an awesome weekend, T-Rex!
Aw, my pleasure!
Hey, I got my pictures developed, by the way!
Oh man, pass them over!
You'll notice that one of my nipples is highlighted in several of the pictures!
Just "FYI"!

transcription.title: try to be a good friend, t-rex.

panel.line: I think sometimes that I am not a very good friend, because I don't have a very good idea of what is appropriate.
I know! I am full of surprises!

But it's true! I have trouble remembering the names of friends and tell jokes when I should be empathetic and understanding. I'm just trying to cheer them up, but usually they want sympathy instead of rough chuckles!
Aww, you're not all bad, T-Rex!
But I'm not perfect either! Hmm...
Yes, that will be my new goal! I will become the perfect friend!
Great!
You can start by taking out my garbage for me, good buddy!
Aha, I know you're only trying to point out the limitations of my plan, but it's to be the perfect FRIEND, not the perfect PUSHOVER.
For instance, rather than taking out your garbage, I'll hang out with you and we can talk about entertainment franchises we have a shared interest in. Do you like the recent Star Trek series?
Nope!
Hah, me neither!

transcription.title: happy canada day comics ii

panel.line: Time to talk more about my made-up country of Canada!
HAPPY CANADA DAY COMICS
a "PG-13" picto-story
In Canada, you get real winters AND real summers, and there's places where you can get winter all year round if that's your sort of thing!
Is that your sort of thing, T-Rex?
That is HECK NO not my sort of thing, but I'm glad to know it's an option!
Also, in Canada? Two chicks can totally get married!
Neat!
Finally, there is social liberalism and national pride, but not one that is predicated on making other countries seem worse.
But doesn't that imply any countries that don't have that desirable feature are worse off than Canada?
It - it does. Well Heck!
That's okay, T-Rex.
I fucked up Canada!

transcription.title: batman dreams!

panel.line: I had the coolest dream last night. BATMAN was in it! And ZOMBIES!
It was entirely great!
Okay, so Gotham City is infected with zombies, right?

People start getting bit, dying, then getting up and feasting on the flesh of the living. Batman and Robin are fighting them off as best they can, and while they're too fast and acrobatic to be touched, there's too many zombies to kill them all. They start rescuing as many people as they can, taking them to the Batcave for safekeeping. It's a good place because it's not only big, but protected and hidden!
So what happens next?
Well, soon the Batcave is getting pretty full!

And at some point they've rescued this guy who's been bitten, but who's hidden it. He dies, and the next time Batman and Robin come back to the Cave, they find that everyone inside is now a zombie! Their effort has been entirely futile, and everyone they've rescued is dead.
Then what?
Batman FLIPS OUT!!
And I wake up, the end!

transcription.title: did he know it? it seems suspect that he knew it.

panel.line: Today is a good day I think to talk about phlogiston!
That's right! Phlogiston, bitches!

Phlogiston was proposed as a scientific explanation for combustion! It was clear that some things burned (like wood), while other things would not burn (like ash). Phlogiston was a colorless, odourless and weightless substance that was contained in things that could burn. When they burned, the phlogiston was released into the air!
That's a pretty crazy theory!
Yeah, but it totally worked for a while!

It explained why if you burned things in a jar, they would go out: the air can only hold so much phlogiston! But it started to fall apart when people discovered that some things, like magnesium, actually gained mass when burned.
So phlogiston would have to have a negative mass!
Yeah! That seemed a little TOO krazy. But its actually pretty close to what we now believe, only backwards!
(We believe materials are deoxygenated and become oxygenated when burning!)
Off-panel: Man! I know it!

transcription.title: bhangra bhangra bhangra bhangra

panel.line: Copyright is intended to prevent others from ripping off your creations! It used to extend 28 years after you created something, giving you a chance to profit while ensuring good ideas would eventually enter the public domain.
However, lately it's gotten pretty ridiculous!

Copyright extensions have pushed this protection up to the length of your life plus 70 years and beyond - basically, whenever Micky Mouse is due to enter the public domain, copyright law is extended. It's unfair and it restricts creativity!
How does it restrict creativity?
Well!

With these insanely long copyright laws, there is no new public domain, and our modern culture is owned and put in private hands! It ensures you can't build on anything that's been created in the past 70 years.
Wow, you really seem to care about copyright laws!
I just think we're approaching a state of perpetual copyright, and that this could interfere with my bhangra remixes of pop songs.
I mean my non-bhangra remixes, of course!
THEY'RE GOOD

transcription.title: little lower, little slower

panel.line: Oh man, I'm gonna work the phrase "little lower, little slower" into every conversation I have today!
Hee hee! It's a good day to be T-Rex!
LATER:
So I was at the dentist today, and he was all cleaning my teeth, and I was like, "little lower...little slower!"
Hah! What'd he do?
He cleaned my bottom teeth!
LATER:
Hey there, T-Rex!
Little lower, little slower!
Wait, shoot , too soon. Can we start over, and you give me a hug or something?
What? No!
Incidentally, that would be a good phrase to say to an ex-girlfriend you're trying to hook up with! The "start over" one, I mean. Um.
Where'd everybody go?

transcription.title: lots of things are pretty okay

panel.line: Wouldn't it be pretty okay to travel at speeds FASTER than that of LIGHT ITSELF??
I submit that it would be pretty okay indeed!
With that in mind, I'm going to design an engine that can make something go faster than light.
Our current understanding of physics says what you are trying may well be impossible!
Our current understanding will have to be UPDATED, pending my success!
Hey T-Rex, do you want a hand? We could do it together!
Sure! It'll be fun!
MONTHS LATER:
While I do feel this project has brought us closer together, I don't think it's going to work. Perhaps faster-than-light travel really is impossible.
Or PERHAPS we're not trying hard enough! Let's work extra hard for a bit.
Then, sandwiches!

transcription.title: kiss me signs

panel.line: Imagine if I snuck up behind some guy and put a "kick me" sign on his back, only instead of "kick me", it said "kiss me"? Hah hah!
That is one dude who's going to get all the sweet makeouts!!
And he would have no idea why suddenly all these people are making out with him! From behind!
You should do it! Maybe even guys would kiss him, because the sign told them too!
Hee hee! It's the ultimate prank! I'm gonna do it. Should I do it? I'm gonna do it.
Do it, T-Rex!
But, on the other hand, putting a "kiss me" sign on someone's back would be EXTREMELY CRAZY!
Do it!
Hah, you think I should do it?
Man, go for it!
Let's ask past T-Rex what he thinks!
PAST T-REX:
Do it, dude!!

transcription.title: klinical depression komics

panel.line: There sure is a lot I don't know about ...
CLINICAL DEPRESSION!
T-Rex, you shouldn't joke about clinical depression (major depressive disorder)! It's not very funny.
I'm not! I'm just saying that there's a lot I don't know about it. How do you deal with it? How do you best support a friend who is dealing with it? I have NO IDEA.
Well, it is good that you want to find out more!
I agree!! I am a model for us all.
So! Depression?
I don't know much about it either, T-Rex! I think you'll have to do your own research on this one.
Aw boo! Researching things, much like the mental illness of depression, is for chumps!
T-REX RESEARCHES IT ANYWAY:
Oh man, I should not have said that depression is for chumps. That's like the worst thing you can say to a depressed person!
SHEESH, T-Rex!

transcription.title: a list of phrases that you should never say

panel.line: I have been compiling a list that I think might be of value!
What I have compiled is nothing less than...
A list of phrases you should never say because nothing good will ever come of them!
First on the list: "What do you mean you don't love me?"
You're right: there's no way that could lead to anything good.
See what I mean?
I've got a good one for the list!
Oh?
"I've always seen you as the mother I never had."
Yikes.
Yeah, it works especially well if you say it to your girlfriend.
Geez, man...
Thanks for the tip!

transcription.title: friends dating friends who date friends who date friends

panel.line: Okay, so hypothetical situation: let's say you've got two friends who used to totally date each other but now they're broken up, and neither wants to see the other anymore!
Oops!!

The problem this raises for you, as a friend, is who do you invite to parties and such? Do you alternate invitations between events? Invite both friends and assume either they'll work out amongst themselves who's going, or you'll get to see some sparks fly?
It's a difficult situation for everyone involved to be in!
It's true!
I suppose I'd talk to both of the people to see what they'd have me do.
But what if they want you to do conflicting things?
Well, then, I guess I'd face a choice!
T-REX WHAT ARE YOU TALKING ABOUT NONE OF YOUR FRIENDS ARE EVEN IN THIS SITUATION
I like to be prepared!
DUDE WHY ARE YOU EVEN SAYING THIS THOUGH
IT'S SO STRESSFUL

transcription.title: forget all of y'all, crazy rashes!

panel.line: There's this crazy rash I've got on my wrist. This is an unwelcome development that I did not invite!
Forget you, crazy rash!
Have you done anything to get rid of it?
I am a firm believer in the "do nothing and your problems will take care of themselves" school of problem solving.
Really? Well - good luck!
Has this technique ever solved ANY of your problems, T-Rex?
All the time!

Like this one time, I had to pay my phone bill, but it's sort of a pain to mail stuff, you know? So I just waited and waited and eventually a collections agency called ME, and they let me pay my bill over the phone!
But there are conseq-
It was amazing!
A FEW DAYS LATER THE RASH GETS WORSE:
ATTENTION, MEDICAL PROFESSIONALS!!
Why don't you call?

transcription.title: t-rex knows the characters' names, so he must know what he's talking about.

panel.line: Has anyone ever heard of a book series called, oh I don't know... "HARRY POTTER"?!
Dude, because I totally have!
And did you know, Dromiceiomimus that in the most recent book Harry's friend RON WEASLEY ends up asphyxiated on the moon?
What?
Yes! The moon! There's no air up there so it makes sense that he ends up asphyxiated.
You're ruining the book for everyone, T-Rex!
No way, Jose!
Or at least you would be, if your spoilers were at all plausible. Nice try though!
Did you know that during a Quiddich match, it turns out that one of Harry's teachers is a vampire?
Aw man!
And who could forget the twist ending revealed in the last sentence of the book? "Actually, everyone in this story is a vampire!"?
Have you read it?

transcription.title: hot days and movies

panel.line: It's so hot out today! So hot!
HOLY IT'S HOT COMICS
So hot!!
Hey T-Rex, do you want to go see a movie with me?
To escape the heat!
Yeah!
Yes! I've always wanted to do that. For some reason, I've always wanted to be one of those people who does that!
LATER:
Hey T-Rex, want to go see a movie with me?
Aww, sorry, I just saw one!
Dromiceiomimus and I went to escape the heat!
How was it?
Ridiculous! The movie needed way more EXPLOSIONS.
Saying "the movie needed more explosions" is my polite way to suggest that the film was a romantic comedy, by the way!
I got that, thanks!
I find that most movies need way more explosions, though.
You know?

transcription.title: t-rex up to his old tricks

panel.line: I totally went out to fancy dinner with friends last night! It was a lot of fun and the food was extremely delicious.
I also left a big tip, so as not to appear NIGGARDLY!
Eh? Would you say you find something COMMENT-WORTHY in my speech, Dromiceiomimus?
Nope! I know that the word "niggardly" means miserly, and that it has a completely different etymology from any words that it might happen to sound like!
Aw man! Maybe - maybe pretend you don't?
You were just looking for controversy, T-Rex!
It's true, it's true!

But my plan was to educate! When people called me on "niggardly", I was going to explain how it most likely derives from the Scandinavian "nig" (miserly), and in fact pre-dates any similar racially-charged words by hundreds of years!
Looks like you blew your chances with us, my friend!
LATER:
Hey there! How's everyone doing? Say, that river sure is getting high, huh? Maybe someone should put a DYKE up around it!
Eh? Eh?
Homophobia?

transcription.title: indoor voice! indoor voice!!

panel.line: What a beautiful summer's day! A good day for me to PARTY DOWN and shout "Wooooooo!", I think!
Wait, I can do better.
*ahem*
WOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO!
Whoah, T-Rex! Use your indoor voice - you don't have to be so loud!
"Indoor voice"?! We're outside, Dromiceiomimus! Anyway, if we were indoors right now, I'm pretty sure I'd be just as loud and proud as ever!
In that order!
"Indoor voice" refers to the situation inside a house, where others are sleeping and stuff! There's a whole context there, T-Rex!
Man, context is for suckers! And with that revelation, I don't see how the term "indoor voice" on its own can mean anything at all!
Y-you're not -
That's right! I'm questioning the very IDEA of an "indoor voice"! The revolution begins here!
SHORTLY:
The revolution has ended due to lack of interest!

transcription.title: totally totally pooched

panel.line: So how do people do it? How do people choose a direction in their life, I mean!
It seems pretty hard!
Well, T-Rex, I think most people choose a direction they want to go in, a job they'd like to do, and then work toward it.
Yeah, but what if you finally get that job, and it's not all you hoped? What if it sort of sucks?
What are you talking about? You don't have a job in the first place!
Yeah, but man!
Being unemployed was sort of the dream, but now I realize that it just leaves me with a lot of free time, and I feel useless and unaccomplished at the end of the day!
So get a job! Problem solved!
But being unemployed isn't sucky all the time, just some of the time! I don't know! I'm pooched, man! I'm pooched!
Being pooched is akin to being screwed!
Now you know!

transcription.title: little secrets

panel.line: So sometimes I have these little secrets, yes?
Yes!
And SOMETIMES these little secrets accidentally become BIG SECRETS, because I never told the people I should have about them and it's too late now.
Ooh! What are these secrets?
I'm not thinking of any in particular, actually! Just the general case.
Oh. That's less interesting!
Maybe you shouldn't keep so many secrets then, T-Rex!
But I don't!
They're just - you know how when you've forgotten somebody's name, and it's way too late to ask them now? It's like that with these little secrets. You know what I mean?
No, that doesn't really happen to me.
Am I the only one with these problems?
Because if so, then I guess I get to work on my life management skills!
D-Do people still talk about life management skills?

transcription.title: t-rex messes with time, what's the worst that could happen?

panel.line: Okay, so I've made a few runs at it and have never actually been able to travel back in time. This I concede easily! I totally dropped the time ball.
But baby, I've got a good feeling about today!
Aw, T-Rex, why do you want to go back in time so much anyway? You've already been in the past; you know what it's like!
My own life doesn't count, and besides I could go back in time and CHANGE things! Like your breakfast today: wasn't it delicious? Don't you wish you could have had that breakfast YESTERDAY?
Mmm?
Man, even if you were successful, I can just tell you'd screw up my timeline on me!
I would not!!
Besides, it's not YOUR timeline. It's EVERYONE's timeline. We have to share it.
Well, you should take me with you, so I can keep you out of trouble.
Fine! FINE. I'll take everyone back in time with me. WHY NOT. HOW HARD WOULD IT BE TO TAKE EVERYONE BACK IN TIME.
SHORTLY:
IT WAS ACTUALLY NOT THAT HARD

transcription.title: high-concept time travel comics?

panel.line: TIME IS RUNNING FORWARDS:
Aw, shoot!
Did that fix time? I don't think that fixed time!
Well! I guess our only hope is to focus all of our willpower on changing things back to normal!
Do you think that'll make a difference?
I believe that MAYBE it could? It's not like we have too many options! Let's do it!
SOON:
I don't feel anything different - do you?
I feel the same!
But... MAYBE this is something we simply can't fully diagnose with our senses - maybe it's just too subtle!
Broken timeflows are crazy! I'm sorry! Maybe we can fix it with wishes?
I guess it's worth a try! On three!
TIME IS RUNNING BACKWARDS:
I don't think that fixed ANYTHING, man! Things are as messed up as ever!
Also, my head hurts and I feel like making puns involving the word "watch"!

transcription.title: all you can eat

panel.line: Today is a good day I think for going to all-you-can-eat restaurants!
Imagine...
All I can eat!
As a T-Rex, I appreciate being able to gorge myself for one low price.
It's a good thing gluttony isn't a sin!
indeed!
Have you considered the meaning of your actions?
*gasp*
I have not!

Well then, allow me. An all-you-can-eat restaurant, especially in a world where people are starving, is essentially immoral. Besides, consider the symbolism of gorging yourself on more food than you actually need: of eating just for eating's sake. Gluttony because it's affordable: what kind of

image is that? Plus, you can't ... such a restaurant ... if you don't ... cheap, it becomes All-You-Can-Politely-Eat, since you're trying to impress your date and thus you can't go all-out. Food should be a delight, not a symbolic stop at a gas station. I find
I'm going to eat SO MANY WINGS!
[[T-Rex's line in thought-bubble; partly obscures Utahraptor's screed]]

transcription.title: this temporal anomaly is tearing us apart!

panel.line: Wow, it's great to be back in a timeframe that ISN"T beyond recognition! Is this the last time I will ever have incident to say that sentence?
Here's hoping!
How are you feeling, Dromiceiomimus?

I'm feeling alright! I just don't understand how all this happened. How did you manage to screw up time itself? And since time and space are a continuum, wouldn't you have screwed up space itself too?
I don't know! PROBABLY I'm just lucky.
I think she raises a good point, T-Rex!
About time travel and space?
Yeah! In fact, I think this whole thing has raised a lot of questions. How did you even build a time machine in the first place?
Dude, I simply employed lots of ingenuity and cleverness! SO much.
That's not an explanation! That's not even close to an explanation!
The REAL question is, why's everyone getting all up in my fries? Is there something particularly more attractive about my fries today?
Discuss!

transcription.title: hinduism comics! or, or eisegesis comics.

panel.line: Today is a good day I think to talk about HINDUISM.
HINDUISM COMICS!

In Hinduism, there are many gods and aspects of gods, and many of these divinities are sexual. It's true! Some even have sex in the woods with regular mortals just for the fun of it! In conclusion, Hinduism is a famous religion, plus, sexual congress.
T-Rex!!
What?!
Man, leave it to you to take a great religion and focus ENTIRELY on the sexy bits.
I do that with all major world religions though! For example, Christianity?
Mary Magdalene?
Eh?
Some religious scholars believe she and the historical Jesus were more than "just friends"?

transcription.title: the great library of alexandria

panel.line: Ah, the great Library of Alexandria! A repository of learning founded in the 3rd century BC, this library has become a powerful symbol for knowledge.
Especially since it was destroyed by fire or maybe looting a few centuries later.

Oh, what knowledge we have lost! What revelations were written on those ancient papyrus scrolls, now entirely beyond our grasp? With this lost information, could the industrial revolution have arrived a thousand years earlier? The only answer I can offer is an enthusiastic "perhaps!" followed by a wide-eyed "who knows??"
Whoah, I think you're putting to much into this, T-Rex!
It was a pretty great library!

Yeah, but you're treating the actual libraries (plural) as a symbol, which only confuses what actually happened historically. Certainly SOME ancient knowledge was lost, but I think it's disingenuous to suggest that its loss meant our development was set back thousands of years!
You're saying that by building up the legend, I do a disservice to the actual libraries? Well, I've got news for you, my friend!
Um!
The news is, you make some convincing arguments!

transcription.title: chasing after birds naked? looks like my friday night just got filled up!

panel.line: Ah, to be a child again! To have no responsibilities! To have a high metabolism that allows me to eat whatever I want!
To chase after birds in the park, wearing nothing but a grin!
Your idea of childhood is chasing after animals naked?
Well - after being small and irresponsibly eating a lot, yeah.
That's pretty weird, T-Rex!
It's not THAT weird, is it?
It's a little weird!

It's just that it's such an odd image of childhood, and that you came up with it before other more popular images, like splashing in puddles or whatever! Did you once memorably chase naked after a bird? Is that it?
Hah! I deny all these scurrilous allegations!
DUDE BY MY COUNT YOU'VE CHASED AFTER LIKE TWO HUNDRED AND SEVENTY THREE BIRDS WHILE NAKED
There's no shame in that! I do everything naked!
HAH
ME TOO MAN

transcription.title: webcomics about science as the new webcomics about pirates/monkeys/ninjas? here's hoping!

panel.line: Science is based upon hypotheses, conclusions and theories formed via repeated observations and experiments!
THE PHILOSOPHICAL BASIS OF SCIENCE

This allows us to fashion an empirical and verifiable understanding of the world around us. Theories are said to be correct if they match up with the observed properties of the universe! However, science makes the tacit assumption that the universe is predictable and orderly and regular, which MAY NOT BE THE CASE.
I ask the question: what if some of the theories and laws of science were merely statistical?
Explain!
Well, we say the speed of light is about 300,000 km/s, because it's been that every time we've measured it. But what if there's a small chance that sometimes, the speed of light can just - change?
You're questioning the basis of science by postulating a non-deterministic universe.
Yeah man! In such a universe, science totally fails!
So does life, probably! It wouldn't matter because we'd all be dead!
Dead WRONG!
About science?

transcription.title: we'll have a manliness contest right after flipping this five-course meal onto the dirt, BOOYAH

panel.line: You know what would answer the very important question of "who is the manliest?"
None other than a manliness contest! Heck yes!
Dromiceiomimus, I'm so manly that I crack open walnuts for old ladies with my pectoral muscles!
Oh yeah? I'M so manly that I manage my emotional output, plus I swim all the way up waterfalls!
We both understand we're using manliness as an archetype, and that your claims to manliness do not reflect upon your ideas of femininity, or of normative gender. In any case!
I'm so manly that I pound nails into the wall with my bare hands!
Oh yeah?
Well I'M so manly that I use my bare hands to pound them out from the other side!
Oh yeah? Well I'M so manly that I do that too, WHILE IMPREGNATING MY GIRLFRIEND.
Pretty manly!
AND pretty consequential!

transcription.title: borderline-racist PROFESSION jokes that people keep telling, why, why

panel.line: What do you call fifteen PROFESSION MEMBERS buried up to their necks in sand?
Not enough sand!
Oh! Why don't PROFESSION MEMBERS play hide and seek?
Why?
Because no one will look for them!
Hah! Ouch for PROFESSION MEMBERS, and their stereotype!
Hey, are we telling PROFESSION jokes?
We are!
Okay, why do PROFESSION MEMBERS leave AND IDENTIFYING INSTRUMENT OF THEIR PROFESSION on the dashboard of their cars?
Why?
So they can park in handicapped spaces!
Hah hah! Oh, those PROFESSION MEMBERS!
They're not like us!

transcription.title: t-rex has another Theory

panel.line: I'm not hotted out by women who continue to wear high heels while getting increasingly naked.
I'm just not!
I have a Theory about conventional western civilization being infatuated with a cartoonish idea of femininity.
Explain!
Well, you look at the women shown as being attractive in the media, and what do you see? An exaggerated female stereotype, with all of the womanly characteristics underlined and highlighted.
It's as if guys are so afraid of being called gay, they go for the most capital-w Woman they can find!
That's absurd!
I don't think so, man! I think it's a side-effect of homophobia in the media.
There's so much wrong with your theory, I don't know where to start.
Okay! How about with "womanly characteristics"?
Isn't that an odd and frankly creepy way to describe something? "I'm really interested in your womanly characteristics, darling."
"What are they like"
"What are they like"

transcription.title: solipsists: there can only be one

panel.line: Ah, solipsism. The belief that only one's self exists! Everything and everyone else are just a projection of my imagination. I made them up! Who invented all the arts and sciences?
Why, Apparently, it's me - T-Rex!
Okay, but if this is the case, why do you imagine a world for yourself in which people's ice cream cones can fall in the dirt?
Probably I just want to make things more interesting!
And I guess all the pain and death in the world is also just to make things more interesting?
That makes me sound pretty messed up, but yeah! I guess!
But you do admit you don't have control over the entire universe, right?
I can't make you dance, that's true!

Right! So part of your mind you can't control (your unconscious) must be at work there. But since you can't control it, it's effectively external, right? So the rest of the universe is still external to you! You haven't gained anything by imagining it's all in your head.
Dude, I gain the knowledge that if I die, the rest of the universe dies with me. Woo hoo!
(This makes me super important!)

transcription.title: utilitarianism comics

panel.line: Utilitarianism is an ethical system in which you always act to minimize pain and increase happiness! This is the perfect system for me, as I am ALL ABOUT increasing happiness.
UTILITARIANISM COMICS

Dromiceiomimus, I am crushing this house because, holy, what if the people inside are really sad about something? By smushing them, I increase net happiness on the planet over the long term, because they won't be sad anymore, ALSO, stomping makes me happy. Net happiness: increased!
I don't think that's fair!
We could debate it, but that might make me very sad.
You must realize that this isn't a fair application of utilitarianism, T-Rex!
I must?

Yes! Although, you DO raise some of the fundamental problems with the theory: there's no pleasure calculus to measure happiness, especially not one that can take into account the long-term consequences of our actions.
I like this phrase, "pleasure calculus".
Is it truly as erotic as advertised?

transcription.title: a flashback and a poem

panel.line: Knowing that the Utahraptor and I have had an illicit affair has put a new spin on our relation. I hope the easy camaraderie we share will not be lost.
I also hope I was the one who ended it.
THREE YEARS AGO
What about all the good times we shared? How can you be so cold-blooded? Or was that a lie too?
I I'm sorry
That was indeed a difficult breakup. I'd prefer to be the person ending it, given the choice!
*ahem*
Eh?
I just wanted to say that I will always treasure the short time we spent together, and I hope that in time you will understand how I feel.
T-Rex (thinking): It's such a little thing to weep, so short a thing to sigh; And yet by trades the size of these We men and women die! - Emily Dickinson

transcription.title: compressed pornography comics

panel.line: COMPRESSED PORNOGRAPHY COMICS
Oh oh. . .
Cover your eyes!
Alright, I'm a plumber come to "fix your pipes" but you have no money! Also you're Asian.
Is there no way I can pay you?
Perhaps through... sexual intercourse?
LATER. . .
Whew!
That was graphic!
Can I borrow a cup of sugar?
Wait... why do you need sugar?
It's a pretense for a scene of cooking-themed sex.
Oh my goodness!
LATER. . .
Is this the face of exploitation?

transcription.title: a house party! down the street!

panel.line: THERE IS TOTALLY A PARTY AT THIS HOUSE DOWN THE ROAD TONIGHT
Hooray!!
Oh man, do I ever love parties! And parties held at this particular house are always the BEST EVER.
They're "house parties" where anyone can show up!
I know! It makes me feel like a member of a community, plus, I can meet new and attractive lady dinosaurs!
So are we going?
Man, we're going!
My friend, tonight not only do we get to party, but we get to party while eating free delicious snacks!
Well take me off the shelf and put me in a plastic bag, because I'm sold!
Okay!
Wait, what?

transcription.title: the play was called 'don't pinch me like that dear eliza', no real reason

panel.line: T-REX HAS AUDITIONED FOR A PLAY. HE BELIEVES THE AUDITION WENT WELL, BUT HAS NOT BEEN AWARDED A PART.
LET'S WATCH!
Rejected?!
The heck?! I was way better than most of the people there! It's discrimination!
Aww, I'm sorry, T-Rex! But how do you know it's discrimination?
I was told that "someone of my *ahem* 'stature' didn't belong under stage lights". For crying out loud!
I'm sorry too, T-Rex!
It's so aggravating!
They wanted a short orange guy and I gave them a tall green guy, and they threw me to the curb!
I understand, and it's difficult to deal with! But sometimes actors do have to look the part they're playing.
LATER T-REX GOES OUT TO DINNER WITH FRIENDS:
That was muchas delicious but did little to resolve the disparate issues raised by today's events!

transcription.title: never tell a lie

panel.line: I bet that if I was absolutely, universally, honest and never told anyone even a tiny lie again, I'd become the most popular and respected dude ever! I would probably become known as "Cap'n Honest".
Good thing anything that ends up with someone getting a new nickname is worth doing!

So! Dromiceiomimus, assuming you and I share the same general reference point, a similar set of aesthetics, plus senses and ways of interpreting those senses that can be trusted, it appears to be a very pleasant day today!
Yes it does, T-Rex!
I believe that I believe that it may or may not be a nice day for stomping on things. Yes!
I fear this plan of absolute honesty is doomed to failure, my friend!
You do?

I'm afraid so! You'll either end up saying nothing at all, or run the risk of saying something that could be false when viewed from another perspective! Eventually you'll end up saying an untruth to SOMEONE.
Oh, it's true! The only viable solution is to never speak again!
T-REX NEVER SPEAKS AGAIN... IN THE PARALLEL UNIVERSE WHERE EVERYTHING IS CRAZY!
I'm wearing underpants on my head AND passing my driver's test!
Isn't that SO crazy??

transcription.title: why come everything's so 'spensive?

panel.line: How come everything's so EXPENSIVE?
Seriously everyone! How come?
Everything's not THAT expensive, T-Rex.

I don't know, Dromiceiomimus, everything seems pretty expensive to me! It's becoming clear though that my sense of what a good deal is froze when I was about fourteen years old. Inflation since then causes my sense of being ripped off to increase daily!
You're going to be a crotchety old man, my friend!
Oh, it's already begun!
Look at me, I'm complaining about the present by comparing it to how things were back in my day! I'm stereotypically OLD, Utahraptor.
How does it feel?
Great, actually!
I feel like eating food carefully AND interacting with technology in ways that would be embarrassing to any younger people I'm with!
(Thereby fulfilling the stereotype as I understand it!)

transcription.title: you can't see it, but in the last panel all the dinosaurs have had DIFFERENT BREAKFASTS.

panel.line: I just realized that if the universe lasts forever - infinitely forever - then anything that CAN happen WILL happen! It has to because of infinite time!
Infinite time! Kick ASS!
But T-Rex, isn't the current scientific thinking that the universe will expand forever, but in doing so become a lifeless frozen expanse just above absolute zero due to increases in entropy?
But Dromiceiomimus - infinite time! That means that the possibilities are ENDLESS! There must be a timeframe where we're all pirates or whatever.
That's not necessarily the case, you know.
Dude! INFINITE time. Things get CRAZY.

I understand the concept, T-Rex! But while it's true that things with small probabilities would be guaranteed to occur, things with zero probability still wouldn't take place, even with infinite time! And I don't see how you're going to get around the entropy problem.
Yes, but -
TWENTY TRILLION YEARS LATER:
- our understanding of entropy could be wrong!
Off-Panel: Yes, but it's not rational to assume that's the case.
That's true!

transcription.title: how to be patronizing... on the internet!

panel.line: HOW TO BE PATRONIZING
Oh shoot, it's so easy!
AND so fun! AND a recipe for a one-man party!

Okay, so the first secret to being patronizing is to react to everything people do with an aloof amusement, as if it's so PRECIOUS that they did something all on their own. Aren't you just so SPECIAL, Dromiceiomimus?
Nobody wants to be patronized to, T-Rex.
Aw, sure they do, Dromiceiomimus! Here, let me give you a pat on the head. You've earned it!
Another great secret is to call people "Champ".
Seriously, T-Rex. Knock it off.
What's up, Champ? Something bothering you?
God damn it, you're making everyone angry. Why are you even doing this in the first place?
Don't you worry about it, Champ! Here, have some Lego. If you try super hard, you can get some to stick together!
Aww, don't worry Champ! Not everyone gets it on their first try!

transcription.title: Scientists: these guys are on the ball

panel.line: Anyway, forget infinite time! I have a better idea. What if this universe is just one . . . of many?
Okay, people have had my awesome idea before. BUT!

BUT, my idea is actually DIFFERENT. Because what if these universes all exist at once, right now, regularly spaced throughout an inifinitely-huge multiverse? Instead of infinite time, infinite space. Then trillions and trillions of kilometres away from me in every direction is another universe, with another me!
Infinite high fives all around!
I think this idea has been put forward before, T-Rex!
What? Not again!
Yeah, the idea of multiple universes is so popular, I'm pretty sure EVERY theory that's at least borderline probable has been put forward before.
Friggin' scientists!
How do they come up with all my ideas before I even articulate them?
Man!
These guys are on the BALL!

transcription.title: things t-rex did that one time

panel.line: THINGS T-REX DID THAT ONE TIME
ANSWERED THE PHONE IN THE NUDE:
Hah hah! Yep!
PUSHED SOMEONE DOWN A SLIDE BEFORE THEY WERE READY:
Really, you did that? That's very unkind! Were they alright?
They were FINE. It's a slide! People are meant to fall down it!
TRIED TO HAVE A NAP IN THE SHOWER:
What mde you think that was a good idea?
I was tired?
LEFT A THERMOS FULL OF FOOD FOR MONTHS AND MONTHS, HOPING SOMEONE ELSE WOULD CLEAN IT OUT:
Man, I remember that thermos! What happened when you opened it?
I don't know! It's in the attic. You can clean it out if you want!
DONATED MONEY TO AN ORGANIZATION TO HELP BUILD NEEDED INFRASTRUCTURE OVERSEAS:
Aww! A touching ending!
Also, this one time? I ate a whole lasagna before dinner but my parents got me in heaps of trouble.

transcription.title: well, at least they're social

panel.line: Sociopaths view other people as obstacles.
Isn't that WEIRD?

Hah! There's a lot of crazy things about sociopaths. The whole callous unconcern for the feeling of others, incapacity to feel guilt and to profit from past experience, and disregard for social norms, for example!
Any particular reason your're talking about sociopaths?
No reason!
Certainly no SOCIOPATHIC reason, Utahraptor.
Ok-
Certainly no SOCIOPATHIC reason.
Hah hah! Come'ere you, I was just fooling around!
GIVE ME A HUG.

transcription.title: better at it than me

panel.line: Who is the best at eatin' cupcakes? The probable answer is T-Rex, because my goodness I ate seven cupcakes yesterday all in a row!
And guys I wasn't even trying that hard!
Wow! If that's the case, you're better at it than me! I start to feel sick after about five.

Ah, Dromiceiomimus, that's actually "better at it than I". An easy way to remember is to include the "to be" verb you're dropping: "better at it than I am" sounds right, while "better at it than me am" does not! Easy!
Geez, that was kind of rude, T-Rex!
It wasn't meant to be!
Yeah, but it was. Correcting people's grammar in conversation is difficult to do without sounding like a jerk!
It's true! Plus, you've got to be eternally vigilant with your own grammar, lest you mess up yourself.
And yet, I do it freely!! That's because I live on the edge, Utahraptor.
That's because, some days, I take an envelope out of hte box and I PUSH IT.

transcription.title: no cussing (for real this time)

panel.line: Here's a question to ask myself:
"Why am I here?"
The answer?
I have no {{censored}} clue!
Hey! Careful with the cusses, Captain Cussy Pants!
Sorry.
My point is -
Did you just swear?!
Yes I just swore! I said -
I don't want to hear it! No cussing!
FINE.
T-Rex {{thought bubble}}: {{censored}} {{censored}} {{censored}} {{censored}} {{censored}} mother {{censored}}!!

transcription.title: world's cryiest baby

panel.line: I just got off a bus featuring the World's Cryiest Baby. Oh man, what a relief!
Here's a tip: SOME babies need to learn to cry a little less!
That's a terrible thing to say, T-Rex! You can't blame a BABY for crying!
I know, I know! I was just a little irritable and making jokes. I don't actually blame the baby, Dromiceiomimus!
But you sort of blame the baby though, right?
No!!
I just wish it'd cried less. I'm sure if the baby and I got to know each other, we could be friends!
Hah hah, you hate babies!
No man! I love babies! Some of my best friends used to be babies!
HEY EVERYONE T-REX HATES BABIES
Why would you even say that?! I'm the only one that can hear you!
HAH HAH
ZING

transcription.title: going back in time to kill bad guys

panel.line: Hello everybody! I'm back in the present, after going way the heck back in time to kill a great dictator for the common good!
Now, to convince my friends that I'm not coo-coo KRAZY!
Dromiceiomimus, I'm back from the past, where I've changed the timeline to remove someone bad from history! Isn't that PLAUSIBLE?
Um - do you have any evidence?
My only evidence is how incredibly plausible my story is. I would rate it: super plausible!
I find it pretty implausible that you'd return to a future where we all remember you just as you are!
Oh yeah?
Go ahead, ask me anything. I bet I'll get it wrong!
This is dumb.
You know what's dumb? Not believing my incredibly plausible story!
MEANWHILE, SOMEONE ELSE HAS GONE BACK IN TIME TO KILL T-REX!
WHAT THE HELL.

transcription.title: abandonware adventures

panel.line: I BRING YOU NUMEROUS GREETINGS T-REX
AND A QUESTION I WISH TO POSE TO YOU
Aw man! What do you want?
T-REX AND THE DEVIL STAR IN: "ABANDONWARE ADVENTURES"
I SIMPLY WISH TO ASCERTAIN YOUR OPINION ON CLASSIC GAME EMULATION
THERE ARE OFTEN CIRCUMSTANCES IN WHICH A GAME'S COMPANY HAS FOLDED BUT THE GAME ITSELF REMAINS POPULAR
IN THESE CIRCUMSTANCES IS IT ETHICAL TO COPY AND EMULATE THE GAME IN QUESTION
T-That's actually a really interesting question!
Which is, T-Rex?
The question the Devil just asked me about "orphaned games!"

It's actually just a subset of the larger problem of orphaned works still under copyright. How can such works be dealt with when it's impossible or prohibitively expensive to figure out who owns the rights?
Man I'll leave you to it! I'm going elsewhere to have an INTERESTING conversation.
But - copyright laws as applied to software IS really interesting! Come on!
I TOO WILL LEAVE FOR I MERELY WISH TO PLAY CLASSIC NES GAMES FOR FREE T-REX
HOLY MOLEY

transcription.title: capital-p Problems

panel.line: I think I put too much symbolism into random encounters with people I meet on the street! I see them as a microcosm for larger society.
It is a problem with me!

FOR EXAMPLE: the other day I saw some kids who had dropped their bag of marbles. It was a stereotypical image of childhood! But when I stopped to help them pick them up, they said, "No, don't touch them please."
Ouch, man! What went wrong? Can we no longer trust a stranger's helping hand?
Sure we can, T-Rex!
Well, these kids couldn't!
My mood was off for the rest of the day because of it. I was worrying about communities and stuff!
This IS the danger in seeing kids as symbols rather than as real people who just want to pick up their own marbles.
T-REX DECIDES TO SOLVE ALL HIS PROBLEMS BY FOUNDING HIS OWN UTOPIAN COMMUNITY:
It's actually been on my to-do list for a while now, if you can believe that.
Everyone! Be just like me!

transcription.title: good night, don't let yourself bite the bed bugs

panel.line: As I was drifting off to sleep last night, I rolled over and discovered there was a bug in my bed! With me! Right on my pillow!
Ewwwwwwwwwwwww!
That's so gross, T-Rex! What'd you do?
Well, I ate it. Problem solved!
Tada!
Ew, T-Rex! You don't know where that bug has been!
Sure I do!
I know it's been in my bed.
Yeah, but BEFORE that, it could have been anywhere! What if it was a poo bug?
Aw man, do those exist?
These bugs aren't made out of what I think they are, are they?
Other poo bugs?

transcription.title: the sweet dudes featuring justin time

panel.line: I've decided to write a story about my own team of superheroes. That's right! They're called...
The Incr-- The Fant- The Sweet Dudes!

So far I've got four people on the team. The first is Justin Time, who has time-based powers! The second is Justin Case, who can control probability. The third is Chix Diggit, who is an attractive dude if I do say so myself, and the last member is Tim Foresnax, who can eat a lot if he wants to! They fight crime and prejudice and have romantic (mis)adventures.
This seems a little derivative, T-Rex!
Nope! It is 100% my creation!
Come on! "Justin Case"? "Justin Time"? Those are old names that weren't that funny to begin with.
Well, Justin Time goes by his middle name, Tehnikov, because having two Justins on the team would be confusing. Get it?
Their names sound like common phrases that people might say sometimes! "Just in the nick of time"? Hee hee!
It's pretty implausible that someone named "Justin Time" would end up having temporal powers though.

transcription.title: t-rex's life goals

panel.line: Time to make some Life Decisions, set some Life Goals!
That's right, ladies! I am going to be a dude with direction!

But this isn't just a ploy to seem more comely to members of the attractive sex! I really feel like I need a goal to work towards, something that I want to achieve. In the past I've always just gone with the flow!
Go to school, okay, then university, okay, then get a job -
And then?
And then... work at that job or at better jobs as they come along, until I get married and later on die! THE END.
And you're hoping to avoid this by having Life Goals?
Yep! Somehow!
T-REX'S LIFE GOALS:
Get big and smart?
Eat my weight in chocolate?
Learn how to fly rockets or something?

transcription.title: t-rex playing with the british national corpus

panel.line: I went through a document of 100 million English words and counted each of them. You'll never guess what the most-often-used verb form in the English language is!
It's "is"!
The second-most-often used is "was", then "be" and "are" and "have" and "had".
These are all pretty boring words, T-Rex. Most are just forms of the same verb!
This is not my fault! People just talk about being and having a lot. What we need to do is spice up our conversations with more interesting verbs!
Hey, let's start doing this right now!
YES. Motion passes!
Okay! So, um... let's- fletcherize?
Dude, that's not a conversation! That's just using a victorian-era verb (which means to chew one's food thoroughly) without any context!
Well - I was asking if you wanted to chew your food thoroughly, that's all!
Oh, okay! I guess I do, a little.
D-Do you want to do it at your place or mine?

transcription.title: i'm so intense, dude.

panel.line: One of the great myths of our time is that the trick to becoming good at something is to practice it over and over.
I'm afraid that I must respectfully disagree!!

PROOF BY COUNTEREXAMPLE: I have probably practiced eating hundreds of thousands of times! And yet, sometimes I screw it up. Practice clearly hasn't helped me here, because I should be super awesome at eating things now!
You screw it up?
I choke! It goes down the wrong tube or whatever. It's very embarrassing and sometimes I require medical attention.
Well, to be fair, there's a difference between practicing eating and just doing many times over many years, T-Rex.

When you're practicing, you're more aware of what you're doing, examining your own actions actions with an eye for improvement. It's a focus one dosen't have while simply eating as a matter of routine.
Perhaps it's a focus YOU don't have, dude! You forget that I am extremely intense.
And I can prove it, too! Ask me how my day was.
Okay, how was your day?
FRIGGIN' INTENSE!

transcription.title: time to check up on that utopian society i founded!

panel.line: Time to check up on that utopian society I founded! I bet everything is totally perfect there in Utopia Land.
SOON:
They MOVED?!
My utopian society moved, Dromiceiomimus! They moved away!
What do you mean?

Just that! They packed up everything they could and moved somewhere else, and it's not somewhere nearby! They clearly thought things would be more utopic if they moved further away from ME. Argh! I hate those guys so much right now!
But maybe they didn't move, T-Rex! Maybe they just DISAPPEARED!
Huh?

They're a utopian society, right? But the term "utopia" is a neo-logistic pun in Greek! There, depending on how the word is pronounced ("eu" or "ou"), it means EITHER 'good place' OR 'no place'. In English the "u" handles both these sounds, so 'utopia' actually contains both of these meanings!
That's ridiculous! They didn't phase out of existence for the sake of a pun. You're just using this as an excuse to cram an etymology lesson where it doesn't belong!
Colour me impressed!

transcription.title: alternate ending comics

panel.line: ALTERNATE ENDING COMICS
that Utahraptor and his ilk. I don't care what he thinks we did!
What I do care about is vitamin B12!
ENDING ONE
... if only I knew more about it!
THE END
ENDING TWO
... and that's when I woke up and realized that the past few weeks had all been some crazy dream! IT WAS ALL A DREAM!
Damn, guy, you shoulda realized when the Utahraptor was as big as you!
THE END
THANKS FOR READING!
ENDING THREE
How can you talk about vitamins when I'm having your baby?
What?
But - you're a guy! ... AREN'T YOU?
So you assumed! But, think back! Did you ever see me wearing pants?
Did ANYONE?
He - she's right!
finito
ENDING FIVE
Italics: IN MEMORY of GENE RODDENBERRY

transcription.title: digital camera prank

panel.line: Okay, so I take a picture of myself with my digital camera put it on my computer, and then digitally alter it. I make it appear like I'm snow-boarding or meeting famous people or something! Something that is at least PLAUSIBLE.
Then I upload the altered image back to my camera, thereby forming the Perfect Prank!

Now, all I have to do is show people the pictures on my camera, and they'll assume they're authentic because you can't alter a photo like that in-camera! I will exploit the expectation that most people only copy images from, and not to, their digital cameras for comedic effect! Tee hee!
People will fall for this for sure!
Okay, but which people?
You've just explained the prank to both Dromiceiomimus and myself, dude! Do you have other friends that you're close enough to to LIE to them like this?
I sure do, baby!
Hey God! Check out these awesome pictures I got on my camera!
OKAY T-REX BUT YOU KNOW I AM AWARE OF EVERYTHING EVER RIGHT
Okay nevermind.

transcription.title: let's talk about feelings

panel.line: So who here wants to TALK ABOUT FEELINGS? Wooo! Everyone loves a dude who talks about feelings, right?
Feelings: let's talk about them!
Dromiceiomimus, how do you FEEL today?
Fine, T-Rex!
Hey, I feel fine too! Would you like to talk about it for a few hours because that's always a good idea?
Hah hah, no thanks!
Secretly, neither would I! High fives!!
Hey did I overhear that we're talking about feelings?
You probably did, my friend!
Great - listen, I'm sorry I've been a bit snippy lately; I've just been a little stressed out about some things at home.
Oh, um, I was sort of making fun of talking about feelings, but we can actually talk about them too. This is because I am a Good Friend!
A good friend who keeps such conversations in strict confidence, no less! So, tell me about your problems.
Well, as I was saying-
Do you have any problems with sexy stuffs?

transcription.title: who would have thought this 'who can be the better fake panhandler' competition would reflect poorly on us?

panel.line: I was asked for money on the street today, and after I gave what change I had, I was told quite aggressively by the guy that it wasn't enough! This can only mean that it's time once again to discuss everyone's favourite topic. . .
Panhandling!

And it's a tricky issue! Giving money to beggars can be helpful, but some feel it encourages bad behavior and undermines the work of social support organizations. Plus there is always the rumour of beggars who take home hundreds of dollars a day! On the other hand, there may well be people for whom begging is the only means of support they have.
You're sure using a lot of qualifiers there, T-Rex!
It's intentional!

I really don't know very much about panhandling, and a lot of people feel really strongly about it. I don't know! I usually try to learn more about things by doing them, but if I panhandled I'd be a total poseur.
I bet if *I* did it, I'd be way more of a poseur than you!
Man, you're on!
Wait!
This belittles us both!

transcription.title: things t-rex got in the mail for free that one time

panel.line: THINGS THAT T-REX HAS GOTTEN FOR FREE IN THE MAIL COMICS
PANTYHOSE (2 PAIR):
I gave them to my mother for her birthday! What a good son!
INTERNET OSTRICH MEAT STICKS:
Hmmm... they tasted like regular meat sticks, I guess!
What do those taste like?
Like spicy leather? I wouldn't have eaten them under normal circumstances, but, you know, free internet ostrich meat.
BREAKFAST SHAKES:
And how did that taste?
They were so vile. I literally could not understand it.
DEPENDS"#8482; BRAND ADULT DIAPERS:
Did you try them? Did they work??
Only BRIEFLY. It turns out they're meant for the elderly, not for virile young dudes! They don't say this on the package though.
Nooo way.
A BEANIE CAP WITH A GLOW-IN-THE-DARK PROPELLER ON TOP:
How come you don't wear it?
'Cause it's a beanie cap with a glow-in-the-dark propeller on top?

transcription.title: the devil claims to be significantly l33t

panel.line: T-REX I HAVE BEGUN TO EMPLOY NUMBERS AND SYMBOLS IN LIEU OF ACTUAL LETTERS IN ONLINE ENCOUNTERS
AS AN EXAMPLE BACKSLASH LETTER O FORWARDSLASH
INDICATES HOORAY
Okay! Thanks for that!
IT SEEMS A LOT OF GAMERS USE THIS OR AT LEAST A LOT OF PORTRAYALS OF GAMERS IN THE MEDIA
IT IS DIFFICULT TO TELL WHERE THE TRUTH LIES

OF COURSE IT DOES I DON'T WANT PEOPLE TO THINK I'M LAME
I ASSURE YOU

Well, why don't you just check to see what others are doing?
Talking to the Devil?

Is that what they do in hell? Play video games all the time?
ACTUALLY IN HELL YOU CAN DO JUST ABOUT WHATEVER YOU WANT ONLY WHILE YOU'RE DOING IT YOU HAVE TO SING SONGS WITH ALL THE LYRICS REPLACED BY "PARTY"
That doesn't sound so bad!
