transcription.title: this comic is for ninjalicious - i never met him but he did many excellent things.

panel.line: Hey, who wants to come with me to sneak around in abandoned buildings?
I know you want to, Dromiceiomimus!
Maybe I do, actually! What's this about?

It's urban exploration! We poke around in abandoned factories and schools and mental institutions and stuff, but not to steal things, just to look at how things have changed since the building was in use. It's awesome! You see old bathtubs and all sorts of stuff!
Alright! Count me in!
Is this like infiltration?
Yeah, man!

The difference is that infiltration includes exploring buildings that ARE currently in use, like subway systems and stuff, going places you're not supposed to go. We're only going to buildings that haven't been in use for years. It's more like trespassing!
Count me in too! What could possibly go wrong?
NOTHING! EVERYONE HAS A GREAT TIME AND TAKES SOME AMAZING PICTURES:
Hooray! We got to feel what it would be like to be the last person on earth, surrounded by the decaying remains of civilization.
(One more thing checked off on my lifetime 'To-Do' list!)

transcription.title: not the first time t-rex has tried to avoid unconsciousness

panel.line: T-REX STAYS UP FOR 41 HOURS IN THIS COMIC:
Well, I'm perfectly content. Time to mix things up by staying awake for 41 hours!
It's going to be great! This is the best idea ev-
HOUR 20:
I'd never want to eat polluted excited pork meat, Dromiceiomimus. I just invented it and I never want to eat it.
Okay!
Just think about it! "Polluted"? Eww!! And what does "excited" mean when applied to meat? It just raises too many questions.
I wouldn't be able to enjoy it.
HOUR 26:
What's it like being awake for over a day?
Last night I ate lots of pears by mistake.
HOUR 34:
What if I'm a new form of dinosaur that can get tired but that doesn't actually require rest? I'd never know until I did something like this!
I think you're exhausted and can't recognize it.
Are you jealous of my mutant dinosaur powers?
HOUR 40: T-REX'S HEART SKIPS A BEAT
Ahh! Oh my God! THAT WAS NOT EXCITING OR ROMANTIC AT ALL!!
I would have words with the people in charge of aphorisms!

transcription.title: sapir-whorf, make it so

panel.line: Does language alter the way we think? Sources say: perhaps!
This source says: DEFINITELY YES.

I think it's a subtle but pervasive effect! If a language doesn't have a word for something, I think I'm less likely to think about whatever it is that word would refer to. For instance, in English we have words for "friends", but what if we had a single word for the phrase "friends who deserve pie more often"? I bet I'd consider buying people more pies!
You're saying that if we had words for these things, people would think of them more often?
Yeah!

Well, I agree, but I think you're confusing cause and effect! As things become more prominent, they move to become words. Like "electronic mail" becoming "e-mail" and finally "email" - that was due to email becoming more popular, not because people were creating the word in order to MAKE IT more popular. You know?
MEANWHILE, IN THE UNIVERSE WHERE THERE'S NO WORD FOR LOVE:
Aww, I really respect you and wish to spend more time with you in a romantic fashion, too!
TIME FOR MUTUAL KISSES.

transcription.title: if you don't know what vanilla extract is, this comic will be so confusing.

panel.line: You know how vanilla extract smells really good, but tastes really gross when you drink it?
I think this is very symbolic for... something!
Maybe it's symbolic for love? Great in moderation, but you can ruin it by taking too much (i.e., smothering the person with affection)?
It's a little forced! How about symbolic for our generation's sexual politics, in ways I think are pretty clear?
It's a possibility, I guess! Hmmm...
Are we seriously trying to come up with things that vanilla extract is symbolic for?
Yep!
Okay - why vanilla extract?
I don't know. Vanilla extract! Not many people talk about it, so I thought... I thought I'd be the first?
EARLIER:
Off-panel (whisper): t-rex, i am a talking bottle of vanilla extract
That's a little weird, but okay!
Off-panel (whisper): can you tell people about me though

transcription.title: how many songs are there where they rhyme 'school' with 'golden rule'? lots?

panel.line: Ah, the golden rule. Do unto others as you would have them do unto you!
Pretty crazy!
Following this rule, I could feed my vegetarian friends delicious steak sandwiches, because that's what I'd like, Mmm-mmm delicious!
Well, no, T-Rex, because you probably wouldn't want to be fed something you didn't like.
Aha, so much for the golden rule! There's a lot of other awesome variants anyway.
Wait - are you really abandoning the ethic of reciprocity?
APPARENTLY, dude!

Now I'm all about "Do unto others AS they do unto you". Notice the lack of a "would have". Actually, NOW I'm all about "do unto others before they do unto you." No wait! "Do unto others at the same time as they are doing unto you". That one is about doing things together with friends, I think!
I notice you are leaving! Could my conversational stylings be partially to blame??

transcription.title: depression comics: i wish i was never born!

panel.line: DEPRESSION COMICS
It's all so meaningless!
No wonder nobody likes me!
Why should I even bother stomping this house? It's just going to get rebuilt.
Screw it!
Screw EVERYTHING!
What the heck's your problem, T-Rex?
Oh, I'm just practicing. How was I?
Pretty good.
I know, eh?
Hey, can you do "I wish I was never born"?
I wish I was never born!

transcription.title: research for this comic included visiting websites with the word 'astro-NOT' used over and over again.

panel.line: You know what makes me irrationally angry? It's people who say the moon landing was faked!
ARGH! I am getting angry just thinking about it!
It's not like you to respond so emotionally to something like this, T-Rex! Why don't you just respond to their points and disprove their claims?
Because it feels useless! Because most of these people just want to take on of the most transcendental achievements of our time and belittle it any way they can. They're not interested in facts!
Whoah, so instead of attacking the position, we attack the person?
No! Well, yes!

I don't know! It's just that we're in a special place in history now, where it still matters that we've been to the moon. Once moon travel becomes routine people won't care so much, but right now, the landings are unique. They're still special.
How's that? You've been to the moon like two times yourself!
Man, I don't count! I was talking about OFFICIAL visits to the moon. Mine were in a strictly unofficial capacity.
You have my assurances!

transcription.title: hardcore wasting time is like softcore wasting time, but with more clinical close ups on people blinking

panel.line: JOKES EXPLAINED PRESENTS: "CONFUCIUS SAY"
This vaguely-racist form of comedy relies upon the double-entendre! It narrates the advice of a man called "Confucius" who delivers many a "bon mot".
For example: "Confucius say... man who run in front of car get tired!"

Ho ho! Did you catch the comedy there? There are two meanings in that phrase! If you don't get it, don't worry - the key to emulating understanding is often just to repeat the last word or phrase. Fake a laugh, say "Hah! TIRED." and you will be SET.
Was there a real-life Confucius, T-Rex, or is he merely a convenient fictional device?
Well!
As you know, there was in fact a real Confucius. He lived in the 5th century in Ancient China (then called "China") and was and is an incredibly well-respected philosopher!
Indeed!
So yea, you've got to be careful, because the real Confucius said many non-hilarious things.
Phrases like "they who know the truth are not equal to those who love it" are not meant to be laughed at! SO DON'T EVEN TRY.
To conclude, I hope people needed this joke explained, because otherwise I've been hardcore wasting my time today!

transcription.title: i imagine there's a waiting list of some design

panel.line: Some larger cities are plagued by advertising trucks: trucks paid to just drive around in the downtown core with giant advertising placards mounted on the back. The hell? I disagree with this in the strongest way possible!
And generally I'm a seriously easy-going dude!

They're just so WRONG. They're causing unnecessary pollution in an area that already probably has problems with air quality, PLUS, they're congesting the road and making our cities more corporate and less beautiful. They're ugly, and the whole idea is self-centered, and thoughtless, and the worst kind of capitalism.
Oh man, those ad trucks piss ME off too!
Really? You don't think I'm going overboard?

Not at all! It's aggressive advertising that intrudes on our public spaces, and since it adds to congestion on the roads, ACTUALLY MAKES PEOPLE'S LIVES QUANTIFIABLY WORSE. The time lost stuck behind an ad truck can be traced directly to some jerk who thought his message was more important than minutes from your LIFE.
SERIOUSLY GUYS I HATE THOSE AD TRUCKS TOO
T-Res: Then why don't you do anything about it?
I HAVE MAN
ANYONE WHO IS RESPONSIBLE FOR ONE OF THEM ENDS UP BEING REINCARNATED AS THE UGLIEST POO BUG IN THE WORLD
ZING

transcription.title: how to be jawesome

panel.line: I've written a draft of a new book! The book is called, "How To Be Awesome".
I know! It's totally the book I was meant to write!
In the book, I tell people that the key to being awesome is to do awesome things at awesome times.
You know T-Rex, you sure are using the word 'awesome' a lot. Is your vocabulary really that limited?
You're right! I'm not certain if overusing 'awesome' is, in fact, awesome. I'll cut it out for a bit while I consider the issue!
So wait, I missed it - what's your new book about?
Um... it's called - "How to Be"?
And in the book, I tell people that the key to being is to do things at times.
Hey. It'll rule.
"HOW TO BE" FAILS TO RULE IN AT LEAST FOUR DIFFERENT WAYS:
I now realize that replacing 'awesome' with a semantically similar word, rather than dropping it entirely, would have been a more viable course of action.
Live and learn, bitches!

transcription.title: documentary films

panel.line: My stars, do I ever love documentary films. The best form of filmmaking?
As I see it, yes!

What I've come to love is the tension between filmmaker and subject, the way editing can so easily be used to slip the filmmaker's politics into the film. The veneer of realism, the claim of legitimacy - ooh! It's all so GOOD. There's politics in every film, sure, but only documentary makes the claim of truth, and it's THAT claim that makes it all so interesting.
You're still on about documentary film?
Dude! It's SO GOOD.

My favourite are the extended takes, where you ask your subject a question, they answer it, and then you hold the camera on them for a good ten seconds afterwards while they glance around and look ridiculous.
It is a great way to subtly undermine your subject without saying a word.
Yep. T-That's what I think!
I-
Um.

transcription.title: intelligent design comics, featuring: talking dinosaurs coexisting with humans!

panel.line: Intelligent design (or ID) is the idea that while we may begin to understand the universe through science, it is actually created with divine intent. Evolution is not the chaotic product of random mutations, but rather intentional.
Much as a watch implies a watchmaker, so does our universe imply divinity!

Okay! It's a very nice idea, but it's not science because it's not disprovable: you either believe in intelligent design or you don't, and there's no way to show who's right. That's not science - that's faith!
And whould faith be held to the rigors of the scientific method?
Of course not!
The issue is that some think ID should be taught in schools as an alternative to evolution, right?
Right!
But there's nothing in ID (as I've formulated it) to say that the two can't exist peacefully. One just doesn't belong in science class, because it's not a science. It belongs in religion class.
Wait - T-Rex, you claim to hear the voice of God! What does he say about all this?
I LIKE TO DANCE IN MY UNDERPANTS T-REX
He says - there's some merit to both sides of the issue?
THAT IS SO NOT WHAT I SAID

transcription.title: GOOD EVENING PROFESSOR SCIENCE, I HAVE A QUERY AGAIN

panel.line: Things sure would be different if one day, the speed of light slowed down to something like half a meter per second for some reason.
Yes indeedy!

For one, games of hide-and-go-seek would be more complicated. Also if you were a long-distance runner, it would be more difficult to run because when you went faster that light you couldn't see where you were going.
Is that true?
I think so. Maybe?
I think you'd still be able to see things, actually!
How's that?

Well, light can be thought of as a particle, right? And so it's like - if rain was falling really slowly, and you were running throught it, you'd hit more particles than you would if you were standing still. I think that's how it would work.
You know what? I'm not even certain if it's possible to travel faster than light. I'm going to ask Professor Science.
Utahraptor (off-panel): Aw man, that guy's a rube!
Dude, he's a diplodocus with one of those square graduation hats on him! WHAT IS NOT TO LIKE?

transcription.title: by the end of this comic, the word 'class' has lost all meaning

panel.line: THE UNIVERSE WHERE T-REX THINKS EVERYONE SHOULD GO TO CLASS, BUT NOBODY IS GOING TO CLASS:
Why isn't anyone attending their classes? Guys! Class is on! It's time to go to class!
What the heck is wrong with everyone in this universe?
I just don't understand why nobody is going to class.
THE END
THE UNIVERSE WHERE EVERYONE GOES TO CLASS BUT T-REX:
You're late for class, T-Rex!
Dude, you know what I say? I say, "forget class!".
You can't say that! Class is important! Class is really important.
Hello? I play by my own rules. Rule number one: no going to class, baby!
Rules two through five are various socio-economic and anarchic justifications for not going to class. Rule six says it's really too bad that all the ladies are in class right now!
My philosophy - she has her limitations.

transcription.title: vaudeville-style comedy, i guess?

panel.line: Today, I am selling compliments!
. . . for PROFIT!
Dromiceiomimus! I have some very special compliments for sale. Would you like to buy a compliment, gorgeous? (That one is on the house!)
No thank you, T-Rex! I don't buy my compliments.
An insult, AND an implication that my business model is not sound!
Hey, can I buy a compliment, T-REx?
You-- really? Sure!
I was sort of expecting that you'd point out flaws of my home business, but sure, I'd be glad to sell you one!
Okay! What can I get for one dollar?
I can hook you up with an "Attaboy Special", which includes a five word compliment and a firm handshake.
SOON:
You are a good dude!
I want my money back.
SUDDENLY YOU ARE NOT SUCH A GOOD DUDE.

transcription.title: 'daydream believer' was on the radio when he woke up

panel.line: I have accomplished much today and it's not even noon yet! I feel as if I could take on anything and anyone and succeed!
And ladies, I am all about putting theories into practice!
Dromiceiomimus! Give me a challenge!
Sing the alphabet!
Something DIFFICULT.
Jump to the moon!
Something difficult yet possible, Dromiceiomimus! My stars! This is like a 1920s comedy routine without the punchline.
Man, anyway! I'll come up with my own incredible challenge.
I've got one for you!
How about you go TWO DAYS wihtout stomping on anyone or anything? This is my challenge to you.
Aw - but, man! I was looking for a challenge I WAWNTED to do. Anyway, yeah, I can do it. Easy. Easy peasy Japanesey.
Is that racist??

transcription.title: compressed film comics ]|[

panel.line: COMPRESSED FILM COMICS
today's film: TITANIC
And that makes me the love interest!
I'm a ruffian with a heart of gold! Are there any sensual socialites on board?
I'm the snidely husband-to-be of just such a bored but sensual socialite: Rose! Stay away from her! Your "forbidden love" has no place in my haughty world of pretension.
You are repressing her free spirit and sexuality! Notice how I am a throughly modern hero, despite my being born in the 1900s? I am appealing to a hypothetical audience, 100 years in the future!
I am Rose, your fated lover! Let us enjoy ourselves in this consequence-free environment!
Sweet!
Would you say that not even God Himself could tea us apart?
There's no time for that now! The ship is sinking and there are not enough lifeboats!
I will float on this piece of debris, but I am sorry, there is only enough room for one!
DENOUEMENT:
I was a fool!

transcription.title: learnability of natural languages comics THAT'S RIGHT

panel.line: Learning a language is hard! It is especially hard with your first language, when you're a baby who has to figure out an entire grammar and vocabulary just from what people say to you.
It's not just hard: in fact, it may well be impossible!

It turns out that natural languages are so complex that we probably can't figure out all their rules just from hearing words spoken around us, but we CAN approximate these rules and get very close. So the result is we (as learners) end up speaking a language we're able to communicate with, wut which is slightly different than those that surround us!
How slight a difference are we talking about here?
That depends on the learner, I guess!

Rules that are used everyday are going to be more fixed, because there's more of a chance somebody will correct you. But less-frequent parts will be more malleable, which explains why languages evolve so quickly!
Because a language is never passed down, just an approximation of a language.
Yep! Of course this has changed a little with the advent of grammar books and formal schooling, but it's still there. For example, I might think the word 'tenet' is enraging!
Utahraptor (off-panel): Really? You think the word 'tenet' is-
Screw you!!

transcription.title: honestly, some of my best friends are named 'timmy'

panel.line: T-Rex as Cultural Critic
What's with mainstream music nowadays? It's all so BAD. If I wanted facile lyrics, I would just write them myself and make sure not to try very hard!
All the music I hear on the radio has lyrics by Timmy!

Plus, I saw this painting of a woman the other day and it was clear that the painter had no idea what he was doing! It's as if someone just described to him in passing what a woman looked like, and he was all, "I got it guys!" Everything was just a little off. It was a portrait by Timmy!
Who is this "Timmy" guy?
He's a rhetorical dude!
He's also my new critical trademark. When something is really juvenile, I'll say it's by Timmy. It implies so much earnest ineptitude!
T-Rex! All you're going to do IN THE BEST CASE is ruin the name of real people called "Timmy" !
Man, I already did that with my safe-sex campaign! Remember? "It is almost certain that you will contract STDs from guys named Timmy"?
Hah hah! Ouch for Timmy!

transcription.title: ten whole chickens and a litre of milk

panel.line: Oh my goodness, I feel sick to my stomach today. I woke up and I felt sick to my stomach already.
EARLIER:
Ten roasted chickens for dinner? I believe the answer is "Heck yes!"
BACK IN THE PRESENT:
I don't understand it! I was not around any sick people. I did not eat any bad food. And yet, ouch, my stomach!
What did you have for dinner last night?
I had ten whole chickens, Dromiceiomimus. Mmm-MMM!
Well, there's your problem, my friend!
No way!
They were very delicious chickens. I would eat them all again, given the chance.
Yeah, but you shouldn't just have chicken for dinner, T-Rex. You need BALANCE in your diet. Nutrition, man! You know about nutrition.
CONFESSION TIME!
Alright, I admit it! I knew it was bad for me, but I ate them anyway! And - sometimes I don't clean my house as often as I should? Oh! And one time I pretended I was deaf.
I - I got caught.

transcription.title: crypto / trapdoor functions

panel.line: Oh goodness, cryptography. It's really interesting!
Specifically, trapdoor functions are SUPER interesting! Times two!

These are functions that are easy to compute but difficult to reverse-engineer - unless you have the secret 'trapdoor' information. For example, the product of two prime numbers (p and q) is not hard to figure out if you know their values (it's just multiplication!), but if all you have is the answer, n, guessing what p and q are can take a really long time.
And yeah, functions like this are a basis of cryptography!
How's that?
Well, say I send n to you, and you know what the secret value of p is. There's a chance my message might be intercepted by a bad guy. But this dude will only know n, not p!
So I'll be able to figure out q easily, knowing what n and p are, but this guy will be totally stumped!
Yep! Of course, all this lets us do is communicate a prime number q in secret to each other. But you can probably do even more things with trapdoor functions!
Probably?
I'm almost certain!

transcription.title: here is a startling thought: SNAKES ON A PLANE

panel.line: Here is a startling thought: what if the things I believe in are wrong?
I'm serious! This is a big concern for me!

It's the reason I've never really attended any political marches - I can only rarely convince myself that I believe in something SO MUCH that those who don't share my beliefs are wrong, and need to be publicly convinced otherwise! I'm always conscious that I may one day look back on my present-day self and shake my head.
So you're left with paralyzed middle-of-the-road beliefs?
Not necessarily!
I'm just left with an acute awareness that I could be wrong about some of the things I currently believe in. Not big things, like racism, but little things, like mohawks!
Wait - you believe in racism?
No, man!
I think racism is BAD. It's like when you say you're fundraising for cancer - you're not in favour of it! You want to cure it. That's what I meant!
Alright. T-Rex: not necessarily racist.

transcription.title: A CAUTIONARY TALE about marrying flappers, just in case, you know, this ever comes up

panel.line: Here is a list of things that were once totally cool and remain so:
Flappers!

And this is where my list derails so that I can talk about flappers. Oh goodness, flappers! These were the 1920s equivalent of hipsters, only they looked like boys and had way better slang. The way they talked was the BERRIES. That means something was great!
I got that, yeah!
Could it be you have a CRUSH on flappers, my friend?
It could well be, Utahraptor!
And it doesn't concern you that you have a crush on an extinct social group just because of their sweet slang?
Nope! It gives me hope, because one day I could meet someone who actually talked like a flapper, and then we could get married!
A FEW YEARS LATER:
Man, what was I talking about? It was a terrible idea to marry someone just because of her cool slang!
I really need to think long and hard about my life decisions.

transcription.title: t-rex's big tattoo

panel.line: Man, how great would it be to have a TATTOO? Assuming it does not go disastrously wrong, it would be super cool!
T-REX'S BIG TATTOO
How would it go disastrously wrong?
Oh you know - the usual. I get a tattoo of some figure in popular culture and it turns out that figure is crazy racist. We've all been there, right?
We've probably all been there.
Hey, I've got a great idea, T-Rex: let's get tattoos together!
Like twin tattoos?
No, like we both get tattoos at the same time - for moral support. Twin tattoos? You were thinking we'd each get separate halves of the yin yang symbol or something?
Yeah, I guess I was! Hah hah! That WOULD be pretty crazy.
We'd have to press our tattoos together to make them line up and all the people would think we're married! Plus what if we got the tattoos on our lips?
Okay! I'm going to stop talking now!

transcription.title: he gets knocked down, but he gets up again

panel.line: TIME TO TELL PEOPLE SOME EMBARRASSING SECRETS T-REX
Aw man, I don't want to tell anyone my few remaining embarrassing secrets! Come on.
SERIOUSLY IT'LL BE A HOOT
No!
DUDE COME ON TELL PEOPLE YOUR EMBARRASSING SECRETS
IT'LL BE SO MUCH FUN
FOR ME
GOD
Okay! Okay, FINE. I'll tell ONE embarrassing secret and that's it!
But all you're getting is one secret, no more!
Who's getting a secret?

Apparently, you are! And the secret is this: when I lost my virginity, I had the song "Tubthumping" by Chumbawamba stuck in my head the entire time. I just really liked the song. I remember being afraid I would hum it afterwards!
Hahahah! You get knocked down, but you get up again!
Now don't go around telling that secret to anyone else, okay?
I already sent it out over the news wires!
THAT WAS SO IMPROBABLY FAST!

transcription.title: t-rex has decided to stalk someone

panel.line: T-REX HAS DECIDED TO STALK SOMEONE:
I've decided to stalk a friend! Hah hah, why not? I will be the person they least suspect!
This is because I'm violating the understood limits of our friendship!
Dromiceiomimus, I'm going to let you in on a secret, okay? I have decided to stalk Utahraptor! Can you help me out?
I can and I will! This is all in good fun, right?
RIGHT. We are NOT allowed to murder him.
A FEW DAYS LATER:
T-Rex, I think I've got a stalker!
Hee! That's too bad!

Yeah, it's not actually that bad a deal yet. This guy just calls me and tells me he knows where I live, and I'm like, okay, and then he giggles and hangs up. I think he's new to this. Sometimes a woman calls too.
Hee hee!
A FEW DAYS LATER: CONSEQUENCES!
Cheese it, the fuzz!

transcription.title: the man knows how to make an entrance

panel.line: Tonight is Hallowe'en, and that means...
... treats! Hooray! Hooray for treats!
Are you - you're going trick-or-treating this year, T-Rex?

Sure am! I have decided that giving it up when I achieved pubescence was a MISTAKE. I am going to dress up and go door-to-door and get candies! Woo! All I need is a costume and a way to minimize embarrassment.
You'll miss out on seeing all the costumes of the kids who come to your house!
That's okay!
You'll also miss out on the Hallowe'en party we're having after the trick-or-treaters are gone!
I'll just be late, that's all! Late with my PILLOWCASE FULL OF CANDY.
Man! There's a reason adults don't go trick-or-treating!
THAT NIGHT, AT THE PARTY:
Hi guys! It turns out the reason adults don't go trick-or-treating is because you get berated at every house for being too old! Also some kids tricked me and stole my costume!
It has been a night of revelation!

transcription.title: Egoism!

panel.line: I have discovered a new philosophy for life that appeals to my own sense of self-worth!
Egoism!

In egoism, all your actions are motivated by a desire to make things easy for one person: yourself! For instance, I crush this house because it's in my way. My actions are justified, thanks to egoism!
But what about yourself? You're only here because your parents selflessly decided to have children. Your very existence is against egoism.
They probably realized what a great dinosaur I'd be and figured it would be in their own interests to creat me!
What the hell?

First off, I don't know why you need egoism to justify the destruction you're going to wreak ANYWAY. Second off, egoism doesn't account for charity, unless you reduce it to 'good will in the bank', saved for some future benefit. That in turn doesn't account for charity seen in lesser animals, who aren't cognizant of such self-centered account-keeping. In conclusion: it's untenable.
"In conclusion: it's untenable"? YOU MUST BE A LOT OF FUN AT PARTIES!

transcription.title: too many friends?

panel.line: Is it possible to have too many friends?
The answer is "Definitely yes!"

This is because if you were friends with EVERYONE ever in the history of time, you'd have so many people who'd expect you to talk with them on the phone and hang out with them and stuff, and there's only so many hours in a day! Eventually you'd end up snubbing at least SOME of them, which is bad.
Therefore, yes, it is possible to have too many friends!
You know, talking like this risks backlash, T-Rex!
How so?

Well, few people worry about having too many friends, and those who feel like they could maybe use some more friends might become resentful. It's not the sort of thing you go looking for sympathy about.
I don't have too many friends! I was speaking hypothetically!
I could use some more friends, actually. I tried calling an escort service once but it turns out that is a euphemism and all the people there were just interested in sex for money!
I was like "Hah hah, what?"

transcription.title: so yeah, he's going.

panel.line: THE DAY DROMICEIOMIMUS INVITED PEOPLE TO A PARTY TOO EARLY
(in comic form!)
Well! I certainly hope I don't get prematurely invited to any PARTIES today!
BUT THEN...!
Hey T-Rex, do you want to hang out on New Year's Eve?
What? But it's barely November. You're planning this now?
Yep! It's not going to be that big of a party, but I thought people might be in high demand, so I'm asking now.
I - I guess I don't have any other plans!
Huh! That was weird!
What was?

Dromiceiomimus invited me to a party like two months in advance! But - more weird was that I was actually musing about not wanting to be prematurely invited to any parties just before she spoke to me. It's incredible.
That's so unlikely. It's such a weird thing to worry about.
I know! I'm freaking out over here. This is me:
HUH??? CAN ANYONE EXPLAIN THE CONFLUX OF THESE TWO EVENTS?
That's seriously me right now!

transcription.title: autodidacticism comix

panel.line: You know what's better than school? Not being in school but still learning!
Yes indeed! I have decided to become AUTODIDACTIC.

This means that I eschew formal schooling and learn on my own terms at my own pace, Dromiceiomimus! I learn things that interest me and don't rely on someone else to tell me what I should and should not know.
Didn't you graduate years ago?
Shhh!
Hey, why are you setting up learning on your own and learning in a classroom as opposites?
It's not you can't do both! Learning is learning, and some ways work better for some people.
Well, I've also incorporated into my auto-didacticism a distrust of schools as inefficient, repressive institutions. It's part of my new "damn the man" persona!
I can demonstrate, my friend! Ask me where I picked up a word like "autodidacticism"!
Where'd you pick up a word like "autodidacticism"?
Not from any SCHOOL!

transcription.title: t-rex has a cold :(

panel.line: Nobody can kiss me today, because I'm sick.
Sorry, LADIES!
While you may have wanted a smooch just now, Dromiceiomimus, you can't have one because I'm sick! I have a cold.
That's alright - I'm sure I'll survive somehow.
M-Maybe tomorrow?
Is this a new kind of come-on for you, T-Rex?
No!

It is! I bet you're just trying to play "hard to get". And, actually, by announcing that nobody can kiss you, you imply that they'd probably want to kiss you under normal circumstances. You're just spinning your cold, using it as good PR!
It's true!
But, I'm ALSO creating an artificial shortage of T-Rex kisses to increase demand. Would you say you irrationally want some of my kissing now?
Nope!
Try harder!

transcription.title: guest week party central: bernie hou

panel.line: #/usr/local/bin/qwantz
my ($bologna);
for ($i=0; $i<2; $i++) {print "$bologna{'name'}[$i]\n";}
# t-rex.pl
What's up T-Rex?
I've decided to start speaking in PERL more often! It's my favorite computer language!
What makes PERL so special?
Well for one thing, it's an extremely portable language. That means it works in all sorts of environments without many differences!
You mean I can go to Uganda and they'll understand me?
Do they need Powerful word-parsing in Uganda? Try PERL's "Regular Expressions"!
For example, if you said "showers" and I said "s/sh/fl/", you'd get "flowers"!

s/that's c/i'm h/

transcription.title: guest week party central: ryan estrada

panel.line: I sometime wonder if I've become too dependent on my daily routine.
I think I need to start thinking "outside the box"
I will imagine that this house is the box. My stomping of said box will symbolize my ability to effect change in my life.
You will symbolize change through repetition?
DO NOT LESSEN THE METAPHOR!
What does the girl represent?
Since I stomp the girl every day, she represents my daily routine.
Your metaphors for changing seem to be a thinly-veiled attempt not to.
Oh yeah? Well this next one represents you.
LOOK AT ME! I'M A STUPID UTAHRAPTOR! I WISH I HAD LIFE ALL FIGURED OUT LIKE T-REX!
(left elbow down, right elbow up) The crazy Utahraptor thinks I have OCD.
(open mouth) I wonder what that stands for. "Overly Competent Dinosaur"
(Left foot, stomp house.) Or perhaps "Outstandingly Creative Dialogue".....Hey Dromiceiomimus, did you hear? Utahraptor thinks I am "One cool Dude"!
I am filled with my "Ordinarily Cautious Doubt"
(Turn around, stomp girl.) Hey Utahraptor, I really appreciate that you think I'm "Oh-so Clever and Delightful"!
What?
OCD stands for "Obsessive Compulsive Disorder"! It means you are consumed by the constant need to do something, in this case, stomp.
Oh, Crap! Detected!
Holy crap! There's a bomb in the comic.
If I stop stomping the comic will explode!
I must stomp unceasingly or we are all surely doomed!
Isn't that all you ever do anyway?
I must heroically continue to save us all!
Holy Crap, T-Rex! You just stomped that house!
It's okay! It was full of cans!
You see what you've done? You've distracted me from my stomping. Now the comic will explode.
I'd better run!
Now that he is gone I can freely admit that there never was a bomb. I just wanted an excuse to stomp!
I am reliving the same day of my life over and over again until I get it right.
I will prove it to you, I know what will happen before it happens! Watch: I am about to stomp a house.
You see that? Proof!
T-Rex, you are confusing yourself with a Bill Murray character again.
I knew you were going to say that!
Hey T-Rex! I know what's going to happen too!
Really, what?
You're going to say something stupid and then naively play it off as though everything worked out in your favor.
Oh yeah?? Well... I... predict that you're a stupid!
How did I know? You see that? Proof!
Hey, you know what I don't like anymore? STOMPING.
It's so overdone. I no longer enjoy STOMPING.
Hey T-Rex, why are you stomping that house?
Irony. Haven't you heard? It's cool to do things you no longer enjoy.
And why are you stomping the girl?
Nostalgia.
It's been so long that I've enjoyed stomping that it has come back in style.
It seems that all your stages of fashion involve stomping.
Irony and Nostalgia are no longer "In". The big thing now...... Stomping!

Ah-

transcription.title: guest week party central: jon rosenberg

panel.line: After several years of study I think it is safe to say that I have a firm grasp on the nature of reality!
News Flash: Reality is super-awesome!
My comprehensive understanding of the inner workings of the universe gives me complete control over every aspect of existence! I am an omnipotent stud!
But T-Rex, crushing things isn't fundamentally altering our universe.
It isn't?
You're certainly changing your immediate environment, but to change the nature of the fabric of space time is far beyond our technological grasp.
Then I am going to be requesting a refund for that correspondence course!
Sally Struthers, you should be ashamed of yourself!

transcription.title: guest week party central: jim burgess

panel.line: I find it exquisitely funny to give someone a nickname that is at odds with said person's true identity.
Nicknames!
For example, I would nickname you Fat D. because in reality you are quite svelte!
Hello there, T-Sex!
Gasp!
He must have been talking to someone behind me.
NO DUDE. YOU ARE TOTALLY ALONE.

transcription.title: the intercourse instinct

panel.line: Today is a good day I think for trying to explore THE VERY LIMITS OF MY OWN BODY.
By which I mean "examining instinctual responses", of course!
I find the idea of instincts interesting. What's it like having a drive to do something but not really understanding why? Have I ever felt an instinctive urge like that?
Well! I intend to find out, using the power of science coupled with the power of auto-experimentation!
SOON:
So, how's the experiment going?
TOTALLY SUCKY!
I can't figure out what I should be testing. What are some instincts people have?
Oh, well, you could always put your favourite food in your mouth and try not to chew or swallow it. It's possible to do this, but the desire to eat it is strong. Tada! Instinct!
Ooh! OR, I could surround myself with attractive and sexually-available women and then try not to have the intercourse with them!
That seems more like an excuse for group sex than actual science.
EXPERIMENT: APPROVED??

transcription.title: the answer is yeah, some mice can actually live outdoors

panel.line: There was a mouse in my house last night. A mouse! In my house! That rhymes!
But that's not important right now!
This mouse was not only in my house but in my kitchen and on my kitchen counter. Clearly, he needs to die!
Awwww, T-Rex! Can't you just use a human trap instead of killing him?
FINE.
A FEW DAYS LATER:
How's the mouse situation?
Sadly unchanged!
I'm at an impasse! I don't want to kill him, but I figure if I use a human trap to release him somewhere else, I'm just shifting the problem to the new dude whose kitchen he moves into.
Can't mice also live outdoors?
I don't know! I can't look up mice on the internet because my internet is down!
What about an encyclopaedia?
Dud, WHAT ABOUT THE INTERNET??

transcription.title: flavoured chips!!

panel.line: T-REX CAN YOU RATE YOUR FAMILIARITY WITH CLASSIC PEN-AND-PAPER RPGS
ALSO KNOWN AS RPGS
I don't know what they are, man! Let's talk about something else - like chicks!
CHICKS ARE NOT AS MULTIFACETED AS A TRUE PEN-AND-PAPER ROLY PLAYING GAME T-REX
IN WHICH ONE PERSON IS THE GAME MASTER AND TELLS EVERYONE ELSE WHAT HAPPENS TO THEM
FOR EXAMPLE
YOU HAVE KILLED AN ORC
TO WHICH THE PLAYERS REPLY
INDEED
RPGs sound like nerd games that nerds play! With - with nerds!
That's pretty close-minded, T-Rex!
You shouldn't be so biased against them. They're really just collaborative storytelling with especially terrible PR and easily stereotyped players. But they're probably fun! I imagine!
Have you ever played one?
Nope!
I INVITE YOU ALL TO PLAY RPGS WITH ME TONIGHT T-REX
I'm not going to hell just to play RPGs!
I PROMISE ONLY FLAVOURED CHIPS AND HIGH ADVENTURE

transcription.title: winning the lottery; what could possibly go wrong?

panel.line: Sometimes when people win the lottery, they end up getting into a lot of trouble because they don't know how to handle that much money.
Dear lottery officials: I would not have such troubles!
I would invest the money wisely and live reasonably. My only extravagance would be a pair of diamond studded house slippers, and upon my death, I would donate them, and my riches, to charity!
Which charity?
Huh?
Which charity would you donate to? Is it perhaps a charity dedicated towards RESUSCITATING YOUR DESICCATED CORPSE?
What? No, I wouldn't think of doing that. I'm not trying to set up a Walt Disney-esque scheme for tax sheltered reanimation here!
T-REX SOMEHOW SETS UP JUST SUCH A CHARITY BY ACCIDENT:
These events only serve to further undermine my credibility!
Man!
Friggin' events!

transcription.title: this is why you have to be so careful with which charities you donate to

panel.line: Utahraptor's started his own charity dedicated towards reanimating his body when he dies.
What a copycat!
It's MY idea, even if I did do it just by accident. Now it's like a bizarre arms race, seeing who can reanimate their dead body first. It's dumb. And yet, I'm totally going to win!
This isn't a race, T-Rex!
It is, and you started it!
Fine then - I'm ending it! I just thought it would be cool to have people working on reanimating our bodies when we die, but if it's such a big deal for you, forget it.
Awww! Really? You'd give up being a reanimated corpse for our friendship?
Because that's what my charity was looking into: reanimating long-dead corpses! We was gonna make zombies.
We - we was being straight out socially irresponsible.

transcription.title: sweet pranks

panel.line: HEY T-REX HAVE YOU EVER PULLED ANY SWEET PRANKS
Sure have, God!
HAHA ME TOO MAN WHAT ARE YOURS
Well!

Back when I was in middle school, I used to go to the computer labs and add all sorts of common typos and misspellings to their spell check dictionaries, like 'teh' and 'acceptible' and 'amoung' and 'tahn'. Hee hee!
THAT'S SUCH A SUCKY PRANK
It rules! All these kids handed in essays with massive spelling mistakes!
It sort of sucks, man!
The person who falls for this probably won't even realize they've had a prank pulled on them! And when they do, there's no moment of laughing realization, just irritation.
Pranks are supposed to end in laughter all around?
The best ones do!
Huh! Mine have all ended with me getting punches to the gut. A fre ended in broken marriages!
What is this emotion called 'regret'?

transcription.title: i have surprised even myself

panel.line: I have decided to become a scientist dinosaur. All I need to complete the ensemble is glasses and a lab coat.
You can call me...
Professor Tyrannosaurus Rex, PhD!
Do you have any science questions you'd like answered?
Actually... I have been dabbling in genetics and was wondering what a group of alleles is called.
It depends on what alleles you're talking about. In the same gene, they're called an "allelic series" but in different genes, a set of alleles is known as a "haplotype".
And now I will demonstrate stomping physics!
Stop please!
How the heck did you answer that genetics question just now? I didn't know you knew about stuff like that!
I - I don't know!
I have surprised even myself!

transcription.title: holy shit, what is your favourite food day!

panel.line: WHAT IS YOUR FAVOURITE FOOD DAY:
My favourite food is bread! It's the most delicious thing to eat before, during, and perhaps even after a meal!
T-REX: BREAD
My favourite food is avocado sandwiches! They're fatty but teally really delicious. I also like orange juice.
Everyone loves orange juice! Well, except for people who have cuts on their lips, but they've made their choice.
DROMICEIOMIMUS: AVOCADO SANDWICHES, ORANGE JUICE
My favourite food is - a secret!
Aw, Utahraptor, that's dumb!
No it's not! It makes me a little more mysterious, I think. It's like keeping your birthday a secret!
That's dumb too! The only people who do that are old people who don't want to age anymore and young people who - actually, I'm not sure if young people even do it.
Anyway! Back to bread: do I like it because it's so delicious, or is it so delicious because I like it?
Can we avoid this conversation if I say my favourite food is sweet and sour chicken?
NOT ANYMORE.

transcription.title: what if you could murder a guy who you knew was going to do fifty murders, for instance

panel.line: When someone says "murder is wrong", they're clearly making an ethical statement. But what are they actually saying? Let's totally find out!
Okay, so -
"Murder is wrong!"

Wait - was I just saying that it is objectively and verifiably true that murder is always wrong? That's a pretty big statement.Or was I merely saying that it's the societal consensus of most that murder is not such a good idea? Maybe it's an emotional statement, saying "I'm against murder, personally". Or MAYBE it's more of an imperative, better phrased as "Don't murder!"
We've built a whole system around ethics and you're questioning its foundation!
That's right, baby!
I think it's cool that most people will agree that "murder is wrong", but that they all might have very different ideas of what that actually means. We never really specify!
And we never will! What's to be gained from arguing fine semantic points of justifying MURDER?
A better understanding of ethics? Plus the ability to not feel bad for accidentally "murdering" your friends who shoot down your ideas.
I MEAN
OOPS

transcription.title: the sissy-panted are those who favour sissy pants over regular bottomwear

panel.line: If I had the means to design and build my own house, it would have all sorts of cool features. Like skylights and sensible door chimes and high counters designed to accommodate my giant frame!
And perhaps... A FIREMAN'S POLE and WATERSLIDE??

I am so serious about this. I would have a fireman's pole. The waterslide - the waterslide I can see dying on the drawing board. But a big brassy fireman's pole is a very Freudian way to say "Ladies, I'm the dude with the giant fireman's pole in his house".
That's pretty sweet, T-Rex! But you don't think you'd get tired of it? Eventually?
Never!
How could I, when there'd be a trampoline at the bottom to ensure soft landings, AND stairs at the side for the elderly and the sissy-panted?
But then you'd always hit your head on the ceiling!
Nope, because there'd be a second UPSIDE DOWN trampoline too, man! Kapow!
I will call my house, "The House Where It's Very Hard To Get Any Work Done".

transcription.title: if you want to trip out in panel six then that is your call

panel.line: So has anyone here ever ingested any...
PSYCHOTROPIC SUBSTANCES?
Dromiceiomimus? Have YOU ever done any consciousness-altering drugs?
I don't - why are you asking this?
Just curious! I've never done any, but some of my friends have. They say - they say it's pretty alright?
Then they rub their faces on the carpet.
Are you going to try mind-altering drugs because of peer pressure?
No way, man!

I have no interest in being reminded that my mind can be chemically altered, OR in rubbing my face on the carpet. It's just, sometimes I wonder if I'm wrong, thinking these drugs are not the best idea. But-
But it's hard to find out more, as it's such a politicized debated. Everyone seems to have an agenda!
That's exactly it! Is marijuana addictive? Who knows! This tiny bug on my nose doesn't know!
Morris: yeah but i don't know a lot of things like this one time i wasn't too good at sports so i had to be a timekeeper but i wasn't too good at that either even though i tried super hard
Okay!

transcription.title: little morris the bug

panel.line: So, tiny bug on my nose, how was your day today?
Tiny Bug on T-Rex's Nose: oh t-rex, it was really a challenge for me today. but, you can - my name is morris, if you wanted to call me that. morris the bug
Pleased to meet you, Morris!

Morris: gosh i'm pleased to meet you, t-rex! and yes, in answer to your question it was a real challenge for me today. i tried to park my car by the grocery store so i could buy some groceries but then i couldn't find where the parking meters were and i looked everywhere and finally i asked some people to help but none of them knew where the parking meters were either! so it was real confusing
Didn't the grocery store have a parking lot, Morris?
Morris: yeah but i didn't fine that out till afterwards and i'd already made an awful embarrassment of myself by asking everyone where the meters were! sometimes i get a little confused is all
That's okay, Morris! Everyone gets confused sometimes!
Did they have the groceries you wanted?
Morris: well, i dunn because i got so flustered from my mistake that i ended up just going home, empty-handed
Aww, Morris!
I'm Utahraptor, by the way. Pleased to meet you!
Morris: shucks, i've never met so many people before all in one day! i'm morris and i'm just a little bug who tries real hard
If you ever need some help getting groceries, Morris, I bet we could help you out!

Morris: that's awful nice but it turned out that bugs don't even shop at the grocery store! i must have gotten myself mixed up with a show i saw or a movie or something because we catch our food ourselves
Is that why you're on my nose? To look for food?

Morris: no, i'm just here to get out of my house a little plus i wrote my address on my wrist but i must have written it in smudgey ink or something cause all i see now are smudges! i've probably made a big mess of things again - i can just tell.

transcription.title: nothing says 'nature' to t-rex like a koala bear

panel.line: I'm going to write the best story ever. It's called - okay, I don't know what it's called. But i have a fantastic premise!
It's a world where everyone knows how they're going to die!

You can go in to a doctor and he takes a blood test, and then his machine spits out a piece of paper that says "exploded" or "drowned" or "poisoned apple" and that's it. No dates, no details! And so people who are to die from drowning spend their lives avoiding swimming pools, but they end up drowning anyway. Part of the fun would be seeing how!
This story sounds pretty morbid, T-Rex!
Morbidly INTERESTING!
True!
I guess the only safe one would be if the paper said "old age".
Nope, cause then you could be killed by an old guy! This machine delights in ironically vague deaths.
"Natural causes"?
Hit on the head by a falling koala bear!
It would also work on animals, but all the ones for cows would say "made into delicious cheeseburger".
Not that the cows could understand!
Friggin' cheeseburgers!

transcription.title: t-rex really dropped the ball at the end there

panel.line: I think it would be great to have my last words planned out in advance. They'd have to be really memorable, so that people would keep talking about them, and by extension me!
Unfortunately, all the good ones are taken. Sucks to THAT!

There are a ton of people who have died saying things like "I feel fine!", but irony is overdone in last words. It has to be something fresh! Einstein spoke his last words in German, but the only person present didn't speak the language, so his last words are lost. That's actually pretty neat, I think! I could learn some obscure language before I die and use that as a backup plan.
It's too bad you're not a doctor!
Why's that?
There's been a few doctors who have died just after having said "stopped", which isn't that eerie until you're told that they were checking their pulse at the time.
Ahhh! Oh wow, that's a great one. Man! Can you imagine feeling your own pulse stop?
WE SKIP FORWARD TO T-REX'S DEATH:
Hey guys! P-
Pooty pooty?

transcription.title: HeLa cells

panel.line: HeLa cells are a strain of cancer cells that, unlike regular body cells, can live indefinitely outside the body, grow very quickly, and don't die form old age. They are used in labs worldwide and are in many ways an independent organism!
They also helped in the research that eradicated polio!

So not only are HeLa cells the first observed example of devolution or speciation in human beings (going from a multi-celled life form to a singe-celled one) but they're also maybe a first example of immortality: her cells live, but the woman from whom the cells were taken, Henrietta Lacks, died from this cancer in 1951. That's crazy!
Crazier: there's probably a greater mass of HeLa cells now than there was of Henrietta when she was alive!
Yeah!
The whole thing is so surreal, don't you think? The woman made a huge contribution to society just by getting sick. And imagine a new species EVOLVING from your body?
Well, Henrietta never found out. She was never even told that the cells were being cultivated!
And with that, I exhaust all my knowledge of Henrietta and HeLa cells. I am well and truly tapped.
The cells are called "helacyton gartleri".
AW MAN!! I totally knew that one!
Also: learning is not a competition?

transcription.title: that is one dude with a grudge

panel.line: HEY T-REX YOU SHOULD PROBABLY DO SOME CHRISTMAS SHOPPING SOON
I'm going to ignore the symbolism of this!
T-REX IN: THE MALL
THAT EVENING:

ARGH! I had hoped to avoid this realization, but it's inescapable: I hate the mall! I know it's a cliched thing to hate but it's TRUE. I hate the crowds and the cell phones and I hate the music and the consumerism and the shops that don't have anything that I want. And I didn't hate but I really disliked the burger I purchased in the food court. It had no toppings. Also it was very dry.
You're becoming a generic stand-up comedian!
I'm not! I just feel their pain!
And YES, I understand that of all the things in the world to get worked up about, maybe poverty and climate change are above one soul-crushing shopping experience downtown. But man! The mall!
Hah, if you felt as serious about climate change as you do about the mall, we'd have that settled in no time!
T-REX TRIES TO GET AS WORKED UP ABOUT CLIMATE CHANGE, BUT IT KEEPS COMING BACK TO THE MALL:
Everyone! Support the implementation of the Kyoto Protocol!
ALSO SCREW THE MALL IN ITS STUPID FACE OKAY

transcription.title: people who only date asians comics

panel.line: I have a friend who, as near as I can tell, only dates Asian women. I don't get it!
PEOPLE WHO DATE ONLY ASIANS COMICS

I don't think he's a racist guy, but can you still be racist if you like an entire group of people (instead of hating them) for some perceived racial qualities? Maybe? But then again, there's nothing wrong with finding some feature particularly fetching, and maybe all the Asian women he meets just happen to have this feature. I don't know what to think!
Does he like Asian cultures too, or just Asian women?
Huh?

Well, I'm wondering if it's purely a physical thing, or if maybe he's got this weird fetishistic cultural interest in Asian countries as well. The whole "ooh, it's foreign to me, how FASCINATING and EROTIC" thing, coupled with a cultural conception that exaggerates the broad brushstrokes while ignoring its subtleties.
No, I don't think he has that.
"A Complicated Issue"

But
I'm sorry.
EARLIER THAT MORNING...

transcription.title: if regret parties catch on and become a hipster trend I TOTALLY WANT THE CREDIT

panel.line: REGRET
I regret never going white-water rafting!

I regret - well, it was in grade two, and I was just a little girl, and there was this near-deaf kid in class who had a hearing aid. One day on the playground I walked up to him and moved my mouth like I was talking but I didn't say anything. I just wanted to - I don't know, see if he'd be tricked or something. He wasn't, of course, and wasn't even that upset, but all of a sudden I could see what a jerk I was being. I don't want to be the kind of person who does that.
Wow!

transcription.title: crazy racists, you know, as opposed to the regular flavor

panel.line: I wonder if there are any revelations that would make me want to end a long-term friendship with someone. What would they have to say?
I guess if they were a crazy racist, that would probably do it!

But then I wouldn't be friends with them in the first place, I bet - UNLESS they'd kept it hidden until now. Could I be friends with someone, knowing they're a crazy racist? And would it make a difference if it never really came up that often?
This is actually a pretty tricky question I've considered myself, T-Rex!

Yeah! Because I wouldn't really want to be friends with a crazy racist either, but isn't that sort of just fighting intolerance with intolerance? The person was still your friend for years and years, so they're probably a good person, all the crazy racism aside.

E-Except for racists.

God, you ove me several sub-themed items too!

transcription.title: the alternate ending has t-rex in panel 5 asking utahraptor to tell him something exciting so he can use the expression, and utahraptor says he was at a party last night where some people were doing cocaine in the corner, and t-rex really doesn't know wha

panel.line: You know what people don't say often enough anymore?

Holy smokes, but that's a pretty awesome expression! "That dude just fell down the stairs! Holy smokes!" It has the charm of a child, yet is better than the old standby of "holy cow" because nobody says "holy smokes" anymore. It is forgotten. It is UNDISCOVERED.
Holy smokes!
And with that it becomes overused!
Ah well, it had a good run. Now onto the next new thing!
Wait! Wait a minute! I never had a chance to use it for real!
Anyway man, who says you're in charge of when things become "old hat"?

Qui dit que vous ?tes responsable du moment o? les choses deviennent "vieux chapeau"?

transcription.title: robots!

panel.line: Today is a good day I think to talk about robots!
Holy crap yes!

Oh man, robots. So awesome! What other literary construct allows us to discuss the disparate issues of slavery, prejudice, identity, the body AND the self, while also allowing for all the trappings of a science fiction setting? Only robots, my friends!
I would seriously marry robots if it were even possible.
In fact, the only fault I can find in robots is with their real life counterparts!
Why's that?
They're a canonical study in failed promise! They never try to take over the world and rarely act as a mirror of our own essential humanity. They just sit around!
Some of them build cars, T-Rex.
But man, imagine living in a world with literary robots? It would be the coolest!

So awesome!!

No presents, T-Rex?
Nope! And then I compounded it by telling Dromiceiomimus that I had something extra special for her. And OH MAN, now you know my secret. I'm out of control!

transcription.title: my father's famed and final prediction!!

panel.line: I have made a very important New Year's Resolution! It's to make sure that my name becomes an EPONYMOUS ADJECTIVE. People will soon all describe things as "T-Rexian"! What sort of things?
Awesome things, natch!

Wait, huh? I'm not the sort of person who says "natch". I never say "natch", I say "naturally" and even then only sometimes. I have no idea why I said "natch" just now. I'd like to take it back, Dromiceiomimus!
Hah, hah, too late! Looks like being T-Rexian is using unpopular and out of favour slang for no reason!
Aw, shoot! My eponym is a disaster!
Plus it wouldn't even get used that often!
The only time I can imagine using it is - well, when describing you.
Wait! Let's change it so it means using out of date slang that's still cool, like flapper slang or pirate's slang or whatever. Can we do that?
I don't think we can do that!
Had I finally and irrevocable "blown it" with my own name? Had my father's famed and final prediction come, at last, to pass?
Daaaaaang!

transcription.title: naming your kids after ex-girlfriends, yee-haw

panel.line: Here is a hypothetical situation: let's say I'm married and going to have a child (with my assuredly hott wife)! What should it be named?
MY position is that babies should be named after old girlfriends!
Not only does it allow excellent names to be redistributed to new children, but as we have more kids we'll catch up, and eventually one will be named after my wife! It evens out! Everybody wins!
Except for the kids who are born male.
They can be named after my wife's ex-boyfriends. As you can see, I've thought of every possibility.
Are you really into all your ex-girlfriends that much?
They all had quite excellent names!
How excellent are we talking about? I bet they were named "Cheeseball" and "Chuggy G".
Those are terrible names! Those are names you give to cats that you don't like.
"DEDICATED TO CHUGGY G"

transcription.title: t-rex isn't so much 'left wing' as 'a multifaceted and varied crystal'

panel.line: Okay okay so - am I making the best use of my time? Judging by the success of others the answer may well be, in fact, "PERHAPS NOT".
BACKSTORY: T-REX IS WORRIED HE'S NOT AS AFFLUENT AS HE SHOULD BE?

I've never really cared about being rich before, but on the other hand having disposable income is sort of alright! Is wanting more money the first step on the path to becoming more and more right wing as I get older? Such a trajectory IS one I have sometimes observed in my peers and elders.
Wait, I'm confused. Are you worried about not being rich, or about drifting to the right?
Neither! Both?
I'm - I dunno. I guess I'm worried only about getting one shot at life and messing it up, or not making the best of it.
These are serious fears that will likely haunt you till old age, some of them no doubt blossoming into a startling and varied garden of regret!
UTAHRAPTOR: A GUY WHO IS NOT HELPING RIGHT NOW
FRIGGIN' GARDENS OF REGRET!!

transcription.title: (a)bort, (r)etry, (m)urder

(A)bort,
(R)etry,
(M)urder!

Is the entire script based on computer puns?
Well...
So far, yeah.
But there is a scene where he types and the screen projects onto his face!
Stop it!
T-Rex, you're just ripping off every movie ever made with computers in it. What are you saying that's new?
What are you saying that's original?
You must not have heard what my main character's name is!

transcription.title: cool AND improbable: that's me, baby

panel.line: It would be cool to be able to flash forward and see what my life would actually be like in ten or twenty years.
Cool AND improbable!
So improbable, in fact, that I have no idea of how I would accomplish it. Ah well! SO MUCH FOR VISIONS OF TOMORROW.
SUDDENLY, A VISION OF TOMORROW!
Hey, remember when years ago, you wanted to see the future?
Yep!

I was just lingering over breakfast when I suddenly recalled that entire conversation. Isn't that wild? And I realized that if I told you about it, this could be your vision of tomorrow: future selves recalling the past!
That's pretty wild!
BACK IN THE PRESENT:
Well!
I for one would like to register disappointment with every aspect of the future?

panel.line: INCORRECT HOMOPHONE COMICS
Two words that are homophones sound the same but mean different things!
For instance: the word "awful" (really bad) and the word "offal" (burchered entrails)!
To begin: my stomping on this manner is a sorted little affair! Take soulless in the fact that at leased ewe are knot being chaste as well!
Why don't you chews to do something else? That would be good gnus to me!
I will here nun of it!

I'm saying weird homophones!
Yeah, but you're not writing them down, so it sounds normal. Pretty normal, anyway. It sounds a little like you're speaking with a weird accent.
I was speaking in hilariously inappropriate homophones! IT WAS EXTREMELY HILARIOUS.

transcription.title: selling naked pictures online for profits

panel.line: ONE DAY:
That's it - I'll sell naked pictures of myself online! FOR PROFITS!
Dromiceiomimus, you'll bid on naked pictures of me, right? For profits?
No thanks! I don't see why I would bid on them whe I can see you naked, for free, right now.
FIRST OFF: whatever! And second off: what if I died and you wanted pictures?
Hey, can I bid some ANTI-DOLLARS on your pictures?

SCIENCE CORNER
Do anti-dollars really mutually annihilate when combined with regular dollars?

transcription.title: logical fallacy comics: begging the question

panel.line: LOGICAL FALLACY COMICS
today's fallacy
BEGGING THE QUESTION
Begging the question is when what you're trying to prove is assumed implicitly in one of your premises!
FOR EXAMPLE: T-Rex is a pretty sweet dude because he's always so friggin' awesome!

This is actually formally valid: if the premise is true and I'm friggin' awesome, then it follows that I'm a pretty sweet dude. However, I've provided no logical support for my "T-Rex is awesome" premise, but only made a conclusion (T-Rex = pretty sweet) which relies on the premise being true. I haven't offered any evidence, so I am begging the question!
But "begging the question" is mostly used today to mean "raising the question"!
I know! IT'S SO WRONG.

Well, I suppose that begs the question, T-Rex: if it's used more often to mean "raises the question" than "a fallacy of presumption", doesn't that suggest that the definition of the phrase has evolved?
NO IT DOES NOT. What it suggests is that everybody sucks but me!
LATER: THE FACE OF PRESCRIPTIVE LANGUAGE??

transcription.title: "everyone has better reasons for being here than *I*", t-rex

panel.line: Oh goodness, I am so thirsty. My thirst is - exquisite. Sublime. Immaculate.
GET A DRINK T-REX
Nopers!
I would much rather consider the precise nature of my thirst. It's - strong! Insistent.
T-Rex if you get a drink of water then you won't be thirsty anymore.
Please! I am trying to consider the nature of thirst. It's - stern?
It sure is great that everyone everywhere has safe access to clean drinking water!
Aw MAN!

See, now what can I do? I can't stay here and consider my thirst, because that's revelling in what for some people is a terrible fact of their lives, but if I go get a drink, I'm just underlining my privilege.
I think if you REALLY want to show me up, your course is clear!
LATER, PERFORMING AID AND SANITATION WORK IN SUB-SAHARAN AFRICA:
Man! EVERYONE has better reasons for being here than me!

transcription.title: religious issues solved in this comic: zero!

panel.line: I've never had any problems with dating someone of a different religion, but I imagine under certain circumstances it could be a problem!
Much like... most things?

I guess if there was some religious beliefs that one person had and the other didn't, it could lead to tension, but relationships are about compromise, right? But if someone, say, adopts the actions of a religion as a compromise, but not the beliefs behind it, isn't that just going through the motions, which isn't really what most religions are about?
I guess a lot of it depends on the faith of the people involved, T-Rex!
How so?

Well, if you REALLY believe that by not sharing your religion, your partner is harming himself somehow (i.e., comdemning himself to a sucky afterlife), then you'd want to help him out, right? I could see that leading to tension, since there's not much room for movement there unless one of you softens your views.
That's true! Luckily, as I say, this has never happened to me. Therefore, double high fives for conflict avoided??
I'm not giving you double high fives, T-Rex.
Man! Don' leave me hangin'!!

transcription.title: t-rex would never have been able to win the role of spock and that makes him very sad

panel.line: HEY T-REX SETTLE A BET
WHAT ONE CHANGE WOULD YOU MAKE TO YOURSELF IF YOU COULD
Raising one eyebrow!

I would really like to be able to raise one eyebrow. It seems like everyone can do this but me! And as a consequence of my being unable to operate my eyebrows individually, my facial expressions are limited to either SURPRISE (both eyebrows raised), ANGER (both eyebrows furrowed), or danged neutrality! The intrigue of raising a single eyebrow seems destined to remain frustratingly beyond my purview.
I've seen you look intrigued before, T-Rex, I'm sure of it!
I'm afraid it was all an illusion!
When I feel intrigued, I have to say "How intriguing!" or "Guys, I'm really intrigued right now" because I can't express it through my face. Watch! Say something intriguing.
Um - geez, I can't do it on demand
Well it probably wouldn't have worked.
OKAY WELL IT LOOKS LIKE I LOST BECAUSE I THOUGHT YOU WERE GOING TO ASK TO BE PURPLE
Why?! Purple doesn't rhyme with "machine".
YEAH ANYWAY NOW I'M DOWN A TRILLION LIFETIMES OF FRIED CHICKEN
THANKS T-REX
YOU AND YOUR FRIGGIN EYEBROWS

panel.line: What is the deal with everyone walking in on me while I'm having showers? This has gone well beyond random chance and I am at a loss to explain it.
Everyone needs to stop walking in on me while I'm having a shower, please!
And with that I'm off to go have a bath or something.
HEY T-REX WHAT WAS THAT
WHERE ARE YOU OFF TO AGAIN
Nowhere, dear friend! I am off to "#8211;go sit and"#8211; read a book. About "#8230; famous deserts of the past!
SWEET
MAN! It almost happened just there!
What almost happened?
This new "LET'S SPY ON T-REX IN THE SHOWER" problem that everyone seems to have "#8211;and now God's in on it too! I don't understand. Also I just realized I lied to God about reading a book.
